column8:
I played this once as a kid and kinda disliked most of it. I couldn't wrap my head around it. 2 decades later I've come back to try it again. Turns out, I understand why I disliked it back then and why a good chunk of people hate it: 

[h1] This game is not made for stupid people. [/h1]

Mechanically speaking there is a lot of customization and optimization here. I hear a lot of people complain about the scaling system, I never had any trouble with it, but I also took the time to stock up on spells and make sure I had a good Guardian Force composition on my 3 primary characters. You can do a lot of prep work for your party and make them truly powerful, regardless of your current level. There are abilities to manipulate just about everything, for starters you can modify [b] every [/b]  stat on your character. Luck, speed, hit chance, strength, defense, status effect defense, and more. As far as enemies go, you can reduce their defenses, manipulate their AI, and even change their level (up or down!). This is not a plug-and-play Final Fantasy like 4 or 6 were. You have a plethora of tools at your disposal.

On the plot side of things, there are a lot of threads to keep track of. There are many characters, in different timelines, and your actions in them can have an effect. For example, picking up a certain magazine before going back in time will result in you have 1 less party member during that sequence. Not only that, but this game does not spoon feed you the story. There is a ton of dialogue, but also visual story beats, as well as things that are only implied. This has led to a lot of fan speculation and theorizing, and some of them hold a lot of weight. One of the game's directors commented on these fan theories, denying them, but also adding that he couldn't speak for the other writers on the team and their vision for the story. So much of the story is not simply just handed to you, you have to flex your brain and think about it.

I fucking love this game, and it is a grand litmus test for the intelligence of a Final Fantasy fan.

column8:
[h1][u][b]Intro[/b][/u][/h1]
[b][i]Final Fantasy VIII[/i][/b] è un JRPG sviluppato e distribuito da [i]Square[/i] nel 1999. 

È Il sequel di un pilastro del videogaming e come prodotto videoludico portava sulle spalle il peso di una gigantesca eredità. L’esame della critica passò con ottimi voti conquistando larga parte della stampa. A sua volta il giudizio dei fan fu eccelso e l’ottavo titolo del franchise conquistò senza grande fatica un posto d’onore in migliaia di cuori di tutto il mondo.

Tornando al presente la Square-Enix pubblica nel 2019 questa [b][i]Remastered[/i][/b]. Un nuova versione per moderni sistemi con un limitato graphic update e poche feature aggiuntive (tra l’altro opzionali). Un prodotto nuovo solo di facciata che mira ad adattare un prodotto essenzialmente datato ai moderni players del giorno d’oggi.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2933540598
[h1][u][b]Analisi[/b][/u][/h1]
[h2]Storia[/h2]
[b]Narrativa[/b] 
I Garden sono accademie militari private e il loro scopo è quello di addestrare giovani mercenari. Come una moderna e deviata scuola i bambini e i ragazzi vengono ospitati nelle strutture per studiare e allenarsi. Ogni anno un esame coinvolge i più grandi con l’obiettivo di farli diventare Seed: guerrieri elite a cui vengono assegnate missioni in tutto il mondo. È un privilegio e solo una manciata di eletti ha l’onore di portare il prestigioso titolo. Squall e Seifer sono rivali fin da bambini, oggi è il giorno del test che cambierà per sempre la loro vita.

Parto con una affermazione forte ma necessaria: la narrativa di Final Fantasy VIII non solo è invecchiata male ma è anche e da sempre veramente brutta. È un'avventura con una trama nonsense dai tempi del racconto sbilanciati. Tra eccessiva lentezza o rapidità, costante è però il fatto che il tutto è sempre un mix superficiale e frammentato. Questo porta a elementi narrativi confusionari e colpi di scena senza logica alcuna. Una mitragliatrice di momenti sorpresa senza senso la cui unica giustificazione proposta è sempre l’aspettativa di una spiegazione futura. La trama prosegue accumulando misteri, incognite e rilascia tardivamente e senza contesto vaghe e disinteressate soluzioni. 

L’impressione principale che deriva da tutto questo è che si è provato a mettere troppa carne al fuoco. Esempio lampante è il worldbuilding che appare fin dalle prime ore di gioco come un'accozzaglia di generi diversi senza reale amalgama. Si passa senza continuità da città western, a castelli dark fantasy medievali ad astronavi spaziali. Come contestualizzi e racconti il passaggio tra una società cyberpunk e una steampunk? Non puoi.

[b]Personaggi e dialoghi[/b]
Quello che maggiormente manca a Final Fantasy VIII è appunto costanza e profondità, non si è neanche lontanamente provato a legare contesti e l’esempio più palese di questo è nello sviluppo dei personaggi. La storia di Squall e dei co-protagonisti è fondamentalmente una teen (love) story nascosta in un sottotesto “maturo”. La narrativa vuole apparire adulta ma tutto il racconto gira intorno alle tematiche della crescita, della solitudine e della fiducia. La proposta è sempre in chiave adolescenziale e il tutto appare come un mega pippone raffazzonato. Squall ha la profondità di un sasso e come lui tutti gli altri personaggi secondari. Sono esattamente come appaiono, non c’è reale sviluppo del personaggio, sono una macchietta stereotipata dall’inizio alla fine del titolo.
[h2]Gameplay[/h2]
[b]Come funziona e cosa va alla grande[/b]
Dal 1999 a oggi i JRPG hanno fatto passi giganti e questa versione di Final Fantasy VIII ha mantenuto lo stesso gameplay senza apportare alcuna variazione. È lento e macchinoso, il party attacca scandendo i tempi attraverso una action bar che si carica col tempo. Il player può decidere se attaccare, usare un'abilità speciale o apprendere magie dai nemici (non c’è la barra mana quindi si dovrà accumulare o utilizzare subito le spells “rubate”). In situazioni di stress e difficoltà inoltre sarà possibile attivare le Limit Breaks, poteri speciali unici per ogni personaggio che fanno danni massicci o regalano powerup sensibili al party. 

Nella sua importanza vanno poi citate le Guardian Force. Gli storici summon tornano più forti che mai permettendo di liberare potentissime abilità sugli ignari nemici e regalando un'unicità di gameplay. Le caratteristiche fisiche dei membri del party sono infatti influenzate dalle evocazioni equipaggiate. Il player dovrà assegnare i summon ai personaggi e questi scalerà le skills in base all’affinità e al livello del potere.

[b]Difficoltà[/b]
Per finirlo gli ostacoli sono tanti e quasi tutti correlati a scelte tecniche di gameplay. Il titolo non è user friendly e necessita studio. I menù sono macchinosi come mai, un inferno di management e comprensione. 

Final Fantasy VIII può essere finito senza grinding, i mob e boss scalano vita e danni in base al livello del party. Il level scaling è però punitivo e ineluttabile. Già dalle prime ore di gioco il player noterà che i mob e boss hanno troppa vita, le battaglie sono infinite e tediose. Gli incontri casuali risultano traumatici e il fatto che caratteristiche positive come i Limit Breaks abbiano esiti aleatori rendono le battaglia una tortura.

[b]Durata e rigiocabilità[/b]
Dura mediamente sopra le 40 ore ma non mi sentirei nella posizione di consigliare la rigiocabilità all’infuori dell’effetto nostalgia.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2933540228
[h2]Grafica[/h2]
Tanto quanto perde nella costanza della qualità narrativa e di gameplay, Final Fantasy VIII conquista in graphic design. Avanguardistico, estremamente vario con ambienti isometrici dinamici che regalano bellissime fotografie di ambienti. 

La remastered purtroppo crolla nella resa generale. Rimanendo fedele all’anzianità del titolo si è scelto di optare per un rifacimento totale dei modelli 3D di personaggi e nemici mentre tutto il resto è rimasto identico all’originale del 1999. I personaggi nuovi viaggiano nei vecchi fondali e l’effetto è da brividi…in negativo. Non si comprende perché è stata fatta questa scelta e doveva essere fatto un minimo di sforzo in più.
[h2]Audio[/h2]
Il doppiaggio è totalmente assente ma [i]Nobuo Uematsu[/i] torna e scrive una colonna sonora eccezionale e per certi aspetti superiore a quella dei precedenti titoli del franchise. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2933539770
[h1][b]Conclusione[/b][/h1]
[quote][b][i]Final Fantasy VIII: Remastered[/i] è il frutto di una prolungata bugia. Lasciamo in secondo piano le palesi critiche a questa falsa remastered e ci troviamo di fronte a un vecchio titolo che ha da sempre avuto enormi lacune. La trama è noiosa e banale quasi quanto il gameplay è macchinoso e lento, non è un cattivo gioco ma non diverte.[/b][/quote]

Runs well, no crashes so far. Enjoying the nostalgia, and game is decently priced.

EDIT: Finished the game, not a single crash. Was good fun, glad it got the remaster.

column8:
I'm obviously not going to talk up any state of the art graphical mastery here. There is only so much which can be done to touch up a game from the 90s without outright remaking it as they did with Final Fantasy VII.

I will, however, present my opinion that the characters, world, and story are something that I wish carried over to RPGs of more recent years. It is like comparing a truly great novel to the type of dreck you can find on Amazon for less than a dollar.

The original Final Fantasy VIII will always be one of the core memories forming who I am as a gamer. I feel I got so much more out of the experience playing it again as an adult. Being able to truly comprehend, appreciate, and absorb the underlying depth of storytelling which my adolescent mind was incapable of has made this game an even more important memory for me.

column8:
Junto con sus hermanos clásicos de Ps1 y mi favorito el 10 de Ps2.
Este por gusto personal es el que menos me gusta. No dejando de ser una obra maestra por ello.
Cada vez que juego a esta saga a sus títulos clásicos pienso lo mismo. Que lástima que hoy en día no existan juegos con la mitad de calidad y magia que tenían estos juegos en su día

Siendo mi favorito, admito que es uno de los mas flojos de la saga, la historia no esta hecha para todos los públicos, no es difícil de seguir, pero sin dar spoilers (de un juego de hace 20ypico años) es bastante "pointless" todo lo que ocurre durante el desarrollo de la historia. Y en si, la finalidad del "Final Boss" no queda muy clara, sabes lo que quiere hacer, pero no para que, no tiene sentido.

A nivel de sistema, el combate por turnos esta tan roto que es divertido (prácticamente a LVL7, entendiendo bien el sistema de enlace te pasas el juego) , se pierde mucho tiempo en farmear magias (aquí va por unidades, no por PM, los Puntos Mágicos no existe en este juego) aunque hay algunas formas de reducir significativamente la cantidad de tiempo invertido en ello.

Los personajes.. bueno, son olvidables, pero no lamentables.

Se nota que es un juego con el que Square quiso experimentar un poco, cambiando cosa aquí y allá, y quedo este juego, que representa fielmente la saga, si, pero roto hasta los topes. Aun así, me parece increíblemente divertido. 8/10

column8:
The improved visuals for npcs and player characters is really great however nothing else appears to be improved which leads to hilariously stark contrasts. luckily there is a very strong modding scene for this game and most everything has been radically up scaled and re textured to look beautiful but it does take a little bit of work.  It was a lazy remaster on squares part but i've seen lazier so...

The real crux of this version of the game is an issue with the game constantly crashing. It seems to maybe have to do with the new x3 speed feature of the game and transitioning between too many screens too quickly. Sometimes it'll happen sparingly and other times the game will crash every 2 mins.

 I can't truly recommend this version of the game for pc but if you do want the improved visuals that are mainly the work of devoted fans and the game hack features than I'd strongly recommend two things. 
FIRST: don't transition between screens with x3 speed on.
SECOND: ALWAYS BE SAVING CONSTANTLY!!!!

column8:
AWE-INSPIRING REMASTERED FFVIII GAME!!!!!!!! (kinda long review)

I played FFVIII for the first time in 2001 and I fell in love with it immediately.
Just like FFIX, I always used to have problems with the 4 discs because they always got scratches due to overplaying lol. (I know you understand how I felt, my dear old school gamer!!)

Then, I played the first version for PC and it was so pleasant to play the game fluently that I thought that there was nothing which could beat that feeling.

Nevertheless, years went by and FINAL FANTASY VIII - REMASTERED appeared in this world! 
WHAT CAN I SAY? I JUST...FELL IN LOVE WITH THE GAME AGAIN!!

I mean it! You can see how much the developers and graphic designers and all the team love this game because they literally remastered every single character.

You can see their faces perfectly and the "boosts" are a great idea because we all know that some stuff gets very repetitive and there's no need to waste time waiting. 
(for example: drawing lots of magic, farming items, etc)

Thus, I can say that I 100% recommend this FFVIII. 
If you liked the original version of this game, you'll like this one even more. (Some people disagree, though. I don't understand why. It's basically FFVIII again but with better graphics and the maps load really faster!!!! What else could we possibly ask for???)

Last but not least, I've played over 60 hours and I just have two more achievements two unlock: (1000 kills and 10.000 kills, which is a hidden achievement btw.) so, I guess it's crystal clear that when I say I love this game, I am NOT lying at all LOL. (I'm even gonna play the game again because I want to be just like the pro players HAHA)

To sum up, if you love FF classic games, you can't miss this one! 

It's very cheap and it's worth because you'll have loooots to do in the game!

FF8的故事说实话前期任务有点无聊，伴随着谜之突然插入的不知道是谁的回忆剧情让人摸不着头脑，但是中后期谜底揭晓，剧情开始一发不可收拾了。男女主的刻画是真的非常细致，从舞会初识到被雇佣出行任务，在各种行动中逐渐无法不在意彼此，再到后面一次次的相互拯救。FF8的主线可以说是围绕着男女主的爱情展开的，最后也以庆功派对上男女主月下拥抱接吻为结束点。真的感叹史克威尔当年在FF巅峰期的游戏制作能力。剧本音乐战斗系统是真的厉害，真的是不输给的时代的经典。喜欢FF的不要错过（FF14的伊甸和相关剧情就有致敬FF8的剧情，万魔殿这作甚至有同名召唤兽不知道能不能看到14组重新设计的万魔殿登场）

Though not in my top 3 favorite Final fantasy games, this title is certainly memorable in a good way. The unique "draw" system for magic and rich story-line calls me back and deserves another play-through. I could go on with the opportunities to improve this game but I'll take the digital remaster for graphics and enjoy it for what it is: Good Final Fantasy game, even if it tries to hard to be/top FF7,

column8:
FF8 is a solid entry in the franchise that explores a major recurring theme of introspection—looking into one's own consciousness. This is depicted by the many monologues that are frequently used as a storytelling device in both serious/story-related situations and for comedic relief. Initially, FF8 develops a romantic subplot in a way that 90s teens could get behind. As the story progressed, this subplot matures into other themes such as overcoming self-imposed loneliness and developing assertiveness. These themes have remained true from the 1999 PSX release all the way to this Remaster.

This was one of the first few titles in the past which stood out to me due to how they tried to blend in-game movement and FMVs together. A lot of games in that era transitioned in and out of FMVs without the ability to act during that transition. I enjoyed this element in the game because it was a clear sign of progress in the franchise. It's not perfect by any means, but it did a lot to maintain immersion during that era. Admittedly, Squall's face wasn't consistent throughout all the cutscenes and there were some really weird scenes near the end but the overall package was tasteful.

I don't have a lot of special feelings about the combat in this game, but the Junction system is a fun transition away from the Materia system in 7. It's an interesting reconfiguration of how you can customize character stats and roles in the game. It expanded the role of summons/GFs that were explored in FF7 to greater lengths and turned them into equippable/customizable components in lieu of equipment. It's a good system to promote a little bit of creativity.

As far as the remaster is concerned, I don't think there was a significant graphical upgrade. The boosts to customize the gameplay experience (their words) are not enough to objectively say it deserved a 150% price bump. Regardless of this minor observation, I still think the overall price of both the OG and remastered versions on Steam is just about right for getting access to an iconic title such as FF8.

If you are new to FF8, I suggest buying the non-remastered version first. If you are a returning player, check this one out in case you want to play the game with boosts on to speed up some of the slower transitions (such as long-ass ladders). Overall a solid title and an okay remaster.

column8:
I've recommended this because it's a FF game, and I think all of the FF games are generally good and worth playing.  Overall, check it out if you like JRPGs and are a fan of the FF series.  

However, this one is weird as hell.  There is a theory about the main character, which I won't put in this review, that really makes the entire game make more sense.  Story wise, outside of the fan theory, this is probably the worst FF story (and I'm even comparing this to FF13).  The magic draw system is bonkers and tedious.  The music is sub par for a FF game.  

Some fun things: even though the magic draw system is dumb, you can break the game fairly easily by finding rare spells and attributing to stats.  It's fun to try out new things and explore.

Random battles - I don't mind random battles but this game has 2 extremes: fight constantly or put on an ability for no encounters.  

Some people in the reviews complained about the game not working.  I had zero technical issues running through this.  The remaster is a nice, cleaned up visually appealing version of FF8 and I would recommend this version.

Final Fantasy 8 offers great music, decent combat and an entertaining story. 
But the remaster is a pretty lazy just like all the other remasters from square enix.

[b]Story Overview[/b]
[spoiler]The story is adventurous and goes from schoollife to military operations to hunting the almighty witch. We accompany Squall who overcomes his teenager angst, find friends, falls in love and finally saves the world. [/spoiler]


[b]Weak Remaster[/b]
15fps in battles, untouched blurry backgrounds, only 8 directional movement. The remaster only adds HD models for the main characters and GFs. Furthermore Squall and Rinoa's faces look a little different than in the original.
SquareEnix also removed the little side game chocobo world. Instead rinoas dog angel will now be able to randomly find the items.
They added cheats to get all spells or to speedup the game by 3times.

[b]Mods[/b]
There are many mods by Mcindus which add hd weapons and upscaled backgrounds. If you like gameplay mods you should consider the ff8 2013 version.

column8:
Final Fantasy VIII was a game that I thoroughly enjoyed playing through when it was originally released, and the remastered version has only made the experience better. The graphics have been updated to be more in line with modern standards, which has helped to bring the game's stunning environments and character designs to life in a way that wasn't possible before. The gameplay mechanics have also been refined, making it easier to play through the game and enjoy all of its content.

One of the things that I particularly appreciate about Final Fantasy VIII is its unique story, which follows a group of young soldiers as they navigate a world filled with political intrigue and magical threats. The characters are well-developed and likable, and the plot is full of twists and turns that kept me engaged throughout the game.

Overall, I would highly recommend Final Fantasy VIII to any fans of the series or to anyone who enjoys role-playing games in general. The remastered version is a great way to experience this classic game, and it's a must-play for anyone who missed out on it the first time around.

Pour avoir joué à FF VIII lors de sa sortie sur PS1 il y a... longtemps, j'étais bien content de pouvoir jouer à cette version remastered. N'étant pas ce qu'on peut appeler un testeur aguerri, je vais faire simple et concis et je ne parlerai que de la comparaison entre la version originale et ce remaster, pas du jeu en lui-même.

Points positifs :
- des modèles fidèles à l'original mais bien plus jolis.
- des fonctions supplémentaires appréciables (vitesse x3, no-combat...).
- une expérience originale conservée, sans fioriture. 
- des options de triche pour ceux qui veulent rush l'histoire sans grinder...

Points négatifs :
- ...mais des options de triche qui désactivent TOUS les succès Steam. Pensez à sauvegarder si vous voulez activer la triche, au cas où vous changeriez d'avis.
- des graphismes très inégaux comparé aux nouveaux modèles de monstres et personnages (certains fonds ou gros plans piquent sérieusement les yeux).
- un bande-son toujours excellente mais qui aurait mérité un peu plus de travail.

En résumé :
Un jeu qui est toujours plaisant à jouer, avec ses points forts et ses défauts, et quelques fonctionnalités appréciables... mais on est sur un remaster (et pas un remake) qui assure vraiment le minimum syndical. Les graphismes auraient mérité un coup de pouce dans leur ensemble et pas juste les modèles. Si vous avez le choix entre l'original et le remaster, prenez évidemment ce dernier. Si vous avez déjà la version originale, réfléchissez-y à deux fois, car vous n'y gagnerez au final que peu de choses.

column8:
Final Fantasy VIII is the immediate sequel to one of the best games of all times. It sold extremely well at its launch, leveraged by the huge hype built on its predecessor's success. However, the game came to be known as underwhelming, not because it's bad, but because it didn't achieve the same level of FF VII in basically every aspect. While I do agree that this game isn't as good as VII, this is still one of the best games I have ever played.

However, I prefer to concentrate my review on this remastered version for Steam. This is a very good version of the game, better than the OG in every regard. Graphics are a lot better, the game is faster and there are a lot of QoL improvements to make the game more playable. The only adjustment I had to make was to download a graphical improvement, so the pre-rendered scenes where sharper, and more pleasing to the eyes.

If this is the first time you're playing this game, I have some tips that might improve your experience:
- use a guide, as there are a lot of details and missable items and events that are very interesting;
-  OR do NOT use a guide at all. The game is somewhat linear. You will miss a lot of things, yes, but the game is not very hard and can, in fact, become a real joke, which leads us to...
-  avoid breaking the game. Yes, you can become immensely powerful very early in the adventure, but believe me when I say that the game becomes worse. Use the system to your advantage, but do not abuse it.

FF8 gehört zu meinen Lieblingen. Aber die Version von Steam für den PC stürzt ständig ab. So macht das Spielen einfach keinen Spaß!

[h1] Una muy buena historia [/h1]

Este es el Tercer Final Fantasy que juego, mi objetivo es jugar todos y compartir mi opinión sobre cada uno, vamos hacer un Tier List del mejor al peor, ahora respecto a este Final Fantasy VIII Remastered, tengo muchas pegas, la primera es que no recomiendo la compra, tiene muchos problemas, vamos que no pude completar la partida en Steam tuve que jugar una versión emulada. Sin embargo es una reseña positiva porque me encanto mucho el concepto del juego, dejo de lado los problemas técnicos.

Analizando la historia, las mecánicas de juego, lo que me hizo sentir en comparación al 7 y 15 que ya he jugado. Puedo decir que es un muy buen Final Fantasy, es completo, una historia muy buena con agujeros de guion en mi opinión, pero me gusto mucho, me encanto como trato los viajes en el tiempo, me parecieron coherentes, considero que están bien ejecutados, aunque no me gusto mucho como derrotaron a uno de los jefes principales (Artemisa) me pareció algo muy conveniente. 

La trama de FF VIII me parecio muy diferente a los que ya he jugado, vamos que es una obviedad, me refiero a que sale de lo convencional, el primer CD me pareció buenísimo, una obra maestra, me encanto aunque, Squall no me gusto como protagonista, pero es el único personaje principal con evolución, los demas fueron por rellenar el equipo, aunque Rinoa si me gusto pero el estereotipo que representa no mucho, el de la niña cool, nice, pija, etc.
Irvine me parecio el peor personaje, junto con Saifer, que al principio o mejor dicho en el primer CD me encantaba saifer como antagonista, pero su sueño u objetivo es vamos lo peor, me vendio humo. Irvine es vamos quien arruina la trama del 2do CD o 3er CD, cuando llegan al orfanato y el ya lo sabia, sin entrar en Spoilers.
 
La subtrama de Laguna es espectacular, [spoiler] Me quedo con la parte en que el enamorado de la cantante Julia a quien iba a visitar cada noche que subia al escenario, ella nerviosa y esperando que el llegara, una pareja enamorada, que por diferentes motivos no estaban destinados a estar juntos, años mas tarde, Rinoha y Squad se conocen, ese beso, y darnos cuenta que Ella es la hija de Julia y Squad en teoria hijo de Laguna, ufffff que buena parte [/spoiler] .

Las mecánicas de juego, pues sin mucho que agregar, aunque debo admitir que me vicie horrible con el juego de cartas, creo que es uno de los mejores minijuegos de todos los tiempos, junto a GWENT de The Witcher 3, vamos que logre conseguir casi todas las cartas.
En cuanto al nivel de dificultad pues a diferencia del VII este me parecio mucho mas fácil, en cierto punto podría decir que es fácil romper el juego, extrañe el uso de las materias, pero no esta mal los enlaces o extraer las magias de los enemigos.

Mi conclusión respecto a este juego; tiene una de las mejores bandas sonoras, para mi la mejor banda sonora de los FF que he jugado, tiene la mejor Intro de todos los FF que he jugado, el primer CD es espectacular tiene todo lo que le pedimos a un FF, al menos lo que yo no vi en el VII y XV, no me gusto Artemisa, no salvo a ningún personaje secundario a excepción de la trama de Laguna o el pasado que esa subtrama es de lejos lo mejor del juego, 
Me parece una muy buena historia porque disfrute muchísimo la correcta ejecución de los viajes en el tiempo, para mi lo hace muy bien, me encanto ese plot twist de Edea y el Director Cramer, me dio mucha risa porque no lo esperaba, no me encanto el excesivo protagonismo de Rinoa, me encanto que Squall tiene una evolucion, vamos que paso de ser el típico estereotipo adolescente japones emo a no serlo, banda sonora espectacular, me encanto la escena final del juego que detallo en los spoilers.

Por el momento, mis juegos Final Fantasy favoritos son:
-Final Fantasy VII
-Final Fantasy VIII
-Final Fantasy XV
-Final Fantasy VII Remake (aun no lo termino, sin embargo por el momento).

En ese año que salio fue un boom, ahora con los recuerdos que tengo sigue siendo un boom, que historia la que tiene !!, hay muchos juegos con mejores graficos, pero este con su historia es muy bueno!. Uno de lo mejor que saco Square Enix.

Still it is a really good game and has it's own merits.
The soundtrack is one of if not the best in the entire Final Fantasy series.
The problem lies in the progression system it's really complicated to wrap your head around and even then properly using it is a whole other can of worms.
BUT once it clicks hooo boy can you just brake the game apart and doing that is pretty fun.
The narative even though a little weird and nonsensical at times is still quite good and interesting.

Man I just wish this game would get a full blown Remake like FF7 did, but sadly I dont see that happening, since people tend to avoid this one and would rather see FF6 or FF9.
All I can say is give the game a shot, yes it is old and not the most accesible but once you get in the groove and it clicks it's very enjoyable and definitely worth your time.

One of the weakest entries in the series, FF8 is over-designed and over-written.  I would not pick this up unless you're an FF completionist.

Most of the negative reviews you'll read talk about how broken and boring the magic system is.  But the rot runs deeper.  For the first several hours of the game, your main attack will be summoning.  Every summon has at least a 30-second, unskippable animation.   Since even early bosses have big health bars, you're going to use summon *a lot.*  The environments are also massive and your character runs very slowly.  You're going to be backtracking and hitting random encounters *a lot.*  Never has a remaster benefited more by a triple-speed button.

Apologists will say you can skip this nonsense by crafting items and playing the card game.  Or draw magic and then run away from combat to avoid leveling.  You can even skip most combat with an early ability.  Making this game enjoyable seems to involve a lot of (checks notes) skipping the game.

But then you'll stumble into an unskippable enemy that absorbs the element you equipped.  You can't change your strategy on the fly, you just have to lose and load up the last save.  There are even several side quests and unlockables that you can permanently miss without realizing it because they're poorly telegraphed.  It really feels like the best way to experience FF8 is to pull up a walkthrough.

Story-wise, I dig the boarding school vibes but holy crap these characters are morons.  In the middle of a life-or-death mission, one character runs off to make an apology.  She's presented as the smart and reasonable one, but I guess that couldn't wait until after.  Later the main character is put in command and is now responsible for dozens of lives.  He eventually runs away without telling anyone and this is presented as a heroic moment.  Nobody ever mentions how he basically abandoned his troops.  Even the world building feels weak because the rules of the world are only explained once they're immediately relevant.  What's a sorceress?  How does she get her powers?  What's a Lunatic Pandora?  What's a Lunar Cry?  These questions are introduced and answered in the same moment you're watching them reshape the story.  From the first act to the last, deus ex machina is confused for a clever story twist.

Here's a moment that's going to stick with me.  When the main character runs away, he takes this one very long, narrow bridge to escape.  There are no other boats, airships, or vehicles nearby other than the one he's leaving.  An NPC tells us this bridge is the only entrance into another country.  But somehow, when he gets to the end of the bridge, all of his friends are there to meet him.  The ship they came on is still behind him.

The best FF games have intricate foreshadowing that you catch on replay.  This one gets worse the more you think about it.

column8:
A true remaster of Final Fantasy 8 needs to understand the origin of the Final Fantasy series.

This game's exploration of common aesthetics in medieval high-fantasy (birthright, witchcraft, knights, romance, loyalty, etc.) gets put through the modern "wash" of the internet. Final Fantasy 8 doesn't make the similarity between high fantasy and modern life clear, but it's quite obvious when you put the minimal effort into thinking about the game. The main character, Squall, is a Myspace emo kid with little-to-no parenting. This is in large part because he is an orphan-turned-soldier of Balamb (the misleading 'student-life' aesthetics in the first parts of the game gradually give way into a full-fledged military context as the game progresses), but it's also because the world of Final Fantasy 8 is a world divided along digital lines. At the very beginning of the game, Quistis asks you to use your digital console to refresh your skills, this acts as an in-game instruction manual, but it's also a marker of digital education; in a sense, the absence of a formal educator. By the very end of the game the party is fighting for their lives, they're fighting for a semblance of physical reality that is not based in a pure operation of time but a human conception of time. 

Near the end of the game Final Fantasy 8 refers to a concept called [spoiler]"Time Compression"[/spoiler] which has no real depth of meaning outside of the implication that it exists: that you could potentially [spoiler]compress all of time into something controllable by one entity[/spoiler]. Honestly, it's just a literary 'MacGuffin' to 1) imply that time has a fundamental physical essence that you can control and 2) that only a Neo-classical-but-also-genocidal obsessed Final Fantasy villain would be interested in such a thing. Compressing [spoiler]all of time[/spoiler] in order to wield absolute control over the universe is an overly complicated and obtuse plan. 

It's also evil! 

This is why the game is all about a party of (mostly) simple-minded heroes stopping such a dumb thing from happening. This same conflict occurs within Squall's character development: [spoiler]his obtuse and complicated inner dialogue often gets 'washed out', or confronted, by the real situations he faces and the real people he loves and leads[/spoiler]. I think the tidal / beach sand imagery that opens the game is a good representation of all this: the content of water is actually chaotic, but when it comes up against the stable force of land it is kept in check.

It's also fitting that the game's first real 'dungeon' so-to-speak has you cutting through the waves to land on a beach. I don't think this is spoiler-worthy, but you storm a Communication Tower, an icon of digital life if-you-will, where the villains are 'turning it on'. You'd expect the bad guys to be taking over or destroying something, but no, they're activating a device. I could go on into how [spoiler]Lunar Cry is really an invading force of digitality (the Wild West of the late 90s / early aughts internet)[/spoiler] and how the game's 'Love Story' is about being 'turned on' in a sexual sense (thus, 'turned on' in a fundamentally human sense), but I think that requires some familiarity with other Japanese games and fiction in this same time period. 

No one has time to read about all that in a game review; I'll let you connect the individual dots because I don't want to [i]waste your time[/i] (wink-wink, nudge-nudge).

An actual thesis about this game would go something like:

"Everything in Final Fantasy 8's plot suggests that a simple life of love and marriage is what wins over the evil of [b]lost time[/b] at the end of the day; it truly is a modern take on all the chivalry and feudal life from previous Final Fantasy games." 

Anyway, enough about story...

In terms of gameplay, this same re-interpretation of old Final Fantasy aesthetics applies to its contentious and flawed "Junction" / magic system. Despite its complex mechanics, Junctioning still relies on the traditional aspects of Final Fantasy gameplay. You can transition any character from a White Mage to a Dark Knight between battles if you're smart about it (and you should be smart about it).

Your use of magic in Final Fantasy 8 is finite, but it's also hampered by your ability to find magic in the first place. Your characters draw 'magic stock' from other monsters and out-of-battle 'draw points' when you're walking about. This was the biggest complaint regarding Final Fantasy 8, but if you play beyond the first hour of the game or so, you quickly realise that you don't need to draw the maximum amount of stock for each magic spell you find. You just need enough to get by. Even though early spells get useless fast, there's a lot of menu alchemy (the 'Refine' abilities you learn as the game progress bypass the draw system of gaining magic) you can perform to make (some of) those early spells more powerful. 

The leveling system is flawed too: the game does give you levels (which imply small stat upgrades), but they're mostly meaningless. Enemies scale with your level too, so if you're worried about finishing the game with ease, power-leveling with experience points doesn't help you much. What's actually important is finding the Summons, the Guardian Forces (a.k.a 'GF'), so that you can gain abilities and Junction the variety of 'magic stock' you find to your stats...and the way to find (most) of those summons is to play through the story. 

Essentially, the only thing any character in Final Fantasy 8 can really do on their own is use their hands (with a weapon) to fight monsters and the only thing the player should be doing is completing the story. Final Fantasy 8 really is a narrative-driven game and if you've played through it once you've already played it a thousand times. Almost everything gameplay-wise is window-dressing or semi-unpolished; I think this Final Fantasy has the most static pool of monsters out of any RPG; there's virtually no 'equipment' in this game due to the Junction system; you technically upgrade your weapons, but it's very lackluster and based on more of that 'menu alchemy' I mentioned; I think I can go on forever about all its flaws...

Again: the actual gameplay is lacking. 

The bread-and-butter elements of the gameplay: Triple-casting, using Aura to spam Limit Breaks, 'boosting' and defending with GF Summons, equipping the best GF abilities, etc. all of this stuff is cool to execute but annoying to implement and discover.

Bottom-line, no one at Squaresoft (now Square Enix) ever understood the game they were trying to create: it's nigh impossible for them to actually remake or remaster the damn thing. It's telling that there are so many fan mods which aim to recreate the original aesthetics of these Final Fantasy games. The Final Fantasy 9 remaster for instance, has an issue with sound sampling: it's glaringly obvious when you start the game. I would be more interested in an emulation of the original games on PC, instead of the obsession with recreation, remastering and remaking. The mere existence of Plot-Ghosts in the Final Fantasy 7 'remake', the brightly saturated visuals of the Pixel Remasters, the rote reproduction of the words "Final Fantasy" in non-video-game contexts....

...a lot of what this series has evolved into seems like [spoiler]Time Compression[/spoiler] to me. It's not simply a refusal to let the past be the past: it's a refusal to authentically re-contextualise the past in a meaningful way. 

The only people who could understand Final Fantasy 8, or even attempt to 'remaster' it, have already gone through the ringer of all its obtuse gameplay intricacies, all of its weird plot devices, all of the off-key emotional moments and odd translations....they've moved on and maintain a wide berth from claiming it as an objectively 'good game'. 

Play through Final Fantasy 8 at least once, but you've officially been warned.

[h1] 极具争议的优秀佳作 [/h1]
[b] 已更新完美汉化补丁！感谢大佬们 https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1zK411S7GS/ [/b]
遥想六年前，在PS模拟器上玩着天幻版文本看着攻略，被吸引到没日没夜花了一周通关了这部优秀的作品。如果你不介意4:3和15帧与老游戏的长流程体验，无脑入手就完事了，在维持前作7革命级的CG化叙事基础上进行提升，大量GamePlay与CG无缝衔接，战斗系统繁杂却精密，需要投入大量的成本钻研它的乐趣。

R是否等于U的说法众说纷纭，毕竟过度解读本身也是评价喜闻乐见的一部分，每个制作人有自己的私货，square竟然喜欢留白让玩家深爱到即便过了二十多年，依然有人为其探讨去分析，足以证明它对于绝大多数玩家具有非常的意义。

就在近日，几位用爱发电的大佬完成了19版Remasterd的高清汉化工作，非常了不起！帮助更多想要入坑的玩家提供官方Remake之前最棒的选择，希望更多的人了解上这部优秀的JRPG。

只是人物重新建模，看起来“高清”顺眼了许多，背景还是糊的一笔，类比摇杆支持也不好，完全不类比，只有8个方向，就是十字键的映射，还TM没有震动。完全不值得购买。
还好民间大神汉化了，还做了高清MOD，有情怀的可以为情怀买单，就像我一样，没有情怀的就算了吧，想体验一下的直接模拟器，还支持类比摇杆和震动，不值得花钱。
j'ai adoré ce jeu a sa sortie !

column8: A great throwback and one of the best in the franchise. The Remaster just updates the character model and updates a few features that allows you to complete the game 100% without needing Chocobo World. Although it would have been nice if they updated the environment graphics, they hold up well enough. The only issues I noticed is that the game can crash if you play 3x Speed for too long. But playing at normal speed, the game runs great and any crash issues that others have reported seem to get resolved simply by pausing the OneDrive sync.

column8:
Das Spiel hat mich einfach nicht gepackt, hat aber durchaus seine Daseinsberechtigung, weil es halt innerhalb der klassischen Final Fantasy-Teile (I - IX) mittels seiner Spielsysteme noch einmal heraussticht. Wahrscheinlich liebt oder hasst man es.

Wer klassische JRPGs mag und dieses Spiel noch nachholen möchte, der kann und sollte natürlich zugreifen. Das Remaster scheint die derzeit beste erhältliche Version zu sein, wobei es in meinen Augen sehr lieblos gehalten ist: Die Models der wichtigen Charaktere sind stark aufgehübscht, die Umgebungen sehen allerdings weiterhin sehr altbacken aus, was zur Folge hat, dass auch Nebencharaktere/Statisten als mit eben dieser Umgebung verschmelzen. So wirkt das Spiel nicht "wie aus einem Guss".

Mithilfe der Cheats kann man das Spiel möglichst schnell hinter sich bringen, wenn man einfach nur die Story genießen möchte. Diese sind aber selbstverständlich optional.

Für einen Einstieg in die Final-Fantasy-Reihe würde ich diesen Teil nicht empfehlen, gerade weil er so eigen ist. Stattdessen finde ich die Teile VI, VII, IX und X zugänglicher, können mit ihren Erzählungen ebenfalls verzaubern und sind sinnbildlicher für die Reihe. Fans wissen natürlich, woran sie sind. Denen würde ich das Remaster allerdings nur empfehlen, wenn Final Fantasy VIII für sie auf keiner anderen Art und Weise mehr spielbar ist.
作为零零后第一次接触ff系列的作品，由于没有汉化的缘故，前期了解设定什么的还是比较吃力，但熟悉之后就彻底沉浸到游戏之中了。请对自己英语能力没有很大信心的朋友们谨慎购买。以及Faye的Eyes on Me实在是太好听啦。

Note, the game runs great on the steam deck but its not play nice with the standby of the deck. after a standby the game crashes for me if i switch to the menu or fights.

The game is "good" but I have to be "honest". It's "bugged" and "crashes" at "random times". I started playing it and was really enjoying it(was at the beginning of it where I can "Level" Seifer to "Level 100" doing the "Seifer-Leveling Trick"). Did that and then Saved. Game crashed after(Thankfully I saved). Also when I was destroying "X-ATM092" there were "Graphical Glitches" after the "First Battle" with him. Game crashed after "Destroyed him" after draw-stocking "Protect" AND getting the "Force Armlet" drop from immediately after. It also crashed BADLY at the "ShoreLine" where I met "Quistis" after "Saving" there(Again, thankfully I saved there!). It seems to "Crash" when you go to/from a "Screen-to-another". Game is practically UN-PLAYABLE. I really hope they "Patch" this.

之前在PC上用PS1模拟器通关了一遍，现在补票又玩了一遍【3倍速】，只能说最终幻想8是让我意犹未尽的一部最终幻想。
本作流程主线大概在30个小时左右。
这一部来自1999年的最终幻想，和前辈庞大的世界观相比，显得略微逊色。
最终幻想7本传挖的坑，前传，电影，小说，动画都给填了回来。
但最终幻想8所埋下的诸多伏笔，却只能埋藏了本篇中，这是我觉得很遗憾的事情。
在情怀属性的加持下，我还是更喜欢最终幻想7，但这并不代表最终幻想8不是一款好游戏。
本作为1999年PS1最终幻想8虫豸版，只重置了分辨率和贴图。
购买建议：不建议路人购买，我可以负责任的说，不建议任何路人玩以前的老JRPG，真的会给你地狱般的体验，以前的老JRPG基本都是这一套缺点。如果你能接受积木人的角色建模和标清的过场CG，无汉化，随机刷怪，游戏对话文本极多，不能随地存档，刷级体验繁杂，等一系列的缺点的话，那这就是一部不可多得的佳作。
重置版自带金手指修改和三倍速游戏，只需要LT【左大扳机键】+L3【左摇杆按键】就能调出金手指菜单，L3【左摇杆按键】为三倍速游戏。
关于汉化问题：由于SE的逆天操作，汉化都不能用了。建议上某宝或者某网站下个中文重置版盗版，然后将盗版文件覆盖到正版文件夹里面，就是中文的了，覆盖前记得备份存档，会连存档一起覆盖掉。
最后顺便跟蒂法说一声，叫她不要再联系我了，我怕莉诺雅误会。
Perfect!

Comecei a jogar a franquia desde o FF5 e com certeza o FF8 é um dos piores FFs que já joguei. Gameplay chato, o sistema de draws é muito cansativo. A história é bem chata tbm, não empolga. Os personagens não tem carisma, a trilha sonora é fraca. E a cereja do bolo foi a preguiça dos Devs em remasterizar os gráficos do jogo, só tiveram o trabalho de refazer os personagens e NPCs. Terminei usando os cheats do próprio jogo, fiquei de saco cheio de jogar como deve ser jogado. Lembro que na época do PS1, o jogo foi um marco tecnológico comparado ao FF7, mas jogando novamente agora, lembro o porque eu não gostei do jogo.
Se vc procura um bom FF, jogue o FF6, FF7, FF9, FF10 ou FF12. O FF8 e o FF13 esqueça.
Nota 3.

FINAL FANTASY VIII has a ton of great things going for it. The game looks stellar. Its innovations don't always work, but they're often bold and interesting. But this release has one key issue:

It crashes. Constantly.

The crashes are consistent across multiple devices, and some are at story-critical moments that cannot be avoided. There are a variety of workarounds that can overcome some of these crashes, but the frustration still lingers. Hopefully one day the game will be patched and playable. For now, I can't recommend anyone buy this version of the game.

Also it has Triple Triad so it's automatically a 10/10.

column8:
I can't recall if FF VIII was my first FF or my second, but it was for sure the one that has left a long-lasting favorable impression on me to this day. The funny thing is, seeing the graphics that I experienced many years ago, I can't believe how we used to imagine the game in a way that most people are going to see the Remastered version and think that it looks the same way they remember it, but it does not. 
FF8 has IMO the best protagonist, it has some deep to it, and is not a generic blonde hero like many other FF. I think XV tried to do a similar OP as Squall, but I don't remember that game very well. It was also the game that thought me that a romantic plot has a place in a fantasy game and my teen brain was in love with Rinoa way before the word waifu existed.
The music of FF8 is also IMO the best of the series. Not a single annoying track and the vibe that most of the non-combat locations gives is pure bliss. I get peace just by listening to them. 
This Remastered version has very improved models and some quality-of-life boosters that help you to just go ahead and experience the story again without the time-consuming farming that plagues most Japanese developers and FF games in particular. 
TL; DR: You want to experience FF* again with decent graphics for its date, without having to put many hours into it? This Remastered version is for you. Also, your purchase perhaps will convince Square Enix to make a truly Remastered version as they did with FF VII. 

Story: 9/10
Gameplay: 8/10
Difficulty: 8/10
Characters: 10/10
Music: 10/10
Enjoyment: 9/10
Replayability: 8/10 (story run)  (6/10 perfectionist run with PC version improvements).

Final Fantasy VIII is one of the shorter Final Fantasy games. Despite this, playing through it took me the longest simply because I dreaded playing this game. Out of the Final Fantasy games I've played, VIII easily ranks towards the bottom of my list. 

When I started playing I chose to ignore playing Triple Triad because I do not play Final Fantasy for cards. That was a huge mistake. By the end of disc 2 I was severely underpowered. Squall hit like a truck, but every single other character was doing chip damage. This is because without playing Triple Triad I was locked out of weapon upgrades, and I was lacking a ton of magic that you can mod from the cards. I understand having a fun card minigame for those who enjoy that, but I should not be weaker for not playing it.

After I looked up why I was so weak I realised that I HAVE to play the card game in order to have anything resembling a strong party. That is not good game design. I prefer how Final Fantasy IX handles the cards; A completely optional minigame. If I want to get on with the story and gameplay, I should be able to without getting handicapped for the entire rest of the game.

Drawing from enemies is a drag. It makes every battle where you see a new spell take ages as you draw 300 of it for every character. It doesn't help that theres always one party member who will only draw 0-5 at a time instead of 9. Then you have two members with 100 of the spell and one character still lagging behind with 50 of the spell. Without a defend or wait action, you are forced to either draw another spell you might not want, or if you are full on every spell for that enemy you simply have to kill them, stopping the slower member from stocking up.

The story is rather weak in my opinion. It starts off pretty slow with you at the Garden, and then doing the mission with Seifer. After that you do a gimmicky train section with Rinoa and after that is when things start to really happen. I won't go over the whole story, but a lot of it felt like filler. The only parts I liked were switching over to Laguna, the last half of disc 3, and disc 4. The game kind of gets crazy near the end and i was there for it. At least i wasn't bored anymore.

The music is a highlight for sure. Nobuo Uematsu knocks it out of the park as always. Some of my favorite tracks were; Man with the Machine Gun, Force Your Way, Eyes on Me, and Liberi Fatali. All of them were awesome and made playing the game just that little bit more bearable. 

One thing I did like was how often the game would switch to an FMV animated background and let you retain control of your character. It felt awesome to be walking around these giant events happening all around you, and it would happen fairly often. Those fully animated cutscenes were a joy to watch as well. My favorite being Squall driving up to assassinate Sorceress Edea. Something about that was just so cool.

Normally I don't mention if I play a remaster but holy shit is this a bad one. Square seems to have lost the source for the backgrounds so they look worse than they did on PS1. There is also no wide-screen. Basically the only things that make this game a 'remaster' are the new models for every main character, and some cheats like triple speed (thank god for that).

Character related spoilers: [spoiler] Seifer's character was terribly handled. One of the only things I knew going in was that Squall had a cool rival with a matching scar, so I was excited to see how it would play out. Well, near the ending you fight him, and then he just goes away. Later in the final cutscene you see him fishing. That's it? Seriously? Total waste of a cool character. He should have been involved in the final dungeon somehow. It wouldn't be too hard to write him in. [/spoiler]

Overall, Final Fantasy VIII goes just above II and IV for my least favorites. Not the worst Final Fantasy, but certainly not the best. I wouldn't recommend this one to anybody but die-hard fans.

column8:
Final Fantasy 8 gehört zu den Besten Teil der Kompletten Reihe. Sowohl die Kämpfe als auch die Wunderbare Story. Nur ist sie für mich nicht Neu. Ich hab Anfang der 2000er das erste Mal FF8 auf PSX gezockt. Diese Version ist einfach die gleiche, nur als Remastered. Die Texturen von Charakteren etc. sehen echt geil aus. Man erkennt Gesichter und sogar das Blinzeln der Augen. Klar sind 20€ gewagt für aufgewärmtes, aber für 50% Rabatt, also 10€ alle male Wert. 

In der heutigen Zeit ist das Game aber für viele eine Belastung, vor allem die, die nach 2000 erst Geboren wurden. Denn hier gibt es KEINE Sprachausgabe. Es wird Gelesen und Gelesen. Und es gibt viel zu Lesen. Begleitet wird alles mit einem schönen Soundtrack.

Da ich alles bereits kenne, hab ich mit den 3 Boosters gespielt (Gibs nur auf Steam, Original PSX nicht). Ich wollte nochmal die Story spielen und die Erfolge holen. Die 3 Booster sind: Unsterblich (So lange einem nichts trifft, was höher als die aktuelle HP ist, Todesurteil geht auch noch, ATB Balken immer voll und immer Aura), Keine Kämpfe (Ausnahme sind die gescripteten) und Spielgeschwindigkeit x3. Es gibt noch "Cheats" wie alle Karten oder items, aber wer diese nutzt, deaktiviert auch die Erfolge.

Leider kann man bei FF8 ein riesen Fehler begehen... denn FF8 ist zwar ein RPG, wo man kämpft und EXP bekommt. Aber das Frühzeitige hochleveln ist ein Fehler!!! Ja, denn die Monster Leveln alle mit. Man kann quasi das Game mit Level 10 durchspielen. Im Originalen FF8 gibt es sogar ein Erfolg, da muss Squall Level 7 bleiben. 

Man muss halt die richtigen Zauber koppeln und am Besten jeden Char einzeln später hochziehen, sobald man von den GF Ability hat wie "HP Plus, Stärke Plus" etc. dadurch bekommen wir pro Levelaufstieg max. Werte. Lustig ist, dass man Squalls Beste Waffe "Löwenherz" schon von Anfang an kriegen kann, sowie starke Zauber wie Tornado, womit man einige Tausend Schaden macht und viele Gegner damit sogar One hittet.

Zudem spielt das Koppeln von Zauber eine weitere Rolle. Es gibt die Abwehr und Angriff. Ich hab es geschafft, damals Squall auf CD 1 auf Level 100 zu bringen (Man braucht immer nur 1000 und max. 99.000 EXP bis 100). Aber es brachte nix. Ich war Schwach wie Scheis se :D 

Und den Fehler machen viele - fast alle, die das Game nicht kennen. Nur woher soll man das Wissen, vor allem damals ohne Internet etc.

Thema Erfolge: Es sind einige vom Originalen FF8 entfernt wurden. z.B. 
- 10.000 Kills... das ist einfach nur bekloppt. Selbst mit Hardcore Leveln schafft man vllt. paar Tausend max.
- Choco-Beute... so ein Mini Kagg Game
- Sammle alle Karten... einer der allerschwersten Erfolge (Nicht wegen das Minigame, sondern wegen dessen Regeln)
- Mit Squalls Anfangslevel durchgespielt... möglich, aber schwer, da Squall fast immer in Gruppe ist und am besten Kampfunfähig sein muss

Im Remastered sind eigentlich nur der Omega Weapon der Schwerste, obwohl "Sammle alle Timber Magazine" weniger haben als den Omega Erfolg :D

Spielzeit beträgt Casual mehr als 40-60 Stunden. Wer ALLES holen will, ohne Booster etc. braucht locker 100-120 std, vor allem, wenn man jeden einzelnen Charakter hochlevelt mit den Abilitys.

Ist das Game 20€ Wert? Ich sage mal, JA! Denn FF8 ist echt Hammer! Für Kenner und Erfolgsjäger empfehle ich eher die 50% Rabatt. Werde die nächsten Wochen anfangen die Erfolge im Originalen FF8 zu holen <.<

A personal problematic favorite Final Fantasy game of mine that is filled with as much weird stuff as it is gameplay issues. I really miss the Squaresoft that was willing to publish weird stuff like this game and Xenogears. I more appreciate the risks this game took now that we are decades away from it's launch even if I didn't love it when it first came out.

This remaster is overall worth it but takes some adjustment. Firstly, they upscaled all the models but none of the backgrounds, meaning you're going to be running around really terrible looking backgrounds the entire game. They added a Cheat Mode that gives you infinite power and HP, a no random encounters mode and a 3x speed mode. These are all completely optional and can be toggled at anytime but the 3x mode really speeds along some of the dry stuff like drawing magic from enemies or waiting for the AI to make a choice in Triple Triad. No Encounter mode is already in the game itself via the Diablos GF, so I personally didn't feel that bad about using it. I never used the Battle Cheat toggle, but it's there if you want to use it for any reason and can be turned on and off anytime.

I see some reviews stating to just play it on an emulator. I do think this is worth it for the added modes, and the 3x speed is better than an emulator because the game will automatically slow down at points that you need it to do so (such as during Irvine's Limit Break.) I also see some complaints about game crashes. I'm sure this is based on specific computer hardware but never experienced any issue in my 43 hours of gameplay

Final Fantasy VIII is a Beautiful Game... a Beautiful Flawed game might I say however. This game has always been the most polarizing game in the series in terms of who likes it or not, as either you think this game is one of, if not the best Final Fantasy game, or you think that it is one of the worst. While I really liked this game, I can completely understand either sides, as this game is either a "you love it, or you hate it" type of game due to how it is structured.

Story
FF8's story was something that I actually like liked a ton. While it does get pretty confusing with the time travel, loops, and warps, it doesn't get to the point of obsurdity till around the end part, and even that was pretty easy to understand at the end apart from like one scene I was confused from. I however still think the story is one of the strengths of this game, and is a much more complicated story especially when compared to FF7. While it isn't the BEST executed story, what is there is lovely imo. There were also just a ton of scenes in this game that were amazing, from the space scene, to the end credits, enough to wet my eyes at points. There are a ton of pacing issues in this game, and it suffers even worse then FF7 original and made me doubt my rating, but each time it does get back to the story I was hooked again. The start is slow, but it gets REALLY good around 1/4 of the way through for tensity. There are also a ton of dream sequences, which if Laguna wasn't as good of a character as he was, would prob be annoying to deal with.

Characters
I really did like the characters in this game, I especially liked the flaws they each inherited, even if they were kinda glossed over at times. Squall is a reluctant hero, Rinoa is in control of a evil power she doesn't know what to do with, Irvine may act confident but easily chokes in situations and panics, Edea regrets her actions and Laguna, my god was his character arc really good to go thru, from his confident, yet awkward scenes with any female, to his relationship with Julia, tying with Squall and Rinoa's relationship, to Ellone and Raine. It also helps a ton that his battle theme BANGS. Of course there are some issues as well, Zell does have interesting character development, as he begins to doubt himself after a mistake he made, but he is kinda just the energetic guy who loves to eat. Selphie is also interesting, but not as interesting as the other characters, Quistis is also interesting, but again, isn't as developed as the other characters, as she is just simply the teacher demoted to a student, who also doubts her abilities after that.

Gameplay
This is where FF8's biggest weakness shows. While I have mixed feelings for it, I also believe that if you go into FF8, expecting the usual Final Fantasy gameplay... you may turn out disappointing compared to if you tackle it like I did and played it a different way. SOOOO many aspects of this game was made to oppose a ton of usual Final Fantasy mechanics, and while I do understand their reasoning for each of them, it can throw off people who expected it one way and got this instead. For example, Grinding in this game is basically gone, as not only is there level scaling, but the enemies get STRONGER the more you level up, basically discouraging grinding. It is the only time I said "FUCK I leveled up" and meant it. The one mechanic however that people point at is easily the draw mechanic, and in connection to, the junction mechanic. I do think the junction mechanic was a smart solution to how players don't really care for their armor, usually auto selecting the one with better stats and not caring for the other. They basically made planning your stats a gameplay element, and while I do think it was a very smart way of handling it, it is kinda damaged by how the draw mechanic works. Simply put, Drawing in this game is... boring. It isn't fun at all and I hate this mechanic personally. It is smart at first cause MP is basically gone, replaced by stocked magic, but it just slows down the process cause now you would have to basically grind the magic and not even kill the enemy to get the stacks you want. Also since magic is stocked and your junction is tied to your magic stocks, it discourages using your magic, cause now you have to consider using that magic spell that is junction, will weaken your character due to having less stocks overall. This is something that would easily put me off... but is quite honestly SAVED by one gameplay mechanic... Triple Triad. Triple Triad is an AMAZING minigame, and easily my favorite of the series, its just so damn simple yet so addicting of a card game. However not only is it really fun to play, it is also basically tied to your progression in the game, as it turns the game into this pokemon-like, as instead of killing enemies, you card them. With this, you can either use those powerful cards to battle better opponents, especially with the side quests that tie into the card system, or you can use those cards and turn them into items, which turns into MAGIC. With this, the draw mechanic is basically AVOIDED for 95% of the game, and is only really used in the beginning, and near the end when you are basically forced to use draw again for the end-game spells, since the cards are no longer the efficient method of getting huge amounts of those spells sadly which sucks. Approaching the game THIS way made it just that much more fun, and while I do understand the criticism, even I agree that it is strange how the system works, and if you don't like cards, how much you would prob dislike this game, triple triad is what carries this game's otherwise ok gameplay in comparison to other FF games. 

Music
Well of course the music is good, it's Final Fantasy. What I didn't expect however was how good OVERALL the ost was for this game, even better then Final Fantasy VII IMO. Not only were the overall songs just really damn good with the battle and boss themes, garden theme and other songs, it also has REALLY good standout songs like again, garden theme, Laguna's Theme, Eyes on me, Final Boss theme, and many, many other songs that I just LOVED. While it ain't all perfect of course, the OST overall was pretty damn good, even for Final Fantasy standards.

Nitpicks/Last Positives
-Omega Weapon Superboss was a bit too easy, I did use the holy war strat, but even without it I could imagine the boss not being that hard due to how strong limit breaks are in this game, especially since he scales with you in the remaster.
- I really disliked how Draw is basically needed to be used again end game, kinda was hoping that they could be earned through the cards, but nope.
-The Graphics in this game is easily a plus for PS1 graphics, especially when compared to FF7. While I do know that the models were upgraded in the remaster, this game's cinematics and such is still very impressive.
-I loved how much faster paced the combats were, small things like how as one party member's attack is ending, the other is already starting, and the GFs (summons) were not broken in terms of damage, so while even though their animations are shorter overall with more action packed in them, it was a nice change to not have to do something similar to FF7's knights of the round spam LOL.
-FUCK the Random ruleset in Triple Triad, if I had ONE thing to complain about, it was how rules spreaded, ESPECIALLY when Random was a choice it just made resetting and RNG praying that Random doesn't spread, made it really damn annoying to deal with.

Conclusion
Despite the easily noticeable Flaws of FF8, I still really enjoyed this game for what it is, a creative and big jump to innovate the usual FF formula, and while some things didn't land of course, it was a nice change of pace. While the story isn't perfect nor are the characters, and the gameplay isn't the greatest of the series, It stands out amongst the rest of the series for its uniqueness. Also Triple Triad is PEAK.
8.5/10

column8:
--- I got this game on sale for $5. This review is based on that--- 

This is not really a full remaster. The character models did get a good upgrade, but the backgrounds were untouched. I can imagine that if they were to redo all the backgrounds in a widescreen 4k and re-do the models, well thats all that there is in this kind of game from this era. It would end up becoming a remake. I don't mind it.

I also dont mind the aspect ratio. The game was designed with that aspect ratio, including fov moments and menu/icon locations. There are mods if you want to change it, but it takes away from the games deliberate design imo.

The music is original too. Also something that I like. Again, there are mods if you dont. I do feel like they could have done the music and given us an option to go between old and new, ala the Resident Evil 2 Remake.

What it DOES add is niffty quality of life improvements that make the game a MUCH more enjoyable experience that are mapped to controls and available from the start of the game. The ability to speed up the game really takes the drag out of grinding levels/AP/Items and cuts down on travel time. The ability to toggle random encounters on and off is also a huge headache saver, since now you no longer have to go through a bunch of menus to equip to no encounter ability and go re-equip it when you're done.

I have had no issues with sound, video quality, or play back issues.

Its my favorite way to play FF8 by far. Would love to see a proper remaster one day.

column8:
UN FINAL FANTASY CONTROVERSIAL
Para muchos una obra maestra de los videojuegos, para otros un juego bastante cutre, para mi una castaña aburrida, porque? Os dare mis motivos:
La historia empieza con un chaval llamado Squall que se enfrenta a su mayor enemigo Seifer, ambos diestros en las artes de la lucha con Sable pistola y ambos alummnos del Jardin de Balamb unas instalaciones que Forman a los Seed, unidades de elite que pueden ser contratados por otros paises para escoltar personas, participar en guerras y demás, basicamente mercenarios.
Con esta premisa, que es lo mejor del juego "El principio" pero escala muy muy mal, he de decir que esta critica es mi opinion personal, para gustos colores algunos me darán la razón y otros me llamarán loco (Si me encantan las frases de Thanos).
Dicho lo cual comenzamos:

Gráficos: Hablaré de la opción remaster, ya que el original es muy pocho, este solo profundiza un poco el mapeado y las caras las hace normales y no pixeles puestos porque si, sin nada del otro mundo en su dia fue un salto enorme pero visto lo cual prefiero las opciones 2D a esto por que los graficos dejan mucho que desear y ojo entiendo que en la epoca Aka 1999 era la polla pero a dia de hoy si no lo has jugado de niño te va a doler.

Historia: Al principio buena, luego va dando altibajos momentos culmen y momentos basura, no sé quien hizo el guion o si en su dia hubo problemas pero esto es terrible, Seifer es lamentable y el jefe final olvidable, lo unico destacable es Laguna y su historia que parece que lo ha escrito otro guionista pero este con dos dedos de frente, te deja muy mal cuando acabas el juego, final forzado e innecesario.

Gameplay: Por turnos, Y como cada Final Fantasy es diferente, yo digo que la implementacion del sistema de combate de este en concreto es jodidamente malo, los que te digan que el gameplay es god y que no lo entienden son subnormal3s profundos, entendemos el sistema de Enlaces iluminado pero eso no quita que sea aburrido de narices y no sirve ni presenta dificultad por lo que voy a decir a continuación:

Dificultad: Este apartado es absurdo, Los enemigos escalan cuando tu subes de nivel, traduccion = no presenta dificultad alguna, por eso dije antes que el sistema de combate es absurdo, de que te sirve hacer combinaciones si vas a realizar el mismo daño? Porque los enemigos tienen tu mismo nivel, que sentido tiene que subas tus personajes a nivel 100 y los enemigos tambien? Square que habeis hecho??? Es innovador no os lo discuto pero es una tremenda basura, Cuando juegas a este tipo de juegos quieres farmear y pasarte jefes dificiles o Hacer la historia normal pero que presente un minimo de dificultad como en todos los FF, Con nivel 5 te puedes pasar el jefe final no tiene sentido, Enemigos como omega y demas jefes dificiles en toda la saga son dificiles aqui son un jodido chiste.

BSO: Machacante es la palabra si, Lo unico destacable, La cancion de Laguna es increiblemente buena y la de Eyes On Me que es muy buena de las mejores canciones de la saga en mi opinion.  

Mapeado: No tengo palabras para describir esto, Mapa del Paint en 3D.

En definitiva, Parece que soy un Hater de la saga o algo asi pero ni mas ni menos soy un hater con este juego en concreto! Los demás juegos me encantan unos mas otros menos, pero este me costó acabarlo no es coña, queria acabarlo para ver como acababa pero j0der.

column8:
Gioco INFINITO e bellissimo

Graficamente il migliore dei migliori, nettamente tra i primi della classe per quanto riguarda la Play 1 all'epoca
Era il gioco finale, una longevità assurda, possibilità di fare il minigioco delle carte e dei chocobo
Upgrade armi
Livello personaggi che per i maniaci della saga rappresentava una novità (sistema Junction e magie numeriche invece che con MP non erano il massimo) ma a me piace di più rispetto a tutti gli altri FF.
Esatto, FF8 è il classico odio et amo.

O lo ami, o ami il 7 o il 9 ... alla fine non c'è storia.
Anche il 10 ha il suo perchè (eccome se ce l'ha) 

Però essendo stato il primo JRPG giocato da me, come si dice? 
Il primo amore non si scorda mai.
Ecco che ho tutte le versioni per tutti i dispositivi e praticamente ho platinato tutto ovunque e mi accingo a platinare anche la versione Remake ...
Qui la vita è più semplificata, ma almeno ti mette voglia di rigiocarci e reiniziare ogni volta che si vuole, almeno non si stanno giorni ad assimilare le prime magie.

I boss diventano meno stressanti e la vita ti sorride ma diventa sempre un titolo longevo e bellissimo per chi si vuole approcciare al mondo degli FF

Must have per gli amanti, consigliato per chi vuole giocarci ad oggi ed ama i giochi retrò.

column8:
Final Fantasy VIII, What do I say about this beauty of A game?

Well it is the definition of my childhood, It is the 1st Final Fantasy I remember playing to date besides Final Fantasy IX.

I love everything about this game - The story, The world, The monsters, The replayability with the GF/Junction system, The party members. To me it is all just amazing and it needs the Final Fantasy VII remake treatment as it is a better game for me personally. 

10/10 this game is just flawless, I see no faults with it whatsoever. 

Only small minor problem with this game is the final boss, It didn't seem to matter who I prepped for the final fight the party was chosen at random so I had to die time and time again until I got the 3 I had maxed out.

column8: Final Fantasy VIII "Remastered"... ma non troppo. Chi ha memoria di questo gioco potrebbe valutare l'acquisto di questa versione leggermente rifinita, che tuttavia, per questioni tecniche (sembra che il codice originale sia andato perso) non si presenta all'altezza delle aspettative. L'aspect ratio rimane il 4:3, buona parte degli sfondi, dei modelli e delle animazioni sono rimaste tali e quali all'edizione standard, con solo un aumento di risoluzione che non giustifica, secondo me, l'esistenza stessa di questa versione. Il volto di Squall è poi così diverso dalla versione originale da non sembrare quasi lo stesso personaggio. Mi sarei aspettato un volto quanto più simile allo Squall delle cutscene originali, che a quello rimodellato visto già in Final Fantasy Dissidia. Un valido motivo per acquistare FF VIII Remastered è la nostalgia e l'affetto verso questo capitolo, che chi come me vuole spesso rivivere, può adesso farlo a velocità tripla e saltando qualsiasi tipo di grinding. Per chi invece volesse avvicinarsi per la prima volta a Final Fantasy VIII, mi sento di consigliare la versione standard, che offre un'esperienza più autentica e graficamente coerente. Nell'attesa di un Final Fantasy VIII Remake, buon junctioning a tutti!

column8:
"在永恒与虚无面前作出自我抉择，对友情的信任、爱情的守护，一场完美的青春校园爱情剧。"
  2022年8月12日，我通关并白金了PS4版本《最终幻想8重置版》，这份来自1999年以"爱情"为主题的馈赠，我欣然接收了，初三的暑假我为《最终幻想7倾吐了内心千字感言，今天也在这为《最终幻想8》来份完结吧。
  《最终幻想8》在电子游戏史上是怎样的地位就无需多言了，上世纪90年代继《最终幻想7》《异度装甲》《超时空之轮》等里程碑意义游戏后的又一款艺术作品，把史克威尔再次推上了巅峰。《最终幻想8》其首次采用现实人物比例，大量的过场cg，新增的战斗系统，以"爱"为主题的故事剧情，掠走多少泪水的《Eyes on me》以及ff系列的常驻人物，野岛，植松，北濑，野村，桥本等常驻人物的正常发挥，毋庸置疑的，ff8再次成功了。我也是完完全全体验完《最终幻想7》之后，开启了，我的《最终幻想8》之旅，纵使知道正版都与汉化无无缘，2022国内汉化也才正式起步，但还是分别购入了PS1原版实体，ps4数字版，Steam正版，为所热爱的支持，是游玩的一种尊重吧!
  《最终幻想8》的进程是要比《最终幻想7》快很多的，不知道是不是8代1年半做出来的成品长度不及ff7还是咋滴。开始ff8之前其实我是特别犹豫的，因为他全平台没汉化，我又特别想玩正版，也不想云，所以我想出来一种方法，ps4平台玩通关白金，玩一段，b站看一段翻译，直至昨天12号才正式通关，比较麻烦，但还是坚持下来了，通关了正版，这也就导致了我没办法像玩ff7一样投入游戏剧情中了...只能说se更新游戏顺带禁汉化的行为确实不友好!但还好，白金程度我认为是ff系列最低的一部。刚开始玩的时候，开头的cg就把我惊到了1999年的游戏你进游戏都能看到这样的cg，确实是瞠目结舌了，ff7还是在游戏正式开始后才来的cg，可以看出经过ff7的技术沉淀，史克威尔3d技术已经很领先了，太膨胀了也导致了ff灵魂深处的破产....
  我正式开始了《最终幻想8》的旅程，游戏中很明显地体会到这作的不同之处，整个游戏大部分地方以欢乐轻快的音乐来突破先前ff系列较为沉重的剧情，集聚一堂的巴拉姆学园，一切都从斯考尔开始。玩的时候我就在感慨了，ff8不重制的状态下人物面部表情已经如此精致，动作归功于动捕也显得活灵活现，那要是remake，其成品将压倒ff7重制版吧，斯考尔的与莉诺雅的绝世美颜也绝不会差与蒂法与克劳德，当然还是撼动不了我心中尤娜的地位!其次是争议较大的战斗系统，依旧是及时战斗，但是竟然是动态等级，而且取消了"装备"选项，代替而来的是魔法石的代替与升级，我是不太喜欢的，ff传统的jrpg已经玩的太习惯了，但这一改变我觉得是正确的，凡事都是再不断革新中成长的，当然熟悉的召唤兽还是延续了下来，出场破费的演出完全不逊于前作。然后就到了正式成为seed后的舞会，那一让中国玩家吹爆的名场面，说实话，ff7cg多，但很少让我印象深刻，不像ff8和ff10，真实的比例人物和应景的音乐，脑子马上就浮现出ff10幻光河的吻，ff8的舞会，ff15的水下露娜，只能说这一幕随着eyes on me的伴奏真是太神了。就此，女主邂逅了男主。
  虽然说抛开了较为沉重的剧情，但ff系列故事总少不了冲突和对人物形象的塑造。这点在游戏中后期凸显的极为严重，先前钢铁直男斯考尔面对诉苦的老师却是沉默以待，后来竟为了女主作出了改变，性格上，心理上。男主一直以来可以说是一个孤儿，母亲死亡，父亲忙于政事，从小就独当一面，内心也压抑着痛苦，女主虽然出生优渥，但与父亲对立的她一直充满内心矛盾，从要强直面魔女到清楚自己内心，最后还是要男主的依靠，于是，父母辈命运不平的二人走在了一起，人物塑造还是和ff7一样做的很出色，这也是为什么我要用引用我在贴吧看到的"在永恒与虚无面前作出自我抉择"斯考尔还是和克劳德有点类似的。ff8中尤其是斯考尔背着莉诺亚走上几天几夜那一段，他为女主吐露出太多心声，与之前沉默寡言，充耳不闻的高冷形象形成了鲜明的对比，男女主羁绊也进一步加深。
  其实吧，ff8注定圆满的结局，并没有像ff7，ff10一样太触动我，并不是说ff8不够经典，也许吧，在我心中他并不是我心中的经典，每个人都有自己的ff经典，可以说，ff每一部都可以成为经典，也可以这么说，我认为我更喜欢ff中的悲剧，爱情背后的悲剧我觉得是最容易引起玩家共鸣的，当然也不是不喜欢大团圆.....ff8也在我童年完结了，我以前抱怨我不能早点出生，第一时间玩到ff系列，其实不应该这样，现在在17 16岁的年华玩到了最终幻想最经典的作品，也深受触动，这也在我童年范围内啊，必然在十几年后，我能回忆起现在指尖一字字打下的玩后感的情景，我想也和当初人们看到ff7重制一样，充满了情怀怀念吧《最终幻想8》无疑是游戏界最经典的游戏作品之一，当它结局后《最终幻想主题曲》的响起，一切肃然起敬了，对ff系列的尊敬，一部幻想作品的完结撒花，旅程的重点，都寄托在这首伴奏中，我也希望，未来ff7重制ff16做完了，se能够重制一下《最终幻想8》，那时候的预告片我希望用上《eyes on me》，到底又会有多少玩家流下泪水呢.....
  谢谢你，se和最终幻想，遇见你们，我很幸福。

亲情、爱情、原罪与死之螺旋——基于现实的幻想
它不需要被重制，但需要被人记住
——B站UPviya
倘若有人问我：“《最终幻想》中你觉得最“”幻想”的一部是哪一部？”我会毫不犹豫地回答道：“《最终幻想10》。”
高一暑假第21天，2022年8月1日下午4点55分，我用近40小时的主线和N小时无尽的白金时长，完美通关并且白金了PS4版本《最终幻想10 X HD重置版》，自从初三时期最终幻想7》让我倾吐千字感言，今天，我也要用一晚上时间，循环着《素敌だね》，倾诉内心感言与这一段”以死为主题的爱情故事”到头来，我还是最想对游戏玩家说的一句话：“能遇见《最终幻想》真是太幸福了。
初次邂逅FF10，是初三吧，那时候偶尔能在B站或者游戏资讯上看到一个漂亮、温柔、果敢、短发的女性FF角色，便渐渐对FF10产生了兴趣。这之后我除了看到一些关于Yuna的游戏图片和同人图，我没有观看任何关于FF10游戏剧情的任何视频，因为我早就别人无意间剧透过，这是一部悲剧，是FF系列剧情天花板，我也渐渐对FF10产生敬畏感。那会吧，也还在打《最终幻想7：重制版》，也是这一重制作品，把我彻底拉入最终幻想的世界，让我真正想去主动接触一个游戏系列。在FF7的游玩下，我也没有过多的去接触关于FF10的游戏相关的信息，直到我初三暑假，真正的，把FF7整个系列：小说、电影、动漫以及它的一切衍生作品，通关撒花后，我才放下了FF7，开始接触下一部FF作品，它就是FF10。FF10啊，并不是我接触的第二部FF作品，在我小学到初一这段时间吧，刚买PS4不久就买了《最终幻想15》的国行版本，也是懵懵懂懂的通关了就回血了，没怎么关注这个游戏系列，觉得好玩，纯ARPG?所以FF10是我正式接触的第三部FF作品了。于是，我购入了PS4版本的FF10国行，之所以买国行，是因为自带铁盒啊…然后还买了它的PS2原始版本，打算收藏，也单独买了一份FF10港版作为收藏，顺带购买的，是我另一个对我影响重大的系列——异度神剑，同XB1一块购入，并且还没开始启动游戏，就已经决定要永远收藏这两款游戏了。
FF10和XB1的旅程同时开始了，我还更新了PSN的个人介绍为“想要帮助尤娜打倒辛，重回高桥的异度大陆继续我的旅程.”看起来那时候的我是无比幼稚啊，想笑，到现在还是这个简介。FF10我并不是一口气推完，不然我也不会到高一暑假才真正完结，我是每周玩一点，或者每个月玩一点，我很清楚FF10是JRPG慢节奏的一部作品，核心在剧情，需要沉下心来，内心感受的，那时候的我没那么浮躁，越长大，我发现我愈是浮躁，但面对着FF10，我还是会静下来，体验这般旅程。刚开始的FF10呢，算是比较懵懂？开始困难的？因为那时候的我并不知道我后面要遇到多少强敌，多少迷宫与困难…也不知道我要卡多少关，我只是一个劲的推剧情，对于“幻光盘”的升级系统，也没怎么看教学，这就导致了我中后期严重卡关，前去救尤娜的飞空艇毒龙，下船后的追兵，并且没有存档点，差点把我整破防，还好我回去刷级了，说实话，那时候比最后白金FF10需要的两个奖杯：0秒胜利赛鸟以及200次避雷，还难受，因为你就卡在那，我很害怕我的旅途无法继续，我就一直卡在这，我无法前进，也办法看到尤娜，不过还好啦，FF10算是FF系列中难度系数算高的了，虽然我也没玩过其他作品，凭感觉吧，但我敢说，白金难度，绝对是FF系列榜首，期间卡关的时候我也有思考过，这是20年前PS2 FF10的HD高清版本，玩过老游戏的我也知道，越老的游戏，譬如《仙剑奇侠传》《古剑奇谭》《异度装甲》早期的《最终幻想》等重量级作品，都很硬核，难度较大，FF10作为21世纪初的FF作品有难度也是很正常。
慢慢的，盼着《异度神剑3》我也提前在暑假前把xb1给通关了，在XB3明天或者后天？启程之前能有个完整的故事观，FF10则是进度较慢。从早毁灭的遗迹，辛所创造出来的梦，“扎纳尔坎德” 中提达被赋予遗嘱的神秘人逃离了“辛”突如其来的攻击，邂逅了她，一路为寻找回家的路，当上了她的护卫，踏上了无论如何也要讨伐世界灾厄——“辛” 的冒险。一味想着回家的我，并不知道这位名为尤娜的少女，背后所背负的命运，也不知道自己即将面对的一切，直率的他前进着。故事剧情很明确，没有谜语人的话语，故事的起因是“辛”主角也便是尤娜，而在我看来，男主角更像是是配角，前中期他并没有多少自己的见解，对于这个未曾谋面的新世界，只能默默跟从，直到与尤娜的羁绊日切加深，两人的爱意开始萌生，故事开始了反转，我的眼泪，也开始积攒…直至前往拯救尤娜，我得知了尤娜的命运——死亡。这是史匹拉的宿命——绝望与短暂的希望并存，人们只能通关打败暂时的“辛”来获得短暂的和平，而这一切，都在“死之螺旋”中循环着，尤娜所做的，亦是为了这一份，短暂的和平。
剧情没有平淡的发展下去，开始有了巨大的反转，这反转我觉得就是男主角越来越成熟了，也越来越勇敢了，对尤娜充满无限爱意的她也不愿牺牲自己给大家换取短暂的和平，于是发誓不惜一切代价，既打败“辛”，也要尤娜活着，带她去“不夜城”扎纳尔坎德，看水球赛，宛如《素敌だね》中歌词写道“感觉很美好吧，能互相牵着对方的手 ，一起走着。”确实很美好，其实啊玩到这里，我以为这后面演变成“英雄救美”还拯救世界的经典剧情，泪腺马上停止的时候，我错了，泪腺愈攒愈满了…
让我眼泪每次重新积攒的动力是什么？我觉得SE很聪明，应该说当年的是克威尔，当年的植松伸夫，游戏中会听到很多遍《素敌だね》，而很多遍中，也有很多遍是《素敌だね》的变奏，这首歌是FF10的主题曲，本身充满着一种悲伤感，让人悲从中来的感觉…我每次听到这个旋律都会想起尤娜与提达，每当游戏出现煽情或者感人片段，这首歌不需要我想起，就已经响起在我耳边…剧情演出，赞不绝口...游戏中整体基调“悲”，所以中途并没有很多欢乐的片段，有也只停留在“温馨”的程度，温馨的目的，只是为了衬托出“辛”，灭亡后短暂的和平和即将到来的痛苦吧…另外，FF10的两个经典CG动画——“异界超度”与“深深的爱”，游戏与CG无缝切换，翩翩起舞的尤娜护送着死亡的灵魂，月光水下初次的吻，我真觉得是把这个游戏提高了不止一个层次，经典中的经典画面，太zhi愈了，想想20年前，在互联网尚未发达的时代，那时候的人们，看到这副幻想中的场景，该是什么感受啊…每次看这一段内心都很难受。
时间也很快，随着我剧情的推进，也到了暑假，我每天通过30分钟左右的游玩，最终也在今天，8月1号的日子，完结撒花了，其中的一部，这后期可真TM痛苦啊…特别是为了白金，白金很的太难了，我觉得当时fami通没有给FF10满分，可能原因不会是因为这几个恶心的小游戏吧…不过对于我热爱的游戏，白金无论有多远，我也要得到，毕竟是对这份游戏的爱啊..结局我直接绑不住了，直接炸了，真正把“辛”灭亡后，提达也要回到那个梦中的扎纳尔坎德，与尤娜告别.尤娜的最后一句话”谢谢你”，就很落泪了，特别是背景音乐还是熟悉的那个催泪歌…二人无论如何都要离别的结局，悲剧果然容易让人产生共鸣，容易引人深思啊….
提达直率的内心，也驱使着他一往无前，头也不回的，告别了她。二人的旅程，从此画上了句号。尤娜也在胜利演中发言道：“那些过去的人们，希望偶尔，能够想起他们。”，不断拂过的记忆，与他的回忆，又在一起掀起了我的眼泪。最后的最后，随着花絮的出现，贯穿游戏的主题曲《素敌だね》再次响起，伴随着幻想的终焉，终.
尽管，FF10并不是FF系列中最优秀的一部作品，也不是JRPG中的佼佼者，我也很清楚，它并不完美，十多年后重置的他并没有解决自身的一些小毛病，深有体会，但在我心目中，它绝对是JRPG中剧情的天花板，目前吧！游戏阅历也没那么丰富，但我就FF10为我内心中神作，我会给他果断给下满分，这是我热爱的，是我内心一直所追求的，幻想世界，也许打破幻想，回到现实的意犹未尽…也并不差。
谢谢你，SE，能让我遇见《最终幻想》，能体验到你们所叙写的一部又一部幻想故事，真的是太幸福了啊，游戏的魅力就在这啊。
未来的未来，我会继续带着《最终幻想10-2》，结束提达的故事，开始新的尤娜的故事。

PS:这将成为我这16年中写过最真挚、最难忘一篇文章，我想把我对它的热爱表现出来。
去年的四月份，《最终幻想VII重制版》发售了，这便是一切的起源，是我真正想去了解最终幻想这款游戏，以及第七部这整个系列的作品，作为一个5年主机玩家的心情从未有如此波澜。
于是，不到一个月的时间，我完美通关并且白金了《最终幻想VII重制版》并也像现在这样发表自己的言论。那一次通关，在凌晨，我坐在屏幕面前，听着重制版的主题曲《Hollow》,整个冒险历程历历在目，呈现在屏幕上，内心一直在打转，那是不可理喻的心情。从那时候起，我就下定决心，立下flag:补完ff7全部的坑，玩完它的所有作品，不要给人生留下遗憾。
终于，2021年7月30日，我，把1997年的《最终幻想VII》通关了。耗时将近30小时，耐耐心心，仔仔细细地体会1997年se留下的精华。
通关那一刻，我完成了我的flag——补完ff7。没错，《最终幻想7:危机之前》《最终幻想7;最终密令》、《最终幻想7:核心危机》、《最终幻想7》、《最终幻想7:圣子降临》、《最终幻想7:地狱犬的挽歌》《最终幻想7重制版》《最终幻想7尤菲dlc》《最终幻想7:通往微笑之路》完结撒花了，美中不足的是，但由于条件有限，地狱犬的挽歌以及危机之前，是云完的，而重制版还没出完，所以也无法完美补完ff7整个大坑。
为什么我会喜欢上最终幻想7，可能因为我去年是初二，至今也只是准高一的小屁孩，还处于青春期中，我渴望幻想里头的世界，完全沉浸到最终幻想7里头了，让我无法自拔，喜爱之心愈发强烈...最终幻想7蕴含的情感太丰富了，爱情，亲情，热血情，正义等弥补上了我心中缺失的情..7的故事正是我想要的故事，先不说re里头仙女般的3d建模，则是1997年的像素小人爱丽丝与克劳德的离别，便让我完全沉浸在游戏里头，体验这一般经历;克劳德原版和圣子降临中，意识模糊，心里软弱，无法证实自己，每一次挫折，都有着蒂法的陪伴，这种爱的羁绊，也许正是我所渴求的;萨菲罗斯每次的诞生与湮灭，都让我热血沸腾...在贫民窟的教堂中听着爱丽丝的主题曲，在第七天堂中听着蒂法的主题曲，在与萨菲罗斯的战斗中听着片翼天使，都已让我心灵得到慰藉。
其实，最终幻想7的剧情相对于其他最终幻想作品，算是通俗易懂的了，虽说衍生作品很多，但当把这些衍生作品和1997年的本体结合起来，你会发现，这是一张大网，早已是作者设计好的大网，每一部串着一部。其实啊，se也没想到第七部如此火爆，1997年已经把扎克斯这个人设定在游戏中，为未来的核心危机的诞生埋下伏笔，这是他们提前设计的，但后来的危机之前，圣子降临，地狱犬的挽歌，都是因为本传和核心危机火爆，带来经济效益，有了做下去的资本与动力，才得以把“塔克斯” “文森特”“萨菲罗斯后续”等内容细写，从而达到补写1997年中疏漏的地方，丰富游戏内容。se的野心也是够大的，地狱犬的挽歌中的结局，不知死活的杰内西斯突然蹦出来带走了纯白帝王维斯，可能要出续作，又有的出....总的来说，最终幻想的第七部，是一座游戏界的里程碑，也是一款让破产的se翻身之作，se把最后的积蓄给了第七部，最后成功了，而且是出乎意料的成功，以至于成为整个最终幻想系列衍生作品最多的一部，有资本，有条件，推出重制版以及开发新作，新ip。
1997年，这游戏给了多少人的回忆，多少人的童年，当时第七部没有汉化，民间汉化又少，想玩，也只能夜里捧着个英语字典，一点点翻译完，这就可以解释为什么当年e3放出第七代的重制版的预告片时，人们如此激动...因为这是他们的童年啊。我是不幸中又有幸，不幸的是，我太晚接触这部作品了。所幸的是，我接触到了，我没有留下遗憾，不算太晚。虽已16岁，童年一词被淡渐，但我相信，这一两年与最终幻想7的点点滴滴，都已烙刻在我的骨肉之中，长大后，回首过去，也能体会到当时1997年那群人的心情了吧...那是无比幸福啊。
谢谢，让我遇到最终幻想，这种基于现实的幻想.将会永记与心间。
(另外，我大胆预测重制版第二篇章以及重制版第三篇章，如果按照1997年的原版剧情来做，3章还做不完，没有个20年也基本做不完，还有开放世界...所以呢，考虑到玩家的年龄和耐心，se在第一篇章就提前加入了“菲拉”这一新的概念，原版无的，这种束缚命运，引导主角一团人照着原版的剧情走向发展的东西，但最后被消灭了，也就是说，剧情和命运肯定不会和原版一样发展，也就是说，爱丽丝可能不会死，结局也可能完全截然不同，或许是杰诺瓦被完全消灭，萨菲罗斯不复存在，或许是更悲惨的结局，或许是，扎克斯复活，或是平行世界中另外一个扎克斯穿越...反正，剧情肯定不会照搬原版，有所改动，正常重制版3章我觉得最合理，现在玩家对第二篇章的期待值已经被拉上了高潮，第三篇章再出，玩家的期待值也不会那么高，如果再出第四篇章，也许就会亏本了...se老懂玩家了，野心也够大！期待ec和第二篇章以及ff16!正如重制版第一篇章结尾所说:未知的旅途将会继续..在第二篇章即将揭晓.)
