column8:
No spoilers.

Final Fantasy VIII was the first FF I had ever played... 21 years ago. After this one, I discovered VI, IX, then I played almost all the oldest ones. In my mind though, FF VIII was never a good game, mostly for it's "too mature" world that I disliked (while I love all the "cartoons" FF). 21 years after my first playthrough, I decided to try again with this Remastered, just to see if the memories I had of it were still correct. And oh boy... It was worse than I remembered.

What I like about the game, compared to other FF:
1. Weirdly enough, the Draw system. As most people know, you can become extremely powerful in the beginning of the game by "drawing" magics from enemies. If you draw 100 of each and junction them to your characters, you end up having very good stats, much more than what the game expects of you. So, to become "overpowerful", you just sit there on every single battle, drawing every single magic from your enemies. That's something most players hated about the game, but weirdly, as I said, I kinda like it. Knowing that you're going to become an unstoppable machine after only a couple hours was really satisfying to me, even though each battle ends up taking 5 minutes instead of 30 seconds.

2. The main story line, especially starting the end of CD2, when the story actually settles. No spoilers here, but my favourite part was from the end of CD3 to the end of the game. If you found the start of the story not appealing (like I did), hold on to the end, it gets better.

... and that's it for what I liked. Now, the big thing, what I HATED about the game:

1. The setting. As said earlier, I used to love the old "cartoon" FF, and I absolutely despise what they tried to do with FF VIII, with more realistic character design and world design. It's personally not appealing to me at all (the whole first quarter of the game is a real pain for me), and, objectively, it kills all comic relief of the "lighter" scenes. Seeing a cartoonish character doing silly jokes in older FF worked no matter how dramatic the situation was; here, it just doesn't work.

2. The story felt like it was written by teenagers. Seriously, I said earlier that the main plot was actually good (not to say great), but there are so many little details that just do not make sense at all, especially starting third quarter of the game. One example: a character has been kidnapped and their life is in real danger. It's a matter of hours before they're probably killed. Should we all move now? No, let's create a rock band instead (I am not kidding) and rehearse before we do a show, so that the two main characters can have a date (WHAT?).
Another example: you are about to be attacked by one of the biggest threats so far, the world and everything we've known is literally at stake, and soldiers are being killed as we speak. You must certainly move and defend... but the game decided that your character had to talk about a ring, and give it to a friend, so that he can go and make a copy to offer it to his love interest. That mini-scene happens literally while dozens of your mate soldiers are being killed. It is pure nonsense.
The game is filled with filler "mini-scenes" like these, which have strictly no implication to the main plot, and have absolutely no reason to be. The big problem about this love interest between the two major characters is that it's apparently more important than everything else. At numerous times throughout the game, characters will tell you openly that it doesn't really matter if dozens, hundreds, maybe even thousands are killed: what's most important is that the two major characters and the love they (apparently?) have for each other. It's the most stupid tale I've ever heard.

3. Talking about the main characters... Please make someone kill these guys, Squall, big-time asshole and Rinoa, the most annoying groupie you'll ever meet. I don't understand why they are even attracted by one another. Actually, Squall is not even attracted by her! All he does during the first two thirds of the game is to shoo her away, and clearly tell her that he's not interested. But thanks to her constant harassment, she somehow manages to... squeeze his brain out? All of a sudden, Squall, who spent (story-speaking) weeks to try to tell Rinoa that he wasn't interested, realises that she is the love of his life, and starts speaking like the 12 year-old me in front of my love-interest of middle school. While I thought the game had characters with a certain depths, I realised at that moment that the game was actually a fan fiction for teenagers. Nothing makes any sense starting that point. No matter what the first half of the game tried to tell you about Squall and his misanthropic self, Squall suddenly becomes this weird empty brain that can only think about one thing: his annoying love interest. Please kill them both. What's even weirder is that other characters that I used to find extremely annoying and shallow (Zell, Selphie, Irvine) end up being the deepest ones.

4. At random points in the game (at for random reasons), your characters will be swapped and their talents and builds will be as well. And here's the problem: the game will never tell you that the character you are controlling has had his build emptied. What it means is that you can control a character and he fight fine, then there is an intermission, after which you take control of the same character. But suddenly, you realise that your character lost all their abilities, summons, magic. Why? No clue, the game doesn't explain. What's even more unexplicable is that most of the time, the game just does fine. But there will be for sure those several times where you will start a fight against a boss and end up with a game over screen because your character lost all his abilities. Always check your character status and junction screens, even on every single scenery change if you must.

5. Be ready to NOT know where to go. I'm warning you, read every single line of every single dialogue in the game, because way too often, "what's next and where to go" will be said only once. If you missed it, well, be ready to visit every single little town and background screen and talk to every single character in the game, hoping to unlock the next dialogue that will make the story go.

6. Who came up with the idea of pressing up to go left, bottom to go right and so on? On every other background map, the direction controls are just ... randomly assigned. Same thing as the previous point: there's no rule. Most of the time it works, and suddenly pressing "up" will make your character go left.

OK it's enough. I really wanted to walk through it one more time 21 years after release and that's what I did. But this game is bad. It's not only a subjective point of view. It's not even a matter of whether the "remaster" is good or not. There are way too many things that this game does wrong, to even put it at a mediocre rating. Squaresoft (then Square-Enix) did a much better work with every other Final Fantasy out there. This one is to skip.

What's even more unexplicable is that most of the time, the game just does fine. But there will be for sure those several times where you will start a fight against a boss and end up with a game over screen because your character lost all his abilities. Always check your character status and junction screens, even on every single scenery change if you must.

5. Be ready to NOT know where to go. I'm warning you, read every single line of every single dialogue in the game, because way too often, "what's next and where to go" will be said only once. If you missed it, well, be ready to visit every single little town and background screen and talk to every single character in the game, hoping to unlock the next dialogue that will make the story go.

6. Who came up with the idea of pressing up to go left, bottom to go right and so on? On every other background map, the direction controls are just ... randomly assigned. Same thing as the previous point: there's no rule. Most of the time it works, and suddenly pressing "up" will make your character go left.

OK it's enough. I really wanted to walk through it one more time 21 years after release and that's what I did. But this game is bad. It's not only a subjective point of view. It's not even a matter of whether the "remaster" is good or not. There are way too many things that this game does wrong, to even put it at a mediocre rating. Squaresoft (then Square-Enix) did a much better work with every other Final Fantasy out there. This one is to skip.

column8: Simply Amazing!

TL;DR - FF VIII is a weird, weeb-tastic JRPG, but dammit, it's fun (if you like JRPGs).

FF VIII is a wonky, weird narrative of a fantasy-scifi world about teenagers facing their destiny. The main character (a student-mercenary at a school for orphans) deals with teen-angst, time travel, and a needy love interest, all while putting his special forces training to the test against tyrannical governments, rival mercenary companies, and an evil time-traveling sorceress.

FF VIII has one of the coolest, most original RPG systems for character power-ups that allows extensive customization. In addition to the traditional "level-up" system and changing equipment, characters can "junction" magic to their various stats for a strong boost. There are several crafting systems to power-up your magic, and therefore your characters' stats.

The story is a weak love story shadowed by the traditional "fate-of-the-world-hangs-in-the-balance" trope.

Best game ever and i love this game the most. Amazing memories came back after I played this beautiful game today. I played this wonderful master piece when I was 18 years old girl (2001) on my Playstation 1. A fantastic game with a fascinating story. It's my first Final Fantasy experience and still the most favorite.

The good: Basically all of the main character models, monster models as well as the special effects have been upscaled and look nice and the menus have just been cleaned up a bit too looks wise. To be honest I am not a fan of the art style they went with as the characters look quite anime like and I felt that what made this FF so unique was the rather European serious science fiction, non cartoony look, that no other FF really had. So it just felt a little off in my opinion however the models do look nice and polished so it is down to personal taste.

Some assists have been added to the game which are such a warm welcome as game play wise this is a very boring game which involves you sitting for a about 20 mins to draw magic (used for stat building) as simple as 100 fires from enemies FOR EACH CHARACTER. I feel that they are well done as you can either use all of them to fully cheat or use them more to assist you, if you want to play honest but without the unnecessary grind. I will explain some of the nuances of some of the key assists that you only find out by trial and error, so that you do not meet the same fate :).

3x game speed: I would recommend just using this for skipping GF cut scenes, limit breaks, fight animations, level grinding and especially drawing magic. This makes magic drawing much more bearable and is a good to take advantage of if you want to play honestly and not use max spells at all.

Max spells: This doesn't give you every magic spell, it simply gives you the maximum number of stock (100) for whatever spells you currently have. So you still have to obtain that spell, it just means you then don't have to worry about stats dropping because you have used 3 cures.

Max GF levels: You still have to obtain the GF yourself. However If you plan on using this do beware that if you have customised the GFs abilities by removing them with forget GF ability items and adding your own, do bear in mind that this will reset the GF's to having their all of default learnable abilities unlocked, so you would loose whatever abilities you have added yourself.

Now onto the bad: There is alot of laziness and you will feel ripped off paying 15.99. Alot of the NPC sprites have not been updated. So you will have the updated polished characters talking to literally distorted, fuzzy pixels. To make matters worse this is also the same for some of the back drops and backgrounds which haven't been changed.

For example there is a scene in Esthar city where you get in a car to go to a certain location. The car is animated as moving and so is the background. You can see how dated and horrible the moving background is compared to this remodelled car. I just feel that it ruins the whole remastered experience and you do feel cheated especially if this game holds a special place to you as it did for me.

Overall I would recommend this game to be honest, simply because of the addition of the assists. As I feel that this game is nearly unplayable in 2020 on a first time casual play through with how pointlessly grindy and slow it is and you really are able to enjoy this game without feeling like you are cheating. I have no idea on PC mods but If you can somehow get the original, slap some graphic mods on it and maybe get some assist mods like what is on this game then do that??? This game is worth buying.

column8: This is the weirdest Final Fantasy I have ever played. If you are just here for a story I suggest using the boosters because in my opinion most of the systems in this game are needlessly convoluted and push you to play the game in a very specific way. I honestly thought I'd end up playing more Triple Triad but I just didn't want to spend the time on it. It's a very different Final Fantasy and it had the shit job of coming out after VII. Most of this game in general feels needlessly convoluted actually. I enjoyed this but if not for the boosters I don't think I would have. It has solid music an interesting story at its best and a boring one at its worst going up and down constantly. If you're not looking to deal with mods it's definitely the best and easiest way to play Final Fantasy VIII on whatever your preferred game device is. If you aren't a fan of Final Fantasy I'd honestly say just pass on this one.

column8:
Final Fantasy VIII is my ultimate, most favorite Final Fantasy of them all. I was introduced to it and the series about 20 years ago and I fell deeply in love with it. I don't know how many times I've completed this game, but I remember when I'd play it annually. Now, it's been remastered and the game looks beautiful! Check YouTube for a video that will show you the difference (between this and the original) to see for yourself. I haven't completed the game in this play through yet, but I feel like it deserves a strong recommendation (from one of FFVIII's biggest fans).

Aside from some upgraded and now beautiful textures, one slight difference between this and the original (the other version you'll find on Steam) is Chocobo World. I never played this until I played that other Steam version, because I didn't have the extra accessory to play it on the PS1. However, if you're looking for Chocobo World here, you're not going to find it, or at least I'm quite sure of that.

The game does have it's own launcher, kind of. It's fine though, it gives you a chance to tinker with some settings. One thing that this version does include, that was also included in the original Steam version, is a few cheats. You can significantly increase the game speed and turn off random encounters, for instance. I haven't used these and I don't really plan to, but it's still nice to have them.

If you love Final Fantasy VIII, you should definitely check this out. Even though this game hasn't gotten a "remake," having a "remastered" version is still great. I'm so glad my favorite Final Fantasy game got a face lift, it gave me a great reason to play it again!

After watching a video, I'm reminded of some of the negatives, though, for instance rumble and analog support is gone. I saw mention of input lag, but as I continue to play, I find Squall's limit break to be normal.

No new artwork, characters don't match the art work or cut scenes, no overhauled textures for the world or people so there's almost a jarring difference between your character models running around vs you. No real difference in cut scene quality either. If I could get a refund I would.

MOD UPDATE: Recently a pre-public version of the much anticipated Angelwing Ultima Remastered mod is available to Patreon members who contribute $5 or more. Will change your life. Goergous backgrounds. 4gb download.
http://www.patreon.com/mcindusmods

FPS UPDATE: As of January 2021, the *FPS problem seems to have been solved. Keep reading for instructions. *Mod guide included as well. 

GAME REVIEW
Assuming the worst is behind us, I recommend this game to EVERYONE! Second maybe only to FFIX w/ Moguri Mod, the Remaster of this game (especially when modded) was outstanding. I enjoyed it from beginning to end, and can't imagine playing any other version. 

First of all, the game is gorgeous, and is by far the best designed in the franchise. Among the boosts and cheats included, is the *3x Boost, which I think is essential. You'll easily get your people and GFs to 100, and do it honestly without having to grind for hours on end. Got a lot of satisfaction from that. 

The storyline was really good, and is one of only a few games where I liked all the characters, including the protagonist.   

Where you might struggle a bit is the first 5 hours. This game definitely has a learning curve, but there's a lot to explore, so stay with it. You won't be disappointed. 

*Scroll down for FPS fix. 
*If you haven't applied the mods yet, keep reading.

MODS
The best tutorial for explaining the mod process can be found on Youtube. These videos are easy to follow & will explain everything you need to know, including where to download the files.  
1. Start with *Fans Remaster Final Fantasy 8 Remastered! Mods Setup Tutorial, Part 1* You'll use this method to apply about 5 mods -- Cards, Squall, UI, Weapons, etc...
2. Then follow up with *Modding Final Fantasy 8 Remastered Guide - Battle Background Textures!* by the same YouTuber. This video explains how to apply various HD textures. 

FPS FIX
As of *January 2021, the newest version of *Special K seems to have fixed the FPS issue, and doesn't require any additional steps to work. To get it, do a search for *22 FPS Fix in 2021. This will explain the process, which basically consists of downloading the latest version of Special K, renaming one of the files, placing it and another file into your Steam folder, and then starting the game. 

Just to be sure, I started a new game and played to an area that was impossibly slow using the old fix, and it ran smooth. An increase of 10 FPS or so. 

NOTE
If you have trouble getting the game to run after following the instructions above, it might be the newest injector. To use the older version of Special K, do a search for *An Unofficial Guide to Special K and download the *Global Injector. This will install to your *Documents folder. If you need to, install this version first and then follow the instructions above and it'll work fine. 

Just to be clear, I don't use the black "front end" injector that comes with the newest version, and threw out everything but the 2 files I moved to my Steam folder for the fix. I prefer the older version, and highly recommend it because it looks better and has a custom *ReShade plugin that I use for several games. 

Hope this helps,
*tips hat

column8:
Classes are gone, making everyone the same type of unit. The heroes are way too powerful to make the gameplay feel intense. Ammo is unlimited so 'tension' is more about stalling your enemy for long enough until they die rather than require any creative thinking. And because everything is so easy, I don't care enough to learn the more complicated methods of making yourself slightly stronger when I have no need or benefit for/from it. 

Oh, and everything is janky and it's not clear what is and isn't an invisible wall, making travel really frustrating.

Which I might be able to understand if I could get a feel for the story. There's a conflict in the town so Garden sends people to help out? Seifer doesn't get a promotion because he wants results? Then this Selphie  chick shows up so that Seifer stops being in combat? I can describe every character in 1 or 2 words because they're just that flat. They don't have stakes explained as to why they're in the plot, and for some unknown reason I doubt they'll get development.

Ok, so, I think that we can all agree that this isn't a full Remaster. I get why - missing the source code can cause some big problems - but for me it isn't that big of a deal. The game is still the same game that we fell in love with 21 years ago, and for me that's enough. The game still plays the same as its PS1 original (with a couple of technical differences that only matter if, like me, you're a speedrunner), and even has various options to make running the game easier (though IMO you don't get the full experience if you use them).

As far as the technical stuff goes, I can only say that if I can run the game without issues on a 3-year-old laptop, there might be something else to blame rather than the game itself...

column8:
ゲーム自体の評価は幾らでも出てくるので、リマスター版としての評価。

[h1]良い点[/h1]
[list]
[*]リマスター化
[/list]
PSレベルのグラフィックがPSP相当にはなっている。一方でリマスター化が中途半端であり、それによる気になる点も存在する(後述)。
[list]
[*]ブースター機能の強化
[/list]
for PC従来の機能に加え、新たにエンカウント無しが追加された。
その他にも全てのアイテム、アビリティ、カード、特殊技を入手などが追加されているが、こちらはオンにすると実績がそのセーブでは取得出来なくなる(警告有)。
一方でダメージが全て9999になる効果は削除されている。

[h1]悪い点[/h1]
[list]
[*]謎のFPS制限
[/list]
折角のsteam版なのに従来通りフィールドは30FPS、バトル中、メニューは15FPS(PS版はメニュー60fpsらしい)となっている。倍速モードをオンにすると分かる事だが、FPSを上げるとゲーム自体が加速してしまう為60FPS化は難しいと思われる。
[list]
[*]リマスター化による弊害
[/list]
キャラクターモデルは綺麗になった一方でそれ以外はそのままな為、背景の上にリマスター化されたモデルが立っているだけで浮いてる様に感じるし、特に背景として描画されるキャラクターと並んで立った時の浮きっぷりが凄まじい。
[list]
[*]日本語版ではMODが機能しない
[/list]
よくある事だが、英語クライアントと日本語クライアントでは構造が違う都合上ほとんどのMODが適用出来ない。MOD目当ての人はよく調べてから購入する事をお勧めする。購入後言語設定をEnglishにしてからダウンロードすれば問題は無いが難しい所。
[list]
[*]おでかけチョコボ自体が無い
[/list]
for PCでは存在したが、削除されている。代わりとしておでかけチョコボ限定アイテムはアンジェロサーチで手に入るらしいが、うち一つだけは入手報告が無いためブースターを使わない限り入手不可と思われる。

[h1]その他[/h1]
[list]
[*]値段設定について
[/list]
for PCは1500円、リマスターは2500円...キャラモデル(+G.F)のリマスターのみで+1000円。擁護しておくとセール中の最安値が1270円ではある。
[list]
[*]音源について
[/list]
for PCのMIDI版ではなく、PS版準拠。これは完全に好み。
[list]
[*]フォントについて
[/list]
変更されていること自体は良いが、元の方が良かったと思う(ストアページの画像参照)。

[h1]総評[/h1]
FF8自体をプレイしてみたかったので、という事でオススメにした。一方でわざわざSteamで買う程か、と言われると微妙な所。

and I will play it again and again later

column8:
Não vale o dinheiro que cobram, baixe um emulador e jogue a versão do ps1 que vale mais a pena.
Screen-tearing é tão violento que é como jogar dois jogos ao mesmo tempo no mesmo monitor, os modelos novos ficaram legais até mas não se deram nem ao trabalho de fazer um upscaling automatico nas texturas das coisas ou dar qualquer refinada no resto do jogo. O mais interessante é que existem mods grátis feito por fãs que como hobby que melhoram as texturas como um todo do jogo. 
Se mesmo assim decidir comprar espere o preço chegar abaixo de R$ 9,00 e mesmo assim vai estar pagando muito.

Update: Fechei o jogo, para fazer valer meu dinheiro, tudo que eu disse acima continua a mesma coisa, pior na verdade, pois existem mods gratuitos, feitos por fãs, que incorporam cenários e modelos dos inimigos em HD, o que deixa mais na cara que o fato do jogo ser do jeito que é atualmente é pura preguiça da S-E (ou incompetência mesmo). Quanto ao screen-tearing, a solução é até simples, apesar do jogo ter opções de resolução que correspondem ao seu monitor se escolher uma resolução muito alta começa o tearing, então basta selecionar uma opção de resolução bem porca que vai, o problema é que em lugar nenhum dizem isso, é meio que adivinhar mesmo.

column8:
Quick:

5/5.  Final Fantasy 8 is an RPG done right.  I had a great time playing through this game.  The experience was memorable, and the characters were enjoyable and unique.  Story-wise it is a bit confusing, but it is very interesting and fun to play.  I'm well aware of the reputation that this game has, and its' standing amongst others in the series.  As a youngster, the only Final Fantasy game that I played and beat was Final Fantasy 10.  I was not a fan of RPGs back in the day.  I knew a good deal about them and about this series in particular.  Keep that in mind while reading this review.  You're reading the opinion of someone who is not as well versed in Final Fantasy as a series.  And, perhaps, similarly not as biased in my expectations of this game.  I went into this one not totally knowing what to expect, and I was impressed.

More:

When I score a game, a perfect score is not an indicator that there are no flaws with it.  After all a 4.99999 out of 5 is, for all intents and purposes, a 5/5.  Yet, it isn't perfect.  That's how I score games in my reviews.  If the final score is closer to a 5 than it is to a 4... it gets a perfect score.  Flaws and all.  With that being said, and the blemishes of this game taken into account, the final score is a perfect one.  I consider this to be a great game, and I wish that I experienced it when I was younger.

Thinking back on Final Fantasy 8: Remastered, I remember Balamb Garden the most.  Walking out of the save room and entering the main hall of the garden is the picture my mind's eye conjures up when I ponder this game.  That music in the background plays inside my head as I imagine embodying a young SEED embarking on dangerous campaigns throughout the world.  The music is soft and calming.  Around you, the garden is vibrant and alive.  It all seems so lovely and promising, while at odds with what is going on in the world around Balamb.  That, to me, sums up this game.  Beauty, majesty, and wonder are equally painted on the surface of the world... contrasted against war, conflicting emotions, and the pain of loss.

I know a lot of people criticize the game for its' corny character development.  I hear the phrase 'teen angst' used often to describe the main protagonist, Squall, and his interactions with the rest of his teammates, and other characters in the game.  It is definitely a bit 'drama queen-esque' if you take a step back and look at it.  I agree with those criticisms.  However, they do not bother me that much, if at all.  Beneath the oversaturated image of edginess is an equally cheesy love story.  Both of them I enjoyed fully.  If you accept this game for what it is, and embrace its' tone, you will walk away more satisfied and enriched than you otherwise would if you dwell on its' inadequacies... of which there are a few.  Of course, that could be said about any game.  Just accept the game for what it is, enjoy it where you can, and you will be more satisfied than if you didn't.  Fair enough. There is a fine line between apologetics and empathetic embodiment.  Just give it a chance, though.

There is not one character in this game that I despise... or even dislike for that matter.  They all have their place, they all play their role, and they fit together like a puzzle.  Most of the main story elements, such as boss battles and plot progression take a back seat to the characters at times.  For example, during a mission to hijack a train, I was much more interested in the associated rebel group's cause and their day-to-day life than I was the actual mission.  I wanted to know more about their plight and their personalities, than I wanted to complete the mission to advance the story.

Mechanically, the game is just as good... and just as flawed.  I loved the battle system in this game.  The requirement to draw magic and junction it to your characters has been touched on by so many people, so many times, that there's nothing I could say about it here that hasn't been said, and that you probably haven't already heard or read before.  In my opinion, it's a good system.  It's not great, but it is interesting, it is enjoyable, and it is fun to figure out.  Drawing magic can be a pain at times, but it's not bad enough to take away from my enjoyment of the main game.  The same can be said for the junctioning system.  Honestly, I didn't even really figure out how it worked until I was on the last part of the game, about to fight the boss.  But once that light-bulb in my head went off, I was pleased to discover how much more powerful my characters could become by junctioning different types of magic.

From the perspective of a novice RPG and JRPG player... my perspective... this game is great.  If you are a veteran of this genre, it makes complete sense to me why you would disagree with my assessment of this game, and I would probably agree with you on almost all of your points.  If, however, you are someone like me, who is just in it for the experience and a little escapism for a couple of hours, I think you will enjoy this game.  I am glad that I played it.  My time spent attempting to defeat the final boss repeatedly, though frustrating, was time well spent.  This is another game added to the 'games that I love' category.  I hope that you get as much out of it as I did.  Enjoy.

[h1][table]
    [tr]
        [td]✦　关键字：经典、日系角色扮演、剧情丰富、冒险
✦　《最终幻想8》最初发行于1999年的PS主机上。
✦　眨眼间，二十年过去了，其辉煌依旧，经典从未被超跃。

✦　这款高清重制版，有一定的精彩之处。
✦　例如画质，我是4K屏，虽然动画CG保持原味非高清未优化，
✦　但是人物的立绘，外形，样貌全部进行了更新，
✦　开局就能看清 Squall 帅气的脸庞以及 Questis 美丽的容颜，
✦　而不再是以往糊糊的感觉。就连对话的文本，
✦　UI的字体也是超清显示，非常锐利，看起来非常享受。
✦　另外，还加入了几个全新功能：
✦　提高生命值、ATB量表和极限技增强；提升x3的游戏速度；
✦　无随机遭遇战；获取最高G.F.等级、货币和魔法；
✦　获取全部道具和能力；获取全部极限技和集换卡。
✦　对于加快游戏节奏，看重体验游戏剧情的玩家来说，
✦　是非常实用的。这些改变所带来的游戏体验，
✦　绝非各网站的下载版可以比拟。
✦　我也拥有Steam上非重制版的最终幻想8，游戏体验很渣，
✦　还需要登陆绑定SquareEnix的帐号，都不如各网站的下载版。
✦　要买就买这款，真正的 FF8 情怀所在。
✦　但是也有值得中国玩家吐槽的地方，眼看着支持多国语言，
✦　唯独没有中文，是挺气人的。

✦　做为老铁粉的我，早己对剧情耳熟能详。
✦　讲三个永生难忘的精彩片断，剧透，但大家应该都玩过了。
✦　　第一个是相识舞会。
✦　莉诺雅作为一名活泼的女孩，主动伸手邀请斯考尔跳舞，
✦　斯考尔没跳过，就显得很笨，
✦　两个人的舞姿伴随着音乐让人永远铭记。
✦　这是二人感人至深爱情故事的初相识。
✦　　第二个是暗杀魔女伊迪雅。
✦　亚威恩的子弹被魔女隔空挡住，斯科尔安慰了亚威恩后，说：
✦　“ 照顾好莉诺雅 ”，接着站起来，拔出刃剑，跳下广场，
✦　大刀一挥，朝铁栏后的魔女伊迪雅冲去。
✦　短短十几秒的CG，却可以让人热血沸腾。
✦　　第三个是太空船之爱情返航。
✦　斯考尔和莉诺雅连续斩杀四对大怪之后，太空船即将返程地球，
✦　斯考尔这时抱起莉诺雅坐在了太空船的驾驶位上，
✦　而莉诺雅则安然的躺在了斯考尔的怀里，
✦　这时，响起了整个游戏史上最精彩的主题曲，
✦　王菲演唱的『 Eyes On Me 』
✦　歌曲火遍全世界，王菲自此成为国际歌星。

✦　《最终幻想8》在当年确实有很多开拓性的壮举。
✦　CG动画属于跨时代的惊艳，
✦　开头动画则达到了当时的世界最高水准。
✦　请王菲演唱主题曲，属于游戏界和音乐界的完美合作。
✦　注重剧情，爱情故事接近完美。
✦　摆脱无趣的打怪练级，有别于当时传统的RPG游戏。
✦　每个场景都让人印象深刻，配上BGM让人难以忘怀。
✦　当时的网络不发达，游戏也不多，
✦　注定《最终幻想8》会凝聚一代人的成长回忆。
✦　就象《拳皇》和《灌篮高手》一样。

column8: Morons will try to convince you that this is somehow bad, but this is honestly the best version of FFVIII that I've ever seen. Having played this, the original steam release (modded), and an emulated version, I'll just go ahead and tell you that this is the one to get. The QoL additions are nice, namely the speed boost. I don't really use anything else even though there's plenty of cheats/boosts you can use if you just want to play for the story. People will complain that the backgrounds are blurry, which is true, but I think it's due to the sharpness of the new character models. In contrast to the new models, everything is going to look blurry. The resolution upscaling honestly makes the backgrounds look more detailed than the original, but people will find anything to bitch and moan about. I'm not saying it's perfect, or this is the golden ideal example of a "remaster" but it's honestly more love than I was expecting this game to receive. VIII is a subjective favorite of mine even though it receives a lot of hate, namely due to peoples inability to understand the extremely basic concept junctioning. In 1999 before YouTube existed, this might have been understandable and why so many people were initially off put by the combat system, but EVERY FF has some kind of unique system variation that you have to learn, so I think the whining is mostly uncalled for. It's really not that complicated. I assume it's just people parroting shit they read on the forums twenty years ago that became a meme that people just say as a knee-jerk reaction to any and all FF VIII discourse. It's honestly one of the better entries in the series if you actually block out the nay-sayers and give it an real chance.
column9: Morons will try to convince you that this is somehow bad, but this is honestly the best version of FFVIII that I've ever seen. Having played this, the original steam release (modded), and an emulated version, I'll just go ahead and tell you that this is the one to get. The QoL additions are nice, namely the speed boost. I don't really use anything else even though there's plenty of cheats/boosts you can use if you just want to play for the story. People will complain that the backgrounds are blurry, which is true, but I think it's due to the sharpness of the new character models. In contrast to the new models, everything is going to look blurry. The resolution upscaling honestly makes the backgrounds look more detailed than the original, but people will find anything to bitch and moan about. I'm not saying it's perfect, or this is the golden ideal example of a "remaster" but it's honestly more love than I was expecting this game to receive. VIII is a subjective favorite of mine even though it receives a lot of hate, namely due to peoples inability to understand the extremely basic concept junctioning. In 1999 before YouTube existed, this might have been understandable and why so many people were initially off put by the combat system, but EVERY FF has some kind of unique system variation that you have to learn, so I think the whining is mostly uncalled for. It's really not that complicated. I assume it's just people parroting shit they read on the forums twenty years ago that became a meme that people just say as a knee-jerk reaction to any and all FF VIII discourse. It's honestly one of the better entries in the series if you actually block out the nay-sayers and give it an real chance.

TL;DR - Although it isn't a complete remaster, and you shouldn't pay full price, a lot of people on here are overreacting and/or don't remember how bad the original PS1 game actually looks now.

FF8 was my favorite PS game I owned back in my childhood. Weekends and summer holidays I'd stay up until the wee hours of the morning, my PS1 mini (The one that looked like just a slightly bigger Discman) whirring away as FF8 beat out Gran Turismo, the original top-down GTA, and 2 or 3 other games for my attention.

I was cautiously excited when I saw the FF8 remaster last year. I was over the moon that the characters and enemies got retouched textures and models, and the game had been given some bug fixes and an optimization pass or two over the original PC release, but I was also hesitant as people claimed the overworld map and most of the backdrops looked like they weren't touched up at all, and at full price that'd be something of a cardinal sin.

I ended up waiting until it went on sale, and while I'm glad I bought it at a reduced price, it is not the utter disappointment that hyperbolic people are claiming it is. Characters, GFs, magic effects, and many of the enemies have beautiful new HD textures and some subtle model adjustments. 

Contrary to what people are saying, the backgrounds DID receive an art pass to smooth them over as well, and gone are the jagged, pixellated background textures of yore. For people claiming that the characters stand out too clearly from the backgrounds, you need to play the original discs - they've always looked like that. You're either just forgetting, or you never played the original release.

The overworld map and battle maps are a different story, and have been sadly neglected. This isn't a deal breaker at all, but considering about 2/3 of the game involve you freely roaming the world map, and you'll spend a considerable amount of time in battles, one would think that more care would've gone into updating them.

A few QoL improvements have gone in as well, namely the "3x Speed" mode (F3), which makes battles to item and/or draw-farm mobs actually bearable. There's also a "God Mode" cheat (F1) that basically functions like casting Regen and Aura on your whole party - Barring a hit that does more damage than a character has HP, their health will stay full, and they have constant access to their Limit Break as long as the F1 mode is active. While it obviously makes the game far too easy normally, If you don't really understand how FF8's systems work and you've buggered yourself into a corner against a boss that you can't beat, this cheat could save your whole game and let you get past that part without completely restarting a new game.

The audio also sounds a bit cleaner and less 'tinny' than the original. I'm not much of an audiophile though, so for me this is more just a bit of extra icing than an actual prop point.

Ultimately, am I glad I bought the game? Did it give me back some of that late-night childhood nostalgia? Did I abuse the absolute piss out of the Junction and GF-abilities system to min-max my characters? Is Squall a whiny, self-centred dink for most of the game? Should you buy this -on sale- if you loved FF8 as a kid?

Yes, yes, hell yes, absolutely, and do you really even need to ask that last one?

Just one last thing: Do yourself a favour, and play it with a controller for maximum nostalgia. Just trust me on that one.

column8:
Este Final Fantasy pretende aleccionarnos sobre uno de esos puntos de inflexión en la vida que hacen a uno madurar o ver la vida de otra perspectiva. Ese momento en la vida que un amigo/a entabla una relación sentimental con otra persona y este amigo/a en cuestión desaparece en el espacio/tiempo y no vuelves a saber nada de el/ella.

Conforme avanza la historia nuestro personaje acaba deduciendo que es lo correcto, y acaba perdiéndose en el espacio / tiempo en busca de la chica que ama. Dejando de lado a sus amigos incluso si estos llevaban con el desde el principio.

Lo llaman "Ley de Vida". Pero desde mi punto de vista es una traición comparable a la de Judas Iscariote. 

10 / 10 - Volveria a dejar tirados a mis colegas de nuevo.

-------------ENGLISH-------------

This Final Fantasy aims to teach us about one of those turning points in life that make one mature or see life from another perspective. That moment in life when a friend establishes a sentimental relationship with another person and this friend in question disappears from space/time and you never hear from him/her again.

As the story progresses, our character ends up deducing that it is the right thing to do, and ends up losing himself in space/time in search of the girl he loves. Leaving aside his friends even if they had been with him from the beginning.

They call it "Law of Life". But from my point of view it is a betrayal comparable to that one done by Judas Iscariot.

10/10 - I would leave my friends stranded again.

Das Spiel ist nach wie vor großartig. Die Story FF-like natürlich verwinkelt und ggf. verwirrend, die Grafik halt großteils wie bei einem 20 Jahre alten Spiel zu erwarten ist (abgesehen von den verbesserten Modellen), da kann man nicht meckern. Es läuft bei mir auch stabil.

Im Unterschied zu vielen anderen hier konnte ich keinerlei Probleme mit den FPS oder dergleichen feststellen. Die verbesserten Charaktermodelle sind wohl kein Grund die Remastered-Version zu kaufen wenn man die normale schon hat, wenn man aber noch keine von beiden hat zahlen sie sich schon aus. Die Hintergrundbilder sind dieselben wie im Originalspiel, da merkt man leider schon das Alter und die damals geringe Auflösung. Es stimmt auch was auch manche schreiben: es wurden manche NPC-Modelle nicht aktualisiert, diese sind dann aber offenbar überhaupt keine 3D-Modelle sondern Teil des fixen Hintergrundes.

Die Zusatzfunktionen der Remastered-Version habe ich mir gar nicht angesehen (kein Bedarf meinerseits), dazu kann ich also nichts sagen.
Nostalgia total, recomendo para todos.

[h1] REMASTERIZACION MEDIOCRE [/h1]

Remasterización mediocre, sí, y te voy a explicar porque: 

Es cierto que los modelos de los personajes han mejorado (ya que te guste o no el nuevo Squall es caso a parte)  pero nada mas, algunos entornos siguen igual y eso hace que se note MUCHiSIMO la diferencia entre lo remasterizado y no, después tenemos la exploración del mundo que no ha cambiado casi nada de la anterior versión (en todo caso un poco el modelo del protagonista, montañas bosques etc siguen igual de desastrosos)  y así podría seguir todo el día fijate si le han puesto pocas ganas a este remaster que Incluso tiene menos logros que su anterior versión.

Por lo tanto mi voto es [b] NEGATIVO [/b] no porque el juego sea malo (es uno de mis preferidos) sino porque le podrian haber echado un par de ganas a la remasterización de un titulo que les ha dado tanto a esta franquicia y en vez de eso han preferido hacer un remaster a medias e intentar forrarse.

Lo único salvable, es que gracias a que ponía en su titulo remaster lo complete al 100%  para ver las cosillas que habian cambiado.

column8:
If you haven't played FF8: FF8 is a fantastic game with a fascinating story that is ruined by absolutely abysmal storytelling. Despite its flaws, it’s a pretty strange and unique game and I love it and highly recommend it.

If you have played FF8 and are wondering if the remaster is worth it: It’s difficult to say and is entirely up to personal opinion. 

The character models look very nice, the resolution is higher, and there’s an addition of boosters. One that turns off random encounters (although the GF Diablos has always been able to learn this ability and is accessible quite early in the game, so…), one that makes everything 3x speed, and one that I think gives you infinite limit breaks and infinite HP? I opted not to use it so I couldn’t quite figure it out. 

Nothing else is about the game is a “remaster.” I think the backgrounds actually look worse. They aren’t at all improved but instead have been smoothed out and are very blurry and dull-looking. The original pixelated style had a lot more depth and detail. The CGI cutscenes were slightly improved but not enough to make note of. Menus and Triple Triad do look nicer. I didn’t notice any change in the music (though I love the music so it’s not a complaint). 

I think the original style of graphics had a lot more charm to them. While I could drool over the new and improved Shiva model (so pretty OMG WTH), looking at the characters’ lifeless mannequin faces during serious scenes was sort of a detractor for me. With their original (totally indiscernible) faces, your imagination could fill in the emotion. However, I seriously enjoyed the 3x booster. FF8 is a slow game in a lot of ways -- many scenes play out slowly, GF animations take forever, even the fighting animations make the game feel like it’s moving in slow-motion. When you want to replay the game but don’t want to devote another 80hrs of your life to it, this feature rules.

I’m glad I purchased this version to experience it, but I'm not sure it will be for everyone. And if I ever play this game again, I'm not sure if I'll be playing this version!

EDIT: I've just now realized there have been a lot of complaints about bad frame rate on this game. I didn't experience this issue. The game ran super smooth for me.

The original game is great. Whilst FF8 is the black sheep of the Final Fantasy golden years (from FF6 to FF10), it is still a worth while game. This version is a HD remaster, where the models, backgrounds and the music are much improved upon the original PC release.  I'd recommend it at a discount for people who are interested in novel JRPGs.
However , this version now runs terribly on the Windows 10 2004 may update. If you have this version there is a good chance of having a near unplayable framerate. This review will remain up and negative until this changes.
UPDATE: On the 5th of October 2021, this issue has been resolved and the game is now playable. With this update my machine gets 30 fps on the world map and 15 fps in battle. I believe this is the targeted fps and for this game whilst less then ideal is good enough.

If you're looking for a true remaster, this isn't it. Basically, your main characters faces have been updated to look a little better than they did on the PS1, and that's it. This is a straight port from the PS1. There are some nice boost options that come with the game such as being able to run the game at 3x speed, which makes moving SO much easier. There are others, and a cheat menu if that's how you roll..

In short, if you're looking for a nostalgic trip through and AMAZING PS1 game, that is just a straight port, you won't be disappointed. If you're looking for modern graphics in a game this old, this ISN'T it. The word "ReMaster" is b***s***m and never should have been in the title!

I've played nearly every Final Fantasy and this was one of the last on my list. The overwhelming feeling I was left with was sheer disappointment. The mechanics around the battle system are incredibly tedious and the game effectively penalises you for battling too often, despite bombarding you with random battles at time, effectively detracting from the whole of concept of being awarded for grinding and exploration. Add to that some extremely frustrating set pieces and a few too many 'where do I go next' moments, it's just a game I can't recommend to anyone other than the most dedicated RPG fans. After over 20 hours, I still just couldn't find much enjoyment in it, and have given up, and this is coming from someone who loved FF7 and FF9.

column8:
Ich bin eine Null im kreativen Schreiben, also fasse ich mich kurz und bündig. 

FF8 ist ein absoluter Klassiker. Die Story ist der Hammer, der Soundtrack brennt sich für alle Ewigkeiten in dein Gehirn rein (wie bei jedem FF Teil) und das Ingame Card Game macht schnell süchtig. 

Wer knapp bei Kasse ist, der sollte lieber die normale Version des Spiels wählen oder auf einen Sale warten. Bei der "Remastered Edition" handelt es sich lediglich um leicht verbesserte Character Models, die Möglichkeit die Geschwindigkeit des Spiels auf das dreifache zu erhöhen und Cheats zu benutzen. 

Da ich die normale Version von FF8 sowohl physisch, als auch für die PS3 (via PSN) besitze, habe ich mich nun für die Remastered Edition entschieden und bereue es absolut nicht. Ich bin voll und ganz zufrieden.
FPS-Bug wurde nach ca. 2 Jahren dann mal gefixt (Auf Windows 10 läuft das Spiel durch einen Bug lediglich mit 21 FPS. ES spielt sich aus diesem Grund entsprechend grausam).

Le jeu est très bon.
Mais carton rouge pour avoir appeler ce jeu un "remaster".
Le jeu est en 4:3, je pense que le seul aspect remasterisé (en tout cas ce que j'ai remarqué), ce sont les personnages. Et encore, pas "toujours" vu que parfois, sur certaines maps, certains personnages "figurants" sont "incrustés" dans le décors, donc, ils sont tout flous, ce qui donne des images assez paradoxales avec des personnages en HD et d'autres en pixelisés.
Les décors n'ont pas été revus.

Bref, achetez-le si vous voulez le découvrir, il le mérite largement. Mais ce que fait SE en parlant de "remaster" est scandaleux.

win95/98版、Xp版、メーカーサイトDL版とOSの流れに伴い買ってきました。

うん、これは今までで良い移植です。

未プレイの方に注意していただきたいのが、このFFはキャラのレベルよりも召喚獣のレベルが重要です。

そして、召喚獣で戦うのがメインと言っても過言ではない？

魔法もアイテムとしてストックし、使用するシステムなので基本的なFFをプレイしてきた方からすると「は？」なシステムですので注意が必要です。

そして、この作品はPS1時代のゲームであることを忘れないで下さい。

喋りません。
ワールドマップはFF中最低と思われるほどに簡素です。
PS1では街中、ダンジョン、キャラクターに容量使いすぎてワールドマップの容量が足りなかったんです。

あと、他の方のレビューに書かれているムービーが劣化の件の関しては、メーカーサイトDL版の時と全く同じファイルです。
ファイルをアンパックして実際にムービーファイルを比較しましたが、容量・ブロックノイズの入り方等も同じでした。
これはムービーのフィルターをソフト側が行っていたので実際のムービーより綺麗に見えていたが、このリマスター版はゲーム解像度を高解像度に上げれるからか、ソフト側でのフィルター処理が省かれているために、生ムービーで表示されているので劣化しているように錯覚していると思われる。
(・・・まぁ、「それを劣化と言うんだよ」と言われればそうなんですよね)

column8:
Original game aspects:
Not great - LOTS of missable content, with illogical rules. Many hotspots are quite difficult to trigger, due to the precise placement required. This adds greatly to their missability, as you are unlikely to trip over them accidentally, and there are often no visual clues. It's almost impossible to experience most of what the game has to offer without a walkthrough.
The story is kind of weird.

Remastered aspects:
  Well it's on the PC, otherwise I would not have bought it.  
  Not too many crashes, and reloading the most recent save gets you past them.
  Auto-save and the optional features that make gameplay easier are especially helpful for those of us who are playing it for the second time. 
  Better rendering of characters and monsters.
  Improved rendering of non-background objects (e.g. books) make them easier to see.

Bottom line : 6/10 - it passes the time.

column8:
Two years after the release of the phenomenal FF7, the folks from Square Enix were faced with a major challange: living up to the standard that they set themselves. They managed it by distancing themselves from the formula in the tone of their storytelling, the beauty of their world and the story-oriented gameplay.

You'll mostly play as Squall Leonheart, an antisocial member of a mercenary organization. The characters get entangled in a political scheme which leads up to a series of events and, as in most other Final Fantasy titles, you end up having to save the world. Throughout the story, your cold protagonist is forced to warm up a little bit his frozen heart, remember his past and build links to those around him.

FF8 exploited the emerging advancements in 3D rendering to deliver an immersive, story-rich game in a world of spellbinding beauty. I spite of the poor quality compared to today's technologies, the fluidity of the CGI animations is unmatched even by many modern titles. The architecture in FF8 is very unique, mixing organic elements (Gaudi-like) and baroque motifs. Everything is an eye-candy.

The mechanics and magic system are perhaps the weirdest from all Final Fantasy games - magic is drawn from enemies and "stored" as if they were some sort of item. The Summons are called GF here, and they also play a weird role for "Junctioning" magic. A good point of FF8's system is that it does not foment leveling or grinding. Monsters scale with your characters, so you're free to just ignore leveling altogether. Sometimes I felt like I was playing a Visual Novel.

No Linux port, but it ran flawlessly on Proton 5.0.9. Thanks Steam! Achievements for this one were nice and fun.

column8:
PORT:
Hablando de la remasterización diría que los modelos de los personajes principales me han gustado bastante, pero si que es cierto que en el tema fondos y sobretodo en muchisímos NPCs que se encuentran por los escenarios la calidad es pésima.
Por otro lado la velocidad x3 es una gozada y el omitir encuentros aleatorios sin necesitad de poner cada dos por tres la habilidad de Diablo pues también es algo a tener en cuenta.
No he tenido problemas de crasheos ni pantallazos negros que creo que ocurrían en las versiones anteriores.

HISTORIA SIN SPOILERS:
Otro Final Fantasy de la época dorada, quizá el más flojo de todos por el hecho de que puedes "romper el juego" casi nada mas empezar pero si lo juegas obviando las pequeñas trampas (que realmente no lo son ya que los que lo conocemos de hace tiempo sabemos bien como manejar el sistema de enlaces) es un juego super disfrutable.
El inicio de Squall es para mi gusto de los mas flojos de la saga, pero conforme avanza la historia crece mucho como personaje y la historia se empieza a poner muy interesante con las dichosas brujas.
La banda sonora pues es de 10, es un Final Fantasy, no bajan de esa nota ninguno y ya está xD.

Yo recomendaría su compra cuando se encuentre en rebajas, o en el caso de que seas un fan acérrimo de la saga cómpralo sin dudarlo.

Отличный ремейк старой доброй восьмой части. Улучшенные текстурки и отсутствие задротских ачивок вроде "Пройди всю игру с начальным уровнем персонажа" стоят того, чтобы переплатить за эту версию несколько рубликов. Игра вполне интересна в плане геймплея и сюжета, в ней можно и подраться, и погриндить, и секреты всяческие найти, и в мини-игру карточную сыграть. Классическая пошаговая система боя совмещена с уникальной системой применения магии. Интересно составлять эффективные привязки магии к параметрам, составляя билд против определённого врага или босса, а также под отдельные задачи в определённых ситуациях и местах. При грамотных настройках билда персонажа можно люто имбовать и даже убивать боссов с прокаста за один ход, а при корявом билде успешно протереть лицом пол. Можно призывать эпических чудищ, которые примут на себя удар и нанесут сокрушительный урон всем врагам. Каждый персонаж наделён особой ультимативной способностью, которая подчёркивает его характер, что тоже большой плюс.

Уверенно ставлю 10/10. Играл давным-давно на пиратских болванках, купил Ремастер в Стиме, перепрошёл, ничуть не пожалел. Шикарная игра.

FF VIII es el mejor juego de la historia y por eso merece la pena jugarse de vez en cuando. La remasterización... hombre podría haberse hecho mil veces mejor. Lo de la velocidad x3 es un puntazo, pero hay muuuuchas más cosas que se podrían haber hecho y no.

It's fun, but a bit wacky like ff8 always was. Regarding the port: ppl saying it's the worst thing ever are greatly exaggerating it. It a decent port, but at times it's a bit lazy. However, it runs just fine, at least it did so for me.

If you like ff8 this is the best way to play it =)
If you don't know ff-series that well there are other games to start with before this one. Junctioning is incredibly interesting, but hard and a bit obtuse.

column8:
FF8 è un'ottimo episodio dì Final Fantasy con molte quest da completare.

FF8 non hà bisogno dì presentazioni formali è il classico JRPG a turni con 1 trama molto bella e commovente.

Io lo consiglio a tutti questa ennesima versione rimasterizzata il mio voto a FF8 Remastered è 1 bel 10 e lode.

Deserved way better than this, but at least it looks a little prettier than it used to and speeding through some dialogue is helpful if you're like me and beat the original version an embarrassingly large number of times.

8/10 on graphics + speedy dialogue upgrade
5/10 overall upgrade; so much more could have been touched up and improved upon

Frankly, it feels like they put forth minimal effort after touching the graphics and went "here, fine, now just shut up about FFVIII" . . .

Still recommending, but that's directed to those who don't own the game at all and don't mind paying a little more for the nicer look. Unless you've got the money to blow, don't bother getting this if you have the original Steam version. I kinda regret it.

column8:
This is such a weird Final Fantasy game. It has weird mechanics. It has a weird story. It has weird enemy designs. But I like it so much. If you only played Triple Triad, the in-game card game, you'd probably have a good time. But that card game and the abilities your summons unlock really let you break open the battle system. I find that more fun than anything else. Combined with underleveling your characters and searching out lots of hidden content, the game really excels at letting you become powerful.

The story, although it is weird in how unique it is, is much more straightforward than the other Playstation era FF games. The aesthetic of this game is also unlike any other FF game, but it is consistent and presented much better than in a game like FF7. I love that pre-rendered chairs aren't twice the size of my character model.

More importantly, the characters are good. You stick with a smaller cast than almost any other FF game. In particular, I like that we can read many of Squall's thoughts. The game is amusing because of things like this, and these guys feel like a team.

FF8 is definitely still flawed, though, mostly on the grounds of being old. The controls are clunky. You spend a lot of time in menus. It isn't always clear what your next goal is. Battle animations are well done but slow. However, it ranks among my favorite of all the FF games.

And I have to say, the battle theme for Laguna, Man With a Machine Gun, is just so, so good.

column8: Jogo perfeito

A game I've been conflicted about for 20 years has gotten another run as a remaster. As a remaster the game is wanting, the graphics haven't been updated for the most part, the gameplay is the same and the FMV sequences aren't scaled for modern screens.

However, what was once one of my least favorite FF games has gained new respect for me. The character design and music is some of the best the series has to offer. The junction mechanic, while confusing at first and gamebreakingly exploitable later is still one of the most interesting systems I've ever seen in an RPG.

The story seems to go to hell in what was once disc 3 of the PS1 version and I think now I realize that the game was under crunch to capitalize on FF7's success. A lot happens with very little explanation and the ending can only be described as "Kubrickesque"

This game is the definition of a "flawed masterpiece" and it's unfortunate that the story wasn't allowed to get fully fleshed out and that they didn't fully dive into the morality of child soldiers and only brush on it here and there. This game could have been one of the best in the series but is still an amazing experience

column8:
13 hours in and the game crashes. I can't reload any save file - auto save or manual. Tried everything to fix it. Manually deleting my save files allowed me to start a new game, but why would I if it's just going to randomly crash?

This was truly the beginning of the end for Final Fantasy though. This game does not want you to play it. Bugs aside, everything this game does is an affront to the player. The Junction System is probably the most tedious way to level up ever conceived.  How does it work you may ask? You have to draw magic from scarce (and of extremely limited use) draw points or from monsters. Each draw from a monster takes a turn where you can get between 1-9 units of magic, where 100 is max. You can also create magic from items with certain abilities. Either way you will spend turn after turn drawing magic from enemies in order to boost your stats.

Why do I say boost your stats, and not level up? It's because this is one of those games where leveling actually hurts you. Each level requires 1000 EXP. Your reward for leveling up is a modest stat increase, the ability to draw higher level magic, and congratulations, the whole world leveled up with you. Meaning battles with the same enemies will be just as difficult as they were the whole time! 

Battles by the way, are A CHORE. Just getting into a battle is a drawn out endeavor, as the camera pans across the battle field, loading all of the character and enemy models. Every single action not only takes forever, but it pauses the ATB gauges, forcing you to wait for an action to to finish before queuing up your next moves. 

Which brings me to GFs, the bridge between wasting your time with junctions and wasting your time in battle. GFs are this games version of summons. Except when you use a GF, they get their own ATB for NO OTHER REASON THAN TO MAKE YOU WAIT FOR THE SUMMON. Now this is the real irony of the game: The compatibility mechanic makes it so that the more you use a GF, the shorter their summon time will be. Effectively, you need to waste time so you can waste less time in the future. Technically yes, they can take damage for you, but so what? 

About the only good things this game has going for it are the designs and interesting world. But even then, this game was designed to waste your time. Every single thing you do, or that happens outside of combat takes forever. Text boxes take entirely to long to load during dialogue. Animations play at a snails pace and aren't released nearly quick enough. Fisherman's Horizon is a prime example of this. Want to enter the town? >Walk down long boring catwalk,
>Walk down another catwalk 
>Talk to Familiar Face #1
>"Want to go down?"
>Yes 
>Party member enters
>Party member enters
>Squall enters
>Watch elevator go down
>Exit elevator
>Next screen
>Next screen
>Next screen
>You're in town!

Wanna upgrade your weapons? Have fun on a scavenger hunt for items you have no way of knowing where to get, and even if you do, good luck! You will have to hunt down specific monsters for specific items that have a 1% drop rate, and do it multiple times over! What fun!

The main vehicle of the game is your school, which is kinda cool in theory. But it moves at a snails pace and can't pass certain boundaries. You do eventually get this game's equivalent of an airship, but it's at the end of the game, and by that point you just want the game to end.

This game hates you. And I hate it.

[h1]Addendum:[/h1]
There are also things in this game that they added just to add, because you know, Final Fantasy! Yes, you can ride chocobos, but there's no reason to. You have to stumble on a chocobo forest, catch one, and then...? That's it. You get to ride it somewhere. They feel like an afterthought, as if Square finished the game and was like, "Oops we forgot to add chocobos! Oh well, just throw em in there."

Omega Weapon is another good example. Probably the cheapest super boss ever to be created. It can easily one shot your whole party. There are ways to cheese it, but it's nevertheless a tough fight. What's your reward? Proof of Omega. What does it do? Nothing. It does nothing. You get nothing for beating the toughest boss in the game, maybe all of Final Fantasy.

My last thought on FFVIII that truly makes it a bad game is that this game [i]requires[/i] a guide to play it. And it's not because of any sort of complexity, it's because so much of everything is missable. As mentioned above, you can play this whole game and never upgrade your weapons simply because you either missed the hidden magazines that gives you the upgrade recipes, or you can't find the items you would need to do the upgrade.

How would anyone know you need to kill 50 tonberries to get Tonberry king? Tonberries being one of the toughest non-boss monsters in the game, that just one shot your party members.

Side-quests often have nothing to do with the story or the world, and you wouldn't think to even look for most of them because of how obtusely hidden they are.

You can kind of work out how to find Omega, despite that process being convoluted (pull rope > switch party > find Omega - You have to know where the rope is and know where to place your party to get to him, because you have less than a minute) but also why would you? The game doesn't hint that he even exists, and he's at the end of the game! Literally right before the final boss! 

It's just sad. There were a lot of cool concepts in the game (flying military schools, the game's unique concept of witches, the main cast living out other people's memories) and great designs, but the game it just gets in its own way too much. The story falls off a cliff after disc 1 (when Squall is speared by an icicle), the leveling mechanic is tedious and unrewarding (actually technically punishing), everything in the game makes you wait, and because everything is so hidden from the player, you need a guide to be able to do basic things like upgrade your weapons. I would never recommend this game to anyone.

column8: 自从1998年最终幻想8发售以来，从光盘玩到电脑，几十年过去了，王菲代言演唱的歌曲依然历历在目，每次玩这一代，总会不自觉的回想起逝去的青春，游戏的各种系统是很有趣，人物的等级和怪物的等级是可以相差悬殊的。主要是吸收好的魔法以及改造武器，还有对卡片游戏有兴趣的朋友，可以在FF8里尽情的畅玩由怪物组成的卡片游戏，剧情跌宕起伏，音乐千回百转，推荐有闲暇时间的朋友们玩玩，在最终幻想系列里，是一款不错的游戏

This is the best way to experience FF8. You can play in 4k, with sharp upscaled models, ui and character art. The prerendered backgrounds are a muddy mess in high res, but there's not much to be done about that and I don't find it ruins the experience for me. Full controller support for those who want a more authentic console experience. You probably know the game and made a decision about whether or not you like it years ago, this review is more for the remaster itself, which isn't amazing but is the best one for FF8 that exists on any platform.

column8:
[So in case you are new to the Final Fantasy series you can play the games out of order as the stories are not continuations there more self-contained stories and games, and one of the most interesting things about this series is that all the games play differently so if you don't like one it may be worth researching the others.]

As mentioned before the games all play differently, this game is turn-based with ATB (Active Time Battle) bars which basically mean when you use an action in battle you have to wait for a bar to fill before you can perform another action (you have 3 characters in battle and they all have separate ATB bars). but hands down the most interesting thing about this game is the Junction system, see where 7 has its Materia, 10 has its sphere grid and the other games all have there own ways of pumping character, this has the Junction system, it's basically use GF's (Summons) with magic to makes stats go higher, and there are multiple ways to get magic so it's not hard finding something that works for you.

Honestly, FF8 is probably the easiest Final Fantasy game I've played but that's not bad, the game has a system in place where it bases enemies off your level so if you can stay low level the game is easy, but it also has a lot to offer in replayability from the junction system alone, as well as for people who love card games as there is a game called Triple Triad which I think a lot of people like more then the main game.

The story is fine, it's what you expect from a Final Fantasy game good, but maybe held on a high horse, I don't think it's bad but there about as many issues as there is with any other FF game.

All in all, it's a good game, one of the respectable Final Fantasy games.
8/10 it has a little something for everyone

Ce FFVIII Remastered a du bon et du mauvais.
Pour ceux qui n'y ont jamais joué, achetez-le, vous ne serez pas déçus. Pour ceux qui l'ont terminé un nombre incalculable de fois comme moi, passez votre chemin.

Ceci est un Remastered (graphismes) et non un Remake (tel que FFVII avec des changements majeurs).

- Graphismes : refonte des skins des persos principaux, ennemis en combats, etc.

- Menus : ça fait du bien d'avoir une jolie écriture qui s'affiche à l'écran, ça oui !
- Scénario : le même.

Je ne le recommande pas, l'avoir déjà terminé plusieurs fois sur PS1, émulateur PSX et Steam (version originale du jeu).
Pour les autres, foncez !

FF8 is my favourite game of all time. So I was stoked as much as others were when this was announced.

The good: Basically all of the main character models, monster models as well as the special effects have been upscaled and look nice and the menus have just been cleaned up a bit too looks wise. To be honest I am not a fan of the art style they went with as the characters look quite anime like and I felt that what made this FF so unique was the rather European serious science fiction, non cartoony look, that no other FF really had. So it just felt a little off in my opinion however the models do look nice and polished so it is down to personal taste.

Some assists have been added to the game which are such a warm welcome as game play wise this is a very boring game which involves you sitting for a about 20 mins to draw magic (used for stat building) as simple as 100 fires from enemies FOR EACH CHARACTER. I feel that they are well done as you can either use all of them to fully cheat or use them more to assist you, if you want to play honest but without the unnecessary grind. I will explain some of the nuances of some of the key assists that you only find out by trial and error, so that you do not meet the same fate :).

3x game speed: I would recommend just using this for skipping GF cut scenes, limit breaks, fight animations, level grinding and especially drawing magic. This makes magic drawing much more bearable and is a good to take advantage of if you want to play honestly and not use max spells at all.

Max spells: This doesn't give you every magic spell, it simply gives you the maximum number of stock (100) for whatever spells you currently have. So you still have to obtain that spell, it just means you then don't have to worry about stats dropping because you have used 3 cures.

Max GF levels: You still have to obtain the GF yourself. However If you plan on using this do beware that if you have  customised the GFs abilities by removing them with forget GF ability items and adding your own, do bear in mind that this will reset the GF's to having their all of default learnable abilities unlocked, so you would loose whatever abilities you have added yourself.

Now onto the bad: There is alot of laziness and you will feel ripped off paying 15.99. Alot of the NPC sprites have not been updated. So you will have the updated polished characters talking to literally distorted, fuzzy pixels. To make matters worse this is also the same for some of the back drops and backgrounds which haven't been changed.

For example there is a scene in Esthar city where you get in a car to go to a certain location. The car is animated as moving and so is the background. You can see how dated and horrible the moving background is compared to this remodelled car.  I just feel that it ruins the whole remastered experience and you do feel cheated especially if this game holds a special place to you as it did for me.

Overall I would recommend this game to be honest, simply because of the addition of the assists. As I feel that this game is nearly unplayable in 2020 on a first time casual play through with how pointlessly grindy and slow it is and you really are able to enjoy this game without feeling like you are cheating. I have no idea on PC  mods but If you can somehow get the original, slap some graphic mods on it and maybe get some assist mods like what is on this game then do that???

Otherwise this is still worth the purchase to enjoy an absolute classic.... Just try to do it when there is an offer.

column8: This is a solid port.  Good to have proper controller input this time on pc.  Its just old FF8 but now the game is actually playable on pc.  As for calling it a remaster...lol...  I think the original stuff had a lot more detail, yeah it was pixelated, but it was definitely done with darker vision and not to censor or make everything "cute".  I appreciate the older art over the remake which seems to take a lot from the pc port, which seemed to be a quick job rather than a quality job and thats just a shame.  The remake and the pc port backgrounds are practically identical, it seems only the base characters and monsters got the upgrades.  This was a rushed job again, and even though its great to have it on Steam and finally working great and playable, if u could emulate the original ps1 copy and natively scale that up, I believe it would be still the best version of the game to play.  Its not completely awful, but it honestly just really kills some (a LOT of) nostalgia, they just make all new models and ran the rest of the graphics through a blur filter and decided to sell it.  Lazy remaster IMHO.  Could have at least sharpened up the backgrounds so the player character models didn't stand out like cardboard cutouts against the rest of the game.  It wouldn't surprise me if the people who were responsible for this remaster worked for Nintendo.  In the end, Im upset it wasnt the remaster I really truly wanted for this game, especially when pcs and modern consoles are so much more capable these days.  Original: 9/10, Pc port: 1/10, Remastered: 8/10

column8: This isn't so much a "remaster" as it is a lightly modified port packaged with a collection of graphical mods that had a similar near-equivalent available for free to people who owned the original release. If marketed as a DLC for the original, this would be pretty cool. As its own thing, however, it's probably the laziest "remaster" I've ever seen. Having grown up with the original, this disappoints me. Many things have been visually improved, (mainly characters and enemies with higher polygon counts and higher resolution textures) but just as many things haven't, and they clash pretty terribly against each other. The original 2D backgrounds were intended to display at 320x240 resolution on an old tube TV, and upscaled to 1080p or higher they look like a blurry mess. The characters and objects plastered on top of them render at whatever your monitor's resolution goes up to, so it looks like all the characters and interactable objects are clear and sharp and everything else is blurred out of focus. Also, it only displays at a 4:3 aspect ratio, so if you want to play without black bars you need to resort to hardware scaling which makes the image even blurrier. If you want to play your completely legit copy of the PSX version that you totally ripped from the disc yourself and didn't download off a ROM archive, the whole image can be made a consistent level of blurry using a CRT filter, which looks much more natural than a mashup of high and low quality graphics. The included system menu includes cheat options, and really makes it feel like you're playing it on an emulator too. Not in a good way. Technically this is the best-looking version of the game available, but not by much. I'd say only buy it if you don't have the skill and patience to configure emulation settings or PC mods and want something that just works.

Purchased again for the 8th time, 8 times for the real MVP, Final Fantasy VIII.

Couldnt care less what you say about the Junction system, so fun,

You all can say what you wanna say, this game eats FF7 every night and day, couldnt compare.

Anyways buy this game not once but many more times, when this gets remade you will appreciate it more a true masterpiece, FF VIII Remake, watch this space!

El juego es muy bueno, pero estoy muy decepcionado con esta remasterización... Básicamente han metido unos filtros para disimular, tanto en las texturas como en los modelos 3D, y ya está. No se han currado que sea Widescreen a pesar de que todos lo son ya (es 4:3), no cubre la pantalla completamente ni en aspecto 4:3 (quedan bordes arriba y abajo), y encima hasta los FPS son bajos (15 fps por norma, 22 en algunos momentos y 60 muy rara vez), y tengo una RTX2080, por lo que dudo que sea falta de potencia. Hasta han quitado logros, que eso me llama la atención teniendo en cuenta que el juego es igual...
Resumiendo, han reciclado la gran mayoría del juego incluyendo el motor, y simplemente le han metido filtros para llamarlo "Remaster", por lo que si tienes alguna otra versión del juego no te merece la pena comprar esta otra.
Si no lo tienes entonces te puede servir, ya que aunque no hayan hecho gran mejora, algo es algo, y el juego es bastante bueno.

Almost what you expect from a remaster; better textures with extra game assists (HP always full, except when getting a damage that exceeds the character's max HP or inflicted by "Death" magic, no encounter, and 3x speed). Perhaps better audio but I couldn't really recall the difference. Only it is lacking modern 16:9 screen ratio, because the screen is stuck in 4:3 which is suck for today's standard. The same goes for the FMV cutscenes, stuck in 4:3 and the render is just the same as the 1999 version.
But when getting into the game, these problem is easily forgettable. I really enjoyed the game. I don't see any errors yet for this game as others mentioned. This game works perfectly well.

column8:
I remembered not being a fan of it when it released 20+ Years ago. Reading  about how great it is throughout the years on forums, had me finally willing to give it another chance. Champions saying how the junction system was actually amazing and Ultimecia Castle being the pinnacle of JRPG dungeon design done right had me eager to see if my youth was just misguided, and I found out that my youth was entirely right. 

Sadly, I think two word sum this game up more than anything. Disjointed and boring.  It's the only Final Fantasy game I've not been able to complete because I just can't bring myself to slog through an experience I just don't care about. Hell,  I quit at the exact same spot I vaguely remember bailing at so long ago; The lunar base.

This is the best version of Final Fantasy 8 available on PC. It has great controller support right out of the box. The music is great and true to the original without needing any mods to fix it. Whether you're someone new to the game or somebody looking for a nostalgia trip, this version is true to form and completely worth picking up.

é foda chamar isso de um remaster, eu amo esse jogo, foi o primeiro final fantasy que terminei, e pretendo terminar ele novamente, o jogo não tá diferente do que sempre foi, mas em 2020 jogar algo a 15 frames por segundo é inaceitavel,  já existia um jogo lançamento dese jogo que continha os mesmo problemas, se eles não foram concertados então porque relançar?

column8: this was my introduction to the final fantasy series all those years ago, saw my cousins playing it and i had never seen anything like it, i had to have it, i worked my butt off doing what kids did in the 90s to earn money, cutting grass, washing cars, etc. finally bought the game and i fell in love with it and final fantasy as a whole. Why tell you this? because you have to understand, if you're not familiar with this game its actually one of the lesser liked final fantasies but i still loved this game, the faults people had wit hit just didnt bother me. I was so excited to see this game get remastered, when i saw the mixed review status, i just assumed it was people hating the game from so many years ago. But after less than an hour of playing i requested a refund, this is the poorest attempt at a "Remaster" ever. the opening cutscene is still in its original format of i think like 360p (at best) and the only things get any kind of real work done on them were the character models, yeah they look good, but the backgrounds of EVERYTHING is still the og ps1 graphics, just up rezzed, and all that does is make them even blurrier. its like playing a game at 1080p with the background of 99% of the game being up rezzed 240p still images, it just doesnt show that they gave a shit at all.

column8:
Great story, it made me want a girlfriend.

The remastered version adds the ability to utilize the 3x Speed Boost option (extremely thankful for this one given how absolutely dragging the battles felt without this option turned on), turn off random encounters & enable Battle Assist which makes battles extremely easy by fully restoring your HP/MP each turn. On top of that, you're able to access the cheats menu which allows players to cheat (surprise). This came in handy for me after I realized how much I disliked the GFs & junction system in the game. At the end of the day, I was most interested in the story of this game and utilizing the mechanics that the remastered version introduced allowed me to solely focus on the story without having to deal with the outdated mechanics of the original.

I recommend this game solely for its incredibly touching - and different - story. I cried at the end of the game because of how emotionally touched I was, on top of the fact that I remembered that I was still single.
