column8:
The game itself is great. The problem is with this "remaster"...

Aside from some characters and enemies models, the rest seems to be the same low graphics stuff we had in 1998. In some places, like Deling City, you can see actual npcs being represented as background graphics on maybe 180p resolution. So this thing can hardly be called a remaster.

You can still get the old steam version and install some mods, like Project Rebirth and Project Eden, and it'll look much better than what we get here. You'll also be able to play the Chocobo World minigame, which was removed in the remaster. It's really optional, but it does have some unique items to it.

This game might be doable if you need to play it on a console. But for PC, just get the old version and fill it with the excellent graphics mods avaliable.

Comparado a versão Steam anterior, SEM MODS, considero uma boa evolução gráfica, ainda que sejam evoluções pontuais. Como pontos positivos  contam a facilidade para (principalemente) jogadores que já zeraram uma ou mais vezes e querem algo específico. Velocidade aumentada, boost, e sem batalhas aleatórias desde o início. 
 
Como ponto extremamente negativo conta o fato de que a melhora gráfica foi apenas em pontos e personagens específicos e nada alem disso. Nem 16:9 foi feita para este remaster.

Enfim, se ver em promoção por 30 R$ ou menos, que foi o que eu achei, vale a pena. Caso contrario vá no antigo mesmo com mods.

column8:
Not as bad as I remember when I was younger. Junctioning is a lot more abusable as an adult, very easy to become OP. Triple Triad is fun. Drawing magic is not. (idiots will tell you to refine to get your magic instead, but that's total BS, especially with higher level spells, good luck!) The 3X Speed function saves this game entirely, helps you save a lot of time on stupid stuff that would have totally killed my willingness to keep going, including drawing magic or making long runs around towns like Timber. The FMVs actually hold up really well in this game for being 21 years old. Music is amazing, Uematsu always does an excellent job.

The characters and plot are actually worse than I remember, you barely learn anything about any of the characters, and the plot is so absurd and nonsensical that it's laughable. All the time travel segments with Laguna suck and don't really contribute anything to the actual plot. The junction system, now that I understand it, is actually totally broken, and I don't think I even had a character get KO'd once before the 15~ hour mark, because it's so easy to have massive amounts of hp and damage when you junction the right things to them. There's also no things like MP costs or limits to GF (summons) usage, you can just spam things all day with little repercussion. There's also nothing to equip, you only upgrade your weapons. This is probably the easiest of all the FF games i've played.

If you have nostalgia for the game in any way, it's probably worth picking back up. I'll admit I had enjoyed a lot of the time with the game, especially the first parts I remember as a kid. If you've never played it, the game will mostly likely be a long drag for a lot of it. You will probably find yourself liking Triple Triad more than the combat system.

column8: Я був просто закоханий в цю гру, коли мені було 13. Але тепер, граючи у дорослому віці, бачу її проблеми. І їх, на жаль, досить багато. Недоліки стосуються і геймплею (це неймовірно незбалансована гра), і історії. В основі сюжету - романтична історія, тому гра так сильно подобається підліткам. Крім кохання в сюжеті дуже багато динаміки, і це чудово - гра по-справжньому захоплює. Але коли починаєш трохи роздумувати над тим, що відбувається, то розумієш, наскільки все це безглуздо. Діям героїв явно не вистачає логіки. І це не просто прискіпування, а серйозний недолік - якщо хоч на кілька секунд замислитися над логікою подій, розумієш, що нема тут ніякої логіки. Але якщо відключити голову, то гра може принести задоволення - вона емоційна і динамічна. А ще тут найкращий саундтрек і дуже красиві заставки.

At the time of this review I'm right before the final boss. Having done many playthroughs on the PS1 I can say this could probably be the "definitive" release. I say this only because the models looks excellent. The backgrounds on the other hand look awful and weren't touched up at all. Battles run at 15 fps unless 3x speed is enabled. And maybe I'm dense, but I couldn't get analog movement enabled, something the PS1 version had.

Overall, it's FF8. Love it or hate it, this is a safe way to play the game imo.

column8: いいねー！

I really goof Final Fantasy classic. The only downside to this particular title is since its a remaster, the backgrounds dont scale to the new resolution because they are pre rendered. This makes for really blurry backdrops the whole game. Character models look phenomenal. If you dont mind the blurry backgrounds then definitely buy this bc its great. The junction system isnt as bad as people make it out to be but it is stil not the best progression system in Final Fantasy and it makes it easy to break the game by just NOT leveling and instead junctioning high level magic to your stats as the enemies scale with Squall's level. If you cant handle blurry background and are ok with less than pristine character models then you are better off buying the original version.

総評：良くも悪くも古い作品なので、不便な点や不親切な点を許せる人にならオススメできる作品。

良かった所：ストーリーは本当に面白い。FFという歴史あるシリーズの中の名作であることは間違いない。
また、PSの頃と違って、ディスクを交換する手間も無いので非常にスムーズ。
20年前の作品としては、かなりの大ボリューム。サブクエストも多く、カードは飽きがこない。

悪い所：正直、20年前の作品なのでシステム周りが本当に不便。リマスターで大雑把には修正されているものの、不満点は多い。
また、キャラグラフィックやオブジェクトのグラフィックが向上しているが、背景などはそのままなので、キャラが浮いて見える。
さらに、オブジェクトで管理されていない仕掛けなどが、相対的に非常に見にくくなっている。
ダンジョンの仕掛けなども基本ノーヒントなので、仕掛けに気付かなければ序盤から複数の詰みポイントが存在している。
最序盤であり、このゲームの面白いポイントでもある、ジャンクションというシステムの説明が無いので、個別でWikiなどに頼るしかないというのはかなり厳しい点だろう。

正直、私自身はストレスに感じる要素が多かったので、個人としてはオススメはできない作品だと感じた。
しかしながら、レゲー特有の手探り感が好きな方には、良い作品だろうと思う。
nostalgia galore

column8:
I finally took the time to sit down and play this through. This game was the reason I begged my parents for a playstation back in 99. I had played the demo disc from pizza hut at my friends house, and I had to have it. Being a dumb kid I had a really hard time with the Junction system and never really finished it. I hit a wall around disc 3. Having finally finished it, I'm a little in my feels honestly. I feel like I need to call my friends and tell them how much I love and appreciate them. Once I figured out that the real game is about a kid obsessed with a CCG who uses that obsession to become rich and powerful, because literally every person of power in this world also plays said CCG. Even the GFs are invested in that CCG for some reason and have abilities to allow the user to transform cards into powerful magic. It's a little nuts, but what FF isn't. Loved it. Loved every weird, grindy, card playing second of it. 

As far as the Remaster elements? I enjoyed them a lot. Menus are much nicer to look at which is the main thing for me. All important models looks nice. Only a handful of times where the low res models in the background bothered me.

column8:
[h1]Premessa[/h1]
A 6 anni dalla versione steam, Square propone una remastered di Final Fantasy VIII con poligoni, effetti e animazioni rifatti ed alcuni cheats e boost in più rispetto alla versione precedente. Il titolo doveva riuscire nell’ardua impresa di colpire il giocatore dopo il successo del settimo capitolo con una propria identità e originalità senza prendere troppo dal predecessore. Ci riesce stravolgendo gameplay, stile e modo di raccontare la storia.
[h1]Storia[/h1]
In una sorta di accademia militare/scuola chiamata Garden, vengono addestrati le forze militari del mondo di gioco. Il titolo comincia nel Garden di Balamb, unico luogo dove è possibile diventare SeeD, uno speciale corpo militare in grado di usare le Guardian Forces e addetto al supporto e alla protezione dei civili contro i mostri. Il protagonista è Squall, uno studente che deve svolgere il suo ultimo esame per diventare SeeD. Insieme a lui ci saranno altri SeeD che lo accompagneranno nel corso dell’avventura e Rinoa, capo dei Gufi del Bosco, gruppo di resistenza contro l’impero di Galbadia. I due(Squall e Rinoa) sono al centro della storia, completamente agli antipodi per carattere e atteggiamento, li accomuna la perdita di qualcuno di importante. Mentre Squall si è chiuso in se stesso ed è diventato estremamente introverso tanto da evitare di affezionarsi a chiunque per paura di perderlo, Rinoa è più allegra ed estroversa, ed è l’unica che riesce a far breccia nel muro invisibile che Squall aveva eretto intorno a lui. A livello di background e character design, i due protagonisti sono quelli più approfonditi e studiati. Tutti gli altri sono appena abbozzati o poco approfonditi, non risaltano molto nella storia se non per un particolare che li accomuna. L’antagonista invece è quasi del tutto vuota. Poco e niente si sa su chi sia o sul perché delle sue azioni. Se si va alla ricerca di informazioni nel mondo di gioco si riesce ad approfondire un pò ciascun personaggio ma la pochezza rimane e si sente. Per la trama invece si tocca il delicato quanto affascinante tema del tempo, legato indissolubilmente a quello del destino. Per quanto inizialmente poco chiaro tutto assume una forma e non ci sono buchi o situazioni illogiche, tranne forse un particolare paradosso voluto che si lega appunto al concetto di destino. Quello dei protagonisti infatti sembra in qualche modo già predetto. Altre componenti importanti della trama sono la relazione tra Squall e Rinoa, il lento e progressivo cambiamento di Squall grazie agli amici ma soprattutto a Rinoa e il perché dell’esistenza dei SeeD e di determinati ed inizialmente inspiegabili eventi che intercorrono nella narrazione.
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Quello di questo capitolo è molto particolare. Originale e interessante, ma anche lento e macchinoso. A differenza di un classico rpg i parametri dei personaggi non aumentano con il salire di livello, non ci sono punti magia e i personaggi non acquisiscono nuove abilità o magie livellando. Tutto il gameplay ruota attorno alle Junction. Una Junction consiste nel “legare” una Guardian Force(le evocazioni di questo capitolo) ad un personaggio. Ogni Guardian Force ha delle abilità che vanno apprese attraverso l’ottenimento di punti abilità dopo ogni scontro. Queste abilità permettono di modificare determinati parametri del personaggio, dargli dei bonus o addirittura svolgere delle azioni particolari. Inoltre in combattimento ogni personaggio può invocare la GF a lui legata per attaccare il nemico. I parametri che le GF permettono di modificare però aumentano solo se al parametro viene affibbiata una magia. In base a che magia e a che parametro viene legata e alla quantità posseduta di tale magia, il cambiamento è diverso. Per esempio legare 80 unità di Energia al parametro degli HP, aumenterà di più il valore rispetto a 100 unità di Fire. Il numero massimo di unità per ogni magia è 100. Queste vanno assimilate, tramite apposito comando, dai nemici o dalle fonti in giro per le mappe. Ogni personaggio può legarsi a più GF, inoltre quando in fin di vita, possono eseguire, quando evidenziato, una tecnica finale diversa per ogni personaggio. Infine altra particolarità è che il gioco setta il livello dei nemici al nostro. Ciò vuol dire che i nemici sono potenzialmente sempre al nostro livello. Se da un lato questo diminuisce il grinding, dall’altro permette attraverso un accurato utilizzo delle abilità delle GF di rendere dei personaggi di basso livello esageratamente potenti e ridurre drasticamente così il livello di difficoltà del gioco. Particolare rilevanza viene data al mini gioco di carte che permette di ottenere oggetti rari. La navigazione della mappa segue quella di FFVII con il personaggio che si muove attraverso le terre di gioco con incontri casuali e può entrare in determinati luoghi. La remastered include diversi trucchi per migliorare l’esperienza di gioco.
[h1]Comparto Tecnico[/h1]
A livello grafico la remaster, seppur migliorando enormemente i modelli poligonali dei personaggi porta un problema, lo stacco tra personaggi e background è eccessivamente netto e fastidioso a causa dell’effetto sfocato dato ai panorami, perdendo quella omogeneità tra i vari elementi a schermo della versione originale. La colonna sonora d’altro canto è superba ed ammaliante. La drammaticità trasmessa da Liberi Fatali in contrasto alla soavità di Eyes on Me rendono l’idea non solo della qualità del lavoro di Uematsu in questo capitolo ma anche della buona diversità che va ad accompagnare gli eventi di gioco, esaltando grazie alla potenza dell’orchestra, ogni istante.

[h1]Conclusione[/h1]
Una storia che riesce ad essere originale ed intrigante con un’armonica oscillazione tra il cupo e il romantico, lo spensierato e il serio. Un peccato il mancato approfondimento dei secondari rispetto ai due protagonisti, per non parlare di un antagonista poco rilevante e con debole personalità. Se molti espedienti narrativi sono ben riusciti, alcuni scadono nel banale ed in clichè evitabili. Anche il gameplay risulta molto originale con la nuova meccanica delle Junction, tuttavia si mostra molto artificioso ed incline a rendere il titolo particolarmente semplice fin da subito. Il comparto grafico della remastered è discutibile a causa del fastidioso effetto blur degli sfondi in contrasto con i modelli HD dei personaggi. La colonna sonora resta una delle più indimenticabili della serie.
[h1]Voto[/h1]
[b]85/100[/b]
Excellent remastered d'une série qu'on ne présente plus.

优点:
针对此版本：无。人物高清化我个人觉得与CG中形象不一致，还不如用老版本的模糊脸。纯粹情怀补票。针对原作来看，角色细节刻画很丰富且细腻，游戏系统创新度很高，战斗系统，魔法系统，融合(junction)系统，GF系统，card系统，SeeD,精炼(refine)系统，濒死技（limit break）系统各个是亮点，无缝CG融合，镜头的把控，对比起现在的各式RPG作品，除了技术受限，在音画上比现在的游戏落后以外，其他方面到处都是闪光点。如果是老版本的，可以搭配上当年天幻非常有爱且到位的汉化，食用起来相当不错。放到如今已过20多年，我还是认为这部作品是难以超越的。
缺点：
1. 没有中文
2. 手柄没有震动
要重温的话个人推荐去找老版本PS模拟器的或者98，或03年的PC版最佳)，ffsky的大佬们中文版翻译的特别到位，很有爱。推荐自己找找老版本的玩。

Honestly it's just a re-master of the original. It's not GREAT, but it gives you everything the original game did along with some quality of life changes. For instance, you get to boost the game speed x3 at will for farming sessions(or when you're sick and tired of animations), you get to switch no encounters on and off at will so you don't have to deal with junctioning it all the time. 
There is also a section with legitimate cheats akin to what you could do with Gameshark back on the Playstation. 

The only thing remastered in the game is the character models. This looks a little out of place against the clearly very aged backgrounds, but in combat it looks pretty great. And it also makes interactions among characters more immersive as they are no longer blurry pixels moving about. 

All in all, the best part about the game is having it easily available on Steam, though. But if you already have the non-remastered Steam version then there's no reason to get this unless the above is something you want.

column8: (´・ω・｀)FF8すこ　やっと長年の呪いが解けたわ・・・

ゲームそのものはオススメですが中途半端で雑な高解像度化をリマスターと謳っているのでオススメしません。
雑移植に定評のあるDotEmu製も納得。
未プレイ既プレイに関わらず雑リマスターを笑って済ませられる人だけ買うようにしましょう。
町やダンジョン内の移動が補正されるのはなくしてほしかったな。
あとエラー落ちどうこうってレビューがよくありますが僕はクリアまで一回もエラーは発生しませんでした。

おま国あるいは公式で1500円程度で買えるForPC版ではなくこちらを買う理由を挙げるとすると
・BGMがMIDI音源ではない（最重要）
・中途半端なリマスターで笑ってみたい
・Steamで実績を登録できる（ForPC版のおま国をなんとかできるなら別）
・おでかけチョコボはやりたくないけどアイテムはほしい（専用アイテムはアンジェロサーチで入手可）
といったところ。ぶっちゃけ面倒なんでBGMがMIDI音源じゃなきゃ駄目っていう奇特な人でもなきゃこっちでいいでしょう。
レビューでMIDI音源じゃないのが駄目！って言ってる人がたまにいますけど個人的にはちょっと信じられない。

後は未プレイの人向けです。攻略見たくないけど雑に情報が欲しい人用。
・ゲームシステム
よくレベル上げすると敵ばかり強くなって詰むなんて話を聞きますが、魔法をジャンクション（装備）するというチュートリアルで丁寧に教えてくれる基本がなっていればそういうことはないです。
魔法をドローするのが面倒という意見には返す言葉もありませんが、このゲームにはカード精製と各種魔法精製という非常に便利なアビリティが存在するので、そういうのを使えばドローなんて一部のボスからG.F（召喚獣）を取得するときと希少な魔法がほしいときくらいしか使いません。メニューのG.Fの項目から習得するアビリティを設定するのを忘れないようにしましょう。
逆に敵から逃げたり敵をカードにすることでレベル上げしないように進めるとヌルゲーすぎて逆にやる気が失せます、まじで。
上で少し触れましたけど一部のボスがG.Fを持っていて取得しないと永遠に手に入らなくなるので、ボスっぽい敵から何をドローできるか確認する癖をつけておいたほうがいいです。形態変化した時も要チェック。
・ストーリー（評判聞いてる人向け）
たまに突拍子もない展開や説明不足な展開はありますけども電波や意味不明ってほどではないんじゃないでしょうか。終盤の流れやエンディングの演出は題材的にわかりにくいかもしれませんっていうかわかりにくい。
あと何故かスクウェア三大悪女の一人にカウントされている今作のヒロインリノアさんですが、序盤世間知らずの電波だったりするところが多少あるくらいで普通に年齢相応なんじゃないでしょうか。序盤はイラっとする箇所がいくつかあるでしょうけど、作中でキレられてるので意図的なやつです。そういうのも駄目って人はまあ…しょうがない。

まあキャラクターや乗り物の一部しか綺麗になってない上に動きも特に手が加えられてるわけでもないんで、初代PSくらいのレトロゲーに抵抗あるなら買わないほうがいいです。

already finished this game a long time ago on console but just as i appreciate sega releasing the yakuza series on pc, i appreciate squaresoft doing the same for the final fantasy games.  i've gotten to the "disc 2" part of the game and haven't experienced any crashes.  some people don't like that the remaster is just newer models over the same backgrounds but after pulling out my old copy and playing that for a bit, i vastly prefer the higher resolution characters and esper animations (it helps that you can speed them up too with a push of L3).  the original blocky graphics look like zombie versions by comparison.  and the contrast between the new and old styles actually reminds me of how the original ff7 overlayed dynamic sprites over painted backgrounds.  i've completely forgotten how the game ends so looking forward to seeing it again.  the camera and movement controls haven't aged well but the gameplay still holds up and is more well balanced than some newer jrpg's.

Square-Enix już od kilku lat raczy nas nowymi wydaniami swoich produktów. Jak wypadł lifting legendarnej ósemki? Niestety dość średnio. FFVIII od samego początku cierpiał na kilka niedomagań , po pierwsze - animacja 15 fps (przy większej ilości ruchomych elementów, nawet mniej)  - nie jest to problem nowy, niestety wciąż bardzo widoczny. W kwestii animacji remaster wypada nawet gorzej od oryginału. Gra potrafi crashować z bliżej niewyjaśnionych przyczyn. To co rzuca się w oczy, to z pewnością poprawione menu, oraz modele postaci - zdecydowanie bardziej wyraźne. Niestety, Square nie pokusiło się o poprawienie pozostałych tekstur, przez co odczuwalne jest silne skontrastowanie między mocno rozmytymi tłami niskiej rozdzielczości, a modelami postaci w 4k. Gra nie zawsze nie zapisuje stan przed każda potyczka, lub wejściem do nowej lokacji. FFVIII Remastered na tle odswieżonej (przeniesionej na Unity Engine) FFIX wypada słabiej niemal pod każdym względem. Na plus można zaliczyć dodane właściwości  - 3x speed, oraz wyłączenie losowych walk. To jednak zbyt mało by remaster uznać za produkcję udaną. 

Produkt można polecić tym, którzy z FFVIII nigdy nie mieli styczności - to nadal niesamowicie wciągająca, wielowątkowa opowieść, dzięki której  na jakieś 40-50 godzin przeniesiecie się do innego świata .

The battles feel like they chug in 10 FPS, inevitably resulting in yours truly feeling sick on multiple occasions. column8: Breath taking, and a wonderfully good HD remaster of this game!

recommended, but with stipulations.

New models look good,
     ...but the introduction of texture seams in the world map and blurry background paintings make the contrast more ugly than the original (imo)

 The controls - no analog imput (free 360 movement like in ps1) it's got this horrendous 8 point movement.  Also no vibration, rip happy trigger renzokuken.

The introduction to an easy 3x speed that doesn't garble up the music or do anything bad is awesome.  Adding a mini cheat engine to allow you to max out stuff like cards, items, magic, is fun for playing around with builds if you're like me and have played through the game several times.  

I heard about the frame rate being locked to something like 15 in combat along with the UI - which sucks but not a big deal.

I discovered ReShade which has an awesome CRT filter on it.  It has brought all the elements in the game together in harmony which makes me really happy.  I would have probably hit do not recommend if I hadn't of discovered that sweet little gem.  The 8 point movement I've mostly gotten used to, though still annoys me while everytime I melee with Squall I miss the feedback of a perfectly timed trigger.

It's the best we have, and I think they did a "decent" job "remastering" FFVIII  I just hope I live long enough for them to do a remake of it.

column8:
Final Fantasy 8 Remastered ist ein schönes Spiel und sieht nochmal etwas besser aus, als das originale FF8 auf dem Pc, was damals ja schon um einiges besser aussah, als die PS1 Version.
Zudem läuft es einwandfrei. Es gab nicht einen Absturz.

Wer hier aber sowas wie ein Remake erwartet mit komplett neuen Hintergründen, usw, der ist hier falsch. Es sieht einfach etwas besser aus, als das Original.
Ich hatte meinen Spaß, wobei die Story das einzige ist, was wirklich gut gealtert ist. Ohne den 3-fach Speed (linker Stick drücken) hätte ich das Game vermutlich nicht mehr durchgespielt.

Beispielsweise FF9 und 10 hat dieses Problem, meiner Meinung nach, nicht, aber auch dort habe ich die Speedfunktion bei gewissen Momenten sehr zu schätzen gelernt.

Das einzige, was ich wirklich kritisieren würde, wäre, dass FF8 extrem einfach ist. Man muss sich nicht allzu klug anstellen, um das Spiel zu meistern, aber das ist auch nicht wirklich schlimm.
Wer aber wirkliche Herausforderungen mag, der spielt dann doch besser FF7,9, oder 10. Falls jemand diese 3 Teile schon zu leicht findet, wird er mit FF8 absolut nicht glücklich.

column8:
FF８初プレイです。
古いゲームなのでグラフィックや操作性は置いといて音楽はよかったです

しかし戦闘が楽しいよりも面倒が勝ってしまった。敵を倒してレベル上げすると敵のほうが強くなってしまうシステム
レベル上げが好きな自分としては結構苦痛でした。
ストーリークリア後に召喚獣揃えようと思ったらほとんどが既に取得不可能ってどうなんですかね
取り返しのつかない要素が多すぎる気がします。2週目やるようなゲームでもないのに。

FF7、10、１２、１３、零式をプレイしましたが、ストーリーが一番のめり込めなかった。キャラクターに魅力を感じられず、色々なキャラを強制で使わされるシステムも嫌でした。
世界観も疑問が多かった。全世界で大きな街が３？小さな街が４ほどしかないのに軍事は活発で軍事拠点は豊富、傭兵を育成して派遣する組織が存在する。

正直な感想としては別会社が作ったFFなのかと思いました。
昔プレイした思い出に浸りたい方にはいいかもしれませんが、新規でやる方にはオススメできません。
It's the FF8 you know and remember, and if you're unhappy, there's always mods.

column8:
For New Players:
- This game is fun, but the combat system can be off putting. Unless you know what you're doing you'll feel very weak.
- Barring one really awkward plot twist (which honestly doesn't change that much of the overall plot to be honest) the story is solid. Plenty of action scenes, fun characters, and weird FF plot points that could only occur in a 90's game.
- The Junction System of magic is confusing when you start this game, but know that unless it's a rare spell it's easier to refine spells from items than draw them from enemies... and later in the game even rare spells are easy to refine (Most GF's [summons] learn magic refining abilities)
- Keep Draw on you at all times. Not only can you cast spells directly from enemies without using your own stock of magic, but many Bosses have missable summons that can be drawn from enemies.
- Triple Triad is fun to play, don't be afraid of the random rule as you can refine your cards into items to control the pool of cards you have to use. 

For Old Players:
- The new models for enemies and characters are amazing. On my most recent replay I noticed details that I never would have been able to comprehend with the crappy PS1 graphics.
- The only drawback of the updated models is that in some areas of the game there are character models that are actually part of the 2D background that were used instead of 3D models. These are... really jarring since they're a pixelated mess. But in a way it's also a cool look at techniques they used to get around the limited memory of the PS1. I could count the number of times it happens on one hand, and overall it didn't ruin anything in the long run.

column8:
Το πρώτο Final Fantasy που είχα παίξει ποτέ, στο Playstation, με βελτιωμένα γραφικά. Το παιχνίδι ήταν αριστούργημα και με τις βελτιώσεις που έχει το remaster, είναι ακόμα καλύτερο. Δεν μου έχει προκαλέσει κανένα πρόβλημα, όπως λένε πολλοί με crashes και τέτοια, παίζει μια χαρά, τα γραφικά είναι υπέροχα, μιλώντας για βελτιωμένα γραφικά του Playstation πάντα φυσικά, δεν το συγκρίνω με σημερινά παιχνίδια, τα background βελτιώθηκαν όσο μπορούσαν να βελτιωθούν, εφόσον ήταν prerendered, απλά δείχνουν πολύ θολά τώρα. Αυτός είναι ένας λόγος που επίσης κάνουν πολλοί παράπονα. Αν θυμηθούν πόσο πιξελιασμένα ήταν τα background, η βελτίωσή τους εδώ, είναι αρκετά καλή. Ο μόνος τρόπος να γίνουν καλύτερα, θα ήταν απλά να κάτσουν να τα ξανασχεδιάσουν ένα ένα από την αρχή, που αυτό θα τους έπαιρνε πολύ περισσότερο καιρό και δεν υπήρχε και λόγος να το κάνουν για ένα τόσο παλιό παιχνίδι. Το soundtrack ευτυχώς είναι το original του Playstation και όχι της τότε έκδοσης του υπολογιστή, που ήταν μορφής midi και η ποιότητα ήταν χάλια. Η άλλη έκδοση FFVIII που υπάρχει στο Steam έχει την έκδοση midi. Μην το αγοράσετε, προτιμήστε αυτό.
Το μόνο αρνητικό, είναι ότι δεν έχει καθόλου δόνηση στο χειριστήριο, που ήταν ένα πολύ σημαντικό κομμάτι του FFVIII. Γι' αυτό αντί για 10, θα του βάλω 9/10.

column8: Il y a pas mal de bug (hard lock, cinématiques qui ne se lancent pas, obligé de repartir de la sauvegarde), et l'histoire est tellement blindée d'incohérences que je ne parviens pas à me replonger sérieusement dans ce jeu qui m'avait pourtant beaucoup plu à l'époque sur PlayStation. Par ailleurs, si on veut prendre son temps et tout parcourir / découvrir, on est puni (niveau seed qui baisse pour certaines mission si on prend son temps et qu'on joue souvent au jeu de carte), mais si on rush sans réfléchir et qu'on ne fait pas attention, on rate plein de boost cachés et certains combats deviennent quasi impossibles. Bref, à faire vite fait avec une soluce sous la main à la rigueur, mais c'est à des années lumières de FFVII. Autant l'intégration sur Steam est mieux faite, autant le jeu en lui même n'est vraiment pas à la hauteur.

1/10 No puedo recomendar este juego por una sencilla razón:
El menú de combate esta roto, literalmente. Y estoy seguro que es por la implementación de la velocidad X3, dado que si la activas, el menú funciona perfecto, pero a velocidad "normal" (15fps) sufre tanto lag, que la mitad de los botones pulsados no los reconoce.

Hay mas cosillas, pero pasables, pero esto no. Por que a eso le añadimos que para "potenciar" las invocaciones, de cada 3 pulsaciones reconoce 1. Los combates son una constante batalla intentando que el menú te haga caso.

Simplemente no se en que estaban pensando... bueno si, en sacarnos el dinero.
(pd: solo es el menú de combate).

column8:
A very strange "enhanced" version of this game. The backgrounds have been blurred to oblivion, but on the other hand, the updated character models look pretty good even, if their art style is more Kingdom Hearts-like. The boosters from the 2013 release are a pretty nice feature, as they basically allow everyone to experience the game in their own way. The Junction system is a little weird to get used to (and downright unintuitive compared to Materia in FFVII) so people that just wanna experience the story without effing around with GFs can use the boosters.

 I don't see any reason to complain too much about this version since the original PS1 game is available on the Playstation Network for PS3 and Vita, and the 2013 Steam release is still available for a price much cheaper than this. Barring the visuals and the 15 fps battle menus, the game seems more or less the same as the original. (minus analog controls and rumble, but those aren't major deal-breakers) It should be noted that I haven't experienced any technical issues with this game.

You should know what you're getting when you buy this game. There are tons of videos online that detail the differences between this version of FFVIII with previous versions.

Le jeu en lui-même est excellent du début à la fin, un système de combat très bon, une B.O hallucinante, une histoire qui va aller de rebondissements en rebondissements sur fond d'amour (le logo en dit déjà beaucoup).
Bref Final Fantasy 8 est une perle sous-estimé !
Cependant le terme de "Remaster" est très tiré par les cheveux !

Les personnages bénéficient d'un modèle HD, certes très appréciable, mais le reste ne suit pas.
Les décors sont floutés pour caché tout l'aliasing d'époque, les PNJ disposant d'un modèle eux sont en HD, mais ceux faisant parti du décor (qui n'ont pas de modèle 3d mais ayant été "peint" avec le reste du paysage)  ont juste l'air du grosse tâche de pixels floutés.
Donc nous avons avons du HD sur du SD flouté à la résolution du l'époque, ce qui fait un peu tâche, notamment à Deling City.
Mais cependant ce n'est pas choquant partout, les environnements étant très travaillé et ayant franchi un gouffre depuis FF7.

Nous avons donc un grand jeu, remasterisé avec  feignantise comme nous as toujours habitué Square.
Nous n'avons plus qu'à compter dans quelques temps sur les moddeurs qui feront un travail remarquable et donneront le juste titre de Remaster.

I'm not going to write a super detailed review here. Other people have done that. If you liked the original you will like the remaster. The updated visuals on the characters and enemies are a welcome change. There is a caveat to this. The backgrounds are NOT updated. The contrast between the updated characters and not updated backgrounds at 1080p makes things look awful. To combat this I lowered the game resolution and cranked up the Anti-aliasing. I'm not saying this will fix it for you, but it's easier on my eyes.
  
 If you don't care about achievements you can turn on additional boost cheats (pile of money, 100 of every magic, unlock all GF abilities etc) but imo that takes the fun of the progression out of the game.

The other quality of life changes (eg: speed boost) are great for people like me that are busy and want to ease some of the more grindy parts of the game.

All in all I would recommend this version, even if it isn't perfect.

For someone like me whose favourite and most replayed game ever is FF8, this is a no brainer. The game changer is the speed multiplier. I absolutely adore it. It removes most of the tedious stretches of play and lets you focus on what you wish do be doing (travel with the garden for example or simply grinding those endless draw streaks to reach 100 blinds...). 

I ended up playing most of my game on 3X and would find it difficult playing through again without it (such a time saver for an experiences player).

Sure, there are some negatives. The backgrounds...ok. If you've already played the original, then you know the backgrounds were what made this game beautiful. Now it's the opposite. They sometimes look extremely awkward (Deling city NPCs... scary!). The only real ridiculous and super frustrating thing I find is the 8 direction setup (like an original PSX D pad). How hard would it have been to get 360 movement when it already exists in the other steam version of the game!?!?!

 ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS.

 But it's only a minor frustration and when compared to the rest of the quality of life improvements. It's ridiculous, but you'll probably get over it. Playing at 3X makes things worse so when you find yourself having to navigate around tight areas, go back to normal speed. That's my trick. 

In any case, this certainly beats the FF7 remake (I might get some hate here but yes, removing the turn based system for a teenage arcade action game completely loses the essence of old FF games. If I wanted to bash on my computer I'd go and play something else like assansins creed. Squaresoft, plz spare FF8 whenever you decide to remake this). Cheers

A decent remaster but certainly not the best by any means. When you think remaster you probably think updated visuals, higher video setting for things like 4k and improved quality of life improvements for any given game. Sadly while you do get some of these things in this remaster IT IS NOT all that one might hope for in terms of remastering such an old game. For those that are new here's the basic plot. You play as a Seed candidate called Squall who gets involved in a mission that ends in him building up a team, falling in love and defeating a powerful magic user. The story itself is decent and holds up well considering the original was released back on the PS1 in the late 90's. 

As for the "remastering" itself it really is a mixed bag at time. If you use a keyboard and mouse then the updated visuals might be enough to convince you to buy it again. If you like to use a controller then this is the version to get as the commands on screen corispond to a generic PC gamepad. Which is something the original does not have. In terms of the updated visuals the text has more of a smoother look to it and the models themselves look more detailed then their originals. However it appears they did some upscalling on the backgrounds so at times it almost looks like they're gliding through the world in that it is almost seperate from the character models themselves. This can be a little jaring at times and also make it feel like there is a disconnect between the characters and the world in which they live. Now for the big thing which is resolution. This may be a deal breaker for some while others may not mind. At 1080pi the game does not take up the whole screen which means it leaves some black edges with no way to adjust or correct this. Which also means that running this game in true 4k may be iffy at best. Also the game only runs at low fps like say 15-20max in battles and around 30max in menus and mostly in the open world as well. Surprisingly it still comes off as smooth and it's not really that noticable unless you are watching your fps counter through your chosen software. 

If you haven't play this game before then which version to get is up to you. The price difference is about 5-7 dollars between the original and the remaster. Still for what you pay your looking at easily a 50hr game so either way you'll get your money's worth.

- Background textures aren't remastered so they're very low-res compared to the character models
- Cinematics aren't re-rendered, so they're also blurry and run at a low framerate
- Battle runs at 15FPS, making it hard to hit timed events accurately
- Game crashes frequently

Do yourself a favor and buy the non-remastered version, and then install the Lunatic Pandora modpack for improved graphics.

Awful remaster for one of my favorite childhood games, one that had many improvements to make. They literally could have put in one more day of editing the game to fix many simple issues, but instead lazily put out this joke that a single modder could have done in a day.

Framerate seems to be about 20fps, and only certain character models have been updated with new textures.
The non moving npcs are still sprites, the backgrounds look even worse, and it's still 4:3 aspect ratio. 

Only grab if you don't have 8 at all and it's on sale for 50% or higher.

Awful remaster for one of my favorite childhood games, one that had many improvements to make. They literally could have put in one more day of editing the game to fix many simple issues, but instead lazily put out this joke that a single modder could have done in a day.

Framerate seems to be about 20fps, and only certain character models have been updated with new textures.
The non moving npcs are still sprites, the backgrounds look even worse, and it's still 4:3 aspect ratio. 

Only grab if you don't have 8 at all and it's on sale for 50% or higher.

Solaire Bro's attempt to review every game in his Steam Library continues -

Link to Curator Reviews: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37485611/
Link to Curator Page to Join: https://steamcommunity.com/groups/constantdiversion

Check out my youtube review page: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx6ZcQm_YvJ7Anv_lru3h6w

This has always stood the test of time as my favorite Final Fantasy. I don't say that lightly, as I find the era of IV-X to be one of the most impressive runs of consecutive brilliance in video game history. But I didn’t arrive to that conclusion immediately. My first impressions were, at first, decidedly mixed. Coming off the incredible Final Fantasy VI, and then the impressive (although worse) Final Fantasy VII, I initially found Final Fantasy VIII lacking. After the incredible introduction, the game moves on to slow-paced slog which was too much for the 14-year-old that picked up this game so many years ago. Eventually, however, the game clicked. Or I did. I began to appreciate those early moments more because it allowed the characterization of many of the major players to marinate. And the environments too! It’s actually an extremely effective introduction to the world. Being with the characters and experiencing the mundane school life of the cadets helps draw effective contrast for when all things go awry. A place so peaceful is blown to hell later. It works.

Quiet time is a great exercise that more games should invest in. Particularly ones that care about their story.

Final Fantasy VIII tells an impressive tale. The story of Squall, his compatriots, his love, and his rival, are familiar. But sometimes that’s okay. There’s a reason why these tropes still exist. Especially if the characters are as well-rounded as they are here; this was accomplished by providing the player with a cast of heroes that is less archetypal than most JRPGs. Particularly the ones we’re inundated with today. The main character, Squall, is troubled. He's not bright-eyed and eager. His friends also provide similar contrast just when you think you have them pegged. They have reasons motivated by their pasts. And the characters, each of them, arc like you would expect in a story telling its tale properly. It makes sense Rinoa and Squall fall in love. It doesn’t just happen because the story necessitates it. The fiction hits the right beats and moves to the right rhythms so that everything makes sense – mostly (more on that later). You always know why everyone is doing what they’re doing. Which seems like it should be intuitive, but modern RPG storytelling would beg the differ. It’s nice to have a sense of how a character might react to something before they’re introduced to it – particularly when so much is narrated in the main protagonist’s head. As such, you’re going to know Squall very well after your 50 or so hours together.

As a character-driven experience, it's tough to find a better entry in the series (perhaps VI?). And in that sense, it’s very important to emphasize that this is a character-driven narrative. Not plot-driven. As the plot has some issues. Specifically, one major issue that slightly muddles itself with an odd Deus Ex Machina plot-leap around the 25-30 hour mark. Basically, the narrative makes an extremely convenient connection in order to tidy up things before heading into the second half of the story. The good thing is that this part leads right into one of the most wonderfully action-packed moments in the game, and thus, in Final Fantasy history – the garden battle. This part is truly worth the price of admission on its own.

As far as mechanics, it’s the same type of ATB/Turn-Based combat you’ve come to expect from Final Fantasy’s during this era. The only major difference is that they added the junction-leveling system. A system that is, admittedly, probably overly complicated for newbies. It can take some time to master and turn new players off. And while the tutorials are good at showing you how to work the system, they come at the beginning of the game and negatively affect the story’s pacing. If you can power through that first 5-7 hours though, you are going to be mostly OK. But it’s something that is very difficult to master until it *clicks*. And, unfortunately, you’re going to need to have some general idea of how it works or you’re not going to have a very effective party. I suggest using different junctions and moving different spells/summons around as practice. Any competent gamer should eventually figure it out. It’s not rocket science – but there is a learning curve. And it may have factored into why I originally put the game down. Or it could be Stockholm Syndrome, because I do actually like the junctioning quite a bit these days. Oh, how things change!

If you played it and quit a when you were young, it may be a good time to give it another look. The game being sandwiched between two more beloved entries (VII and IX) probably didn't help its place in history. For my money, it was my favorite. A flawed, of course, but ultimately masterful entry in one of the most celebrated franchises of all-time.

...and that ending, my god...

10/10

NOTE ON REMASTER: There are strengths and weaknesses here that both value this version under/over the original edition. That makes a review of this remaster almost wholly subjective, as most opinions will likely be influenced based on how long you've been playing Final Fantasy VIII, and which parts of it you value the most. For me, personally (and as an example), I do not like Squall's model in the remaster. For no other reason than that he simply doesn't look like Squall. It's one thing for it to bother me on a purely nostalgia basis, and it does, but the biggest issue here is that he simply doesn't match the FMV/CGI model. It irks me. A lot. Personally.

Other than that, you'll find your own strengths and weakness to nitpick depending on your own experience level with this in contrast to the original. Do I think more could have been done with this? Absolutely. Am I happy this exists despite my issues? Of course. 

The remaster debate is simply too subjective to review it based solely on that. So my review stands as called originally - The game is a masterpiece. And I'll be happy people play it, regardless of the iteration.

Cependant le jeu fonctionne bien, les musiques sont celles de la version PSX (donc en clair une des meilleures OST de la saga FF, de la PS1 ou des jeux vidéos en général), les modèles 3D des personnages ont été améliorés de leur côté. 

Bilan positif.

Preso in saldo solo per una questione di nostalgia. Sapevo cosa stavo acquistando, quindi non posso dire che il gioco mi abbia deluso. Bella storia, ho apprezzato il miglioramento della grafica dei personaggi e il trucco della velocità 3x, ma non vale comunque la pena acquistare il gioco. 
Come tanti altri giocatori, mi sarebbe piaciuto avere un miglioramento della grafica dei fondali; sarebbe stato bello poter avere accesso ad una modalità più difficile del gioco (magari senza il med del mago e la magia zero) piuttosto che a dei trucchi che rendono ancora più facile un gioco già troppo semplice. 
Personalmente, mi sarebbe piaciuto avere la possibilità di arruolare Seifer alla fine del suo ciclo narrativo, più per sfizio che per reale utilità. 
Tutti bei sogni, tanto a square-Enix non frega nulla dell'opinione dei giocatori.
 Confido che un giorno qualcuno più in gamba di me riesca a creare una mod che dia un pò di pepe al gioco.

column8:
Früher, zu Zeiten der Playstation 1 habe ich das Spiel schon gespielt!
Es ist ein MUSS in der Final Fantasy Reihe!

Final Fantasy VIII ha una storia bellissima, per quanto inizialmente fanciullesca. In questa versione hanno ricostruito i modelli dei personaggi, così da renderli più di un ammasso informe di pixel, lasciando per il resto il gioco completamente identico alla versione uscita ai tempi su PS 1.
Gioco caldamente consigliato, classico J-RPG con un sistema di potenziamento dei personaggi molto meno classico, tutto da imparare e scoprire.

PRO:
- Tuffo nel passato con una grafica un po' più moderna
- Storia eccezionale
- Sistema di potenziamento dei personaggi orginale, per quanto poco intuitivo
- OST fantatsica

CONS:
- Personaggi estremamente stereotipati

Voto finale: 9/10

I'm a big Final Fantasy fan so I must say It's hard to me to not recomend any Final Fantasy game to anyone, but it usually goes like this:

Not everybody likes FF but, if you liked one FF, then you will probably like them all. And the one that will be your favorite FF game it will be the first one you've played :)

Now about reviewing this game, I loved the story and most of the characters even tho it had some really cringy moments, but what I didn't really enjoyed was the combat and the experience and juction system,
you can get really overpowered early game with the  cards and onehit every monster, even bosses.
The magic was inexsistent, the only thing i used was cure and revive.
You have to draw a lot, and that was really boring.
I also didn't liked the limit in this game, it was way too random, and the only nice limit was Squall's one.

I also loved the mood in the game, the school drama life it's a thing that I've always liked.

column8:
*Huom! Jos tekee paljon sivujuttuja, kannattaa olla varovainen ylilevelöinnin kanssa. Vihut ja bossit levelöivät itseään pelaajan hahmojen keskilevelin mukaan. Loppubossi voi olla aika mielenkiintoinen. Eli tyhmästi, jos käyttää esim. Squallin limit brake -strategiaa, levelöinnistä on vain haittaa. Onnistuin ensimmäisellä kerralla kuolemaan loppubossin viimeiselle muodolle, sen jälkeen kun bossi oli 0HP. En muista plekkarilta tätä ;D.

Skippinappula ja uudistetut hahmomallit ala FFX. Käytännössä sama PC-versio, jota pelasin joku 15 vuotta sitten. Tämä tarkoittaa, että taisteluvalikot on lukittuna taisteluiden ruudunpäivitykseen, joka on tasan 15. Alkuperäisellä pleikkarilla taisteluvalikot ja overdivet oli vähintää 30fps. Käytännössä esimerkiksi Squallin limitbreak on laginen ja mikä pleikkarilla olisi ollut "perfect"-suoritus, jää usein tässä versiossa 4,5- hitiksi. Huomaa valikoissa, GF-boostaamisesta ja joistakin animaatioista. Peli tuntuu muutenkin hitaammalta kuin pleikkarilla.

Paras ominaisuus on nopeutusnappi, jolla saa skipattua kaiken kouludraaman ja loputtoman dialogitulvan. Quistisin loputtoman tutoriaaliripulin saa vihdoin ohitettua. Muuten sama vanha FF8, jossa on hauska statsitussysteemi, klönkkö taistelusysteemi.  

Juoni hävittää kaiken logiikan kolmanteen levyyn mennessä tai rahat takaisin; Aikakompressio, lentävät koulukaupungit, rakettimoottoripyörät. Juonesta perillä pysyminen vaatii tarkkaa keskittymistä. Mikä noita riivaa mitä toista noitaa. Ja sitten on kolmas noita. Ja neljäs noita kuussa. Ja kuu alkaa itkemään hirviöitä. Ja mantereen kokoinen futuristinen utopia, jonka presidentti on herra suonenveto-Laguna, ja jonka neuvonantaja on kirjaimmellisesti itävaltalainen sirkusklovni. Ja rakkaus voittaa kaiken.....Ai niin! Summoneista tulee aivovauriota ja dementiaa. Ja loppubossi juttelee joku 30 miuuttia vielä senkin jälkeen, kun kaikki hp on loppunut. 

Squall on ehkä helpoin päähahmo samaistua, mitä Final Fantasyssä on koskaan ollut. Ainoana täysijärkisenä ihmisenä koko maailmassa, häntä vastaan asettuvat jatkuvaa tyhmyyttä ulostavat idiootit, joita juoni hänen eteensä työntää. Lopulta järki voittaa tyhmyyden, mutta häviää rakkaudelle. Tosi säälittävä rakkaustarina, joka lapsellisuudellaan hämärtää koko pään. On täysin ällistyttävää, miten päähahmo voisi rakastua Seiferin jämä-mällisukkaan. Naiseen joka ei kelpuuttanut Squallia, ennen kuin alkoholilapsi Seifer pahoinpiteli hänet sairaalakuntoon.

Kiva korttipeli, jossa tosin joutuu "metsästämään" hyviä sääntöjä. Miljoona eri muuttujaa sisältävät paskasäännöt leviävät kuin tippuri kaupungista toiseen. Helvetin ärsyttävää pelata peliä, missä säännöt vaihtuu 5-minuutin välein. Kovimpia kortteja tahkoesse menee eläkeikään asti. Pleikkarilla ehtii varmaan muistikortti menemään pilalle jatkuvaan latailuun.

Vieläkin upeat grafiikat, mutta samat sumeat taustat kuin alkuperäisessä. Pleikkarilla sumeat taustat sulautuivat suttuisiin hahmomalleihin, joten kokonaisuus oli aika hyvä vanhalla kuvaputkella. PC:llä vanhat erittäin suttuiset taustat yhdistettynä upouusiin hahmomalleihin näyttää kakalta. Hahmomallit itsessään ovatälyttömän hienoja vanhalle kasin pelaajalle, mutta fiilis on kuin kävelisi vanhan jpeg-tiedoston päällä. Johtuu varmaankin siitä, että Square ei ole säilyttänyt mitään vanhojen pelien tiedostoja, ja näin ollen ne pitäisi tehdä täysin uudestaan. Ja Square Enixhän ei sellaisi summia klassikkopeleihin laita.

Kaikkiaan ihan hyvä versio, jos ei pääse alkuperäisellä raudalla pelaamaan. Vanhaan PC-versioon verrattuna minimaalisen verran uutta, eikä ole ostamisen arvoinen kuin todella syvästä alesta.

マップ画面切り替わり時、すぐにエラーで落ちる。
ひどいとゲームがちっとも進行できない頻度で落ちる。

Acabo de completarlo y que decir... Me encanta FFVIII, en su dia me compre el pack con PSX tan pronto estuvo a la venta y ni se la de horas que llegue a hecharle a este juego en la psx! E de decir que siempre me a parecido una obra maestra y a dia de hoy para mi no a perdido ni un poco esa esencia que  me transmitió en su dia cada momento del juego, aunque tiene sus pros y sus contras como cualquier otro juego, se nota mucho el mimo con el que los creadores crearon esta historia, los personajes, los detalles, etc..

En mi opinión, este remaster aunque de lejos luce bastante bien, no hay que fijarse mucho para darse cuenta de las pocas ganas que tiene esta gente de currarse las cosas un poquito y hacer algo bien hecho... Personajes principales perfectos con fondos a menos definición y personajes secundarios MUY pixelados?? No se, a mi me duelen los ojos en ciertas situaciones del juego... En definitiva, El juego un 10/10, el REMASTER un 6/10 como mucho porque es cierto que solo con la actualización de los personajes el juego gana un buen lavado de cara y algunas otras mejoras están bien, pero eso mismo hace que me pregunte, ya que estaban, por que no hicieron un trabajo un poco mas a la altura? no se, como minímo mejorar todos los aspectos del original... no solo algunos si y otros igual o peor... a mi entender de eso se trata un remaster.

E de decir que Recomiendo 100% el juego sin haber probado el port de steam, así que no puedo opinar sobre el uno o el otro, aunque si te planteas la compra sea cual sea de los dos, acertaras porque el juego vale mucho la pena tras 20 años en el mercado!!

This is my favorite Final Fantasy. It's the first one I've ever played back in 1999. I am a big and dedicated fan. I've completed this game over 10 times throughout my life. And recently I've felt the urge to complete it again. And to my pleasure this Remaster came out just recently which made me very happy.

Some time passed and people writing about small things like blurry backgrounds and lack of mods to fix that and overall "it is not a remake" complaint. And if you are like me, and looking at this version and reading about its cons, then stop reading - it is the best version. 

I am a grown man with real life commitments, family, work. Remember what we love about this game? The story, the dialogues, the characters and humor. Like old friends that are always there. A lot of us love the great and original gameplay mechanics of this game. And maybe like me you are looking at doing "that" playthough. Completing every quest, doing every thing, killing every boss, and maybe, for some crazy reason, maxing out the stats. And this version is the best time to do so. Yes, the backgrounds are a little blurry, but they are also a lot easier on the eyes. And yes, the character models are absolutely gorgeous, both monsters and characters. But, honestly, after first 10 hours I've felt like, despite them being a lot more detailed and remastered, this is still exactly how I remember them from my childhood. There are also a few feautures that nobody mentions enough which were a lot more deal breaking for me, especially if I was aware in advance. 

The X3 speed up is very conveniently at a push of a double stick. You Enc-None is no longer requires an ability slot (Behaves exactly the same way) and is triggered at a push of a button. And there is also a FullATB/AlwaysLimitBreak mode that I've personally never felt the use for. Those things do not disable achievements even. There is also plenty of completely game braking unnecessary cheats that do disable them, however. The amount of sped up card games, loading times, GF summons (that before I would rather not use, now are actually useful, finally Eden can do those 60.000 damage without me falling asleep), random encounters. Despite it being just X3 it feels like X10. The reason it only introduced now is actually a mystery to me. Chrono Cross had that back in year 2000 after you beat it the first time. I have managed to complete every quest, get every single card before disc 4, level up 4 characters to level 100 and all of GF including Eden to lvl 100. I've got the rarest items I've never seen in the game in all 10-11 playthroughs before like Dark Matter, that takes a lot of time to farm, but not when the game is sped up. I even spent a couple hours maxing out HP for my main team. Half of the things I've done this time, last time I've played this game took me well over 100 hours. And this time, this whole playthrough, took me just 50 hours because X3 speed doesn't speed up in game clock. I've literally ran out of things to complete in this game. For a grown up, nostalgia stricken, man like me - this is exactly what I needed. 

If you have doubts about which version of FFVIII to play - it's this one.

C'est personnellement mon FF préféré, devant le 7 donc évidemment, parlons plutot du portage que du jeu

Je vois beaucoup d'évaluations parlant de bug : je peux comprendre, ca m'a gaché d'autres jeux
En revanche pour ma part aucun soucis techniques, jamais. C'est une bonne adaptation, chere payée pour la refonte graphique mais avec l'avantage du no combat, X3 vitesses et quasi invulnérabilité

A prendre si comme moi vous connaissez le jeu par coeur (j'ai du l'acheter 3 - 4 fois depuis la sortie originale et le finir une dizaine de fois) mais n'avez pas envie de vous retaper autant d'heures de jeu une nouvelle fois
de los mejores ff, el x3 de velocidad ayuda bastante a que las animaciones y el avanzar en general no se haga pesado si no es la primera vez que lo juegas
La version definitiva de un gran rpg clásico.

This is going to be a rather critical positive review. If truth be told, I'd rather give this game (or [i]this version of the game[/i]) a "Meh..." than a "Yay!". So let's go over everything right and/or wrong with [i]Final Fantasy VIII Remastered[/i].

[b]Sad feelings: [/b]
[b]* Pixel hunting.[/b] Navigating can be a nuisance in this game. Way to many times did I need to consult a walkthrough to see which way to go further. Pathways are sometimes blocked from vision or are minutely small, and some interactive parts of the environment do not stand out from the environment at all.
[b]* Crash to desktop.[/b] This happened at least a dozen times during my playthrough.

[b]Mixed feelings:[/b] 
[b]* Story, plot, and dialogue.[/b] Even though you shouldn't expect a FF game to give you a profound literary experience, FF VIII still compares rather poorly to the rest of the family. The dialogue is at times cringy and the characters are all one-dimensional. Though none of them are particularly dislikeable, they are rather bland and don't show much character development. Once a character has been introduced he or she acts and behaves in predictable ways throughout the rest of the game. There are definately some interesting plot twists and a few heart-warming scenes, but on the whole it left me rather cold.
[b]* Sloppy remaster.[/b] The newly polished 3D models look great, but they stand in stark contrast with the fuzzy 2D backgrounds straight outta 1999. The FMV sequences have also been left unaltered and they really show their age. This by itself could be forgiven, but the pixelated mess that is the world map is simply inexcusable.
[b]* Junction system.[/b] I'm really on the fence about this one. On the one hand it's great to have a lot of freedom tweaking your characters and it adds another layer of depth to the combat. Much like FFV, the difference between an easy or an impossible boss fight is sometimes just a matter of proper skill management. On the other hand, the Junction system is complicated at first and tedious afterwards: constantly having to draw magic and having to rearrange your junctions can become quite boring.
Moreover, there's something to be said for unique character traits as a method of story-telling, by which I mean that someone's background or personality is reflected in the game-play. It's cool that Zell is introduced as the young, brass, martial arts fanatic, but unless you grant him some STR+ traits, his physical attacks are just as useless as those of the skinny, adolescent Rinoa.

[b]Happy feelings:[/b] 
[b]* Music.[/b] If it says "Nobue Uematsu" on the cover, you know you're going to experience some amazing compositions.
[b]* Side quests.[/b] Like most FF games, there are plenty of hidden locations, optional boss fights, secret items, and side-stories to explore.
[b]* Cheat codes.[/b] Without them, I probably would have given up on this game.
[b]* Triple Traid card game.[/b] It's fun, it's addicting, and it adds some nice diversity to the otherwise stale JRPG concept of "explore one dungeon after the other until you meet the final boss."
[b]* Overall experience.[/b] Despite all the mentioned flaws, I kept coming back to this game. Even though it frustrated me at times, I wanted to bring this tale to its conclusion. Flawed or not, there's still something magical about this game.

Final verdict for Final Fantasy VIII Remastered: [b]6/10[/b]

Я всегда была большим фанатом 8ки поэтому купила и ремастер, заодно перепрошла в который раз.
Далее перечислю плюсы и минусы напишу стоит ли покупать ее тому кто имеет или не имеет оригинал.
Из плюсов в ремастере:
-Пожалуй самый главный -  это улучшенные модели всех главных и в большинстве случаев второстепенных персонажей(но увы - не всегда). Ну и всех монстров и стражей.
- Более четкий шрифт в диалогах и меню.
- Читы и моды для улучшений в виде режима без монстров когда ты гуляешь по карте и локациям( для меня это было весомо, мне всегда было интересно играть в серию ФФ ради сюжета, а не ради прокачки, битв и стратегий, да и ежесекундные появления монстров здорово отнимают время когда передвигаешься по локациям и карте, меня это ужасно раздражало поэтому для меня это очень весомый плюс), так же для увеличения кол-ва гил, режим "вечного лимита" для аттак и читы для увеличения кол-ва предметов в инвентаре, максимального уровня и умений для стражей и т.д.
Эти плюсы дают более приятное впечатление от графики и несколько модернизируют старый геймплей. Ну и разрешают проходить игру без особых напрягов чтоб узнать ее историю.

Из минусов:
- Фоновые сцены стали размытее, я не знаю этот эффект размытия фона стал смотреться куда хуже. лучше бы пиксельным оставили.
- Модели можно найти на замену через моды. но они якобы не будут "оригинальными от авторов", но если это вас не тревожит то можно пользоваться модами и в оригинальной версии( я правда не знаю можно ли и модами и русификатором одновременно).
- Некоторые модели второстепенных персонажей превратились в совсем "замыленный интерьер"(особенно в Деллинге).
- Пожалуй от ремастера многие ждали большего, но кроме замены моделей и интерфейса с текстом и читов мы не получили ничего другого(насколько я знаю трейнеры были до ремастера), но для игроков на ПС4 наверное это весомо чем для игроков на ПК. Лично я ждала улучшения CG роликов, возможно даже их ремоделинг и была надежда на озвчуку хотя бы CG, но это увы. Многим не понравились модели Скволла и других персонажей. Да, я тоже поначалу не особо радовалась "новой" прическе Скволла, которая похожа на ту что из Диссидии НТ, но со временем привыкла. все же лицо у него действительно стало милым и он правда теперь "лучший парень на этом балу". Но к сожалению, теперь он очень сильно отличается от версии в CG-вставке...

Вердикт: если вы имеете старую версию на стиме, и вам в общем-то не нужны эти читы, вы пользуетесь заменой персонажей из интернета на старой версии или она вам не особо то и нужны эти моды на них. я думаю что можно не брать. Сумасшедшему фанату 8ки как я(либо любителю читов и тому кому нравится эта улучшенная графика и для него это весомые аргументы),(либо тому кто не имеет старой версии, а только сейчас собирается поиграть в 8ку) думаю стоит взять. Так же из  раздела "руководств" я смогла поставить старый русификатор на эту версию и все работало отлично.

ゲームクリアと、一通りのやり込み要素までプレイしました。
オリジナル版を楽しんだ身としては、十分なクオリティだと思います。
最近買ったばかりで、他の方が仰るようなバグは見当たりませんでしたので、
既にバグ修正が行われた・・・かも？

【良い点】　オリジナル版との比較
・３倍速モード・・・快適に、戦闘やシナリオを進められます。
・AUTOSAVE有り・・・活用すれば手動セーブの手間を減らせるので、やり込み時に有難い。
・セーブデータ最大６０個・・・イベントごとにセーブしても十分余る。
・原作のストーリーの完成度が高く、
　原作、リマスター共に目立ったバグが無く、
　非情に綿密に組まれたシステムにより、
　やり込めばやり込むほど、新たな発見や達成感に出会い
　忘れられない作品になっています。
　※原作の評価については、私が説明するよりは、WEB検索すれば色々わかると思います。

【悪い点】
・オリジナル版をプレイした私としては、特にないですが、
　フルリメイクを期待したりすると物足りないかも
　※ただし、オリジナル版自体がかなりやり込めるゲームなので全く気にならない
　　フルプライスのソフトに比べれば、時代の差で見劣りするが、
　　同価格帯のソフトよりは楽しめると思う。少なくとも濃密なゲームだと思う。
　　人によって好き嫌いが出るのは、元々そういうゲームだから仕方ない
・３Dムービー時は３倍速できない。（大した時間ロスでもないが）
・音楽は原作を忠実に再現できていると思います。
・ポケステ廃止により、いくつかのレアアイテムが
　アンジェロサーチが使えるようになるまで（かなり終盤）手に入らない。



REMASTERED版をプレイする前は、
また最初からプレイするのは面倒かと思っていましたが、
３倍速モードによってストレスなくプレイすることが出来ましました。
戦闘中にソフトリセットできない仕様は、やり込む上では望ましくありませんが、
３倍速モードがあるので許容できます。


ちなみに、１００時間以上プレイしていますが、
うち５０時間は、アイテム稼ぎのために放置しています。
実際のプレイ時間は、クリア平均３０時間弱、
やり込み含め５０時間強というところでしょうか。

[h1]Respuesta corta: [/h1]
Excelente juego, entre mis FF's favoritos.

[h1]Respuesta Extendida: [/h1]
[b]Historia:[/b] Espectacular, me cautivo de principio a fin ... con unos momentos de suspenso muy inesperados, y personajes muy carismaticos.

[b]Diseño y Gráficos:[/b] Espectacular diseño y Gráficos (Para su epoca, aunque no envejecio muy bien)

[b]Gameplay:[/b] Excelente, muy pulido y con movesets muy interesante, creo que en este aspecto FF nunca defrauda.

[b]Música:[/b] Espectacular, recuerdo cuando era un niño y escuche "Eyes on Me" cuando era un niño y creia que era un anime ... imaginen mi sorpresa 10 años despues cuando descubri que era un juego.

[b]Palabras finales:[/b] Espectacular juego, objetivamente no me parece el mejor FF pero a nivel personal es uno de mis favoritos. Eso si, su diseño 3D aunque es muy bueno, no envejecio muy bien.

semplicemente perfetto, sempre stato amante della saga, già giocato per la playstation 1 veramente epico dalla soundtrack ai personaggi le ambientazioni e la grafica ovviamente dell'epoca ma sempre bella e attuale, e la cosa più importante la difficoltà nel finirlo al 100%, unico straordinario e per la versione in hd remastered nulla da aggiungere uguale ma più bello per la grafica ovviamente e il sound con nuovi arrangiamenti ... l'unica cosa che non gradisco molto sono le semplificazione che hanno inserito che non fanno sudare appieno come nella versione originale ma quì come al X/X-2 hd ormai lo fanno per tutte le remastered a quanto pare....
情怀。

La historia es absurda, no tiene ningún sentido nada de lo que ocurre a lo largo del juego.
El sistema de batalla es casi más absurdo, las magias son objetos que extraes por el mapa y a los enemigos sin tener ninguna relación con el lore del juego.
Sobran la mitad de personajes ya que no realmente solo 3 tienen una historia detrás,
No tiene casi nada que hacer de forma secundaria.
Es ridículamente fácil: a las 2 horas de empezar el juego puedes tener Cura++ y 2500 de VIT en un personaje.

Un gioco che ha fatto la storia!
In tanti si aspettavano un Remastered più "ricco", quando invece gli unici elementi restaurati sono i personaggi e questo può essere senza dubbio un punto a sfavore. Tuttavia un gioco del genere deve essere vissuto per quello che è, considerando che è stato presentato nel '99. Trama incredibile, storia appassionante e coinvolgente, dinamiche di combattimento tra le più belle per quanto riguarda i jrpg di quel periodo. Ovviamente per i gamers di un tempo è un pilastro che non può non essere rigiocato e per i gamers moderni è un videogioco da avere per forza nel proprio cv dei giochi storici.
E' un Remastered che ha stupito? No.
E' un gioco da provare? Assolutamente si. Non solo da provare, ma da vivere al 100%, perchè FF8 resterà per sempre uno dei videogiochi più belli della storia.

[h1]この評価はリマスターの評価を含めてこのゲームの全てのことを評価する文です。[/h1]

ファイナルファンタジー８はいいゲームになると思いますが、でもそこまでいいゲームがならないのが凄く残念だ。
ストーリーは今でも何度も使うことができる学園物系のラブストーリー。これはどんどん没入感かできるから長所だと思う。
グラフィックも1999年のものだったら凄くいいとおもう。
しかし、それ以外の大切なことに嫌な部分を感じた。ゲーム性。何が何かを分からないほどの難しいジャンクションシステム。
これがこのゲームの一番問題点。前作を脱皮する労力はわかるけど、それだけに不親切なゲームは逆に毒になるとおもう。だからそこで一番残念だと感じる。
そこまでがff8の簡単評価です。

次はこのリマスターの問題です。とにかく、一応リマスターになってるけど、昔のゲームと別に変ることがない。
ただ、大事なキャラだけのグラフィックを鮮やかなにするしかない。
解像度もFHDに対応すると言うけど、比率は昔の4:3にプレイするから全然変ることがよく感じられない。
だから、このリマスター版はあんまりおすすめしない。

column8: This game is so loveably broken and unbalanced. The story is wild, cheesy and nonsensical (memory loss, time-compression, love and friendship?). The characters and their designs are so 90s (Squall's inner monologuing and too cool for school attitude, until puberty kicks in with Rinoa). The music kicks so much ass, just what a teenager wants to rock and chill too(the boss fight theme is still one of the best). There's some awesome set pieces as well, some of my favorite in the series(the battle of the Gardens was TOO COOL!) Triple Triad is one of the best minigames in a video-game, and very rewarding, if a bit tedious. This is a love it or hate it game, and I can't blame you for feeling one way or the other. The junction and magic system is inherently grindy and unintuitive, but once you start taking advantage of it, the game becomes a joke. I wish the game had more of a challenge to reward people that took full advantage of the system. Limit breaks are available just by having your character at low health, or at full health with Aura. No other attacks are relevant once you've figured that out. Leveling up is NOT recommended, as enemies level with you. Getting big in FF8 is all about junctioning spells to your stats. To enjoy FF8 is to enjoy being overpowered.

column8:
Let me start by saying that FFVIII is a fantastic game, and by far my favorite of the many FF I've played. If you are looking for an engaging story, interesting mechanics, and a phenomenally built world, than FFVIII is a great game to find it in.

There are some nice changes they've added in the remaster: being given so much control over key bindings, sound, and graphics is fairly rare in a game from PSX, and the ability increase the game speed by three times with the push of a button is VERY nice.

Unfortunately that's where the nice bits die. While some of the graphics and models were touched up...not everything was and the ones that aren't get all the more glaringly obvious. The sky box in battles? Still has that awful line in it. The world map looks....bad. But the most game breaking problem is...the FPS.

You see, the PSX processor ran things at a record breaking 15 FPS...and this port doesn't change that. And yes, a lot of die hard's will say "but it's just a remaster not a remake" or something to that effect. But the problem here is very simply that PCs don't run at 15 FPS and it becomes achingly obvious in a lot situations. For me it's the battles that are the worst and expect to see some places where the graphics stutter a bit and your input doesn't quite match the video response. Given the wide variety in PCs your mileage may vary.

A lot of these problems can be expected when porting games to PC. Console's all have unchanging hardware and software configurations, which make them easy to develop for...and porting to PC which is so diverse can be a real challenge. All the same, I can't help but feel that Square Enix didn't put a lot of effort into this one.

Hopefully FFVIII will get the true remaster it deserves after the latest FFVII wank fest remake is done. I'm not asking for an UltraHD experience at 120 FPS. Don't get me wrong: I'm happy to see FFVIII on the PC, and this remaster isn't HORRIBLE. It's not good either.

Bottom line: The game is currently selling for $20 US. I don't think it's worth that, especially if you're trying to relive an old favorite. Grab when it's going for $10 or less and try to ignore the janky bits.

Pues nada. Lo pillé en la semana de oferta de Square Enix y lo tuve que devolver. Imposible hacerlo funcionar correctamente. Un montón de errores al darle a iniciar. Al final leyendo un foro conseguí bajarme un archivo para solucionar el problema con el launcher de inicio, (aunque indicaban que no tocáramos el menú opciones dentro del juego porque craseaba de nuevo), y sorpresa, se quedaba en inglés y no podía cambiar el idioma a español. 

Mira que me gusta es FFVIII, pero esta edición es un desastre de proporciones épicas. Ni la pantalla panóramica tiene. Tengo el clásico y me quedaré con él hasta que saquen un remake que merezca la pena, y mira que lo siento. 

Lo dicho. No recomiendo su compra, al menos en pc si no quieres calentarte la cabeza con errores de todo tipo.

I know that a lot of people are complaining about the half a**ed job that Square did on this remaster, and they're probably right for the most part. Only the main character sprites were touched up after all, and from what I've seen so far, not much else. The reason that I'm recommending this game over the original FF VIII here on steam is for two simple reasons. The first reason, and the most important one for me, is  that this "remaster" has better controller support. The original Steam release had controller support that was even more half a**ed than this remaster. The buttons only showed up as "Button 1" "Button 2" and so on. There were puzzles in this game where you had to enter button commands in a specific order in a very limited amount of time. How are you supposed to do that when they aren't even marked right? At least in this remaster version, my XBox controls are properly marked. I'll never understand the level of lazy that it takes to port a console game to the PC and not at least make it controller friendly. 

The second reason I'm recommending this over the original is, if you're like me and you've beaten this game over and over ever since it came out on the PS1, you are at the point that you are either playing it again for nostalgia's sake, or you liked the story. For me it's both, and the last thing I feel like doing for the hundredth time is hunting down items to upgrade weapons or drawing magic from crappy draw points that give you five spells at a time and take forever to refill. I admit that the cheats are pretty nice to use if you've beaten the game and just want to play the story without all the hassle. I know there's a lot of people going "Oh my god! You suck if you cheat!" I don't care. I just want to see the story again without pulling my hair out waiting for draw points or random rare item drops. 

If you're on the fence about getting this one or the original, and like me, you want good controller support and the ability, if you CHOOSE, to use cheats to see a great story and reminisce, then I definitely recommend this one. If however, you're afraid of the peer pressure and the stigma surrounding cheats and you absolutely hate controllers, then I'd say get the other one. I'll let you pull your own hair out.

column8:
I want to start this review by saying that FFVIII is a great game if you're into classic JRPGs. Mechanically, its customization system lets you build your party members how you want. Furthermore, the narrative it tells is refreshing given its age in how the quest really shows development of the characters and questions some of the edgy stereotypes often associated with the main characters of this genre, and this is still true 20 years on. The updates for the game also add nice refreshing details for a contemporary audience, and are more of  a VFX update than a 'remaster' - but certainly worth 5 pounds.

However, I CANNOT recommend this game because of the extreme technical issues with the game that seemingly no one takes responsibility for. When I read the mixed reviews for this game, I was skeptical, especially since most of them had to do with players' consideration of what a remaster is and this not doing enough for them. Then I started playing this game. Occasionally I had a crash, or a bug, and thought it was fine; but they became more persistent and at most cutscenes, both breaking immersion and being logistically annoying places (of course, save points are a big deal in this franchise). Even so, I had the game, so I decided to stick with it - whats a bit of annoyance for a real nice game play experience? I'm still relatively enjoying the game so I'll just grin and bear it.

After I had invested over 60 hours in gameplay time (not that my save file is only 35 hours because, lol, replaying sections over and over cause of game crashes), finally I arrived at where I am now - at a point where there is a cutscene that is impossible to progress through. I have tried reinstalling, I have tried technical tricks and support; NOTHING WORKS. And so I can't actually finish the game. This to me means that  I was basically sold an incomplete work because of technical bugs or errors with the port. To make matters worse, because this error arrived so late in the game time, neither Steam or SquareEnix are willing to offer any sort of refund or compensation for selling me an incomplete game. I'm not gonna rattle on about my very limited games budget, but to say the least its unacceptable a company might release a game that is technically rife with issues to the point that some players CANT COMPLETE THE GAME.

tl;dr The game is great! but Don't risk buying this port: its buggy, crashes, and if you're unlucky like me, you'll find out the game is unplayable half way through your run and, therefore, not be eligible for a refund because it happened after more than 2 hours of game play. DONT SPEND YOUR MONEY ON A GAME THAT IS INCOMEPLETE. SAVE YOURSELF THE MONEY AND TROUBLE; DONT BUY IT.

column8:
I'm very grateful to Square-Enix for finally remastering Final Fantasy VIII, this is one of my favourite Final Fantasy games so I'm really happy to see a reasonably good version for sale at a reasonable price.
However, while this is an OK remaster... it is by no means the best that could have been done, Square-Enix is a massive company with thousands of employees and it's kind of sad that this is all they came up with.
16:9, AI upscaled backgrounds, analogue movement, higher resolution textures, lossless FMV sequences... these are all things that you won't be seeing in this "Remaster".

I do recommend this game as I think it's a very good game, especially for a 1998 Console game. But if you're looking for the ultimate Final Fantasy VIII experience... you're better off modding the 2012 version.

column8:
This game has a special place in my life. It kept my mind busy when dealing with major illness in my teens. 

I've been wanting to replay it but don't have time. I was super exited it was getting a remaster with cheats that would allow me to play through the game faster and with improved graphics.

Pros
-the graphics are more clear in some ways-- you can actually see facial features 
-a variety of cheats that allow you to customize your game experience 
-the ability to speed up overall game play (srsly, how many end of battle sequences must a person sit through) 
-good audio 

Cons
-no vibrate feature which serves as an essential cue for game play
-some backgrounds seem blurry 

I was worried by some of the game reviews but was glad I bought it-- the pros outweighed the cons for me and I had a blast replaying this game. If you've never played this games or want to revisit it I recommend this remaster.

column8:
Bueno, vamos a separar las cosas primero, voy a dar la opinión del juego y del intento de remasterización por separado.

Final Fantasy VIII es, fue y probablemente será mi juego favorito de toda la vida, que las horas de juego no  engañen, con esta edición ya van 9 veces que lo completo, de las cuales 7 fueron al 100%, lo compre en cuanta edición salió.

Mi amor por este juego es principalmente por  sus personajes y por su historia, realmente en jugabilidad si bien “innova” con el sistema de GFs y las magias, es el mismo método de siempre, aunque no por eso es algo malo, de hecho se siente bien al jugarlo, aunque el sistema de estadísticas con magia esta un poco roto, ya que podes tener literalmente el personaje re mil buff sin subir ni un solo lvl y sin salir de la zona “introductoria”.

Volviendo al tema pj e historia, el motivo por lo cual lo considero el mejor de la saga es el como el juego logra hacerte identificar con los protagonistas (y algunos secundarios/villanos, excepto Norg, ese personaje ni pincha ni corta) y cómo vas metiéndote más y más en el viaje que estos llevan a cabo. El desarrollo que tiene Squall, si bien es un tanto genérico, es bastante grande, pasa de ser un Sasuke promedio a una persona que logra abrirse a los demás y luchar por una causa propia, y el ship con Rinoa si bien es un poco cringe en ciertas partes porque se nota demasiado desde el principio que VAN a estar juntos, es muy bonito, y tiene momentos que tocan el corazón (Eyes on Me en la cabina del Ragnarok es simplemente hermoso).
Rinoa como personaje me hace sentir que le faltó algo, no se, sinceramente la amo y es una de mis waifus, es hermosa, pero le falta independencia, todo lo que dura el juego no hay casi ni un dialogo donde no meta a Squall o este dependiendo de este, aun asi es entendible, tiene 17 años, pero bueno, quitando eso siento lo mismo que con Squall, que logra buscar una meta más… realista? Bueno, yo me entiendo, no den bola a eso jsjs.
Se que debería hablar de Selphie, Quistis y Zell pero sinceramente quitando ciertos momentos de Zell y Selphie y la confesión de Quistis se me hicieron muy personaje relleno, que decirles.
Irvine es simplemente el verdadero demonio, es un cago de risa y si bien no tiene un “crecimiento”, sus momentos son geniales, en especial el final del Disco 1.

Sobre su historia, es en cierto modo algo “común”, ponele, pero atrapa, y al final tiene tanto plot twist y vueltas que decis “Faaa que loco” y te encanta, tiene lo típico de un rpg, empezas laburando como soldado y terminas peleando contra la bruja que domina el espacio y el tiempo. Eso y que tiene al mejor personaje de la saga de Final Fantasy, que btw tiene el mejor tema del juego, Laguna, el ultimo gran padre.
Bueno, punto y aparte, como remaster, es lisa y llanamente una basura, el precio no lo vale ni en chiste, incluso a un 50% no recomendaría comprarlo, auuuuunque, difieron con los que dicen que es mejor el port viejo con mods, no hay forma, este se ve y se juega mil veces mejor, aunque los fondos sean horribles, las mejoras jugables se notan, y los modelos son mucho mas aceptables visualmente, los que se quejan de que viene con trucos y eso es al pedo, tipo ni siquiera necesitas activarlo, y el poder usar la función para acelerar el juego es lo mejor, es como el framelimit del emulador y hace que sea mucho mas fluido, no como antes que una pelea duraba 2 minutos porque 1:30 eran animaciones.

Y nada, eso, se que seguramente no sea el mejor juego para casi todos, pero en mi juega mucho el factor nostalgia la verdad, y que soy un otaku con problemas que flashea edgylord, pero bueno, necesitaba reseñar esto para hacerle bien a mi corazón, aunque lo que menos parece esto es una reseña.

Si tengo que usar puntuación, como juego le doy 10/10, si tengo en cuenta el remaster le doy 8/10.

Como punto final, ESCUCHEN EYES ON ME ES LA MEJOR CANCION QUE SE PUDO CREAR GRACIAS UN SALUDO A LA FAMILIA
