column8:
I'll largely duplicate my original FFVIII review, but note here that the remastered version does really offer some additional graphics features that made it look better than I originally expected it to. I will be watching as I think the people who previously modified the original may have even more this time to work with, which may end up with an even far better appearing version down the road.

----The following is the review left on the original version-----

I played this originally on the PC not the PSX. There were not all the bells and whistles that have been made available since then, and ABSOLUTELY recommend getting the orchestrated album if you've never heard it.

Keeping that in mind it was a huge step from FFVII in graphics. The story felt very fitting, even as SeeD was supposed to be schools of students in late teens. The music was different in that much of it was thematic (versus previous games that often didn't have an overlying theme in their music.) Though it's odd they chose Faye Wong for the theme, it's one that over the years I have found that many people know - even folks that I don't think or would have expected to play this game! On several tracks I come back to a comparison of James Horner - of which probably the ending credits probably are one of my favorite comparisons.

FFVI will always remain the top of the series for me. This one though, definitely #2.

No es el remaster que nos hubiera gustado pero sí es la mejor versión de Final Fantasy VIII a la que puedes jugar hoy. La opción añadida de triplicar la velocidad de las animaciones (la puedes activar y desactivar sobre la marcha en todo momento), es imprescindible para evitar caer en el tedio durante las batallas y algunos desplazamientos largos por el mapeado y algunas ciudades.

Por lo demás los nuevos modelos 3D están muy bien diseñados, aunque los de Squall y Rinoa desentonan bastante con los de las cinemáticas. Basándose en diseños posteriores de ellos, Squall tiene un rostro más aniñado y Rinoa más maduro.

Recomendable si a día de hoy quieres jugar o rejugar este gran clásico, pero abstenerse coleccionistas que ya tengan la versión anterior y no piensen rejugarlo a corto plazo.

column8:
Final Fantasy 8 is the first one I played and beat and I loved it enough to play through and beat it at least 8 more times. 

This is not going to be one of those times. After just about 2 hours, I can't play it anymore. I'm already disgusted. This "remaster" sports only high resolution character models, nothing else. Nothing. Now while the new character models look great, the terribly off-putting part is that they look so out of place in the world. They didn't even bother to update the character models on the NPCs you can't interact with. Personally, I'd rather play the original on Steam, not the remastered version, so things don't look so ridiculously out of place.

I've asked for a refund. I suggest you stay away.

column8:
One of the BEST if not 2nd best Final Fantasy entry in the series (Final Fantasy VI holds the top spot still, FUCK FF7!!) with outstanding music, a wonderfully woven love story between characters, a Junction customization system that puts the Materia system to SHAME & a protagonist that actually shows personal growth...something Cloud never accomplished in Final Fantasy VII to the same degree that Squall shows. My only gripe about the Remaster is Squall's new look...I am not a fan of his bland "Dissidia face and hair style". If Square took more time & made it match the FF8 art then I'd be much happier because that makes him look much more interesting & realistic.

All in all I HIGHLY recommend this for people who either haven't had a chance to enjoy FF8 or want to experience it again with added features like the helpful Speedx3, no random encounters & the infinite HP, instant ATB gauge fill & always active Limit Break systems they added to this Remaster....all of which can be used without sacrificing Achievement earning.

column8:
Going through some of the older FF games made me realize how shit FF15 is. That it isn't really an FF game at all. Replaying FF8 also made me remember why I do not put it among the best of the franchise. It is still in the sub-top of best FF games however. Do I really have to explain how bad the magic, draw and thus the combat system is? I think the fans of the franchise already know that.

So onto the Remastered aspect. It is....not great. It runs well and never had any crashes or other issues. However the resolution, excl. the FMV's, says it is widescreen. When you apply it...it isn;t. It is the standard 4:3 resolution with black borders. Graphic models of cards and characters is improved which is nice. Everything else needs to be fixed with mods. Such as sound, background imagery of everything, enemy models, world map models all need to be modded.

In short. Just get FF8 on steam and mod that and you'll have a better overall experience.

column8: I'm excited for a visual rework of one of my favorite games of all time, but I'm thoroughly disappointed to find out the midi, non-orchestrated versions of music still in this release. I'm sure there's a way to mod the difference like in the older steam FFVIII, but if you're going to update graphics and re-release a game, why the fuck wouldn't you put the orchestrated audio with it? It's been around since the 4-disc version on PSX..... The music is there and available. I can't believe I blew 20 bucks on this old sounding game. fmv's have orchestrated audio with choral arrangements, like the original. But the FMV's haven't been updated, only the in game graphics. The cutscenes which are rendered look grainy on a new high-end PC. I see no value added to this game's re-release aside from more tolerable gameplay models, nothing else. This should be a patch or a mod to the original steam version of VIII, and it should be free.

column8:
Calling this a remaster is being way too generous.

Here's what you get:
-High res character models.
That's it.

Here's what you DON'T get:

-16:9 aspect ratio. Yes, a game released in 2019 doesn't have widescreen support, so you are stuck in 4:3 with black bars no matter which resolution you use.
-High framerates. Game is locked to 30fps in normal and to 15fps in battles
-High res pre-rendered backgrounds and FMV's. They look even blurrier that you remember on modern monitors.
-Chocobo world. Even the original PC version had this. There is just no excuse not to include it.

Honestly, you are better off playing the original PSX game on an emulator. Even that would allow you to have 16:9 ratio. Or just mod the original PC version

column8:
Bem, o que dizer sobre o Final Fantasy VIII Remastered? Antes dele ser anunciado, eu tinha comprado a uma semana atrás, do final fantasy viii normal, planejava rezerar, pois fazia uns 8 anos que não jogava, quando vi o anuncio e trailer, fiquei bastante hypado, reembolsei o final fantasy viii, e fiquei aguardando ansiosamente pelo remastered, quando criança esse game, Chrono Cross e Castlevania symphony of The night foram meus prediletos e arrisco a dizer que o ff viii era o que eu mais gostava deles, ou seja, foi um jogo que marcou minha infância e me fez quebrar muitos joysticks na batalha contra o Ômega weapon, admito que quando vi que apenas foi alterado os personagens principais e inimigos do game, e que o resto continuou igual o original, backgrounds e até menus, fiquei um pouco decepcionado, poderiam ter feito mais, mesmo que levasse mais tempo e que ficasse mais caro, 60 pilas por um remaster apenas no modelo dos personagens e inimigos é meio caro, de fato foi decepcionante, mas minha vontade de jogar era maior que minha decepção, e assim iniciei minha jornada, o jogo era como me lembrava, extremamente incrível, um dos melhores final fantasys que já joguei, se não o melhor de todos, a história bem completa, com romance, drama, tristeza, alegria, e muitas informações discretas que você tem que pensar pra se ligar (como a paternidade do nosso squall), o sistema de batalha é muito bom, muito divertido juncionar as magias aos status, as GFs ficaram bem bonitas e divertidas de invocar, a trilha sonora não há o que dizer, extraordinária, baixei no meu cell a Eyes on me e escuto de vez em quando no banho, muito boa mesmo, a trama é muito boa, único ponto defeituoso dessa história incrível, é a falta de informações sobre o vilão final, até hoje teorias de fãs rodam a Internet sobre a identidade de Ultimecia e como ela chegou ao poder, talvez uma resposta dos produtores já viesse a acalhar, o game possui muitas habilidades bacanas e estratégias bacanas, fica até difícil escolher a melhor pra você, todos os personagens tem suas "ultimates" e é bem balanceado e divertido usar a de todos eles, desde pressionar os gatilhos na hora certa do Renzozuken do Squall, a apertar o R1 loucamente no Shot do Invine, as sidequest dos jogos são bacanas de se fazer, algumas pode ser um pouco chatas por ter que ficar indo e voltando a lugares, e o minigame principal do game, o famoso jogo de cartas Triple Triad é muito viciante e divertido de se jogar, muito bom a busca por coletar todas as cards e a satisfação de conseguir adquirir todas, os chefes são bacanas de se enfrentar, vários deles tem interações únicas com o Renzozuken do Squall e é divertido de assistir, não acho um game difícil pra quem entende o sistema de junction, pra aqueles que não entendem ou não sacaram como funciona pode ser difícil mesmo, então finalizando a minha análise, apesar de não ser um remastered completo, eu recomendo muito o game, não importa se é a versão original ou remastered, se você nunca jogou final fantasy viii, deve jogar pra hoje, game perfeito, um clássico que jamais sairá da memória dos seus jogadores!!

column8:
Alors il y a pas mal de commentaires négatif qu'on va de suite remettre dans le contexte du "beaucoup de gens donnent leur avis sans avoir véritablement joués au jeu"; suffit de regarder les statistiques des Succès steam : 
*76.9% des joueurs ont eu le succès d'obtention de Golgotha et Shiva, ce qui veut dire que quasiment 25% des joueurs n'ont pas joué les 10 minutes necéssaires pour ce succès où bien qu'ils ont acitvés les codes de triches dès les premières minutes de jeu.
*61% des joueurs ont eu le succès Ifrit, ce qui veut dire que 40% des joueurs n'ont même pas fini le tutorial où bien ont activé les codes triches avant l'obtention d'Ifrit.
*43.5% des joueurs ont obtenus le succès steam "premier salaire" ce qui fait que 55% des joueurs n'ont même pas fini la première mission où n'ont pas pu la faire sans tricher.
Et je pourrai continuer longtemps comme ça jusqu'à arriver au succès steam de fin du jeu, 8% des joueurs ont débloqué ce succès steam c'est qui fait que 92% des joueurs n'ont pas fini le jeu où bien n'ont pas pu finir le jeu sans tricher.

Beaucoup d'avis négatifs de joueurs n'ayant même pas passé 1h sur le jeu, du coup je partais avec un point de vu méfiant.

Et me voilà 80h de jeu plus tard et 30 succès débloqués pour vous donner mon avis.

La prise en charge manette est complète, rien a dire la dessus, pas de bugs particulier

La refonte des personnages est vraiment très bien faite, beaucoup de commentaires se plaignaient que ça ne soit pas le cas des personnages secondaires, comme Cid par exemple, mais même les personnages secondaires ont eu le droit a leur refonte; on pourrait cependant regretter le fait que la refonte soit uniquement sur les personnages et pas sur les décors ni sur le scénario comme beaucoup l'ont fait remarquer, mais il s'agit ici d'un remaster, et pas d'un reboot, beaucoup sont certainement trops jeunes pour avoir connu cette epoque de transition entre la ps1 et la ps2, la qualité de ce remaster arrive pour moi au niveau d'un jeu de ps2 au tout début de la console, ce qui n'est pas trop mal.

La possibilité d'augmenter la vitesse du jeu par 3 est également une bonne idée, ça rend le jeu moins long et les phase de farming moins douloureuses.
Le fait de pouvoir couper les combats n'est pas vraiment très utile vu qu'il est possible de ne faire via les compétences d'une de vos G-Force dès le début du jeu pratiquement.
Le limit-break constant est très bien pour les phases de farming, mais penser à le désactiver pendant les combats de boss pour ceux qui veulent un minimum de challenge.
______________________________________________________________________

L'accès aux codes de triches ne sert pas a grand chose a par si vous voulez avoir vos personnages niveau 20 avec 255 de statistiques partout et vos armes ultimes et de ne pas se prendre la tête a voler les magies, pour rush le scénario ça peut être amusant mais le jeu est déjà très facile même sans ça.

Si je devais lui mettre une note sur 20 ça serait un petit 15, car oui j'aurai aimé une refonte des décors également, peut être que ça viendra.
Le gameplay est le même que dans le ffVIII de mes souvenirs, très bien.

Avis très favorable dans l'ensemble, je recommande.
Ne tenez pas compte des avis négatifs de ceux qui n'ont même pas attendu d'atteindre 1h de jeu avant de publier leur avis, certains n'ont même pas attendu 10 minutes c'est limite risible, bref.

Basically : If you already have the original, throw one of the user mod packs on the clean it up a bit and dont waste your money on this nostalgia grab

column8:
A lot of people have been commenting on the shoddy graphics--yeah, they definitely aren't good. The characters look better, but everything else looks terrible. 

I am here to talk about the game itself. I bought this as a nostalgia trip. FFVIII was never my favorite (that would be IX) but I figured it would be worth a try. Frankly this game just feels totally empty. The cities are terrible, there's nothing to do in any of them. The battle system relies so much on GFs (watching all those cut scenes over and over and over!) The dungeons are lazy (the prison was clearly just copy pasted over and over) There's basically nothing interesting or creative about this game. The story makes no sense at all. As far as I can tell the people who love this game love the characters--I think they're all annoying! Every last one of them!

column8: 不错玩~哈哈

This was my first playthrough of this game.  Of the classic FF games (1-10) this has a very different combat system.  It’s been well documented.  It’s all based on summons, which the game calls Guardian Force (GFs).   It’s a unique system, but what it does is practically make your characters useless for most of the game.  Sure there are some extreme side quests and such where a certain character may be of slight advantage, but in the long run for the meat of the game all the combat system turns into is you having your party summon a GF and watch it’s slow animations destroy your enemies.  Standard attack, magic, items, and even limit breaks are all practically useless.  Limit breaks also don’t appear unless you’re low on health unlike in almost every other FF game where they build up over time in a battle. There is no armor or weapons to swap out, though you can upgrade every character’s unique weapons, which again because you’ll rarely be using them, is pointless.  

I was hoping the story would push me through it, but it didn’t.  I’ve made it into “disk 2” effectively, and so far the combat system has only gotten worse and the story has not been very interesting.  This is billed as a good love story, and perhaps if I played longer I may see more of it.  I do see the beginnings of it. The premise of the evil you’re trying to defeat is so out there though.  You’re part of what seems like some private military organization that hires out it’s members for clients.  You’re trying to stop wars and overthrow oppression. The story seems like it could be good.  Dealing with politics, war, society, oppression, revolution, etc.  All was good up until out of nowhere a sorceress steals the show and becomes the main enemy.  Add to that some of the writing deeply showing its age.  Not sure even in its prime if it was good for some characters.  Zell, Quistis, Irvine, and Selphie for example are purely annoying to listen to or be in the presence of, which is a large part of the cast.

If you are already a fan of this game.  Then this is the best version to play.  Proper support of modern operating systems, controllers, and the improved character models and backgrounds are much better than the other steam version. Included hacks and cheats as well if you want to speed things up.

column8:
Final Fantasy VIII per me non è un videogioco come gli altri, è una parte della mia personalità. Se non l'avessi mai giocato per la prima volta in quell'estate del 2000, sarei un uomo diverso. Mi cucii addosso il personaggio di Squall come il primo abito di sartoria. Da anni porto al collo una replica del suo ciondolo, come un memento. L'avatar su Steam ed in generale firme e tracce personali in internet hanno spesso un riferimento a FF VIII. Quando fu annunciato il suo lancio all'E3 di quest'anno mi sentii di nuovo come se avessi 14 anni.
Insomma, sono sfacciatamente di parte. Se non avete mai giocato FF VIII, questa remastered, nonostante mille pecche ed un generale senso di superficialità da chi l'ha sviluppata, è un must play. Non ascoltate le solite maldicenze di chi da ragazzino evidentemente non aveva capito il junction system o si aspettava un FF VII - 2 anziché un capitolo nuovo di pacca: FF VIII è un capolavoro di tecnica (ovviamente se si pensa al suo anno di rilascio. il 1999), di gameplay e con una trama validissima, sebbene capisco come quest'ultima vada sempre a gusti personali, con personaggi quasi tutti verosimili e non solo stereotipati. Inoltre ha senza dubbio la colonna sonora migliore di tutta la saga ed una delle migliori della storia del videogioco.

Può sembrare strano, ma tolti i vari asset come ad esempio la mappa, FF VIII remastered è stato riscritto da zero. Capisco che oggi spendere tanti soldi e tanto tempo, con Square-Enix ormai totalmente concentrata su FF VII Remake, sarebbe impensabile, ma il desiderio personale di vederlo rimesso meglio a nuovo c'era tutto. Gli unici effettivi vantaggi che offre rispetto all'esperienza originale sono il frameskip (ideale per quando c'è da grindare, soprattutto con le magie da minare) e l'autosave ogni qual volta si ritorna nella world map, anche dopo ogni singola battaglia, obbligata o random che sia. Il no encounters è solo un modo per risparmiarsi l'abilità di Diablos; mentre l'invincibilità non serve a nulla se si è bravi a buildare i junction come me. I modelli dei personaggi principali e delle summon (la censura a Siren è stata patetica) sono nella sufficienza per gli standard attuali, mentre sfondi e modelli della mappa o di personaggi secondari sono rimasti quelli di due decadi fa, e sono un dito nell'occhio. Le carte invece sono state rifatte molto bene, perché anche se il mondo è a un passo dal disastro è sempre tempo per una partita! ;)
Ma ciò che conta davvero è cosa si prova dopo due decenni a rigiocarci: nonostante sia sempre lo stesso gran FF VIII che fu, siamo noi ad essere più maturi (per non dire vecchi) e quindi più attenti ai dettagli ed ai messaggi che il gioco ha sempre avuto, ma che non avevamo colto all'epoca. Ci hanno aspettato nel giardino dei nostri ricordi d'infanzia, fino a quando ci hanno visti arrivare, tenendo fede alla promessa data.
Lionheart!

Still, if you don't have the Steam version, the game is worth picking up, particularly if you are a fan of the series.

This was not what I'd hoped or waited all these years for. It is a fairly lazy remaster, consisting of only an update to character models and fonts, while leaving spells, backgrounds and other graphical elements the same. Shame they didn't at least update the 8-bit paletted textures tech to the modern version.

That said, FF8 remains a solid and engaging game, and if you've never played it, you definitely should. If you've got the extra quiche to spend, you may go for this version; but you're not losing much by going with the original.

I'm just disappointed, it could've been so much more.

Probabilmente i nuovi giocatori troveranno il gioco per gli sfondi un pò retrò, comunque il videogioco è al passo coi tempi per quanto riguarda vari oggetti di gioco.
Storia piacevole e ricca di colpi di scena, se ne si comprende la profonda trama intrinseca di insegnamenti sulla lealtà, l'amore, l'amicizia, la fratellanza e l'ugualianza di ogni individuo. Infatti il videogioco ci porta a compiere determinate azioni che cambieranno il destino dei personaggi.
Cosa non mi è piaciuto? Nulla, lo trovo un titolo apprezzabile.
Consiglio Final Fantasy VIII a chi vorrebbe immergersi in un'avventura Jgdr, Japan gdr. Vorrei farvi notare che il titolo ha una giocabilità in battaglia con le barre di tempo, detta ATB. Il gioco non è semplicissimo vi consiglio inoltre di assimilare 100 magie di ogni tipo, ovviamente in prossimità di equipaggiare quelle più pertinenti in futuro. Oltre ciò vi auguro buon divertimento con il titolo. 
Distinti saluti.

Je me rappelle encore sur ma Psone ; la cinématique d'introduction qui tournait faisant office de crédit...
Soyons clairs, je n'ai jamais joué à FFVIII à l'époque, mais je me souviens de cette anecdote cité plus haut, et je me souviens de l'intérêt que j'avais porter à cette cinématique crédit qui tournait dans la Psone.
Ayant énormément touché à la série avec le temps (il faut toujours rattraper le temps perdu..) Je me suis dit qu'il fallait le faire, se lancer dans l'aventure ;
Cet opus m'a marqué, il m'a touché. Pourtant, c'est sans hésitation, que je boude certains des épisodes plus acclamés.
FFVIII ne mérite pas les critiques lancées à son égard à l'époque et même si le remaster peut faire peine à voir, je met un avis positif car ça reste FFVIII.
Cela dit, je ne conseille pas une manière ou une autre pour essayer le jeu, il faut juste faire le jeu, c'est un de ses jeux, innovateur, complet et prenant, auquelle on peine à trouver aujourd'hui : 
Une pièce maîtresse, pierre angulaire du JRPG ; simplement l'un des meilleurs Final Fantasy auquel j'ai pû jouer.
My personal favourite of the Final fantasy stories.

column8:
Game is buggy... the framerate randomly collapses, I'm using the newest drivers and no other game has any issues... It can't keep 60fps in menus (sometimes it just locks to 50), 30fps on field/world map (it keeps going to 15-23) and the battle fps of 15 won't stay there also, battle menus are too slow too!
This is unacceptable, Square should fix this [b]ASAP[/b]! I think not everybody is concerned by this issue, but enough seem to be.
Other than that, the music is finally good out of the box and character models mostly look good, with the exception of Squall (mostly) and Rinoa (kind of).
Critic points (except from the framerate bugs):
- Battle menus aren't as smooth as the PS1 version (30fps or even 60fps menus should be doable, just program it)
- Because of that, input in battle is slow and sluggish, just pay attention while using [i]Boost[/i] for G.F.s
- No analogue movement
- World map textures look horrible

Other than that, it's an okay Remaster, but we got all of that already (minus the newer textures and music fix[no more MIDI]) in the 2013 Steam version already.
To sum it up, this Remaster was unnecesary: Either do it right, fixing al the grapes people had with the original FF8 HD on Steam, or don't bother at all. That's why I give a thumbs down in this review.
If they fixed all the issues I listed above, this game's rating would be 90%+++.

Update: Still no fixes 2,5 weeks after the last patch

FF8 est tout simplement le jeu qui a le plus marqué ma vie de joueur (je l'ai eu et terminé en 1999). Alors 20 ans après c'est sûr que ça ne m'a pas fait le même effet qu'à l'époque car déjà il n'y a plus la baffe graphique et parce que je me souviens bien du jeu entre autres mais je le recommande quand même notamment pour le premier CD (même si il n'y a plus de CD ici forcément) que je trouve globalement excellent au niveau des décors, de l'ambiance, des personnages et du scénario...

Après malheureusement c'est de moins en moins bien à ces niveaux mais ça vaut le coup de le finir même si sur cette version la cinématique de fin a beaucoup saccadé chez moi ! Heureusement que j'ai pu la voir plusieurs fois dans de bonnes conditions à l'époque. Pas de problème avec les autres cinématiques cependant.

Seems to me some people expected a remake in stead of remastered .
Of course this game is worth the money. It`s a wonderful story, a huge gameworld, tons of things to do and discover, if one should wish to do it all. And the gameplay is a lot easier here , than in the old game. 
It might not be perfect - but I am so happy with what they did to this ; Made me start replaying one of my most beloved games ever !
There is no way I would continue playing the modded version in stead of this.

Sirens skirt in stead of her fig-leaf ? Really ? I think It`s lovely, actually, and many with me do - 
But if her skirt , or no skirt, is the reason for negative reviews, then why buy an FF title at all ?  There are lots of other games to fulfill those peoples` dreams .

column8:
Se você é um fã de Final Fantasy VIII, pode ser tentador experimentar a versão remasterizada. Mas antes de gastar seu dinheiro, é importante saber o que esperar.

Infelizmente, eu devo dizer que o remaster não é tudo o que poderia ser. A maioria dos modelos de personagens foram recriados em 3D, mas os cenários ainda estão em baixa resolução e pré-renderizados. Isso significa que as texturas e detalhes não são tão nítidos quanto poderiam ser.

Além disso, não há suporte para widescreen, o que pode ser uma grande desvantagem para muitos jogadores. É decepcionante que, mesmo depois de 20 anos, a Square não tenha se esforçado mais para melhorar esses aspectos.

Minha recomendação é que você só compre o remaster em promoção ou se nunca jogou a versão original. Caso contrário, você pode ficar desapontado com a falta de melhorias significativas.

No geral, Final Fantasy VIII Remastered é um jogo decente, mas com algumas falhas importantes. Se você é um fã hardcore, talvez valha a pena conferir, mas se você está procurando uma experiência mais polida, pode ser melhor esperar por um remaster mais completo no futuro.

column8:
This is really difficult and depending on your way of reviewing / comparing.

If you just compare this release with the normal version and already own the normal version - it is really not a great improvement at all and not really worth the money.
-We get upgraded characters, monsters, menus, text fonts and interace in general.
-World map and battle stages unchanged which looks really bad by now
-Also some npcs are still ugly chunks of 10 pixels
-Chocobo mini game and some Steam achievements removed (both not really essential or part of the main game)
-Except the graphic they didnt improve anything. (Still wishing for premade card decks or a fix for the broken junctions between Squall and Laguna groups)

But if you review the game itself - I still think it is one of the best FF games.
Fast paced story (compared to other FF games), great music and nice render sequences that tie mostly flawless into the normal game.

So in short: Game itself is a recommend without questions from my side. The "remaster" not so much.

column8:
Es fällt mir schwer, wirklich schwer. Aber ich kann diesem Spiel keinen Daumen hoch geben. Und ich tue das nicht, weil ich FFVIII nicht mag, im Gegenteil. Final Fantasy VIII gehört zu meinen absoluten Lieblings-Spielen, die sich über die Jahre einen festen Platz in meinem Spiele-Herzen erobert haben. Ich tue das, weil dieses so genannte 'Remaster' eine Unverschämtheit sondergleichen ist!

Ich versuche das jetzt mal kurz und knapp auf den Punkt zu bringen:
Diese Spiel ist eine 1-zu-1-Kopie des Originals von 1999. Es wurden lediglich Charaktere, G.F., Monster und (einige) NPCs neu modelliert - Und das sieht zugegebenermaßen auch ganz hübsch aus, für 2019 zwar auch nicht zeitgemäß aber dennoch hübsch. Außerdem wurden sämtliche Dialogboxen, Fonts, Menüs sowie die Darstellung von Parametern und Funktionselementen (z.B. im Kampf die HP und ATB) ordentlich aufpoliert. Ansehnlich. Allerdings wars das dann auch schon mit den positiven Aspekten. Wer FFVIII kennt, weiß, alle Maps mit Ausnahme der Weltkarte bestehen nur aus pre-rendered Backdrops mit zig Alpha-Wänden. Das hat damals gut funktioniert (mehr oder weniger) und sah für die erste Playstation-Generation ausgesprochen gut aus. Wenn man dieses Leveldesign allerdings 20 Jahre später 1-zu-1 in ein neues Spiel steckt, ohne auch nur das Geringste daran zu ändern, dann ist das schlicht weg eine Zumutung. Gleiches gilt für die Weltkarte: Kopiert und hochskaliert. Und das sieht mal richtig grottig aus. Auch die Cutscenes sind dieselben wie damals. Erwähnte ich bereits, dass irgendjemand bei den Entwicklern es für eine gute Idee hielt, *einige* der NPCs frisch aufzupolieren und *einige* einfach in ihren alten Pixeljunk-Korsett zu belassen...?!

All das hat mich damals als ich FFVIII das erste mal gespielt habe begeistert - auf der guten alten PS1, auf einem Röhren-Fernseher, in PAL, in 4:3. Wenn man sich aber vorstellt, dass man sich all das auf einen scharfen 2K/4K-Monitor anguckt ohne das irgendwas davon nur ansatzweise überarbeitet wurde, dann schmerzen einem schon die Augen. Nicht zuletzt zerstört dieses wirre Mischen von 'okayen' remasterten Elementen und altbackener, hässlich skalierter Original-Grafik die sonst so hoch gelobte Immersion, die man sich bei einem Final Fantasy erhofft.

An dieser Stelle sei aber noch mal positiv erwähnt, dass das Spiel nach wie vor funktioniert. Ich meine damit nicht technisch, sondern die Welt, die Story, das Gameplay an sich. Und trotz all der Meckereien oben kann man darüber hinweg sehen (sonst hätte ichs wohl kaum erneut durchgespielt und sämtliche Achievements geholt. Ich kann nicht anders, bin Fanboy. :P). Worüber ich nicht hinweg sehen kann, ist, dass dieses - sich Remaster nennendes - Häufchen Elend tatsächlich mit 20€ zur Kasse bittet. Das wäre so, als würde ich die Original CD der PS1 nehmen und sie in eine PS4-Hülle stecken und dafür die Hand aufhalten.

Ich glaube es ist deutlich geworden, was ich davon halte. Auch wenn es hier berechtigterweise viel zu kritisieren gibt, hatte ich noch mal einige Stunden Spaß mit diesem Spiel. Ein Kaufempfehlung gibts aber definitiv nicht! Wer wirklich Lust auf FFVIII hat: Besorgt euch irgendwo 'ne PS1 und 'n alten Röhren-Fernseher und lasst die Nostalgie damit wieder aufleben.

column8: I didn't think I would enjoy the FF8 Remaster but I"m nearly through Disc 3 and it's just been great to explore everything again with improved visuals/clarity. The quality of life improvements help speed things up significantly so you can focus on the story/exploring, and also just playing Triple Triad. Yes there are some areas which have not been updated with the FMVs and backgrounds looking quite dated, but I wouldn't let those stop you from playing and experiencing FF8 either for the first time or to revisit games from 15 years ago. I've bought the game multiple times on PS1, PS3/Vita, PC and Steam (and now the FF8 Remaster) and I have to admit I barely made it to Disc 2 in each version after the original PS1 game but there's enough improvements in the Remaster to actually make you want to play it. Remember this is a remaster of the original rather than a remake like say Let's Go or the new FF7, so don't expect it to be drastically different and with expectations in check, you'll enjoy the game.

column8:
Did FF8 deserve a complete remake? Yes. Is this remaster worth buying and playing despite that? Also yes.

Within the limitations of the original game's frame rate, Square did a pretty good job of making this game look beautiful again. It's super playable, with no glitches (so far). The Steam controller's layout is automatically set to the most intuitive configuration, which gives the game even more of a console feel... exactly what I wanted.

Square added three new "boosts" on hotkey which make it very, very easy to achieve any kind of play through you're looking for. If that's not enough, the ability to apply cheats is baked right into the menu.

I really wish Square had remade this game from the ground up. FF8 is my favorite in the series and it deserved a lot more effort than this... but I'm having a really good time playing the remaster.

column8:
Its a no from me. I am a huge fan of this game, despite its (rather major) faults and was hoping that Square had done a little more than a fresh coat of pixels to the character and monster graphics.

Pros

- 3x Speed Mode means you can get through the game *even quicker*. Despite it already being one of the shortest and easiest Final Fantasy titles.

Cons

- The music and sound effects still have issues.  I'm guessing some sound effects share the same channel as some instruments in the music.

- Chocoworld has now been completely removed with no real effort to replace any of the items or utility surrounding your summon Chocobo.

- Inconsistent frame rate that drops and stutters the game for no reason.

- Menu moves at the same frame-rate as the graphics, making some things like Renzokuken or Slots very sluggish to use.

- No soft-reset, so anything involving a reliance on the RNG will prove to be a pain (Queen of Cards quest, for example).  NOTE: If you *do* need to manipulate the RNG, use a draw point, then save, do what you need to try and if you don't get the desired result, then reload and use another draw point and repeat.

- Odd graphical glitches that weren't present in the original PC or PS1 versions.  Such as objects characters are carrying in cut scenes either being missing or simply moving strangely. Examples are the flute being missing during the concert or nothing really being in anyone's hands anymore.  To ADD to this - clipping.  Its much more visible in the new resolution.

- No analogue control support. Yep. Its still 1999 PC controls there.

- Less Achievements to unlock than the original Steam release.

In short - this is a soulless re-release that nobody was asking for which offers LESS than the original package did.

column8:
Bis Heute mein absolutes Lieblingsspiel. 
Es macht direkt wieder Spaß.
Man sollte wissen es ist KEIN Remake sondern ein Remaster!
Das bedeuted das Grundspiel wurde genommen und einige Charaktermodelle und Charaktertexturen wurden grafisch überarbeitet. Die Hintergründe wurden leider nicht überarbeitet. Es wurde NICHT das komplette Spiel neu gemacht.
Es ist auch besser für aktuelle PCs angepasst als die 2013er Steam version. 
Die Story ist auch Heute noch zu genießen mit vielen Wendungen und Überaschungen.
Story: 10/10
Grafik: 7/10 (Hat immer noch seinen PS1 Charm)
Sound: 9/10 (Besser als die Steam 2013 version)
Umfang: 9/10 (20~40 Stunden)
Umsetzung: 7/10 (Charaktere und Gegner sind liebevoll überarbeitet worden, Hintergründe und Kampfstages sind jedoch pixelig und matschig, endlich anständige Controller Anpassung)
Spielspaß: 10/10 (Aus meiner persönlichen FF Fanboy-sicht)

Fazit: Für Fans der alten PS1 Final Fantasy Teile, die beste Steam umsetzung aller 3 Teile (7,8,9)
Wer sich mit den Pixeligen Hintergründen abfinden kann und kein Augenkrebs bei allem unter 4k 120Hz bekommt, und japanische Rollenspiele liebt auf jeden fall ein schönes Spiel. 
Für Leute die es auch unterwegs Spielen wollen lohnt sich die Switch Version im Handheld-Modus, wodurch die Hintergründe nicht mehr ganz so pixelig wirken.

column8:
This is the last game I'm ever buying from Square-Enix. Once again, they've tried milking the original franchise with sub-par, or just plain rotten, remakes of their old classics, and somehow, yet again, they've managed to make it even worse. 
I thought they'd hit a new low with their original release of this game -- the music, which was one of the game's absolute best features -- had been reduced to midi format, and the company couldn't even be bothered to fix it. So we paid the company for the game and the modding community had to figure out how to fix it for free, which is just insulting. "Hey," I said, "at least they've fixed the combat system with the "boost" option, which isn't really a cheat code so much as an attempt to address the one shortcoming of the battle system.
Now, I'm looking at the lazy "remaster" and have been insulted again -- not only are the redone characters inconsistent, but there are actual entire scenes missing from the game. Squall's nightmare about being left in the rain, waiting for "sis" to come back, is missing, as is the hilarious G-soldier in Dollet. Who knows what else might be missing that I can't recall from my last playthrough. It's sad that Square, which was such a great company under Sakaguchi and Uematsu, has been reduced to making lazy remakes like this. 
So I've had it with Square Enix. They've lost a loyal customer, finally, after years of my holding out for their redemption. Absolutely disappointing. 
I'

Etant un fan absolue de l'original, j'ai craqué et j'ai voulu tester ce fameux "remaster"
Clairement ce qui ne va pas pour l'instant :

- La modélisation non complete des décors et persos (décors flou et perso en hd, super l'effet les mecs)

- Le redesign des cartes, bordel elles sont tellement moche !! Pourquoi avoir aggrandi la taille des cartes et avoir refait le design des cartes  ??? SERIEUX ELLES SONT DEGUEULASSES COMMENT CA PEUT PASSER EN VALIDATION ???? WSH EN 1998 ELLES ETAIENT 100X PLUS BELLE FRERE

- Les succès sont pas ouf, pourquoi pas un succès pour l'obtention de toutes les cartes au lieu du succès "vaincre 1000 ennemis" ? quel succès à la con sérieux..

Voila que trois remarques mais qui sont des remarques très importantes pour un remaster, franchement les mecs se sont pas foulés, CEPENDANT

- L'ajout de la vitesse x3 sauve bien des vies pcq bon ça blablate pas mal dans ff8 et les combats peuvent être chiant
- Le plaisir nostalgique est présent, même si il y a pas grand choses d'améliorer, on sent qu'il y a un petit air frais quoi

Sinon bah ça reste FF8, le systeme de combat est totalement pété, il n'a pas été révisé (pour rappel vous avez juste à lancer Meltdown + aura et déclencher la limit break de Squall ou d'Irvin pour vaincre TOUT les bosses de ce jeu)

Voila donc il couterait 10 ou 15€ je le recommanderai mais là pour 20€ c'est non !

Echoing so many other reviews, I was immediately displeased with the game. I refunded it within the first 10 minutes of the game and have remained bitter about it since then. It's now a month later and I have had time to think about it and really process why I'm upset with this.

To get one thing out of the way: is this the best way to experience FF8 through official channels? Yeah, probably. It's the best looking version out of the box, at least. It is lacking some content that other versions have, notably that the other version right here on Steam has, like the Chocobo World. Is that a big deal? Well... FF8 has no other way to get Ribbon than in Chocobo World, and all of us here should know how valuable that is. Is Ribbon crucial for this exact iteration of FF? Not really. So why does this anger me? There was absolutely no way to know this based on the trailer, and the trailer is something that FF8R defenders have used to say that Square delivered exactly what they promised. That is important as it isn't the only thing we couldn't have known from the trailer. We have been misled despite any claims otherwise.

The blurry backgrounds are another thing. That is wholly inexcusable. I have seen, both here and other places on the internet, people saying that Square couldn't have improved the backgrounds without remaking them all. But... they could. An unpaid fan of the game put FF8's backgrounds through A.I. upscaling and made everything look significantly better. Just look up a YT video titled "Original vs. GUM Comparison" for examples of before and after. If that person could manage it, there is no excuse for a corporation to not have done it except pure laziness. That video did make some notable exclusions in that it didn't show any examples of backgrounds that had tertiary characters as part of the background. A major example of this would be Cid early on in the game when he is standing in front of the directory at Garden, looking all remastered and then suddenly changes to a sad blurry background piece you can't challenge to a game of Triad. More examples would be during the invasion of Garden where students are blocking certain areas but can't be interacted with in any way; they aren't blurry NPCs but, again, part of the background itself. Those at the very least would pose a challenge that Square would have to find a fix for.

Those two points alone make this a product that isn't as complete as other iterations of this game and that also wasn't as polished as it could have been for a remaster. Those two points alone are enough for this release to be unforgivable to me.

The other Steam version out of the box will look worse as far as characters and NPCs go, but better as far as backgrounds go. You can mod that to look even better than anything in this version. It is more complete. It includes the cheats this game has if you're into that. It is cheaper. There is only one downside: that version requires you to be logged into a Square account to play, while this one doesn't. You can weigh your options yourself, but to me not needing to be logged into an account is not worth what we sacrifice for that.

After a couple of small intros, one of the intros is a battle scene between Squall (your character) and Seifer, a fellow student at Balamb Garden. During the battle, Seifer oversteps the mark and injures Squall. After the intro ends, you awake to find yourself in the medical room, where Dr. Kadowaki asks you how you’re feeling. You’ll be able to reply to the quack from a couple of options on offer to you, after which the quack will ring your instructor (Quistis Trepe), telling her to come and collect you. As you lay on a bed with your arm over your face, a mysterious woman looks through the window at you and says something, however as you go to look, Quistis enters the room.  

After speaking with her about you and Seifer, she escorts you back to the classroom, where you take your seat at the back of the room. She then informs everyone that there is a field exam for SeeD candidates later this afternoon. Those who had failed last week’s written exam, along with those not participating in the field exam, are to remain in the study hall. Those taking part in the exam will need to report to the hall at 1600 hours, when Quistis will assign the candidates to their teams. Until then you can do as you please 

Before you can leave, Quistis tells you to stay behind and asks if you have been to the Fire Cavern? As you haven’t, and you must visit the cavern before doing the exam later, you can go back to your seat and using the Study Panel (tutorial) where you will be able to learn about how Battles proceed. You don’t have to go over the tutorial, but it will tell you the keyboard shortcuts or game pad buttons depending on which you want to play with. If you decide to take a butcher’s at the study panel, once you’ve finished the tutorial you’ll be able to leave the classroom.  

As you make your way to the elevator, you’ll bump into Selphie, who is late to class and is new to Balamb Garden. She asks you if you’d give her a quick tour of Balamb Garden. You then have the choice of either showing her around or not; helping to show her around will also help you familiarise yourself with the various places within the Garden by using the Directory in the lobby. After showing Selphie where everything is, she wishes you good luck in the exams.  Later Selphie will join your team.  

Now, though, it’s time to meet Quistis at the front gate, so that she can take you to the Fire Cavern for a test that is required before you’re able to take the SeeD exam. This is another tutorial and she’ll explain how to Junction Guardian Forces (GF), Magic and Abilities. In the Fire Cavern you’ll make your way through the cavern where you’ll encounter random monsters. Upon reaching the end you’ll come across Ifrit (GF), a fire-elemental boss, who you will need to defeat. Once you have defeated him, he will then join you and your other two Guardian Forces, Quezacotl and Shiva.  

After completing the fire cavern you’ll head back to Balamb Garden, where you find out about your SeeD exam and who is in your team. After completing the exam, which is a mission to Dollet, you’ll receive a Rank on how well you’ve done. The rank will also determine how much you’ll be paid each month; the higher your rank, the more you’ll be paid as a SeeD member. You can raise your rank by taking a written SeeD test at any point by opening the menu and choosing the help option; here you’ll find the SeeD test. There are in total thirty SeeD tests to raise your character’s rank and how many pennies they are paid. Once you become a SeeD member your training is over, and your adventure begins. 

Junctioning Guardian Forces to a character will allow them to power up and use abilities and magic. Selecting the Junction screen from your character options will reveal the current character who you’d like to junction a Guardian Force to. You can swap between any characters within your group; when you have the character you want, you will need to select GF. This will then show you all Guardian Forces that you have under your control. They will show up greyed-out if they are already junctioned to another character, and in white if they are available. You can also check the abilities of a Guardian Force and you’ll be able to add new abilities as they gain experience.  

You can set three Attack command abilities from Draw, Magic, GF and Item. Draw allows you to possibly draw magic from an enemy; you will then have the option to either stock or cast the type of magic chosen. What magic you draw depends on the enemy (normally you’ll be able select an enemy and it will show you the types of magic which can be drawn from them). Sometimes, though, the types of magic are hidden behind question marks, and you’ll have to successfully draw the magic to reveal what it is. You won’t be able to draw all the time from an enemy; you will fail at times but each time you do successfully draw magic you will receive a random amount of that magic. So, drawing and stocking of magic is important, and you’ll need to get plenty of stock in.  You can also find Draw Points around the various places you visit. Here you’ll be able to draw a variety of magic depending on the draw point, and you can revisit a draw point once it’s replenished itself. 

Selecting Magic will allow you to use magic like Blizzard, Fire, Thunder, Cure etcetera (if your characters have any magic stock). GF will allow you to summon your GF to attack your enemy. Item will allow you to use items such as health potions, cures etcetera in battle. You can only choose three of these options, so if you decide to choose Draw, Magic and GF, then when in battle you won’t be able to select any items from your inventory. If you choose to not have magic, then you won’t be able to do any magic while in battle. 

You can have up to four non-command abilities depending on the Guardian Force’s abilities. As your Guardian Force gains experience, they’ll unlock new abilities which you can then added to your character. Abilities such as Magic+20% raises the magic damage done by that character. There are quite a few other options you’ll be able to make use of as you unlock more. If you feel lazy you can also set the abilities, magic and GF to auto, which will give you the best setup with what you currently have. 

In battle, your turn will commence once your character’s bar fills up.  You will then be able to select the action you would like to proceed with, defeating an enemy by reducing their health points to zero.  You can’t see what an enemy’s health is, although you can use the magic Scan. If you have any in stock it will reveal information about them such as health points remaining and weaknesses. After defeating an enemy you’ll gain some experience points and maybe some items.

column8:
まず最初に書いておきたいことはFF8はPSではなくこのsteam版が初プレイであることを書いておきます
そのうえでおすすめできない点は

致命的なバグとして
・倍速プレイすると時々フラグが折れて進行不可能になるバグがある
MD層で機械を調べるときに倍速プレイだと複数調べても起動せず、この状態に陥ってしまうと一度ゲームを落とさないと先に進まないです
近くにセーブポイントがあったので再起動して再度機械を調べればストーリーが通常の通り進みました
MD層以外にも多々このバグがあるので常時倍速プレイはあまりオススメできません

・画質が汚い（これは皆さんが書いています）
PCになって画質も何も改善されずPSそのままの移植は流石に今の時代に合わないだろうと思います
リマスターだからいいだろ？って事ですがそれにしても汚さすぎる

・PSなので15～30FPSが限界
どんなにいいPCを持っていてもコレだけしか出ません
60FPS出すには倍速モード以外ありません
しかし、常時倍速モードにするとさっきのフラグが折れるバグが発生するのでセーブはこまめに取っておかないと発狂します

もう3000円払ってゴミ買うより別のとこの安いこのゲームを買ったほうがいいと思います
久々に旧作FFでストレスたまりました

To call this "Remastered" is a joke. The character and enemy models have been upgraded to look like what I'd call roughly PS2.5 looking models. The models still walk around this world which appears washed out and terrible at higher resolution than the original version. It makes for a worse experience than the original game, where at least everything looked like it belonged together. It's a personal preference, but to me if you're going to remaster only part of a game, you're making it into a worse experience because the new models look clunky and out of place on blurry filtered backgrounds. I've asked for a refund as I feel this game was falsely advertised as a full remaster when it isn't

column8:
To me, one of the best final fantasies ever released, a masterwork of underestimated value.

The game has one feature that will confuse you, the junction system, YOU WILL NEED TO PAY ATTENTION to the tutorial, for is not as easy to understand as other, more simple RPGs.

One of the things I recommend with this game, is to explore the mechanics of the game, to speak to everyone, and connect the dots, some of the history main concepts are a bit on your face, but others require a bit of searching or thinking to understand, and are very rewarding.

When talking about the remaster, I believe that for the price is a simple remaster, some things look the same, others are very beautiful, (Quistis now looks gorgeous).

One note for the min/max guys out there, the soft reset is not available in this edition.

column8:
クリア済み + オメガ討伐済みでのレビュー

PS版をプレイしていて、PS版の感触を再度味わいたい人にはオススメ。
以前発売されたPC版をプレイしている人は買う必要ないでしょう。
私はPS版をプレイしていたので「キャラがキレイになったなー」と「ラスボス戦のセリフが違う」くらいでした。

【システム】
- 3倍速、戦闘強化やエンカウントなしなどのオプションがあり再度プレイするには便利になっています。
- 当然バグ系は修正されておりマルチジャンクションはできなくなっています。
- PS版に慣れていたせいでXboxコントローラでの電車のパスワード入力はボタン配置に慣れず手間取りました。
- セーブにはオートセーブのスロットがありワールドマップに出たタイミングでオートセーブされている感じ（オートセーブを利用したことがないのであまりメリットは感じなかった）

【グラフィックス】
- モデルがキレイになったが背景がそのままなのでキャラが浮くのはちょっと気になるけど、プレイしていれば慣れます。
- フレームレートはPS版と同等に戦闘時とムービーは15fps、移動は30fpsになっています。
- 黒枠がありますが、もともとSD解像度の作品なので変に16:9化させてUIのレイアウトが中途半端になるよりいいかなと思っています。
- 文字はキレイ

【サウンド】
- 過去に出たPC版と違いPS版の音源を使っているため違和感なくプレイできます。
- 過去のPC版ではMIDIで環境によって音が違っていたので個人的には良い改修だと思っています。

【その他】
- 上記の通りラスボス戦のセリフが違っていました。ちょっと違和感。あのセリフだとランダムで戦闘メンバーを抽選する流れにならない。


REMASTERという名前で多くを望むと期待外れと思うでしょう。
そもそもPS時代の作品かつ制限されたハードウェアでの工夫が盛り込まれた作品なのでモデルデータ以外画質向上の余地は無いですし。
リメイクではないですし1999年に発売された当時を振り返る目的で購入するのがいいかと思います。

FF8 mit schöneren models, und eingebauten cheats, aber ohne poket-station featur, nicht mehr und nicht weniger.
hingegen der models fehlt mir eine erneuerung der grafik von kampfarenen usw.

wobei man nach aktivieren der unnötigen cheats man keine erfolge mehr bekommen kann, ist der härteste gamebreaker den ich sehe unter boosts versteckt.
dieser bewirkt das man außer mit onehit nicht sterben kann und permanent spezial´s nutzen kannst, was irgendwie schon dumm ist.
das diese auch noch schön auf shortcut´s gelegt sind gibt mir zu denken.
und mir ist bewusst das man es nicht nutzen muss, aber der speedboost ist hingegen schon ganz nett.

Es un buen remaster, la misma escencia del juego original pero en HD, sin contar los escenarios, lo malo es lo de los 30 FPS bloqueados, y el echo de que muchas veces bajan los FPS a pesar de que el PC en cuestión sea capaz de correr juegos mucho más pesados, aún así lo compre por ser mi videojuego favorito pero muchas veces en combates rápidos es incomodo jugar a 10 FPS

column8:
I thought 15 quid for a few upgrades for FF8 does not seem like a bad deal at all. Fair really. What are all these other reviewers moaning about i wonder? Can't be that bad...  I was wrong. this remaster shows little effort. squall is too different. i would have forgiven my personal disagreements about certain design choices for the new models but i found the game unplayable because every background is blurred. more blurry than the original game?. it just seems like a very odd thing for square enix to this way. i believe someone high up at square enix takes issue with ff8. they ignored fans of ff8 asking for a remaster for years. then, i suspect, when the modding community done some cool things Sqeenix were like woah woah woah we arent getting paid for that! so threw together this. promptly requested refund. i will repurchase if they put more work into it. otherwise i think the original release will do fine.. this just adds to my theory that someone in this company hates ff8. someone high up with a lot of pull.

Edit: It is worth adding that this remaster is not so terrible on the Nintendo switch. Provided that you are playing handheld. I tried it on switch lite when it was on the Nintendo store at a discounted price. I think it is due to the fact that the switch goes up to about 720p. Basically a crap pixel count is less obvious on a smaller screen. The image is more compressed so looks tighter and clearer.  

So, if you really want to play FF8, again. I only recommend this game on the switch handheld or switch lite. it is the best way to play FF8 without modding.

So many negative reviews! But!....

This is my most favourite out of all the Final Fantasy games. I've played the Original PC version from 1999, the steam release and now this. I have to say the updated character graphics are amazing compared to the old ones (except Squall's haircut what's that all about), they do look weird on the old pre-rendered backgrounds which have had 0 work done on them, but because i love the game so much i was able to look past this and enjoy a bit of nostalgia with it. 

I've played so far up to the point of getting Ragnarok, and i've not used any of the cheats speed ups or any of that, I've played it as if it was the original and there has been no problems running it. It does get a bit tedious drawing 100 of each magic off each monster but that's part of the fun right? 

Not MUCH has changed, but if nostalgia is what gets you going then get this, the slight improvements make it worth it. 

Only dislikes are Squalls haircut and the Music is worse i think than the original with the Ye-Olde Microsoft Synthesizer. Some tracks sound the same, but some are horrible!.

1.squll回来了没有
我认为是回来了,从结局CG来看,rinoa 抱着squall哭之后的场景,Seifer在钓鱼,laguna则回忆死去的妻子,ellone向laguna微笑招手,从laguna的轻松表情上看与魔女的战斗应该是结束了,当然也许这时的他并不清楚Squall的下落.另外ellone把squall等人传送到过去,但是并不清楚ellone能否感受到squall等人在过去世界里的情况,因此ellone的微笑也不能完全说明squall安全归来。但是随后庆功会上洋溢着喜悦的气氛，irvine,selphie,quistis,zell都没有表现出一丝不开心，假如squall没有回来，这与他们轻松搞笑的氛围是格格不入的。并且CG的最后selphie看到了在窗边的rinoa,她是笑着请irvine给rinoa一个特写的，好像发现了rinoa和squalld在谈情一般，如果squall真的没有回来，我觉得还是让rinoa一个人静静地看星比较说得过去。另外结局CG的最后虽然有很多rinoa的特定，从rinoa的背景里似乎看不到squall,但是仔细看一下就知道那些特写都是近景(甚至没有一个rinoa靠着的半圆形平台的完整特写)，而squall出现的距离在半圆平台的最右端，(后面走向rinoa)因此可以说前面的摄像机也好，后面的特写也好，都没有捕捉到squall所在位置
2.rinoa是不是ultimecia
我认为是的。
首先是争论得最厉害的，那个戒指的名字问题，我就不说明了。要是单单是名字相同也就算了，可是为啥召唤兽的外表也是squall所描述的狮子外形，这是不是有些太巧合了，有些人说这是rinoa做为魔女传给下一代直至ultimecia的，是rinoa根据squall描述创造了这样一只召唤兽，那就暂且相信这种有些勉强的说法.再看下面的一些证据：
魔女的城堡是在rinoa和squall约定的地方，好，这也可能是rinoa作为魔女传给下一代直至ultimecia的。
结局CG squall昏迷前的一连串关于rinoa的回忆。看到这里是不是觉得rinoa的影像特别的诡异，而且在Squall的回忆里始终略隐略现魔女ultimecia,经常穿插在rinoa的身后，既然是squall的回忆，为啥在想起rinoa的时候不穿插其他好友的影像，而单单穿插ultimecia的影像，这是不是又太巧合了。(至于网上有人说rinoa和ultimecia相像，这个我倒不敢说)。另外回忆中有一部分是刺杀Edea的凯旋门之下，但是出现的居然是rinoa跳舞的片断!这是不是也暗示着什么。
打败魔女之后，为什么只有有squall和众人失散了。laguna说过，要相信友情，相信爱，就能找到彼此。squall在打败魔女后听到了“rinoa”的呼唤，下一场景他就回到了edea被ultimecia寄生的场景，从流程上看，ultimecia被打败后就在时间压缩中把魔力传给了edea,squall很可能是听到了ultimecia的呼唤，而不是rinoa的呼唤，才会和ultimecia一起回到这一场景，否则他应该和大家一样，平安回到现实。
再想想squall为什么会昏迷，昏迷前为什么会流泪!以squall的个性，流泪是难以想象的，毕竟他刚刚领悟到“我并不孤独”，他有足够的勇气坚持下去。我有一种猜测，也许看来会荒唐，那就是Squall在回忆中模糊了rinoa的影像，是受了ultimecia的影响，因为他对友人的印象都很清晰，正常情况下对深爱之人rinoa的印象应该更清晰。另外squall的在对rinoa的回忆中不断地出现ultimecia,以及刚受到呼唤和ultimecia一起回到过去，可能使得他意识到ultimecia正是rinoa,而他自己刚刚打败了未来的“rinoa",使得她把魔力传授给Edea后平静地死去，这等于间接杀死了rinoa,也许是这样的矛盾情况使得他承受不住现实而流泪，甚至昏迷过去。
到此，我对FF8结局有了一种全新的理解，好像也有人提出过这样的看法，就是squall和rinoa回到了现实，但是由于squall是凡人，他终将会死去，魔女失去了骑士就会丧失心智，因此rinoa成为了恶魔，她生活在对squall无尽的思念之中，她一心向往回到过去与squall相会，然而随着时间的流逝，她模糊了想要回到过去的原因，直到她被打败后她说了一些对时间很有感悟的话，也许是这个时候他想起了squall,因此他在弥留之际呼唤squall,和他一起回到了附身edea的场景，然后便平静的死去，Squall在后来对rinoa的回忆中察觉到了rinoa即ultimecia,由于意识到自己刚刚间接杀死了未来的rinoa,承受不住打击昏迷了过去，后来被现实中的rinoa找到，回到了现实，squall醒来后意识到要好好把握现实中的rinoa,因此在CG的最后会出现squall深吻rinoa的情景，这在过去的squall身上是不可能发生的(想想太空船回来的时候Squall都不让rinoa靠在他身上久一点)。然后再次开始故事的循环。要是没有ultimecia,squall和rinoa便不会相识相爱，因此可以说，未来的rinoa不能延续与squall的爱，她用尽自己所有的力量回到过去，却在漫长的岁月中忘记了回到过去的原因，然而一切在冥冥中都已注定，她的出现让从前的rinoa和squall相识相爱，在她即将死去之时，她终于想起了squall,并且成功呼唤感应到了squall后平静的死去，但是这一切又注定了squall和现实中的rinoa幸福的开始。因此，这一切可以被看作是注定的，rinoa和squall的爱永不完结，rinoa失去squall后又通过某种注定的安排，成就了另一时空中rinoa和squall的新爱情。

column8:
Having grown up with this game and made numerous memories in it, this was an instant buy for me. Now that I've finished it, and spent some time grinding in endgame, I wanted to share my thoughts to help other people decide on a purchase.

[b]Since many people just want a quick yes or no... I'll put it here: to me, it was absolutely worth it[/b], both as a standalone title, and as an $8 upgrade to the original game. PLEASE NOTE: it's [i]not[/i] an overhaul or a remake. It's a nice touch-up. If you've never played FF8 before or want to know exactly what you're getting, there's more info below if you want more than a "yes" or "no" verdict.

[h1]For vets:[/h1] This remaster is more or less the same game. This remaster only touches on the character/enemy models and menus. The prerendered backgrounds are still blurry but they would have to remake a ridiculous amount of assets to change that so I don't fault them (but I do wish they used one of those AI upscalers, at least). The FMVs still have those quirky early-3D expressions, and there are two or three places where an NPC is prerendered into the background, so you get your beautiful hi-res party leader talking to a 10x10 jpeg.

The small amount of PocketStation/Chocobo World-exclusive items are now found with Angelo Search. You'll need to idle, at minimum, overnight if you intend to get those but at least they're obtainable now (they were not for the original western release).

For only $8 more what they've done here is very nice. It makes a 2019 replay quite enjoyable. I was downright stunned at times because of how crisp and detailed the creatures I met as a child are now. I definitely got my money's worth and it gave me another reason to revisit this great game.

[h1]For newcomers:[/h1] FF8 is very unusual compared to others in this series and other RPGs. It takes place in a contemporary society with fantasy elements, advanced technology, innovative architecture and ancient [spoiler]sorceresses[/spoiler]. The structures rarely resemble anything from our world, but at the same time it's familiar. There's also a romantic thread in the story that doesn't display in full force until the last half of the game, but once it gets moving it'll really pull at your heartstrings. There's a couple moments in there that left an impression on me which I'll never forget.

Despite being an industrialized world, there are still monsters and magic as you might expect. The game is contextualized by a military school base hub, so expect there to be tests, classes, different campuses and facilities, a school dance and so on when you're not busy exploring the world. There are still archaic elements, for instance, hidden quest objectives that require you to mash the A button until you find a certain flower pot the game expects you to interact with without a single hint. That said, the world is still very unique and charming despite some of its flaws.

It's also worth talking a bit about the battle system. The way magic is done here is very unique and is one of my favorite combat systems ever. Magic is finite (no MP to manage), with you extracting a handful of uses at a time either from enemies or "draw points." The really interesting part happens once you have a store of magic; you can inject it into your stats just like you would equipment in other games. The tier, type, and quantity of that spell you own are the primary factors in your combat performance. For example, if you "junction" (equip) 100 Haste spells to your Speed stat, you'll be able to act far more frequently in fights but if you junction 3 Fire spells to your speed, it won't do much of anything.

Summons are acquired in the same way. However, if you're not diligent you can easily forget to extract it during a boss fight, and lose the chance to get it until some of the last bosses in game. Each summon has their own unique abilities and traits, which are equipped to your character as a package; your summon determines which stats you can inject your magic into and which abilities you can equip. By endgame, you gain the ability to "refine" items into stat boosts, items that teach your summon skills, or even battle items to make you invincible. There's enough content here that you can grind to your heart's content and become [i]absurdly[/i] powerful if you wish, but it's very much unnecessary. If you want to dump 500-1000 hours into min/maxing, you can do just that, but you can still beat the superboss without grinding much. 

The game can be as difficult or as easy as you make it. Junction properly and bosses will be a breeze. Manage it poorly, or neglect to junction anything at all, and it can get pretty tough. Most enemies and bosses scale their AI patterns, stats, skillsets and extractable magic as you level up, so you don't need to worry about over-leveling or under-leveling.

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1] Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed the story, gameplay and the visual improvements to character and enemy models that this release brought to the table. I understood the romance elements and the main protagonist much more than I did when I first played it in the early 2000s and I ended up enjoying it even more than I did my first time. Big recommend from me.

This is not a review of Final Fantasy 8 as a game, but of the remaster itself.

Let's start with the positive:
- The new models are great, much closer to the artwork. The awful, stair-like legs are gone. You can see lots of details you couldn't before, like Squall's scar.
- There are ways to speed up the game, for those who don't like to take their time.

As for the problems:
- No vibration support for the controller. This is a step back from the PS1 version. It's quite annoying for Squall's attacks and Renzokuken. And by the way, how can you take a step back from a 20 YEARS OLD GAME ???
- The map is as ugly as before. You still need to rotate it with R and L. There should be some support for the right joystick instead...
- The battle map looks worse than it did, especially the mountains, which look as if they were redrawn by a toddler learning to use photoshop.
- Compared with the new models, all the backgrounds feel blurry. Worse, some characters in the background didn't receive new models, so you can have a high resolution character sitting next to a low resolution character. Seriously, how lazy can you get?

To sum up, I love this game despite it's flaws in gameplay and scenario. However, this new version is an half baked effort and feels more like a slap to the face than the 20 years celebration it should have been...

column8:
An absolute masterpiece. Final Fantasy VIII, though not as popular as VII, is still one of the best and most beloved Final Fantasy of the series, and for a long list of good reasons. Its strongest suit remains, however, its amazing story and memorable characters.
It was the first Final Fantasy I played (almost 20 years ago!), so nostalgia plays an important part in my appreciation, but I still believe that this game not only signed an era in videogaming by being a masterpiece in its own time, but it still has much to offer to a modern audience, also thanks to this long-overdue aesthetic remaster.
If you have never played it, this remastered edition offers you the perfect occasion to sink your teeth in a story you will still remember 20 years down the line and to meet characters you will fall in love with.
If you have played it back in the day, do not waste any time either, as it deserves to be played again, even more so now, with characters' improved graphics!

column8:
I preface this review by saying the original FFVIII is a masterwork in graphics, audio, and storytelling and is my favourite game even 15 years after first playing it.

However this "remaster" is insulting. 

As for the remastering; the 3D models now look like Playstation 2 models, instead of Playstation 1 models - and that is as far as the remastering made it. 
There has been no attempt to improve any of the backgrounds or overworld, which in their day were stunning, but on a large-screen LCD monitor have aged noticeably. It has been pointed out that running these backgrounds through a couple of open-source image enhancement programs would have produced acceptable results, and yet SE could not even be bothered to have an intern go ahead and do that. 

There has also been no attempt to add any new or interesting content, and in fact, the original FFVIII PC version has more content than this version, in the form of MiniMog and additional achievements. While there has been minimal attempt to address quality of life factors, these take the form of a few cheats slapped over the game to speed up game speed, turn off random encounters, and turn on limit breaks. 

Perhaps most insulting of all is that SE have made no attempts to rectify these problems, despite the obvious decrying by fans. I absolutely expected that within a few weeks of launch, having seen the negative feedback, SE would pull their finger out and address the glaring issues mentioned above. However, even a month after release there has been not a single update applied or announced. 

This version of FFVIII is a prime example of the lazy cash-grab development mindset which is plaguing the industry and perhaps reveals a new low for Square Enix, which were once a developer and publisher known for genre defining games, but in recent times are all too content to trot out sub-par products under the guise of once great franchises (I'm looking at you FFXV and KH3).

It has been pointed out that running these backgrounds through a couple of open-source image enhancement programs would have produced acceptable results, and yet SE could not even be bothered to have an intern go ahead and do that. 

There has also been no attempt to add any new or interesting content, and in fact, the original FFVIII PC version has more content than this version, in the form of MiniMog and additional achievements. While there has been minimal attempt to address quality of life factors, these take the form of a few cheats slapped over the game to speed up game speed, turn off random encounters, and turn on limit breaks. 

Perhaps most insulting of all is that SE have made no attempts to rectify these problems, despite the obvious decrying by fans. I absolutely expected that within a few weeks of launch, having seen the negative feedback, SE would pull their finger out and address the glaring issues mentioned above. However, even a month after release there has been not a single update applied or announced. 

This version of FFVIII is a prime example of the lazy cash-grab development mindset which is plaguing the industry and perhaps reveals a new low for Square Enix, which were once a developer and publisher known for genre defining games, but in recent times are all too content to trot out sub-par products under the guise of once great franchises (I'm looking at you FFXV and KH3).

This review is regarding this version of the game as a whole, and not just the remastering issues. If the remaster was perfectly done, it wouldn't deserve less than 10/10.

- -The Remaster is very lazy in terms of the work done in the environments and FMVs. Mods have done wonders in the past.
- The censorship is barely noticeable (it's mostly just about Siren) but it is there.
- The fps change in battles is also barely noticeable but it annoyed me/took a while getting used to, the first times I used Renzokuken.

+ The game is still standing among the best in the franchise, 20 years later, heavily influencing titles beyond it. A lot of newer players get a chance to enjoy an awesome classic, a lot of veterans shed a tear, at a reasonable price. 
+The time game booster and reworked character models make it the DEFINITIVE edition of VIII, even if the backgrounds and FMVs were lazy work.
++Furthermore, regarding the laziness, this Steam version is the best to pick if you are interested, since you can overcome this via pc and not consoles.

8/10 ;)

column8:
I've lost count of how many times I've played this game both on PS and PC. 
The games in the 90's to early 2000's were always my favourite as the characters had unique flaws. But grew with good character development and interaction. 
The games themselves took risks for their time with story, script writing, gameplay etc.
Quality was focused on a specific target audience instead of trying to appeal to everyone. Which makes a bland 5/10 product. (Modern games imo)

The Remastered comments:
Pros:
Still the same game. Plays the same, feels the same.

Cons:
- Kinda strange seeing the HQ models and then a cutscene where the characters look structurally different and the cutscene itself somewhat either blurry or pixelated.
- The backgrounds are a blurry mess at times.
- Music bugs for the Landing on Dollet (switched to the low quality PC Midi version after saving and exiting) and the ending credits (where had briefly 2 songs trying to play at the same time)     

Controversy:
Siren and Rinoa censorship...Honestly I think it was just a design choice as Shiva, Edea, Ultimecia, Julia are untouched. Still naked, curvy and plenty of cleavage.

Score 8/10 (Room for improvement with cutscenes and backgrounds. But that's about it).

column8:
I played the original back on PS1. I played the emulated PS1 Version on PC. I played the 2013 PC version. And I played this version.

Graphics:
Worse than the community made mods for the 2013 version... although it was made by a professional studio, and not by complete amateurs. Why would you pay 20€ for a worse version by professionals, than a 0€ version by amateurs..? The biggest joke here, is that playing the remake on 720p or lower makes it look and feel better than on higher ones. Simply because the upscaling on 80% of assets is done so freakishly poorly, that it hurts your eyes. As far as I can tell, the did nothing in terms of shading, except increase the contrast and lower the exposure a bit.

Cheats:
Let me be real here. None of these "Cheats" are new. Anyone who can use cheat engine can come up with that in a matter of about 5 minutes. Heck - if you were to be able to use google, you could even download tables for cheat engine that allow you to change pretty much any aspect of the game you want dynamicaly. And it's free - wow!

Controller Support:
I wont praise Square on implementing this. It's a necessity when porting a game from classic consoles over. If you dont do it right, you done goofed. If you do it right, you passed.... and they didnt do it right on porting it over in 2013. I will not praise you on taking 6 years to fix it. Guess what - the community had a way around it in 2013. And that was an amateur software that allowed you to use your controller regardless of whether a specific game had controller support or not. Or you could use the steam link, and assign keyboard keys to buttons on your controller, and pretend to use a keyboard. Congratulations to Square, a professional studio, for not figuring out how to implement proper controller support, and updating the 2013 with that for 6 years.

Conclusion:
Fuck off Square. This is not a remaster. This is a poorly done mod that was rushed out in the middle of development. Or so it looks to be. I'd refund if I could. DO NOT BUY THIS.

column8:
Amo Final Fantasy y cuando digo que lo amo es que lo A-M-O. Mi excesivo amor, conocimiento y orgullo me permiten decir que puedo ser uno de los top 100 mayores fans que hay en el mundo por lo que fácilmente podría ser cero objetivo, darle like, decir que Final Fantasy siempre es 10/10 e irme, pero por primera vez en mi vida tengo que decir que no y que lo que han hecho con este FF es HORROROSO.

Cualquiera podría decirme que si lo quiero tanto lo jugaré y lo disfrutare sin tener en cuenta los puntos negativos que pudiera tener, pero ¿sabes que? Si coges el FFVIII de 2013 o incluso el de 1999 ESTE-ES-MUCHÍSIMO-PEOR.

¡¿Como es posible que lo único remasterizado hayan sido los personajes?! Y no lo digo porque no hayan remasterizado los fondos, los fondos podrían haberlos dejado exactamente igual que el de 2013 y el de 1999 y yo callado y contento... ¡¡¡PERO ES QUE SON PEORES QUE ESTAS VERSIONES!!!

¡¿COMO LECHES EN 2019 TENEMOS UNOS FONDOS PEORES A LOS ORIGINALES?! ¡¿EN SERIO, COMO ES POSIBLE?! Es que parece que los hayan difuminado a posta para que no se vea tanto el cambio de los retoques, pero el efecto es totalmente el contrario, destaca tanto, PERO TANTO, que te saca completamente de la inmersión y parece que estas jugando con personajes remodelados en un cuadro difuminado.

Por dios, ojala pudiera subir imágenes, pero tengo el FFVIII de 1999 en una TV pequeña, el FFVIII 2013 en un monitor y este remastered en otro, y excepto por los modelados el de 2019 parece el primero de todos de lo feo que se ve, en serio ¿sabéis lo cabreado que estoy? Me dan ganas de ir a SquareEnix y romper todas las oficinas con un bate de metal.

Lo peor es que solo puedo jugarlo en mi monitor, si lo pongo en mi televisor los ojos me explotan porque me llega a hacer daño, vamos, que para no sufrir necesito jugarlo en una pantalla pequeña x´DDDDDD ES DE P*** BROMA ESTO.

En serio... ¡¿COMO LO HAN PODIDO HACER TAN MAL?! Ni siquiera un fan enfermizo como yo puede jugarlo de esta manera, y mucho menos viendo el excelente trabajo de FFIX Remastered.

Its your good old FF8 with some "minor" graphic overhaul. You get better char models,monsters,gf's,some veichles, new fonts. You also get 3 "hotkey" cheats that you can enable through F1 F2 F3 which are Godmode, No encounters, and 3x speed. In the game sub menu you also get further cheats like all items etc... 

I'm not jumping on the bandwagon rant about this not bein a true remaster, but i can say the untouched backgrounds really hurts and are a shame because it could have been a true jewel with some little care and less rush.

I'll recommend it to FF8 fans and to new generations who haven't tried it back in time.

Graficamente no esperaba que sea un ramake del juego ( por algo es remaster), por lo que el hecho de que haya cambiado muy poco y nada lo tenía asumido. 
El problema grave que tiene esta versión son los bugs basicamente. El principal de todos es que luego de alguna batalla importante si vas a abrir el menú la pantalla queda en negro y no sale de ahí por lo que todo lo que hayas hecho antes se pierde.
Tiene la ventaja de que esta versión trae una casilla de autoguardado por lo que para estos casos no viene mal, el problema es que el mismo lo hace  hasta donde he visto solo cuando sales al mundo y creo que luego de dormir en la cama de Squal, pir lo que si no hiciste eso antes o despues de una batalla y antes de abrir el menú chau a todo. 
Al menos yo de esta manera pude sobrevivir con este bug, el momento en el que dije "hasta acá llego" es luego de usar la lámpara para invocar al GF Diablo, el cual luego de terminada me dio pantalla negra por lo que ni posibilidad de ir a un punto de autoguardado.
Fuera de eso el juego trae unos "trucos" invorporados para aumentar la velocidad del juego x3, vida y narra de combate siempre llena y otro más que se puede habilitar o deshabilitar en cualquier momento con el F1, 2 o 3 vosa de que si quieren farmear magias sin pasarse 3 días lo pueden hacer y luego seguir el juego normalmente (a gusto del consumidor)
Arreglando esos bugs diría no está mal. Como dije, es un remaster así que no esperen graficos full HD de última generación porque lo más notorio son los rostros de los personajes que ya no son más un cubo de pixeles

column8:
ACTUALIZACIÓN: Con las correcciones que han ido añadiendo con los años, han eliminado la mayor parte de bugs que tenía este FFVIII Remastered en su salida, y ahora está prácticamente perfecto (aunque persiste el problema de algunos modelados y fondos).
Si tenéis que escoger entre la versión original de Steam y esta, escoged esta. Tiene un mejor soporte para mando y no tiene ese launcher absurdo (y, dicho sea, han eliminado Chocobo World y todos sus objetos han sido reasignados al límite de Angelo "Sabueso", que puede gustar más o menos - en mi caso, más).


VIEJA RESEÑA: No compréis este remaster.

Lo único que tiene a su favor es que algunos elementos han sido rehechos (los seis protagonistas, los monstruos, los jefes finales, y objetos importantes del juego como palancas, vehículos...), pero tiene una enorme cantidad de puntos en contra (numerosos bugs — el audio desaparece en algunos puntos, el juego se bloquea al abrir el menú tras determinadas batallas o cinemáticas, etc... —, un diseño de Triple Triad cuestionable, fondos borrosos, personajes importantes sin ningún tipo de modelado...). 

No tiene nada que merezca la pena, y no imagináis la desidia de que la partida se te corrompa después de una pelea larga contra un jefe final, o después de una escena particularmente duradera.
MUITO BOM

This is essentially just an 'officially modded' version of the 2013 Steam release PC (which itself is just a rerelease of the original 2000 PC port). This means it has every issue the original 2000 version had, except with blurry backgrounds and a few new bugs.

Save yourself the money, and just get the 2013 version, there are plenty of good free mods available. Although, objectively speaking, the new character models in the remaster are great and nicely detailed, so I'm sure over time the modding community will fix this version up too.

column8:
Do I recommend this game? Yes, with a big BUT.

PRO
-Updated active models look nice (player characters, enemies, interactive/mobile objects)
-It runs well
-It's Final Fantasy VIII

CON
-It looks like there was NO work outside of active models
-Backgrounds were not worked on, so it's nice active models on blurry as heck backgrounds, it is a horrible contrast
-Sound was not worked on at all, and didn't even bother to use the superior PSX versions over the ancient MIDI PC versions just to show some kind of attempt.
-It kinda comes off as a supremely lazy cash grab or a "test" to see if FFVIII is worth remaking, without putting the work into it that it deserves.
-It REALLY needs VSYNC.

MY RECOMMENDATION
It's Final Fantasy VIII so on its own it's still good, but get this one on sale maybe, otherwise just get the 2013 version and mod it to look and sound better than this.
