column8:
Warum ich das Spiel jetzt doch Positiv bewerte findet ihr ganz am Ende dieses Review! ;)
Über das was in diesem Spiel geboten wird und besonders was alles fehlt bzw nicht Remastered wurde gibt es schon mehr als genug Kommentare. Es ist wirklich schade das Sie 20€ für ein Spiel verlangen das nicht nur abgesehen von ein paar hübschen neuen Skins für die Charaktere und den Cheats nichts verbessertes bieten kann. Nicht einmal eine Funktion um nervige Erklärungen am Anfang (Tutorials) zu überspringen. Oder besser noch die Wahl ob man sie lesen will. Die Symbole für die Boosts sind zwar ganz nett aber in dem ohnehin schon kleinen Fenster doch störend. Wenn man schon schwarze Balken mit einbaut warum nutzt man es dann nicht um so etwas anzuzeigen?
Ich habe nur ca 20 min gespielt und würde mir gern anschauen ob es im laufe des Spiels doch besser wird. FF8 war mein erster FF Teil und seit dem liebe ich diese Spiele. Ganz besonders dieses. Ich habe vorher die vernichtenden Kritiken gelesen. Aber ich dachte mir als Fan der Reihe und nachdem ich es eh mal wieder Spielen möchte gebe ich ihm eine chance. Auch damit die Entwickler sehen das es eine Fan Gemeinde gibt und sich ein Remake wie bei FF 7 lohnen würde.

ABER
Das Spiel ist leider unspielbar. In den 20 Min ist das Spiel 6 mal abgestürzt. Das Automatische speichern speicherte in der zeit nur einmal. Also musste ich immer und immer wieder das selbe machen und mir wie vorhin erwähnt wieder und wieder die selben Erklärungen reinziehen. Sie nehmen also einen Spiele Klassiker. Nennen es Remastered obwohl der inoffizielle Titel wohl "Final Fantasy 8 teilweise Remastered" Heißen sollte und dann läuft es also nicht. Sprich Untertitel "Größtenteils Fertig". Das ist echt traurig und ehrlich gesagt auch peinlich und enttäuschend das Sie so etwas veröffentlichen. Ich bin echt gespannt ob Sie das hin bekommen. Der zauber den dieses Spiel aber für mich hatte als ich klein war ist damit leider ein wenig zerstört. Sollte das ein Entwickler lesen (sehr unwahrscheinlich) habe ich eine Frage. Warum das Ganze?
Lieber nichts machen anstatt Fans so große Hoffnungen zu machen nur um dann eine unfertige Enttäuschung zu verkaufen.

Update: 
Nachdem ich jetzt ein wenig mehr gespielt habe. (Ich wollte damit eigentlich noch warten bis ich deutlich weite bin.) Da ich aber grad nach 30 sec Spielzeit schon wieder mit der Nachricht das ein Unbekannter Fehler aufgetreten ist aus dem Spiel geschmissen wurde mach ich das lieber gleich.
Ich bin immer schlimmer enttäuscht von dem Spiel. So sehr ich es auch lieben will weil das Original bis heute mein Lieblingsteil ist kann ich es nicht. Es ist leider keine liebe zum Detail zu erkennen. Die deutsche Übersetzung ist oftmals einfach nur falsch. Von Kleinigkeiten wo ein mensch als Es statt er bezeichnet wir bis hin zu schlimmen Fehlern die das Verständnis erschweren. Fehler macht jeder. Aber bei einem 20 Jahre alten Spiel bei dem kaum etwas geändert wurde (Ich hatte so auf eine Vertonung gehofft. Gern auch auf englisch) Kann man ja wohl erwarten das sie das mal jemand Überarbeiten lassen der deutsch spricht. Der Zug der Eulen ist auf beiden seiten gleich. Um das zu erreichen wurde einfach der Skin der einen Seite auf die andere gespiegelt. Resultat: wenn man am ende der Entführung aussteigt sieht man das die Schrift und das Logo spiegelverkehrt sind. Figuren die reden bewegen nicht ihren Mund und haben starre Hände und und und. Sie hatten ein Spiel mit einer riesigen Fangemeinde. Daraus etwas zu machen das man bereut gekauft zu machen ist schwer. Aber Sie haben es leider geschafft. Was sie daraus lernen werden wenn die Verkaufszahlen nicht stimmen? Das es wohl doch nicht so viele Fans gibt. Leider aber nicht das Sie sich einfach mühe hätten geben sollen. Es an der umsetzung liegt nicht an dem Spiel / der Geschichte selbst. Es ist nur grafisch ein wenig besser als die schon erhältliche PC Version. Bietet zum Teil andere Features. Selbst das Alleinstellungsmerkmal cheats funktioniert nicht einmal richtig. Bei meinem test stimmt der ton beim vorspuhlen mal zum Rest mal wieder nicht. Manche dinge lassen sich vorspuhlen andere wieder nicht. Besonders die langatmigen Erklärungen die man nicht will wenn man das Spiel kennt bleiben in normaler Geschwindigkeit. Sprich der Text der sich erst weiter klicken lässt wenn er ganz angezeigt wurde baut sich in der normalen zeit auf. Es wirkt an allen ecken und enden wie ein Spiel das man um noch einmal Geld damit zu machen notdürftig zusammen gestellt hat. Ohne wert auf Qualität zu legen. Ich kann jedem nur raten sich die normale Version zu holen. Die läuft und das Spiel ist einfach wirklich Spielenswert. Sollte diese Version mal nicht ständig abstürzen (was ich leider bezweifle) dann könnte man es auch gut so Spielen. Der unterschied von Charakteren und dem zum Teil Katastrophalen Hintergrund ist zwar störend aber die Charaktere sieht man dennoch gerne in einer etwas besseren Qualität. Das Spiel ist  und bleibt Spielenswert (auch wenn die Fassung min im Moment nicht Spielbar ist). Deswegen kann ich nicht anders als eine Positive Bewertung zu geben.Selbst nach 20 Jahren ist es der Hammer dieses Spiel zu spielen. Sollten die Entwickler sich mal dazu durchringen ein Remake von FF8 zu machen hat es das Potential eines der Besten Spiele überhaupt zu werden (für alle die Spiele mit und wegen ihrer Story lieben).

Inundado de nostalgia, jugaba a este juego todos los dias por horas de chico y me trasportaba a otra realidad donde realmente creia q estaba en ese mundo, me da mucha alegria q hayan hecho la remasterizacion de FF8.
Te dan unos trucos que te puede ayudar mucho con los momentos tediosos del juego, lo hace mas agradable si estas apurado.
La unica critica que tengo es que no implementaron la mejora de los fondos y dejaron los viejos pero apenas mejorados.

Yo lo recomiendo por que me trae mucha nostalgia, lo recomiendo para alguien que nunca lo jugo, por que seguro esta version va a ser la que mejoren los moders de ahora en adelante y asi tendremos la mejor version.

While I am incredibly disappointed with the lack of much to be call remastered, bar the character models, I will reccommend the game.

In the near future mods will improve the backgrounds and we will be in a situation where this is the best version out there of my number 1 favourite game.

For newcomers, I highly recommend getting this game. A truly epic story and amazing characters. I hope one day itll be given the treatment it deserves and will receive a remake.

In my honest opinion FF8 is the best Final Fantasy ever made. (With 7 and then 6 coming close 2nd and third retrospectively).

column8:
Three companies (Square Enix, DOTEMU, Game Access) were involved in this so-called remaster and here are the results:

CONS:
- changed the main character Squall (and Rinoa)
- only several characters and bosses improved
- blurry backgrounds
- just the 4:3 ratio
- untouched scenes made of polygons (battle arenas, world map)
- 30 fps in world / 15 fps in battles
- no full controller support
- Square's focus on legal cheats over everything else

PROS:
+ improved characters look really beautiful (except Squall and Rinoa who were not just improved, but completely changed)
+ PS1 quality soundtrack /in case it works..see EDIT below/

Surprised? Not at all, we talk about Square Enix here, right? Exactly. The most uncomprehensible thing in the whole "remaster" is the change of Squall and Rinoa. You can forget how beautifully they look in FMVs and also can forget dreaming about their look in modern graphics. Square has just drastically and absolutely without any reason changed their look due to which they do not look anymore how you remember them at all. This is the most bizzare situation I have ever experienced in any remaster I have ever played. One thing is change some less important things, which let's say werent visually "described" too much in detail before so their significant change would have not hurt anyone, but the other one is to change the MAIN HERO which many fans fell in love with so much that he does NOT look like previously intended anymore! For Christ' sake, who came up with that "amazing" idea?! Together with Squall also Rinoa was visually butchered to the point she does not look as she looks in FMVs at all.

This is a very, very lazy remaster which should be renamed as Final Fantasy VIII RE-RELEASE. The graphics are terrible. Pre-rendered graphics werent improved by modern AI system which modders can achieve amazing results with, but the developers just used very simple blur effect due to which the whole game looks disguisting. Now imagine such blurry backgrounds with such highly-detailed HD characters. Really beautiful, right? And yes, Final Fantasy VIII cointans many scenes in which so that some memory could be spared they baked characters into backgrounds. The results are just like you guess. Now not only backgrounds are blurry as hell but sometimes even some characters which are baked are blurry in the same way. The studios did not touched polygonal enviroments as the world map or the battle arenas at all and they look exactly like in the 2013 Steam version. FMVs look also quite nice, but also they are just imported from the 2013 Steam release and werent improved anyhow.

The game is still in the 4:3 which would be OK if there werent for Capcom's Resident Evil HD Remaster which also contains pre-rendered graphics. Square should learn from this game, a true remaster. Originally, Resident Evil HD Remaster is a 4:3 game but they managed to implement a 16:9 option and that all without new rendered backgrounds. How come? They just made the backgrounds bigger so that they filled the whole screen and the rest of the backgrounds just used a scrolling effect when player moves. It is really an interesting view how 4:3 graphics could be transformed into 16:9 graphics.

From the technical perspective, even framerate has not been improved. You can still walk through the environment at "amazing" 30 fps and in battles you can experience "glorious" 15-16 fps. Do you remember Final Fantasy VIII as a jerky game with an inconsistent fluenty? Well, you can enjoy this remaster just like you remember. Square did nothing to make it better.

Yeah, I admit that the other characters, not counting Squall and Rinoa, look very good, fantastic and I would say so at least this they managed to do right. We PC players can finally also enjoy the PS1 quality soundtrack as the previously implemented MIDI soundtrack, which was pretty awful, has been replaced after all by the original sound quality. But I cannot help myself but that PS1 soundtrack sounds muddy and not clear at all. I dont know what that causes. But these things are the only things I can label as successful improvements.

That is why my score of this "remaster" is a 3/10.

Very poor effort Square...

EDIT: I have just experienced a weird bug that after I loaded my save in Dollet during the first mission, the PS1 OST was gone and just that good ol' MIDI soundtrack began to play.....just unbelievable....

That is why my score of this "remaster" is a 3/10.

Very poor effort Square...

EDIT: I have just experienced a weird bug that after I loaded my save in Dollet during the first mission, the PS1 OST was gone and just that good ol' MIDI soundtrack began to play.....just unbelievable....

It's Fine.
Incase anybody is worried about the negative reviews, I will just add that this remastered edition of the game is fine. For most people its excatly what you expect it is. The old game with remastered 3D models, Upscaled sharpened UI and stability fixes. 

Alot of negative reviews appear to be from people who were expecting things most of us knew were impossible. The FMV cutscenes are the same, the pre-rendered 2D backgrounds are the same. 
Its true you can get the old version and adds mods. In my opinion it does not look better and only makes for an unstable game. Games in those days were certainly not built for mods, it stretches the game to its limit and causes graphical glitches and can cause crashes. Ive tried playing through FF8 with mods and wouldnt recommend. Instead, now, we have an official version. The best looking version you can get. I honestly think its worth the money if you love FF8. The models do look great.

Alot of complaints ive seen that I have just not experienced. No low frame rates, no bad models. I think alot of people have just forgotten how old this game is and how it used to look.
I mean one review I read was complaning they couldnt use the analog stick for 360 degree movement. FF8 never had that. Anybody with some common sense knows what they can do with the game and they have done it.

９月４日時点でEDまで終わらせました。
ムービーが原作画質を丸々持ってきたのは個人的には嬉しいポイント。
リリース前段階で音源が一番気になってはいたが、気にはならなかった。
やはり倍速機能が一番ありがたく、これだけでも十分ストレスフリーにプレイできる。

背景CGは丸々そのままなので不評が相次いでいるようだが、利用可能オブジェクトやキャラクターはその分浮いて見えるので探す際はかなり判りやすいはず。
当時の思い出込みで「そういやこんな画質だったわｗｗ」と思い出しながらできたのは個人としては嬉しかった。

個人的に惜しい点と言えば、やはりコモーグリとムンバだろう。
当時はお出かけチョコボRPGでの限定だったが、この辺りまるっと削られてるのは余りに惜しすぎるので何とかして欲しかった。
また、地味にサブイベントが充実していてカードも評価が高かったタイトルだけに、この辺りの実績も用意して欲しかった。
まぁ、追加されたらすぐさま取りにかかるんだが。

当時の技術と現在との画質の違いを楽しみつつプレイできるので、そういう点ではお勧めであるが、画質至上主義には合わない。

Review bezieht sich NUR auf dieses "Remaster", nicht auf das Spiel selbst, dieses ist großartig.

Bis auf schöne Charaktermodelle und einem Weichzeichner über den Texturen bildet dieses Remaster gar nichts. Etwas aufgehübschte Charaktermodelle und die originalen Texturen der PSX-Version bietet der erste Steamrelease auch. Hier sind die Charaktermodelle, die Gegner etx schon schön geworden, das Menü ist hochauflösender, die Schrift ist besser zu lesen. Aber die Texturen sind eine Beleidigung fürs Auge. Die sind nicht gefiltert oder überarbeitet worden, da wurde einfach ein Weichzeichner draufgeklatscht. Das sieht aus wie Brei und macht den ganzen Eindruck komplett kaputt. 

Von daher, das spiel ist großartig, dieses Remaster ist es nicht.

This version of Final Fantasy VIII seems to already have a bad reputation, but it's not bad per se.
Let's face it: Square-Enix hasn't "cheated". We've known for at least a couple of weeks what the Remastered would be like. They haven't lied and gave us exactly what they promised: nothing more, nothing less. They never said there would be more than a slight graphic overhaul and more support for modern platforms.
This version has a better launcher, better support for controllers and you don't need to install mods to have the original soundtrack back. Also, as far as the new character models go, people may or may not like them, but their quality is good. Some will find them awesome, some will barely notice and some will hate them.
As for the backgrounds, I'm the first to say I expected more: they could have upscaled them better. I wasn't expecting the game to become 16:9, though. Let's face it: to do that, they'd have to remake the game from scratch. If they wanted to do that, they'd probably waste less resources with a full remake along the lines of FFVII. Would it be better? Yes, but, whatever the reason, they are not going to do that at the moment. I still think they should have at least filtered the backgrounds better.
As for the oh-so-hated censorship... well, I don't exactly like it, but I don't see it as a reason to tear the game apart. I don't know why they did it, but I can try and guess. The rating for videogames has changed since 1999 and they probably simply wanted to avoid trouble AFTER the game was released. Also, I've seen worse cases of censorship than what has been done to Siren and, as for Rinoa, if they didn't point it out, I wouldn't have noticed.

To be frank, I don't think this version was made for PC gamers at all. Square-Enix simply wanted to port FFVIII on modern consoles, but then they decided to put it on Steam too. Maybe they wanted to avoid criticism if they didn't, or maybe they just wanted to make a few bucks out of it too. Whatever the case, they didn't do less (or more) than what they promised: it's a stable version, more suited for modern platform than the original (though, being a 20-year-old game, there are still some outdated aspect to it) and it doesn't look half bad. If you don't already own the original 2013 version, I'd recommend this one. You can also wait for a discount, if you think the price is too high. Or you could wait for a mod to fix the backgrounds or remove the censorship.
If you already own the old version, though... well, the game is still the same. There's no new content whatsoever. If the new models and a better support for the controller are worth it to you, then buy it; otherwise, it's not a good idea.

Great remaster of an extremely underrated and in my eyes one of the best in a legendary series.  

The so called "censorship" complaints are ridiculous considering the only noticeable change is to one summon; Siren, and her previously uncovered bush hidden by feathers.  

Though one large grievence I do have is the game not running completely in full screen as there are black boxes surrounding the screen and though I found an easy fix which took 5 minutes to install; this is a remaster, I shouldn't be having to look for fixes already especially for something I would only expect in the original unremastered version.

But past that, you have a great game, legendary soundtrack, plotwise sometimes confusing and can seem a bit rushed late on but overall a classic game which has stood the test of time in my opinion.

La gente che si lamenta può andare a prendere la versione precedente per pc... Il fatto che il gioco vada a 30 fps e 15 durante le cutscene è assolutamente normale, non capite un cazzo di come funziona un videogioco probabilmente, soprattutto di uno di 20 anni fà...
Poteva essere fatta meglio? certamente si!
E' la miglior versione giocabile del gioco senza dover installare mod e cazzi vari? assolutamente si!
Se non vi va bene non compratela o compratevi la versione di steam classica con i file audio in midi e la risoluzione classica poi voglio vedere se avete il coraggio di lamentarvi!
Detto questo, se siete appassionati per 20 € è onestissimo.
Se non siete appassionati e volete provare questo gioco sappiate che è un gioco vecchio, il gameplay non è invecchiato male, gli sfondi in pixel art per quanto graficamente ormai vecchi non sono brutti da vedere (apparte quando le persone fanno parte degli sfondi, in questo caso stonano troppo con i nuovi modelli) e i nuovi modelli sono graficamente appaganti.
La storia è tra le migliori dei final fantasy (non la migliore).

Ich bewerte jetzt hier nur die Technik Seite.  Das Spiel selber habe ich schon bei der 2012 Steam Version bewertet. Nur kurz: FF8 ist und bleibt mit eins der besten FFs meiner Meinung nach.  Umso erfreuter war ich auch als ich hörte das ein Remaster erscheinen soll…auch für PC.  Mein erster Gedanke war: Wie schon wieder? Was werden die Unterschiede zur 2012 Steam Version sein und wie teuer wird das?

Ich habe jetzt ca 10 Spielstunden im Spiel verbracht. Man kann natürlich darüber streiten ob das hier die Bezeichnung Remaster verdient oder nicht. Und gewiss lassen sich einige Dinge nicht schön reden. Squall neues Design ist…Geschmacksache. Mir gefällt es nicht. Warum Siren *zensiert* werden musst verstehe ich ebenfalls nicht. Zwar ist mir das auf der ein Seite egal ob die nun ein Rock anhat oder eine Muschel.  Aber warum? Bei Rinoa musste gestern wirklich genau hinschauen um zu sehen was einige meinen das Rinoa auch zensiert wurde. Dabei ist der Unterschied nur das ihr Dekolleté im Remaster etwas weniger freizügiger ist.  Aber das finde ich nun weniger schlimm weil der Unterschued kaum vorhanden ist.

Was die Grafische Verbesserungen angeht: Ja das 4:3 Format ist blöd. Ja die Hintergründe sind unscharf und fallen jetzt besonders dadurch auf das die Chara selber nun scharf sind.  Die Chara Modelle selber gefallen mir bis auf Squall.  Auch schön das von Haus aus der PS1 Soundtrack dabei ist. Allgemein rein von der Grundbasis Version ist dieses Spiel hier das bessere FF8 als die 2012 Steam Version wo man hier unbedingt mit Mods nachhelfen muss.
Man muss aber auch etwas realistisch bleiben. Wenn ich so manche Steam Reviews durchlese frage ich mich was haben die Leute erwartet? Wer FF7/FF9 bereits hat der wird wissen/gewusst haben was hier auf ein zukommt. Damit will ich die Version hier nicht schön reden. Aber weder FF7 noch FF9 haben so viel hate bekommen wie FF8 hier und das finde ich etwas unfair.  Und wer meint dass nur die Chara überarbeitet wurden, sollte jetzt mal die Original FF8 Version noch mal starten. Auch wenn die Hintergründe im Remaster unscharf  sind sieht das trz besser/glatter aus als im Original was sehr verpixelt ist.  Viele beschweren sich über 15/30FPS.  Ja verstehe ich aber mehr geht nicht weil die FPS an der Engine gekoppelt ist. Mehr FPS würde das Gameplay/Balance umschmeißen.  Das Problem hatte meines Wissen auch FF10 HD gehabt.

Die Frage die man sich halt stellen sollte:
Ist das alles hier 20€ Wert? Für jemand der FF8 jetzt wirklich neu kauft sage ich ja. Man bekommt ein tolles Spiel (Das sollte man nicht vergessen trotz btechnik) und von Haus aus die beste Fassung. (Später werden bestimmt Mods erscheinen die das Ganze noch etwas mehr aufwerten) Wenn jemand schon FF8 hat dann sollte man eher auf ein Sale warten. Allgemein etwas frech von SE das Original Besitzer kein Rabatt bekommen haben. Das wäre hier bitter nötig gewesen (Und Kundenfreundlich) und schätze das Remaster würde dann etwas besser wegkommen..
Love FF8, but this is a wasted opportunity. It's missing pretty basic features, that the original Steam version has, like widescreen.

Im a little disappointed with this remaster as it offers absolutely nothing new to the table other then better character models.

Backgrounds still look blurry and jaggy. There are people on YouTube who are implementing A.I learning machines into PS1 games through emulators, making the games static background and cutscenes HD and more cleaner, if they can do it why cant you Square Enix? are you all that lazy to do it? Also this remaster uses the same original OST, you remastered OST before for past remasters such as Kingdom Hearts Remasterd series so, why couldnt you guys also remaster the OST? Dont even get me started on the 4:3 aspect ratio, that was just unacceptable, in this day and age not giving us an option to change our ratios, even Emulators give us the option to change our aspect ratio.

It would be a mistake to call this a remaster and this is a very big missed opportunity for FF8. this game could of shined so much more brighter if you all put more effort into it.

Instead of wasting time cencoring a 20 year old game, could of made it much better then this.

column8: This is a tough one to be honest.  Final Fantasy VIII is one of my all-time favorite JRPG’s and when I heard about the re-master, I was super excited for it. I just played it and so far I’m not impressed with it. Sure its 1080p…..no wide screen though so black bars are on both sides of the screen.  It has bad frame rate issues. Check out how the lava flows in Ifrit’s cave in the first mission.  The Character models do look great…for the ones that are rendered. In the classroom before the cave you have a mix of fully rendered 3D models and then you have pixelated 2D models sitting in the class…it’s very odd. While some of the characters look great, the “smoothed” backgrounds are just a letdown. This is just a short review being that I’ve barely played through the first mission and with that I can’t recommend this game.  Honestly I would recommend waiting for mod support or there may even be a chance that Square Enix will put out a patch to fix all the background, npc, screen resolution and frame rate issues.

column8: ...Whoever gives a negative review of this game is a freaking moron, don't listen to them. This remastered game is THE definitive version of FFVIII. This game was mainly intended for consoles (PS4, XBox One, and Nintendo Switch) because it was never re-released for those consoles. The creators just figured if they are remastering a game in such a major way, why not release it for PC as well? Yes, the ORIGINAL FFVIII is already on Steam HOWEVER, that game SUCKS compared to this version. You have to modify the crap out of that game before you can even play it the way it was meant to be played, music and everything. This version is 10x better on release. Better textures for all primary and none primary moving characters, the music is EXACTLY the way it's supposed to be WITHOUT MODDING, perfect controller support AND the PC version has extra features that the console versions don't have like cheats that give you all the weapons, maxed out gil, maxed out items, maxed out GF leveling, and more (Activating these will disable achievements so these are really only meant for fun). The game works FLAWLESSLY without having to fix any files. As for frame rate, if these idiots actually understood how these kind of games were made back in the day, you'll know you can't just simply increase frame rate without the whole game moving 3 times as fast (Hey wait... that's an actual game play feature in this game so that alone proves what i'm talking about, look at your frame rate indicator when activating 3 Times speed, you see the frame rate climb to what's considered to be a normal frame rate by today's standards (60 fps and up) as the game it's self moves at lightning speed. Same thing happens in older retro game emulators) you'll have to make a whole new game from scratch if you want to do that meaning more money. Yet despite all those positives this version of FFVIII has over the original Steam Version that you have to fix before you even play it, this one has a WAY lower review score compared to that original piece of trash... HOW DOES THIS MAKE ANY SENSE?! If you have that original Steam FFVIII already than congratulations, now go on that store page and keep giving that game all the positive or negative reviews you want even though it deserves only negatives. That game was definetly a cash grab compared to this one. If you don't have Either of these versions of FFVIII than OBVIOUSLY this is the one for you. You cry baby idiots giving this game a negative review it doesn't deserve is only gonna make things more complicated for people who have never played this game before looking for the best version of this game to play. THIS IS IT RIGHT HERE NEW COMERS!!! BUY THIS ONE!!! NOT THAT OLDER GARBAGE!!! With that said, obviously a thumbs up and i hope you enjoy. This is one of my favorite games of all time and this version deserves a WAY better rating than this.

column8:
Let me start off with, Final Fantasy Vlll is my FAVORITE in the series, hands down. I own the copy that was made available on steam quite some time ago.

Now when I read "Remastered" I was thinking, hey cool they will go in freshen up the backgrounds with new better images to pan across, update some of the basic renderings that were done on the global map and bring things up to about the standard overall of where PS2 came into play at least. I never expected them to do a full tilt treatment of bringing this up to modern Unreal Engine graphics that you see in modern game play. So I was not horribly let down when I didn't see that.

With that in mind, here we go for the Pro/Con in my opinion.

Pro:

- The UI is cleaned up slightly, so it doesn't have the rough edges that it had previously.
- Character models are brought up by about 5 years in quality.
- Music seems to have gotten a treatment as well. (though this could just be a thing I wasn't paying attention to previously. I felt they needed more pro's haha)

Con:

- Sets are all the same as the original Steam release.
- Controls are still clunky and cannot be customized (as far as I have seen thus far)
- Censorship (True that can be either, but I see it as a con unless toggleable)
- Cut scenes are the same. (Perhaps only slightly adjusted to make them run smoother)

Take this for what it's worth, I have only played through for about an hour in the new release; however, in my opinion they should have done more to the game to warrant re-releasing it under the title of "Remastered" If in the future they were to give more effort to it and bring in updated backgrounds and smoothed textures to the scenes and character models, address the UI and controls, bring the music quality up and re-render the cut scenes to smooth their run and bring up the quality I would change my opinion of this "Remastered" version of the game. Until that time I would only ever recommend the game to people that don't already own the game as I still love the base game and story from Final Fantasy Vlll.

All in all I am okay with this because I was expecting a remaster, not a remake like a majority of the reviews seemed to be wanting.

column8:
Having started this game the day it was released, I knew there would likely be some kinds of bugs. I was able to trigger a few achievements, but after a while they just stopped popping up. If those are important to you, you may want to wait to buy this game.
This is a remaster, not a remake. If you go in expecting "FF8 re-imagined like you've never seen it" like what was done with FF3 or Secret Of Mana, you'll be disappointed. This version received the same type of touch-ups as the FF9 port, where you can actually see the character's faces and the graphics are slightly sharper. The game speaks for itself and doesn't need all of that.
No, there are no voice-overs. No, the game does not play in true 16:9. If you want a modern game, go buy a modern game. If you want a retro game that has been polished a little, look no further.
If you are new to FF8 altogether, you will want to do some research of the unique combat system in this game. Most of the standard rules of JRPG don't apply here, particularly the ideas of grinding and over-leveling.

column8:
When I first got news about this product, I was told it would be 16:9 visually, and have updated graphics. The characters and enemies have updated graphics, but the backgrounds and world map do not (aside from the paved roads on the world map).

The controls are being mapped to the highly non-standard PS4 controller, and are locked in. It will not acknowledge the existence of the left side of the center buttons on a logitech gamepad to change it to the "Toggle Map / Boost" button. The Gamepad settings litterally lock it into the PS4 gamepad's trackpad.

Boost is a primary/expected function of FFVIII, and so to have it not properly map-able is negligence. I therefore can not recommend this "Remaster" to anyone. Especially since I still need to use the keyboard to exit the game. This is NOT fully gamepad controllable.

Alright, let's get this out of the way: it's not worth $20. Maybe $10, but that's pretty generous. Unless you absolutely need the extra cheats or upgraded character models, just buy the original release on a sale. This is barely a remaster, and pretty much exists just to put it on newer consoles.

That said, there's no extreme problems with the game. A lot (too many) of people are bitching about the cheats, but they mean literally nothing if you don't turn them on, but I guess somebody must be putting a gun to your head and forcing you to use them or something. They disable achievements as an incentive to stop people from using them, so lookie there, Square is shooting themselves in the foot there.

The backgrounds barely look different, but the character models have been improved. That alone has cause some strange ire with people saying Squall has been "replaced". The hell, people? He's still Squall, he just doesn't have the pixelated face you like to joke about or something. If he still had the pixelated face, you'd be complaining about that.

The music is better, the cheats are fun when you're on your fiftieth playthrough and want to try something different, and the character models look nicer. Get it on sale and enjoy yourselves rather than paying full price just to complain.

column8:
The only changes here are the improved character models, but that's only for field and battle screens. On the world map they actually look worse than the original thanks to the excessive blurring to pass things off as 1080p. The game is using the exact same textures as the original version which was formatted for 480i televisions, but they've applied a heavy blur filter (and a lazy one at that) to the entire game in order to call it 1080.

Honestly the original release of this offers better framerate on cutscenes, better art direction because things haven't been run though a lazy photoshop fliter, and better extras and bonus features (in the original steam release you can fast forward the cutscenes and tutorials in this you can't.)

Save yourself a couple bucks and just pick up the original version and look into modding it if you want to improve the graphics.

column8:
There are aspects of this "Remaster" i can forgive, such as the lack of widescreen support. There are a lot of static backgrounds that would have to be remade to allow this to be a thing and i get they may not have had the resources put aside for this particular project.  

There are aspects I dont know if there was a reason for existing. For example the shitty framerate. This game runs at what feels like about 20fps at best. I wonder though if the games speed is locked to the framerate. Thus if they knocked it up to 60fps all that would happen would be the games speed would triple. I believe FFX had the same problem. If this isnt the case then I cannot understand why a game that can run in 4k on a casio calculator cant have a decent framerate in this day and age

I dont care about changes made to characters and i find the whole censorship argument frankly a load of bullshit.

There are things i do like, for example the cheats, not because i find the game too hard or anything like that. But so that at the beginning of the game i can plough through at x3 speed and grind the shit out of it which i always found to be one of the biggest slogs in the game before now. 

The parts they have touched up look great imo. I dont mind that Squall looks a bit different. At least he doesnt look like he had botox like Tidus did in the Remaster of FFX. 


Things i dont like
- Shitty framerate, though as mentioned there may be a game engine mechanical issue as to why this is how it is
- Jarring differences in details. You can have high res characters next to completely OG untouched ones and its very off-putting.
- Could have at least made the fully 3D areas 16/9 aspect
-  Joystick controls feel wonky
-  No rumble support
- timing for Squalls limit break trigger feel out and without the rumble to confirm its hard to tell if you even timed it correctly until after the fact.

Things i do like
- What has been updated looks great
- The boosters and cheats are useful for people why have completed the game several times over and want to blast through the start.
-  Game price is reasonable
- Autosave function is very useful. no telling how many times ive lost hours of gameplay through either dying or power cuts etc.
- im really struggling to think of more.

TLDR:
If you already have the previous steam release of the game, dont bother with this and just mod that one. If you dont then its 50/50 as that version is cheaper then this and you dont really get a lot more for it

I love FF8. It's one of the first Final Fantasy games I played when I was a kid. I was very much looking forward to the remaster. Unfortunately, it's not done as well as it should have and, in some cases, seems lazy. Some of the character models are updated, which is nice, but there are also some that aren't. Example: I just got to the SeeD exam part right after Cid goes on about stuff. The cutscene-ish part has a higher res version of him, but as soon as it ends, he becomes completely pixelated. Also, the backgrounds aren't updated. They still look very much their age. They've just been blurred slightly, but you can still tell. And there's weird censorship with certain characters (Siren being the prime example). 

I'm still going to keep playing through it because I love FF8 and it has fixed some older game problems (Seifer's head was see-through for me on my non-remastered PC version, for example). But unless you want a few character model updates, and less pixelated art and text, I'd say to just save the money, unfortunately.

Ich habe mir das Remastered gekauft und nach nicht einmal einen Tag zurück gegeben. Final Fantasy VIII ist ein wirklich wunderbares Spiel aber der Begriff "Remastered" trifft es nicht einmal im geringsten. Das Einzige was wirklich sichtlich in dem Spiel angepasst wurde sind die Modelle der Hauptcharaktere. Dadurch wirkt die restliche Grafik im Spiel um so schlechter da an dieser gar nichts verändert wurde. Mein Rat. Kauft euch die alte Version und packt einpaar Mods drüber. Sieht besser aus und kostet weniger.

优点：
人物重新换模型了，终于能看清脸了。
加了官方金手指，体验上顺畅多了。

缺点：
开头还是PS1读取记忆卡的界面，还能再懒一点吗？
都9102年了还4：3画面
CG完全没有改动，分辨率大一点就全是马赛克。
战斗时只有十几帧
游戏背景糊的没法看，辣眼睛。

虽然以前骂capcom是冷饭王，但人家起码真有几个高质量复刻或重制的作品。
不说生化2重制版，光是同价位的生化危机1REMASTERED比这个那真是不知高到哪里去了。
FF8也算是复刻多次了，每次都是一点一点抠门的加料，最后却做成这样？？
很少给差评的，这个真的无法给好评。

这是我最后一次给SE送钱，SE咱们再也不见了。

column8:
*Updated review* 09/19/19

So like I said before this is still the same FFVIII we all remember, there's a few things here and there people are still upset about oh well. 

Censorship, most likely was forced by the ESRB.

FPS, so here's where a minor issue comes in. The game itself runs at 30fps, people wanted 60fps, probably couldn't happen due to the loss of the source code. Battles run at 16fps, not 15fps like in the original, and battle menus run at 60fps, so the issue involves boosting for your GFs. For me, it does not register all my button presses, so I have to time it carefully, even still it manages to miss one here and there. The benefit of this is that sometimes you can still hit the button when the "X" shows up telling you you cannot boost currently and it won't reset. 

Another issue I do have is lack of the fill movement for my analog stick, instead we are stuck with 8 directional movement, which can be a problem when trying to access draw points or something to progress the story. Had this issue a couple times. This is also probably due to the loss of the source code.

The characters themselves look great, but the rendered backgrounds weren't updated at all, which is the largest complaint people have. Again, probably due to the lost of a source code, but at least they're sharper. Mods will probably please people at this point.

Back to the controls, full support, unlike the 2013 release where I had to press Button 1, basically making that version unplayable for me. This game requires certain actions using button presses and something saying Button 1 isn't going to cut it for me. Sure you can get an app to map your controller to you keyboard, but that's more crap you have to do to play the game. The Remaster, however, itself shows you the actually buttons and not numbers. 

Music is back like the original PSX version. 

People have said they encountered glitches regarding music and other things, which I haven't... yet. 

All in all though, if you are looking for a decent copy, I do highly recommend this over the 2013 release, unless you're fine with modding then go ahead and get the other one. To me, this is the definitive version to get. Wish it was a bit cheaper, wait still it goes on sale. 


-------------------------
The amount of people who bought this game just to write a negative review about it astounding. 

The game isn't horrible, I will say it's a significant improvement over the 2013 release. At it's base is a true port of FFVIII, it may not have the glory of other remasters, who gives a shit. People will buy it anyways. Nostalgia.

column9:
*Updated review* 09/19/19

So like I said before this is still the same FFVIII we all remember, there's a few things here and there people are still upset about oh well. 

Censorship, most likely was forced by the ESRB.

FPS, so here's where a minor issue comes in. The game itself runs at 30fps, people wanted 60fps, probably couldn't happen due to the loss of the source code. Battles run at 16fps, not 15fps like in the original, and battle menus run at 60fps, so the issue involves boosting for your GFs. For me, it does not register all my button presses, so I have to time it carefully, even still it manages to miss one here and there. The benefit of this is that sometimes you can still hit the button when the "X" shows up telling you you cannot boost currently and it won't reset. 

Another issue I do have is lack of the fill movement for my analog stick, instead we are stuck with 8 directional movement, which can be a problem when trying to access draw points or something to progress the story. Had this issue a couple times. This is also probably due to the loss of the source code.

The characters themselves look great, but the rendered backgrounds weren't updated at all, which is the largest complaint people have. Again, probably due to the lost of a source code, but at least they're sharper. Mods will probably please people at this point.

Back to the controls, full support, unlike the 2013 release where I had to press Button 1, basically making that version unplayable for me. This game requires certain actions using button presses and something saying Button 1 isn't going to cut it for me. Sure you can get an app to map your controller to you keyboard, but that's more crap you have to do to play the game. The Remaster, however, itself shows you the actually buttons and not numbers. 

Music is back like the original PSX version. 

People have said they encountered glitches regarding music and other things, which I haven't... yet. 

All in all though, if you are looking for a decent copy, I do highly recommend this over the 2013 release, unless you're fine with modding then go ahead and get the other one. To me, this is the definitive version to get. Wish it was a bit cheaper, wait still it goes on sale. 


-------------------------
The amount of people who bought this game just to write a negative review about it astounding. 

The game isn't horrible, I will say it's a significant improvement over the 2013 release. At it's base is a true port of FFVIII, it may not have the glory of other remasters, who gives a shit. People will buy it anyways. Nostalgia.

Omg it doesn't run at 60fps. It's a 20 year old game that SE lost the source code to. They probably couldn't have improvements like they wish they could have. 

All I see is a bunch of self righteous babies crying about how they didn't get what they wanted. You should be thankful that they even released a remastered version of the game. 

If you don't like it dont buy it.

I wouldn't bother buying this edition of the game. It's a lazily made remaster that screams cash-grab, where only a small portion of the game is actually in any way remastered. 
You can get free mods that do the same changes to characters/menu and in some cases, they look better. Save your money. 

These are the changes (good and bad) that I noticed from a 3 hour stream playing it, skipping through saves at different stages of the game. If I hadn't gone over the time limit for refunds, I'd be requesting one right now so the person who gave it to me, could get their money back. I'm so disappointed, FFVIII is my favourite Final Fantasy, they should and could have done so much better. 

Pros: 
Characters/GF's/Human enemies look nicer.

Menu looks nicer, easier to read.
Better controls, more like original PS1 release.

Decent version of music comes as standard (PS1 version, not PC midi)

Cons: 

Exit button in menu, put directly where save was previously. First time I went to save, I quit the game by accident because the save option had been moved, causing me to have to restart.

World map looks atrocious. Hasn't been touched. Same goes for Minimap.
Sprites for vehicles on world map, also unchanged.

Animations for magic/summoning hasn't been updated, so it's pixelly around the character.

Some monster enemies don't look like they've been changed. (except bosses) 

Backgrounds look terrible, are fuzzy and hard to look at. 
New characters make the backgrounds look worse. Same for battle backgrounds too.

Edea's dress has been altered to fade into white (like dissidia) instead of into pale purple like original game.

Siren now has a skirt in game, but the card remains unchanged.
Rinoas costume has been altered as well.

column8:
New character models 
No midi music by default
Some extremely minor "Censoring" (this game never had any nudity, so who cares)
Backgrounds were not recreated, so they are blurry, however, they are not jagged like in previous versions, which does make them seem less dated. 
Not supporting wide screen, and ultra wide screen.. is a dumb argument.  They would have to recreate every screen to accomplish this correctly.  Best you can hope for is a total remake of the game, and not this. 
Better controller support... buttons on screen represent the buttons on the controller, and not a generic number.
Is it perfect.. nope
Is it a better version than the 2013 release.. YES

Is it worth 20 dollars?  Yes, and no.
If you already own the PC version, this is an upgrade, but some will not appreciate the changes. 
If you want the PC version, and don't already own it.. It's worth it. 

On a side note, I recommend using a lower resolution than 1440p
The detailed character models, don't really fit in with the backgrounds at that resolution. 
I settled on 1280 x 1024.  It still looks a lot better than a non modded 2013 release, but is not as disconnected as higher resolutions.

column8:
一部のテクスチャとモデルを差し替えただけなので、当時の画質に沿って本編をプレイ出来ます。

映像は4:3の固定で、ワイドモニターにすると左右がその分だけ黒枠化します。枠を埋める背景画像の用意は無いようです。
また、上下にも若干の黒枠が架かるので、画面に対して映像が一回り小さく映ります。
ストアの動画はワイド向けに加工されており、実際は同ページのスクリーンショットの通りに表示されます。

フレームレートはフィールド・ワールドマップで30fps、バトル画面で15fpsになります。
これらは倍速モードが有効な場合において、60fps及び45fpsに引き上げる事が可能です。

To call this game a Remaster and to hype it up for quite a few months wasn't the best thing as it became somewhat of a disappointment upon release which is a damn shame seeing as this is one of my favourite games of all time.
That's why, even though it's justified, it hurts to give this game a negative review.

This is a quick review of the Remaster, not the game itself.

PRO
- Same FFVIII game play untouched
- Music is the same as PS1, not midi as used in original Steam release
- Boosters allow you to play through at your leisure
- Character models have been improved to look a lot better
- Full controller support
- Triple Triad cards look nicer
- Speed booster similar to XII Zodiac Age

NEUTRAL
- Certain things have been censored like Siren's bush no longer on show instead replaced with a skirt for example. I don't find this a huge problem, it's very minor in the long run, but censorship is getting ridiculous these days.
- An annoying achievement (10000 kills) was taken out which was great but it also removed one of the more challenging and fun achievements too (contrived finish). I know it's cos of the no encounters cheat but still...
- No Chocobo World mini-game. Not too fussed as it was a massive grind but something the original did have over this.

CON
- Widescreen is a joke. Resolution is at 1920x1080 but it's still a smaller box in the middle of the screen with two large black bars on either side.
- The battles still run at 15fps
- The biggest one to me is that minus character models everything else seems pretty much untouched or made worse. The environments are still jarringly blurry and at low resolutions and the menu don't seem to have any overhauls at all. I go by the whole "if it ain't broke don't fix it" but to label this as a remaster when all it really is is a high res character replacement pack is fairly disappointing.

If you're new to FFVIII then you're welcome to try both this one or the original as there ain't much difference but don't go into this one expecting it to be a massive improvement on anything but one set of visuals.
Hopefully this game is modder friendly and the community can fix what should have been in game to begin with either that or SE start patching it as it goes on.

column8: Szczerze powiedziawszy nie jest to zła produkcja. Owszem grafika pozostawia wiele do życzenia, a promowanie gry ułatwieniami jest trochę kontr-produktywne. Nie oczekiwałem od tego remastera czegoś wielkiego i dzięki temu zbytnio się nie zawiodłem. Odświeżone modele wyglądają dziwnie na niskiej rozdzielczości prerenderowanych tłach, co z łatwością rzuca się w oczy. A obiekty na mapie świata mogły by przejść chociaż mały facelifting jak modele postaci. Ogromną zaletą jest na pewno odświeżone UI. Czytając dialogi czy wybierając opcje w  menu czy w czasie walki nie przypomina ci o zaległej wizycie u okulisty. Wszystko jest wyraźne i działa płynnie. Szczególnie widać to podczas grania (grindowania) w Triple Triad. I właśnie to jest mój piesek pogrzebany. To jest wciąż ten sam FF8. Nie mam problemu z tłami ponieważ ich poprawa wymagała by ich stworzenia od nowa a wtedy to już lepiej jakby Sqare zrobił po prostu Remake, a nie Remaster. Works on SteamPlay/Proton SteamOS/Linux Day 1.
Best version of FF8 available today, looking forward to Ultima Mod upgrades from FF8 2013 that overhaul things not re-done in this version -- World Backgrounds.
Did I hope for more improvements? Honestly if they were to do a full remake I would have to but it, FF8 is a classic on the levels of Ocarina of Time and if $20 isn't a lot to you it's well worth collecting.

Looking forward to mods and upgrades and hopefully some more official updates.

How to easily change your games resolution in order to remove the black bars with a simple adjustment!
Hi guys, 

I'm currently running this game on Windows 10 at 1920x1080 (native).
Yet as we all know, there will be black bars as soon as you run the game with the current "modern day" settings.
So how to adjust this annoying issue?
Well it's actually quite simple..
You just need to go to the games ingame/configuration menu and set the games resolution to 1280x960 (the game will not be tearing as a bonus) ^^
Start up the game (or by running the games configurator before launch) and now your screen will be filled up nicely without having to look at those black bars again! 

https://imgur.com/a/V2z4zBc

Enjoy :)

 
Ps: in case you're running the game on a higher resolution, just follow my guidelines and look for a lower (higher than 1280x960 if running 4k is possible) yet closest comparable resolution to fill the screen up entirely.

column8: The new characters models look great. The text boxes are beautiful to read compared to pulling out my PS One and popping the game in. That is about where all my compliments end. This game has hard crashed on me twice within 3 hours of playing. The game would try to load between scenes and it would just stay at a black screen indefinitely until I clicked on the screen with my mouse. Then it would show me a scene from earlier in the game with an error box. Click "Okay" and the whole game just crashes back to it's launcher. I can't complain about the pre-rendered backgrounds or cut-scenes looking bad. We all know they lost the originals. It's just a shame.

column8:
最初に、FF8好きのプレイヤーが書いている
内容的には前に発売したforPCと変わらず、基本的な移植度は問題ないと思う

背景はやっぱりぼやけてる。PS1時代のFFは背景がプリレンダなのでどうしても綺麗にならないのは仕方ないが
主要キャラのモデリング変更は悪くない。頭身が高いため引いた絵が多いのでじっくり見られる場面は限られるが…

音楽がPS版の音源になったのは賛否あるかもしれないが、前のPC版ではmidi形式だったので環境によってサントラと音が違いすぎたりもしたので、個人的には悪くない変更点

一番気に入らないのはやはり、おでかけチョコボが削除されたこと
限定アイテムはアンジェロサーチで入手できて確率も上がってるらしいが、アンジェロサーチ自体がランダム発動なので入手効率は悪い。本当にここが一番残念

他に気が付いた点としては
・セーブスロット1がオートセーブ用に。FF9やFF10HDからの逆輸入
・Xinputパッドに対応。ボタン表示も対応している。forPCはDirect inputだったので良い変更点
・LT+Rスティック押し込みでソフトキーボード表示。今回コントローラに色々特殊操作が追加されてるので、操作一覧も確認できる
・LT+Lスティック押し込みでシステムメニュー表示。forPCやFF10HDではキーボードを押さないと使えなかったチートをコントローラだけで操作可能に
・実績はforPCとほぼ同じだが、スコール初期レベルクリアや青魔法コンプ、雑誌コンプなどがなくなったので少し簡単になってる

現状では以上。遊べないとかそんな事はないが、期待するほどの内容でもない
forPCも購入したが、あちらはすぐ認証回数が切れてしまったので回数制限なしで遊べるようになったのが一番の評価点かも

Same as everyone else said already; player and enemy models got updated, and that's about it. The pre-rendered backgrounds not being remade is understandable since the original 3D models are probably long gone, but when you're in the over-world and those textures haven't even been upgraded let alone the models? And the in battle maps haven't been upgraded either? This game is ghastly to look at when you have the nice clean character models along side the late 90's backgrounds and maps.

Disappointing is a pale word to describe this remaster. I had high hopes considering the renaissance of FF14, but I have been thoroughly let down. Pay the money if you want pretty characters, otherwise skip this one. Oh yeah, at least the cards have clean art as well. Yay.

Its that time again kids! Fork over 15 bucks for a half-azz  port of an all time favorite! 

The word 'remaster' is used loosely here- they basically gave it the FF9 treatment- fresh character models looking COMPLETELY out of place over muddy, low rez backgrounds. That, along with the 15 hz proto-cgi cutscenes and thick letterboxes, are sure to have this game looking terrible on your crisp 2019 monitor.

Jerky frame pacing even at locked 30fps, absolutely a/v chop in Borderless. We are definitely not getting what we hoped for here, this is just another farmed out port. Its cool to see updated models for the SEED gang, but the overall fidelity is too low to justify the re-branding.

 I get it- the files were lost in the fire- thats the same excuse used for FF9 and the OTHER FF8 port. Stop trying to sell us the dream till you can work something out.

column8:
Même avec ce Remaster, ça change pas que FFVIII reste mon FF préféré :D !

Remettons les choses dans leurs contexte : Ce n'est pas un nouveau jeu, c'est un Remaster à la Square Enix et donc, une réédition avec des upgrades à droite à gauche (skin des persos, musiques, options supplémentaires voir difficulté +).

-> Ici, il y a l'ugrade des skins des persos, jolie mais quelque loupé comme sur Edea et son casque/couronne ainsi que Squall, en plus d'être plus proche de Dissidia que de Final Fantasy VIII, c'est deux gars différent entre les cinématiques et le terrain (ancien/nouveau Squall).

-> Les cartes sont refaites, c'est sur c'est mieux qu'avant mais c'est pas encore ça :/ Le Triple Triade est plus lent mais c'est pas une mauvaise chose car, moi, ça me donne tu temps pour réfléchir :D.

-> Le jeu fonctionne avec les éditeurs de sauvegarde pour PSX/ ancien FFVIII Steam. 

-> Les textures autres sont toujours aussi moche, voir pire. Avant c'était pixelisé mais c'était net. Maintenant c'est flou et le découpage des zones à faire passer sur les personnages est berk (pâté d'une autre couleur pas très transparent et qui se voit bien comme dans FFIX HD au passage...).

-> Pas de Chocobo World. Pas très grave c'était pas vraiment ouf non plus.

Je sais que c'est pas un remake mais quand même, les textures qui s'assemblent pas aurait pu être retoucher pour s'assembler ! En SD ça ne se voyait pas beaucoup mais depuis l'ancien sur Steam, le lien entre les textures est très visible donnant l'impression d'avoir deux feuilles de papier l'une à coté de l'autre, pas bien lier et que l'on voit un trait (forêt, ciel, terre...). 

J'ai pas encore fini le Remaster mais j'espère qu'il on augmenté la difficulté (surtout niveau puissance des sorts car sinon les ennemies principaux de l'histoire seront encore pas terriblement dangereux)...

Les boosts sont moins utiles que d'avoir un éditeur de sauvegarde pour mettre Edea dans l'équipe... Mais c'est un avis personnel.

Kein gelungenes Remaster. Das Spiel läuft in keinsterweise im Vollbild Modus. World Map, Sounds, Musik, Cutscenes - nix davon wurde überarbeitet. Was hier hier als Remaster verkauft wird, ist ein Skin für 20€ für die Hauptcharaktere so wie ein Cheat modul.
3 x Speed, Keine Zufallskämpfe und GodMode.
im GodMode ist die ATB Leiste immer gefüllt, Schaden wird negiert und Limit Breaks sind immer parat unabhängig vom aktuellen Leben oder Aura.
Desweiteren scheint das Errungenschafts system nur schwammig zu funktionieren.
Man startet mit zwei G.F´s und ist dazu verpflichtet, eine dritte zu holen um weiter zu kommen. Für alle drei gibt es eine eigene Errungenschaft. Alle drei nicht bekommen. Die vierte optionale hingegen schon. ( musste das Spiel neu starten um bis Ifrit erneut spielen)
Dazu kommt das das Spiel SEHR oft abtsürzt. Grund dafür ist, das aus irgendeinem Grund das Spiel aufhört Texturen zu laden. immer wieder werden meine Charaktere komplett schwarz. keinerlei Detail mehr zu erkennen. Kurz darauf crasht das Spiel.
Für den Preis von 20€ kann ich es derzeitig nicht empfehlen.Der Grund warum ich das Spiel dennoch behalte ist, dass Ich hoffe das SE einen patch rausbringt um ein teil davon zu fixen ODER die Community ihre Modding Skills zeigt um dem Spiel wirklich einen Remaster Titel zu verleihen.

When Skyrim was remastered, they gave it to owners of the original for free. The Skyrim remaster was gorgeous. It genuinely felt like a remaster, and getting it for free if you owned the previous was a gracious gift by the developers. 

This is the opposite. The only thing that is updated, is the character models. You can see tile-placements on the overworld that is exacerbated by the half-assed remaster and the updated models. Some of the models are a part of the background and look exceedingly outdated. Not only that, you have to purchase the game even if you had the original. The original, mind you, has mods that make it look BETTER than the remaster. BETTER. For. CHEAPER. How they thought this was a good idea is beyond me. 

As the favorite game of all time for me, this half-assed excuse of a remaster is truly disheartening and a sickening gesture of faith by Square. I already own the original, and I'll play that one instead.

column8:
So I was really awaiting this when it was revealed at E3. Yes I thought, a remaster of FF8. Let's hope they learned from Final Fantasy IX remaster and the horrible treatment they gave Chrono Trigger. Did they? In some ways yes, and some ways no. 

The Good: 

- I really like the new charactermodels. It's not fantastic, but it gives new life to Squall and company. 
- The music is back from the other version I have, where they didn't have the original PSX version of it. 
- Just playing FF8 again, with a version that really works makes me really happy. 
- The controller is better, and the game works perfectly with my PS4 controller. No using the keyboard at the same time because I don't know what button to use. 

The Bad: 

- The background looks blurry as hell, and seeing as they bettered the character models, this stands out even more than before. 
- The 3D world backgrounds are even worse. It all looks blurry, and I don't understand why they didn't do a better job here. I would have been happy to wait a little longer for them to fix this. Now I'll just have to wait for mods to fix this.

It's still FF8, my favorite game and I am not going to refund it. I like it as it is, even though it has some blemishes. It's the best working version right now. Will update this when I have played more. In the end I am not sure if I can recommend this game. Maybe come back when the mods are out or Squareenix decides to do more work on it. I dunno. I am still going to play it. Will give it a thumbs up even though I can't technically recommend it.

P.S: I find the notion that the game has been censored to be ridiculous. Maybe the original artist decided to make a skirt for Siren, and maybe it was decided to make Rinoa closer to the FMV's. I mean who cares? If they had decided to change big chunks of the story and other stuff I would probably have been there saying it myself. But for this little? Nope. This is the only time I will be mentioning this!

A great game! I loved playing through it as a kid, and it's good they decided to make a modern port of it! I will actually be able to finish it this time, as I only made it to disc 3 as a kid because the memory card died. I of course got extremely mad about this, and stopped playing. Now I can go back and actually beat it with improved character models. I don't really understand the complaining going on as the game works just fine, and is as advertised. The 3x speed cheat, and the improved models seem worth $7 to me, but then I never bought the other version on Steam. So as a new comer this is totally worth the $7 price difference from the original Steam port. Still why buy it again and review it negative if your not interested and refund it within the 2 hour time? People are so petty. I highly recommend this version if your new to the game, and if not a new comer the models are still nice but I understand just sticking to the other Steam version. Either way this game was awesome, and still is!

Now after playing it a bit more I can see a few issues, but not what everyone else is complaining about. The main issue I have had is the noticeable frame rate drops in combat scenes. Hopefully they patch that, but I wont hold my breath. It's still a fun game either way and plays better than the original in some ways.

column8:
[h1]Сразу оговорюсь, этот отзыв касается только реализации ремастера.[/h1]
Игра для меня по прежнему остаётся лучшей из серии FF.

Слишком высокая цена для такого ремастера.

Указали полную поддержку геймпада, а на деле:
Не добавили элементарную поддержку вибрации, которая прекрасно работала на ps1  20 лет назад.
Управление персонажем работает как будто управляешь с клавиатуры - нет свободы перемещения как на ps1 (где на малейшее отклонение стика персонаж поворачивался в ту же сторону)
Нельзя отклонив стик на половину заставить персонажа идти.
Похоже что игра просто эмулирует геймпад.
Ну хотя бы теперь в игре работает крестовина, а не только аналоговый стик.

Если кому интересно по поводу fps: 
в меню 60,   на карте мира и локациях 30,  в битвах 15.

Из настроек видео и графики есть только возможность выбрать сглаживание fxaa или smaa и сменить разрешение.
Задние планы никто перерисовывать не стал, просто замылили (по мне так вроде выглядит не плохо) хотя хочется конечно чтоб их перерисовали по новой.

По поводу звука, теперь дали возможность настраивать громкость звука и музыки отдельно (в старой части можно было изменить только звук, а музыка всегда играла на макс громкости)

Заменили модельки персонажей. Но даже не удосужились перерисовать спрайтовых персонажей местами это выглядит довольно забавно.
CGI ролики смотрятся так себе.
Ах да еще добавили в первый слот автосейв :)
Которым я так ни разу и не воспользовался во время загрузок, но может новичкам он и пригодится.

Видимо ремастером игры занимались те люди - кто эту часть ненавидит, я не знаю как можно такое выпускать.

В любом случае игра в плане картинки выглядит лучше чем оригинал :)

It's Final Fantasy VIII but with better 3D Models, text, menus, and cards. It's a shame they didn't improve the backgrounds as well, but once I'm playing I stop noticing as much since I'm mostly paying attention to the characters. If this rating system used stars, I'd take one off for that. Squall's limit break feels a little weird to me. Almost like it's out of sync but I've kind of got it down.  The controller support is far better in this version and is a huge plus for me. Some of the FMVs artifact pretty bad which should be expected at 4k since they're still the original FMVs. I wish they would have remade those as well. This game runs very well on my phone streaming through steam link. The original was always a pain for me to stream. Huge plus.

Overall, I've enjoyed this release, it's not everything I wanted, but I am happy with it. Here's looking forward to the modding community improving it further.

I preordered this game expecting at least something worth the money, I was hugely disappointed. I love Final Fantasy 8, but this "remaster" is not worth it. I expected more for 20 bucks, and at least thought they would put in voice lines and update the soundtrack (which they didn't). The only thing they "remastered" was the main characters, which still sometimes appear blurry(looking at you Cid).

On the field map you can still see the original background lines pieced together, and I think for Squalls world map avatar they didn't even update it. All the cut-scenes are the original ones, and you can no longer x3 through the tutorial like in the original steam release.

The only thing useful about the game is that you can get all the cards, and get the boosts such as no encounters without needing the GF Diablo. I really wanted to at least make it to Timber, but I couldn't be bothered to play past the awful backgrounds, sub-par character models and clunky gameplay. Refunded. 

TLDR: Don't spend your money on this, its not worth it, and if you want FF8, buy the original.

column8:
Alors, oui, je recommande ce Remaster. Même si en réalité ça aurait pu être un pouce rouge aussi, mais je vais vous expliquer pourquoi selon moi, ce Remaster ne mérite pas toute la merde qu'on lui balance au visage.

Déjà, vous devez savoir que je suis un immense fan de FF VIII. C'est mon épisode préféré et l'annonce d'un Remaster a fait naître chez moi un enthousiasme fou, quand bien même je savais qu'un "Remaster" ne serait jamais autre chose qu'un portage HD. Ne pas confondre "Remaster" et "Remake". Impossible de modifier les cutscenes ou les backgrounds sans devoir tout refaire. Suffit pas d'augmenter la résolution, c'est plus compliqué pour le pré-rendu.

Cette parenthèse fermée, qu'est-ce qui déçoit finalement ? L'absence de 16:9 était évidemment à prévoir, le jeu ayant été créé nativement en 4:3, le jeu n'allait pas par magie se retrouver en 16:9. Alors oui, la version d'origine de Steam permet cela, mais c'est bien évidemment au détriment du ratio. Personnellement je joue en fenêtré sans bordure, avec une résolution de 1280*960 (ou 1600*1024 au plus gros), ce qui permet d'avoir un ratio fidèle tout en minimisant l'impact des bandes noires.

Autre reproche: Le framerate. Oui, le jeu est à 60 fps dans les menus, 30 fps dans le jeu, 15 fps durant les batailles. Exactement comme c'était le cas sur PS1 donc. Le moteur du jeu étant ainsi fait (et n'étant pas modifiable dans un remaster), on retrouve donc l'expérience d'origine. Ni mieux, ni moins bien qu'avant. Il faut d'ailleurs savoir que le code source originel du jeu ayant été perdu, ce Remaster s'est probablement appuyé sur la version Steam, corrigeant quelques bricoles et ajoutant (dieu merci) les bonnes musiques.

Bon, vous commencez à comprendre je crois, que je suis pas d'accord avec tout ce qu'on reproche à ce Remaster (je vais revenir plus loin sur ce que MOI je lui reproche). Finalement, compte tenu de la nature même de ce qu'implique un "remaster", il était évident que les décors pré-rendus n'allaient pas subir de modifications, idem pour le moteur du jeu. C'est tout simplement impossible. Il aurait fallu totalement refaire le jeu "from scratch" pour ça (ce que SquareEnix fait avec Final Fantasy VII Remake par exemple). 

En faite j'ai globalement du mal avec les reproches qui découlent d'attentes irréalistes, basées sur du fantasme plus que sur la faisabilité du projet de base. Prenez le portage de FF IX par exemple (qui a de bons avis sur Steam et globalement apprécié par la communauté). Il souffre des mêmes "soucis" de framerate, de backgrounds flous (que j'ai dû modder personnellement tant c'était laid), mais il n'a pas reçu ce flow de haine. Pourquoi ? Est-ce son prix qui était moins élevé ? L'absence de "Remastered" dans son nom qui rendait les attentes moins folles ? Sans doute un peu de tout qui sait...

Personnellement, ce qui me déplaît fortement dans cette version, ce sont les bandes noires en haut et en bas, tout simplement affreuses. La jouabilité au joystick qui ne semble pas être prise en compte (vous vous déplacez quand même sur 8 axes, comme à la croix), en 2019 ça fait un peu tâche. Son 16:9 fullscreen minimaliste (voire flemmard hein), même pas un peu de décoration autour du jeu (encore une fois, si vous avez un écran assez grand, jouez en Fenêtré sans bordure en 1280*960 ou 1600*1024, c'est propre). Et, son prix. Que je trouve un peu trop élevé pour le travail que je perçois pour le moment.

Il apporte quoi finalement ce Remaster ? Quelques options de confort (oui, des cheats. Encore un reproche qu'on lui fait alors que tous les portages bénéficient de cet ajout, utilisable ou non selon votre envie), une modélisation moderne des personnages (quand celle-ci n'a pas quelques couacs, cf. Cid), des Gforces et de certains modèles 3D comme les armes, les ennemis etc... Cette modélisation "Next Gen" me plait, même si elle a tendance à renforcer l'aspect très (trop) net des personnages par rapport au flou des décors. Très honnêtement je m'y suis fait rapidement, mais je peux comprendre que ça choque. La version PS1 était plus pixelisée, mais elle l'était partout, ce qui donnait une certaine cohérence au rendu global.

Et là vous vous dites probablement "Attends, c'est tout ?". Bah... De ce que j'ai pu en voir pour le moment, les nouveautés ne sont pas légion et clairement, la nécessité de posséder absolument cette version plutôt qu'une autre pourrait être discutable, selon les goûts et les attentes. Néanmoins, je pense que c'est la meilleure version qu'on puisse avoir aujourd'hui, sans avoir besoin d'aller triturer le jeu pour y installer des mods. 

On retrouve les belles musiques de la version PS1 (certains voulaient du réorchestré, je comprends, mais à titre perso' les musiques me plaisent comme ça) sans avoir besoin de passer par un mod. La nouvelle modélisation plaira ou non, personnellement je trouve ça très réussi. Je ne reviendrais pas sur le "drama" de la censure, parce que sincèrement... Pardon mais faut vraiment vouloir emmerder le monde pour rebondir là-dessus. Je préfère la nouvelle modélisation à l'ancienne, cette "censure" n'est pour moi qu'une réinterprétation artistique de certains modèles 3D. ça me choque vraiment pas et je l'aurais sans doute même pas remarqué si j'avais pas lu un article là-dessus.

Finalement, si comme moi vous avez vraiment aimé FF VIII et que vous avez besoin d'une "excuse" pour vous replonger dedans, c'est loin d'être une version au rabais. C'est pas parfait, certes, mais c'est mieux que le portage mobile steam. Et personnellement je prends du plaisir à parcourir de nouveau cet univers, dans une version qui tient la route et qui propose quelques nouveautés, même si très objectivement c'est pas non plus la folie. C'est bienvenue et conforme à ce que j'en attendais (en dehors de ces foutues bandes noires en haut/bas, impardonnable). Il faut juste savoir ce que "Remaster" veut dire, et ne pas confondre le terme avec "Remake".

Pour conclure, je comparerais ce FF VIII Remastered avec Duke Nukem 3D 20th Anniversary. Si vous avez "l'autre" version, c'est pas forcément (selon votre degré de "fanboyisme") un achat urgent ou indispensable. Les ajouts sont là, on les apprécie, mais la grande majorité des joueurs ne vont simplement pas juger pertinent de claquer 20 balles pour un lifting de quelques modèles 3D et de quelques options de confort. Personnellement, j'en suis heureux. Parce que j'avais conscience dés le départ des limites inhérentes au "Remaster" des FF de l'ère PS1. J'en attendais donc pas la lune, mais juste une expérience fidèle, avec un plaisir renouvelé par quelques ajouts/modernisations ici et là. 

Si vous n'avez jamais fait FF VIII, c'est la version à acheter selon moi. Pas besoin de mods, c'est fonctionnel et fidèle à l'esprit d'origine, avec en prime des personnages nettement plus jolis.

Si vous le connaissez par coeur (comme moi), peut-être que vous aurez envie de craquer et je vois pas trop ce qui pourrait vous décevoir (si tant est que vous ne vous attendiez pas à un Remake total) au point de vous sentir volé. Peut-être aussi que vous vous sentirez très bien avec votre portage mobile dégueulasse mais moddé avec soin, et le cas échéant vous ne manquerez pas forcément grand chose.

Je recommande, mais j'aurais pu écrire exactement la même évaluation avec une non-recommandation finalement. Il faut juste savoir ce que vous achetez avec ce Remaster. C'est loin d'être un vol qualifié, mais les gens en attendaient (pour avoir lu les plaintes et les avis) une refonte totale du jeu, alors que ça reste un portage "HD", avec de nouveaux modèles pour les Personnages/GF/Armes/Détails (ce qui reste unique dans les portages FF de l'ère PS1)

Bon voyage si vous y retournez.
N'ayez pas trop de regrets si ce n'est pas le cas, vous manquerez rien si ce n'est quelques modèles 3D plus jolis (si vous êtes fans c'est à faire quand même. Attendez une promo si c'est le prix qui est rédhibitoire).

Here's the skinny:

Is there a cheaper version?: Yes.
Is this version better?: Yes.

I don't understand what people were expecting, but all the promos and demos showed this game in 4:3. The game was made in 4:3, all the backgrounds were made in 4:3. Aside from completely remaking the game, this is the best they could do.

The sound is better than the 2013 version. Not just the music, but the sound as well. The sound effects couldn't be fixed with mods on the 2013 version, so this one beats it out in the sound department unquestionably. Yes, you can get the PS1 music tracks on the old version with mods, so I'm going to call music somewhat even, even tho this one beats the other in convenience. 

The graphics are better in this version as well. Yes, you can get mods to up-scale the 2013 version, but the new character models not only have improved textures, but improved meshes as well. Some people don't like Squall's new look, but I don't mind it. It's a vast update from the previous version.

Honestly, even after a considerable effort modding the old version, you can't get it to the quality of this one. It's worth the 20 dollars in my book, and if you're mad about buying this game, you really don't have anyone to blame but yourself.

I hope that this release gets more attention on 8, since it's my favorite Final Fantasy game and am happy to see it get some love from Square.

Oh, and people are mad that Square censored Siren's bush out. The horror.
Can't wait for the media to pick up the "Gamers are mad about a summoned monster's pubic hair" story. That'll make all of us look like rational people...

column8: 원인을 모르겠는데 이프리트랑 세이렌 먹어도 도전과제가 해금이 안된...왜지...

完全に劣化版リマスター

Initial SeeD task bug

The place where the password is entered is always X C V B, not custom, such as : D X A W

・There is a bug and Selphie's shadow keeps flickering

・The overworld map is even worse and was not touched up at all.
　　And to top it off now the main character Squall's overworld model is glitched and missing part of his hair.

・The opening FMVs in this are somehow worse than the original, lower resolution and slower framerate and a lot of blurring and pixelated noise. The official trailers and commercials show they have higher quality FMVs or restoration techniques on hand but they have refused to actually implement them for the game, god only knows why.

・The backgrounds have not been touched up properly, only blurred, and for a "remaster" this is absolutely disgraceful. Some characters due to tech limitations back in the day were drawn as part of the background to help with limitations of too many character models on screen at once, but now they look like a blurred pixelated mess when standing around perfectly normal characters in the foreground.

・The "cheats" in this were really unnecessary, they should have left an option to select if we want to start a playthrough with or without cheats and that it can't be changed once the playthrough begins without starting a brand new game.

・For some reason the main character (Squall) has low resolution hair textures on his hair.

・The biggest disrespect to fans was the censoring my favorite Guardian Force, Siren.
what makes this so weird is the original Siren design is still visible for her Triple Triad Card in game. There was no reason to alter her. What they've done to her design is f***ing disgusting.

・The did not fix the lack of full analog controls. There's no full 360 movement, only 8 directions. Analog controls are completely wrong. 
　　UThe d-pad is meant to move the player character in a specific direction based on the angle of each area/scene you load into. Where as the analog stick would always move literally down a straight line regardless of perspective.

But now the analog is just a copy of the Dpad meaning it is very annoying to move around and I have to learn the directions for every scene area I walk into as it is scene angle context specific every. single. darn. time..
AND you still can't walk from a slight tilt on analog, ONLY run. NO ANALOG CONTROLS

・The frame rate in the battle menus is nerfed to 15fps whereas it used to be 60fps menus, making it slow and difficult to maneuver, and timing of rhythm button presses inaccurate.

・No vibration AT ALL hinders learning of certain battle abilities that are timing based.

Overture is out of sync. Music cuts abruptly now. Eyes On Me is out of sync.

・The cheaper original steam release (still available at the time of writing) is better quality.
Yes it needs more mods but runs better and has more content (the tamagotchi style minigame they added in). Is uncensored too.


**DO NOT buy this version until the issues have been rectified.**
This is not remastered at all, it's over priced, rushed, and lower quality.

column8:
Final Fantasy VIII was, and still one of the best Final Fantasy games out of the bunch for me. The battle systems and story are different from the other final fantasy stories and made it stand out. A lot of people didn't give the game a chance back then, but with the REMASTERED version you should definitely give the game a shot!

A few things that I hope they fix:
- Ran into display issues when the set monitor on the game settings isn't the monitor the game launched in (Had to edit the config file to make it work as other fixes just didn't work)
- Game is locked in a 4:3 ration and no option to do 16:9 This option should be added for today's monitor/hardware setups.
- I'm not one for being picky with censorship but it tarnishes what the original experience gave us back then. Would have been fine without it.
- Battles are locked to 15fps while cinematics at 30fps which is fine (gives that PS1 vibe tbh) but for the game being "Remastered" they should have definitely have done something to match this up with the current gen hardware as it is more than capable to do so.
- No Chocobo World (WHY?!)

Overall, the improvements on character models and smoother game play along with the nostalgia that Final Fantasy VIII brings is what makes me recommend this game for Final Fantasy fans to try especially if you've never played the game. If you do own the original Steam version the remastered isn't offering much of a change that mods can't do so it's up to you to grab the game.The "cheats" that the game provides can help out first timers get through the story but I definitely recommend not using anything besides the x3 speed for grinding purposes, anything else ruins the experience. Final Fantasy VIII will challenge your strategic thinking with it's battle features that is so underrated by fans, it is one of those really good systems to learn and master to conquer the game.

Totally Recommend!
