Penoso, salvo que reciba algún parche en el futuro la verdad es que es recomendable jugar el clásico o incluso emularlo a pagar por esta farsa.
Sólo se han mejorado las texturas de los personajes y GF. Sin más, escenarios, mapas, todo, absolutamente todo el resto es lo mismo. De hecho existe el FF VIII HD para pc, que es como una versión "no oficial" ahora de este.  Es un timo en toda regla el hecho de que no se haya trabajado un poco en el resto del mundo, agregar algún que otro efecto, incluso cosas simples como suavizar paisajes (costas, bosques, etc.)
Como fan de la saga y teniendo la suerte de poder compararlo con cualquier otra versión, recomiendo ámpliamente esperar a que tenga un 75% de descuento como mínimo.
Bien Enix, muy bien, cómo se nota que lo único bueno que hiciste es Valkyrie Profile (?) Suerte con FF VII, y vos, que estas dudando de comprarlo, creeme, de momento no lo hagas.

É vergonhoso chamar isso de remasterização, não há nada remasterizado a não ser os sprites dos personagens, e ainda assim sequer parecem estarem tocando o solo, a sensação é de jogar com mod muito mal feito.

Se nunca jogou o jogo, recomendo esperar abaixar o preço pois a história vale muito a pena, mas se já jogou, não gaste 1 centavo com esse lixo, vai apenas manchar aquela memória afetiva que você tem do jogo.

Pra quem já possui o port de 2013 desse jogo, obter ele de graça agora já seria caro, pagar R$ 60,00 é uma piada de mau gosto

column8:
I didn't understand why everybody was leaving a negative review for things we knew about the game just from all the previews. It was obvious it was going to still be 4:3. It was obvious it was still going to have a low frame rate. It was obvious the backgrounds weren't getting any treatment.

What I can't forgive is that I've been waiting 19 years, 8 months, and 9 days for the PC version to get the analog controls back, and they couldn't even give us that much. They have a lot of nerve charging money for this to people who already own the game on PC, because a handful of character models do not justify the price of re-entry. This should have been a free update.

Edit: While it was mentioned in the comments, I'll reiterate here—yes, the analog stick will move Squall around, but it does not have the precision analog control present in the original PlayStation version circa 1999. I shouldn't have to rely on my 20-year-old PlayStation discs to play with proper analog controls when the game has now been released three times on PC.

column8:
The beautiful re-haul of character models does a disservice to the untouched background artwork and world maps.  In the original, the fuzzy character models still stood out from the fuzzy backgrounds in an awkward fashion.  This "remaster" makes it look like the characters were imported from a completely different game.

As in other reviews, the screen is not formatted for any modern monitor, placing everything in a smaller black box.  I could forgive this if they remastered all the graphics as opposed to just the characters.

The project managers should feel ashamed for taking a wonderful game and managing to make its weaknesses more apparent.

This is no remaster.  This is a pathetic cash grab and one which I hope none of you buy and support.

column8:
Wow, this game is getting hammered with bad reviews. I'm not sure what people are expecting out of a PS1 game. Yeah the backgrounds are blurry, but these were designed for interlaced 4:3 TVs of 20 years ago. They would be loosing money on this if they took the time to re-render every background in the game in 16x9 format. The character models are great, and I'm happy with what I get here.

FFVIII is my favorite FF game. The things that bother me most about it are fixed with this version simply by the addition of the 3x speed mode. You waste so much time watching GF animations and casting DRAW on enemies to max out your magic. I'm excited to finally play through the game again for the first time in years.

EDIT:
I'm changing my review to a thumbs down for the lack of analog support. It didn't bother me at first, but man, do I really miss having that smooth analog control that the original had. Please add support for analog!

column8:
不算是补票了，毕竟PSN上和PS的原版盘都有入过，但只要是FF8一定会入！
画面圆润了太多，尤其那个字体的显示是在是太喜欢了！

另外说一嘴，官方自带的修改器GF和魔法的修改都是需要入手后才能修改到MAX，你没有入手的GF和魔法是修改不出来的，这一点和全道具不一样，还有就是CC团的卡片也无法通过修改器全部修改出来，其余的卡片都有。
感觉不怎么样,云存档还丢失了,这冷饭真的没诚意。

1. 游戏的CG没有任何优化，与PS移植版完全一样，如果对CG有期待的同学请直接放弃。最尴尬的就是片头CG那个1999copyright。你好歹复刻一次能把它改成2019不？
2. 所谓的复刻目前我看到的就是更改了人物模型和卡片模型，新更改的人物模型基本可以用臃肿来形容，部分镜头下看起来都走形了。
3. 剧情应该是完全没有变化，成就系统设定的就和闹着玩的一样。
4. 新功能的设定不知道是干嘛用的，除了加速可以提高效率外，其余的项目真的有人会用吗？还有买这个游戏的人是没有N刷过的吗？
总结，我瞬间对FF7的重置版充满了犹豫。

FF8老粉了，老PC版通关了多次，新版简评下：
人物建模基本达到了FF10，12重制的水平，改进主要是脸部，这部分改进是达到了重制标准的，身体部分的棱角分明只是部分修正了，玩起来还是常常感受到，另外女主角的深蓝色短裤很扎眼；
修改器可以全物品（生成召唤兽的所罗门戒指，魔法灯没有），召唤兽满级全技能，最大金钱，魔法栏数量提升至100，得到绝大多数卡片，但召唤兽，魔法还是要自己先找，不能直接有，注意主机重制版并没有以上这些功能；
自动存档以及游戏描述里的三倍速，ATB辅助，零遇敌；
=======================================================================
除此之外，这个重制版就和老版一模一样了。
=======================================================================
我觉得重制版可以有的内容：
简繁中；
地图和场景的HD化（是的，这个重制版用的还是老版的地图和场景，一点没变）；
过场动画1080P；
通关后可以观看过场与听原声的选项；
New Game+。
可惜，以上都没有。
=======================================================================
简单地讲，这是一个只重制了两成左右的重制版，除非你是新接触这个游戏，或者像我这样有着深度的FF8情结，不然不推荐入
======================================================================
游戏十几个小时通关了，只补充一点，女主角不是最终Boss!
最终Boss操纵她的身体在太空中给Adel解了封印，之后就把她抛弃了，任其自生自灭，如果她俩是一个人，哪有如此操作的？
有人说纷争里魔女问男主要不要跳舞，我也看到了截图，问题是这俩游戏相隔10年，根本不是一批人做的，除非有明确说明，不然不好附会这种暧昧；
最后的最后，FF8就是个俊男美女大团圆级别的剧情，把它像黑魂一样的考据，就像跟圣斗士星矢的剧情较真一样，是没有意义的。

column8: エラーが続く。起動してからえらーが続き再インストールや適合性、保存先の変更、アンチウィルス特例などおこなったがゲームすることができなかった。

El original era un juegazo y, personalmente, el mejor de la saga para mi. No hay mucho que decir del título en si que no se haya comentado ya, pues es de los mejores Final Fantasy y cualquiera debería jugarlo por lo menos una vez. Por eso le doy recomendado... pero aconsejando a los más pacientes esperar un poco a que o Square o (menos mal que tenemos comunidad) los modders nos solucionen esta versión.

Porque sí, hablando de la remasterización... El modelado definido de personajes hace aun más grave el chapucero desenfoque que se ha hecho en los fondos y los elementos del escenario. Queda muy cantoso y se siente que se podría haber hecho mucho, mucho mejor. Eso sí, claro, los personajes y combates se ven bastante bien respecto al original. Eso y el modo de velocidad x3 son lo que se salva del remaster, porque todo lo demás no vale la pena.

Si no fuera Final Fantasy VIII le daría negativo hasta nuevo aviso por ser una versión muy poco trabajada gráficamente (que es para lo que en teoría se enfoca este relanzamiento), pero su aspecto visual no me ensombrece la experiencia de juego.

Si quieres seguir leyéndome escribir sobre videojuegos en general... https://www.yukharyan.com/

So after 20 minutes of gameplay, I decided to write a review.

First the bad:

4:3 - 20 years later, they haven't changed the format to 16:9

Blurry Backgrounds:  There isn't any blurry backgrounds, they are the original backgrounds.

Cutscenes - are the original cutscenes.

The good:

All of the characters, NPC's, GF's have been updated (which is why the backgrounds look like they're blurry)

Cards Updated

Cheats and Boosts have been added to increase GF levels, items, Limit breaks etc. - (So if you're a wuss, you can play like one)

If you're a turn based RPG person, and haven't played this gem in a while, enjoy!  However, its a facelift at best.

If you're into the newer gameplay of the FF series, don't bother.  

This is probably best for nostalgic purposes only.  And hey......it's only 20 bucks.

FFVIII is my most favorite game, but this? this can barely qualify as a remastered... this is an atrocity.
Sure, the models look nice, all updated and stuff, the music has the PS1 quality, controllers are more natively supported than before (in the original PC port/steam port, if a controller got disconnected, I had to restart the game to make the controller work again), there's a nice system menu....


But even those things aren't consistent.
They still havn't managed to fix the opening/intro, before you get into the menu, the music is still too slow/the credits are too fast.
Right after the briefing where you meet Zell, Cid's model goes from "HD" to 120 pixel-barf on the screen like the background, but that isn't the only instance of character models going haywire.
The Music did a hardreset once and played the weird quality of the PC(/steam) port, not the nice PS1 version anymore.
The resolution is complete nonsense since it pretty much doesn't matter what resolution you pick, you'll end up with a smaller game screen because of some weird, unneccessary big black bars on the sides (beleave 4:3).
The movies still have the PS1 quality with a "nice" 15fps, the game runs between 15-30fps.
And I've only scraped the beginning of the game (right before the trainride to Timber).


One more thing (about boosters):
I admid, I abused the turbo button alot, there was no stop to the turbo, with the "remastered" version, turbo will stop whenever you're in a menu or when you're in a cinematic cutscene; I'm not a fan of that; but there's no need to bind them without an option to unbind them to the controller (I'm not a fan of the boosters in general.. the game's already easy enough as it is).



Do I recommend this version of the game?
No. Basically; get the previous version, and play it with mods, mods that refresh and boost everything, not just character models...

Do I recommend this game?
As stated before, this is my most favorite game, so atleast that's a big Yes, but don't bother with this version, get the previous one (it's cheaper) and either play with those qualities or install mods, it'll be a way better experience than this.


PS.
If you HD/remaster some things, why not remaster everything?
it doesn't need to be on a FFVII, new game, level remaster; but something like... I don't know.. wind waker / -HD?
They really could have at least put in SOME effort and updated the backgrounds... those character models don't fit into the game whatsoever.

column8:
If you don't already have FF8, this might be worth your time. Its controller compatibility is better than the normal PC version (despite D-pad only or confusing 8-directional analog) and items that were exclusive to Chocobo World are in the main game instead. The PSX soundtrack is back (although certain glitches can accidentally turn the MIDI back on) and it's probably the best way for a first-time player to experience the game. Gameplay-wise, FF8 itself is a comically unbalanced game, and the character advancement system is easy to break for anybody who's got an iota of metagaming experience. It has a plot that feels like a lot of cool ideas thrown together, but is still charming and should keep you guessing. (Incidentally, if you're fluent in French, play that translation instead - FF8 was translated in the late 90s when Squaresoft USA's localization department would translate all characters as though they were either children's TV presenters or brooding edgelords. Squall, the main character, suffers for this, whereas the French translation makes him quite witty and snarky, more akin to his Dissidia appearances.) Essentially it's the old PC version with a few quality of life upgrades in terms of controls and gameplay. Take it or leave it.

If however you DO already have FF8, I suggest passing on this as the stuff they've changed really doesn't justify purchasing it again. I'm not bothered about the way certain character models have been changed to prevent a change in age rating (covering up Rinoa's cleavage and Siren's thong is apparently really upsetting the weirdos who used to spend hours hitting buttons looking for a strip code in Tomb Raider) but the HD models clash hard with the blown-up JPEG backdrops of the original version, the cheat options are far less useful than the myriad mods and save editors you've probably been using for years, the FPS is still locked at 30 during exploration and 15 during combat rather than being ramped up to 60 throughout, the aspect ratio is still at 4:3, the entire screen isn't actually used which I feel kinda defeats the point of an HD remaster, and by now you likely installed Roses and Wine to remove the MIDI music anyway - in other words, if you already own this game, the modding community saved you 20 notes.

tl;dr version, you should play this game, but you shouldn't bother to buy it twice.

tl;dr version, you should play this game, but you shouldn't bother to buy it twice.

column8: Lo unico que puedo decir es hermoso el juego y quien diga que es basura aprender a valorar el esfuerzo criticones niños rata >:C

Let's address a few of the complaints that people are having with the game. 

Aspect Ratio: The pre-rendered backgrounds are in 4:3, there is no real way to get the game in 16:9 unless the backgrounds are all completely remade or if they are stretched. 4:3 is fine, it's what I expected, if anyone was expecting differently then they're an idiot.

FMV Sequences: They look fine, low framerate or not, it's not really any issue, they look like I remember, as the original source material was lost, there isn't much that could be done outside of completely recreating them.

So called 'censorship':  As for Siren, she has clearly been censored, but, even when I played the OG FFVIII back in the day, I thought it was kind of awkward that she just had this bush for some apparent reason. The new design looks better I think. As for Rinoa, her character model has been altered to show less cleavage. However, I think this was less a form of censorship and more making her look more in line with her FMV model. Her current design looks much closer to what you see in the FMVs and I can see why they did it.

There are really only two complaints I have with the remaster. They should have remodeled and retextured the world map. The original PC version of the world map always looked worse than the PS1 version and they haven't fixed that here. I feel like it wouldn't have taken much work to smooth out the models and ground so everything doesn't look so blocky. My second complaint is the lack of force feedback. It was satisfying in the PS1 version to trigger Squall's gunblade and feel a jolt in the controller. I enjoyed the rumble going crazy when certain GF's did these massively powerful looking attacks. That's not here and I really wish it was.

Those two complaints aside, I've played modded version of FFVIII on PC, I've played it emulated and upscaled, I played the original PC version back when it was still current. I played the PS1 version on day 1 of it's release. This is the best version of my favorite JRPG of all time. I'm enjoying it. Honestly, I don't think anything Squeenix could have done would have made everyone happy. The only two things they really should have fixed and didn't are like I said, the world map and vibration issues. Either way, I wholly recommend it.

As for the gameplay itself. Fair or not, Final Fantasy VIII has always kind of been treated as a bastard child of the Final Fantasy series. It doesn't look like any of the other Final Fantasy games, they removed 'Magic Points' and replaced it with the 'Draw' system. You can't ride Chocobos around and so on. That said, the game was going for something different and it succeeds. The art direction and overall style of the game is amazing. The junctioning system and magic system are both great and easily my favorite magic and stat system of any of the FF game (I've played them all) . 

The story is fantastic.The characters are great. The characters do get a lot of complaints like Squall is broody and so on. But, other characters actively make fun of him for this. When I played this game when I was 14, I thought Squall was cool. Strong, silent protagonist. But as I got older, I do see him as a moody teenager, but, his moodiness is well earned. For one he is very young and has a lot of responsibility put on his shoulders as well as having a pretty messed up childhood. The characters overall simply act their age. People are to used to fourteen year olds in anime and RPG's acting like grown adults. Final Fantasy VIII doesn't do this, they act like actual teenagers for the most part. They grow and learn and change over the course of the game. The 'moody silent protagonist' angle is deconstructed starting at the very beginning of the game. These characters are flawed individuals and that makes them interesting.

In any case, if your a fan of JRPG's this should be a must buy. Especially if you've never played Final Fantasy VIII before. Ignore the winy, self entitled over reactions. Just kick back and enjoy one of the finest RPG's ever made in the best form it's ever had.


Edit: You can ride chocobos, I forgot. It's been at least a decade since I've played through this game, so I forgot about it. Leaving that part of the review in for posterity.

column8:
The good news is that at least the button prompts are there to be usable during a scripted event. (One that required you to use face buttons accurately and quickly.) The original game on the PC would use buttons with numbers instead, making it hard to react appropriately.

The downside is, this game has really only had some character models freshened up and the PSX music was put in place of MIDI. These were things already done for free from the modding community on the original release. I'm not entirely sure what to have expected, but there are still many texture seams in maps and skyboxes. The same checkerboard presentation/problem for the landscape is present in both the original and this one. 

The cutscenes also seem to stutter more in this version. I know they weren't excellent to begin with, but something is drastically reduced in performance. (10 frames per second maybe?)

Ultimately, what this boils down to is some character model swaps and UI redesign which is good but not good enough to warrant buying it again. This is even more frustrating that those who already owned VIII via Steam still had to pay full price whereas other mod tools out there are free and/or $5 (depending on which route you go). There's just not enough done to warrant the money.

column8:
Mi Final Fantasy (y videojuego) favorito.

-¿No lo has jugado nunca? Compralo, es un Final Fantasy precioso.
-¿Ya lo has jugado? No necesitas comprarlo. A partir de esto expondré las razones mi análisis negativo.

2019 es el año del 20 aniversario de Final Fantasy VIII y debido a que su relanzamiento en Steam y Playstation en el año 2013 no dotaron al juego de verdaderas mejoras visuales en comparación con los relanzamientos más cuidados que han habido en la saga estos últimos años (IX, X,X-2...), Square Enix parece haber decidido relanzar FF VIII ''remasterizado''.
Primero de todo, te venden un videojuego que llaman REMASTERIZADO con:

·Los fondos prerenderizados se ven peor al haber recibido un efecto de suavizado (y claro, los píxeles que marcaban detalles en los fondos se han perdido)
·Las texturas de los escenarios de batalla siguen siendo las cutronas del año de la PSX.
·El mapamundi se ve PEOR.
·El juego sigue fijado a 30 fps.
·La relación de aspecto sigue fijada en 4:3 (estos dos últimos puntos no pudieron cambiarlos debido a que van ligados a las animaciones y los fondos y otras cosas y claro si las cambiaban deberían rehacer casi todo el juego xd)

Lo que no me parece normal, además de un insulto por parte de Square Enix, es que en el año 2019 se venda este tipo de trabajo bajo el nombre de ''Remasterización'' y cuyas características especiales sean trucos que hagan que te dure menos el juego (A menos que tú lo desees) y unos modelados rehechos con más calidad. Los que han jugado FF VIII en el pasado saben de qué peca esta versión.

Este análisis negativo es merecido y ya es criterio de cada uno el querer comprarlo, mantenerlo en la biblioteca o reembolsarlo.

After playing the first few hours of this remaster I can say it is well worth the current price.  This remaster includes 

[list]
    [*]higher quality character models
    [*]easier to read font
    [*]better audio
    [*]3x fast forward 
    [*]no encounter mode
    [*]and most importantly [b]full controller support out of the box[/b] including native PS4 support with PS button prompts
[/list]

These are all quality of life improvements  that make revisiting this game more enjoyable.

column8:
[h1]TL;DR[/h1]

I really like it! [u]But there are some things people are complaining about:[/u]


[h1]ART[/h1]

While some models and textures are nice, others (like backgrounds) aren't. For backdrops that are pre-rendered, I understand that they can't re-rendered them today, but other textures should be updatable. The worldmap seems to be even lower resolution than in the previous FF8 release on PC. I can personally look past that. It's really nice with new character textures!

[b] Aspect Ratio (4:3): [/b] It really doesn't bother me much, but I can see how one would expect modern resolutions in a Remaster. Hopefully mods cover this issue.

[b] 15 FPS for FMVs: [/b] The FMVs aren't remade, so they look like they used to, quality and FPS is low by today's standards, but can't really blame them for that. 


[h1]GAMEPLAY[/h1]

For people accustomed to the game, it's all there. It works like it's supposed to, except for the FPS being pretty low. I felt I didn't get enough input when boosting GFs for instance, this was not an issue on PS1.

For newcomers, there's a lot to learn in the beginning before you master the Junction-System, when to Draw Magic or GFs etc. Be patient and the game becomes very rewarding. -> Found Death magic? Put it on your weapon, and watch enemies die from 1 hit!


[h1]STORY[/h1]

One of my favorite Final Fantasy stories (too long and I won't go cover it here). But I do believe that the game gets even better with many of the fan theories like [spoiler] "Squall is dead" or "Rinoa is Ultimecia" [/spoiler] so I'd suggest reading up on those before or after the game. 


[h1]MUSIC[/h1]

Music is fantastic, one of the best FF OST to date!


[h1]ISSUES[/h1]

- All textures should get an update, not just characters, GFs and monsters
- FPS should not be locked to 15-20 fps. It DID affect gameplay where input wasn't received
- Certain areas have severe FPS drops: (i.e Missile Base where there's a lot of pre-rendered animation)
- Aspect Ratio should be unlocked


[h1]CONCLUSION[/h1]

I hope they update this release with a few fixes. But I'm also happy with what I've got. I did a 100% Achievement run and loved it! ^^ Glad 8 finally get's some more attention!

After some time playing the game I am a really big fan of the updated textures and overall stability of the game. The music is great and overall the interface is just wonderfully easy to figure out now!
BIG NEWS ABOUT FULLSCREEN!
At first I had a negative review because it only supported 4:3 but if you follow this posters instructions : https://steamcommunity.com/app/1026680/discussions/0/1635291505041144048/
You can easily get it running in your aspect ratio. I'm much more excited to play this game now!
If you are on the fence though and don't want to use this out of the way method just get the original for 10$ on steam. Its the same game and it can be stretched to you AR. Overall now that the huge issue of AR has been worked out I think its fair to give it at least a recommendation for the die hard FF8 Fans. Although calling it a remaster in its current state isn't really fair so I gotta give an overall negative review.

I am now changing my review to positive. After I found some workarounds in the reviews and community section, I decided to buy the game again (I refunded the game because it wasn't working good for me at first and the 4:3 aspect ratio bothered me alot). I saw a comment (I wasn't able to get the name) that says it's possible to get a widescreen view of the game by setting the resolution to 1280 x 1024. I decided to try it myself and it worked! I no longer do not have the 4:3 aspect ratio! In terms of controls, it seems that it works fine in xbox 360 controller. I haven't got to the part of the cutscenes yet so I can't tell yet if my issue on the skipping parts of the cutscene still persists.

With the workarounds mentioned above in place, I'd say I'll give the remaster a thumbs up.

FF8 is my most favorite game so I want to give this game all the chances I can give.

FF8好きで期待してたのですが、残念ながら「リマスター」では無いです。。

・ムービーは15FPS、それ以外は30FPSしか出ない
・どう頑張って画面設定しても黒帯が表示され4:3画面のまま
・キャラクターと文字こそ高画質になったものの、マップ背景がPS版のままでかなりぼやけてるのでキャラが浮きまくってる
・シド学園長だけはなぜかぼやけている
・ムービーもPS版のままなので画質が…
・BGMもFor PC版のではなくPS版のもの（For PC版がMIDIなのでこれは賛否両論ある）
・当時の移動のしずらさは健在
・連続剣のトリガーのタイミングがズレている（一番致命的）
・おでかけチョコボ廃止（限定アイテムはアンジェロサーチで入手）
・肝心のブースト機能の3倍速はムービーには適用されない
・お値段はスクエニ公式で買えるFor PCの+1000円

予約特典の壁紙にフルHDサイズがあるのと、
ブースト機能が優秀で簡単プレイできるのと、
メニューの「しゅうりょう」ですぐタイトルに戻れるところは高評価です。



[h1]ブースト機能について[/h1]
[b]◆バトル強化[/b]
HP、ATBゲージが常に満タンで、特殊技も常に可能

[b]◆エンカウントなし[/b]
ボス以外の敵に遭遇しなくなる

[b]◆3倍速モード[/b]
一部シーンを除くゲーム速度を3倍にする

[b]◆全ての〇〇を入手（実績が取れなくなる）[/b]
アイテムは大事なもの以外入手
アビリティはG.F.アビリティ全て取得
特殊技は全て入手
カードはレアカード以外MAX入手

[b]◆〇〇MAX（実績が取れなくなる）[/b]
G.F.レベル、ギル、魔法、その名の通りカンストする
魔法は持っているモノだけ増える



ブースト機能はすごく便利ですが、
本当に「リマスター」では無くてPCでプレイできるようになりましたって感じ。
（公式サイトにFor PC版はありましたが、3回までのコピー制限があったので）
当時の懐かしさに浸るには良いですが、ちょっーと、騙された感じもありますね…
ストーリーも深くゲーム自体は高評価ですが、リマスターとして見て低評価です。

column8:
In general I will try to give this remastered version a mild review since i've had this game since it came out on cd-rom ( yes yes i know, i'm  old ) and do note that this review might contain lot's of buts and or uhmms...

Anyways i also bought it on steam when it was re released due to sentimental nostalgia feelings .. so i pre ordered this version because i read that the graphics were a lot better.. and well..

Okay sure they did improve the static and background graphics somewhat as example removed quite a bit of the sharp pixels that the original 1999 version and the re release had but that's something that anyone could do with time and a blur tool in paintshop. 

They did update the character models so that's nice. and with that said they censored the GF Siren but not the GF Shiva so that's a odd thing to do and they also censored Rinoa’s cleavage i do have to ask Why? 

If this game was remastered for the fans then they should have kept things uncensored or provide the public a uncensor patch at least. so we the fans can at least have the freedom to watch the content how we want to..

A negative point is that the game is in 4:3 and uses all the movie assets of the re release steam version (the original cd-rom version had even worse graphics in contrast from what i can remember) but even so still Minus Remaster points for square there although the movie assets did age well.

So is this a  "Remaster" in the classical sense ? ...Well.. To me honestly i'm feeling a little bit underwhelmed ..
it's almost like they did a about 1 Gig visual patch job and called it a day A remastered to me would be a bit more effort like adding voices to the characters or something or at least redo the static background from scratch,  although some might say that that would take away from the original experience.

Now would i recommend this game? Let Me Make a Big asterisk Here *
- If you are a big fan of the franchise and were going to buy this to complete the collection? Yes Sure Go Right Ahead.
- If you Did Not already own Final Fantasy 8 ? Yes they spruced up the graphics a bit here and there (But i don't know if they censored anything from the dialog or story line compared to the original so it's your choice.)
- If you already own Final Fantasy 8 and are a little bit on the fence due to the negative reviews, Then honestly just wait till it goes on sale as the price tag of 20.- as it is now is kinda a 50/50 depends on if the person wants to support the creators in this way for this price.. but value is in the eye of the beholder as they say..

Hope that this review was helpful :)

If this game was remastered for the fans then they should have kept things uncensored or provide the public a uncensor patch at least. so we the fans can at least have the freedom to watch the content how we want to..

A negative point is that the game is in 4:3 and uses all the movie assets of the re release steam version (the original cd-rom version had even worse graphics in contrast from what i can remember) but even so still Minus Remaster points for square there although the movie assets did age well.

So is this a  "Remaster" in the classical sense ? ...Well.. To me honestly i'm feeling a little bit underwhelmed ..
it's almost like they did a about 1 Gig visual patch job and called it a day A remastered to me would be a bit more effort like adding voices to the characters or something or at least redo the static background from scratch,  although some might say that that would take away from the original experience.

Now would i recommend this game? Let Me Make a Big asterisk Here *
- If you are a big fan of the franchise and were going to buy this to complete the collection? Yes Sure Go Right Ahead.
- If you Did Not already own Final Fantasy 8 ? Yes they spruced up the graphics a bit here and there (But i don't know if they censored anything from the dialog or story line compared to the original so it's your choice.)
- If you already own Final Fantasy 8 and are a little bit on the fence due to the negative reviews, Then honestly just wait till it goes on sale as the price tag of 20.- as it is now is kinda a 50/50 depends on if the person wants to support the creators in this way for this price.. but value is in the eye of the beholder as they say..

Hope that this review was helpful :)

column8:
As a longtime fan of Final Fantasy, particularly VIII, this is by far, a horrible remaster.
as other steam users have stated in their reviews, this "REMASTERED" version of FF8: 
 
1.) Runs in exactly the same framerate as the original (unmastered) version.
2.) Is locked in a 4:3 aspect ratio.
3.) Has no widescreen support.
4.) Has unmastered backgrounds, despite the fact that new character models were made from the ground up for the remastered version. 
   ( Basically, this means there is a noticable contrast between the new HD characters and virtually the entire game, save for the 
  battle sequences. )


There are also some odd things I would like to point out, such as the fact that for whatever reason, with this "REMASTER" Square:

* Somehow made the world map look much worse than the original. Katharine Castle of Rock Paper Shotgun has already pointed this out, as of release day.
She said: "Sweet Shiva, what have they done to the overworld map?" Which was very accurate to my initial reaction upon seeing it.

* Left certain NPCs unmastered, despite the HD models being a big selling point of this version.

* Managed to launch this version with bugged achievements, despite them already making ports of FF games with achievements in the past.

Personally, I just don't understand what they were thinking. The game is good, but this is very disapointing for a remaster. 
I personally feel this isn't worth 20$. It would have been had the problems listed above been nonexistent in this version, and/or
there was fully voiced dialouge. Menus look nice though.  

NOTE #1: Apperantly, Square has lost the master files for FF8's backgrounds, which is why they are only smoothened in this version,
however, in my opinion, square should have just made new ones like they did with the character models. 
They made alot of character models from the ground up, so why not? I do understand that would have taken more time and resources but, no one is asking for
a full on 4k Ultra HD, 200FPS REMAKE, just a nicer, cleaner looking version of a classic game. That's a remaster, Enix.
 

NOTE #2: Lastly, Siren's lower region and Rinoa's cleavage have been altered in this version, and Chocobo World is now removed.
Items from "Chocobo World" are now obtainable through Angelo, through Rinoa. Which is nice.


Overall, my thoughts of this are...


"...Whatever."

column8:
Its quite sad really. It runs fine, it has some improvements here and there, but the list starts adding up of the bad decisions or just lack of just a little more polish from the remaster team.

they remade the character models, yet they stand out so much amidst the filtered mess that is the prerendered backgrounds, that you're better off playing either from a distance or just emulating the original game.

A definitive bonus against the other PC version is that this game at least came with the original soundtrack instead of worse midi versions, controller support is already built in too.

yet the other pc version has mods that rectify most of the problems with this one, albeit with more bugs and way more unstable, slowdown on menus which makes it unplayable sometimes. At the very least the only problem with this one is the graphical part which i'm sure fans will take up the mantle to mod it eventually.

its a shame that by outsourcing these ports companies end up failing simple expectations of a decent remaster.

I do not recommend this game as you're probably better off emulating this game in the end. The clear repurposed dissidia models are not worth the money if you ask me.

I'll make a list of what is lacking from this version that the original had:
Pre Rendered Backgrounds are muddied and with this horrible filter on top that ruins most of the maps, making it worse than the original.
Button Rebinding is in a menu outside of the game where you have to press ESC to change settings.


if I see anything that is missing as well i'll be sure to add to the list, but so far its a damn shame as I thought they'd at least try a bit harder. 
I guess they had way more trouble getting the game recreated from the ground up so the polish needed to actually remaster the damn thing got shafted in favor of getting it running again. 

my tl;dr is this,
You want to play FF8? you can, get the old PC port that is crappy but has a lot of mods, get this one that has fast forward that doesn't ruin the timer based missions, which is a definitive plus for this version, or you emulate it on epsxe and get the original experience despite the lack of some models. The biggest offender on this one is the backgrounds. The FF9 port also had a similar problem with the backgrounds but not as blurry as this.

column8:
Sooooo.... here is my review:

--- Good: ---
Characters Models, Monster Models and Icons (G.F., Characters) are updated and look way better!
Squall even blinks now visible!
Menüs are smooth, look better and cleaner.
3x Speed is good for faster fights, map running and grinding (perma drawing magic from monsters).

--- Bad: ---
Game is still 4:3 (black borders on the Sides)
    + edit #1:  FPS are jumping from 10 to 30 at max 
Background is still really low quality which looks really akward with the new Character models.
Game bugs and crashed multiple times (even sometimes when playing Triple Triad) , in Fights mostly with and without 3x Speed, with different settings (borderless, fullscreen, windowed) or even with Steam overlay turned off.
The quality of the CG scenes are still the same as on the orig. version/ps 
Change of Sirens Model: she "wears" now a golden dress instead of the orignal "bush" /clothe part. 

---Result: ---
Rating: 1/5    (for the try and the good work with the models) 

there needs to be more done tbh
    + edit #2: this is not worth 20 Bucks or a re-release of one of the best FF parts. :( 
Stay with the original for now!

column8:
Final Fantasy VIII è un videogioco che ha segnato per sempre la mia infanzia.
Questo titolo è rimasto nel mio cuore e non se ne andrà mai da lì. Affascinante, poetico e maturo.
FFVIII è composto da grandi pregi e difetti. La sua sfortuna più grande è stata quella di essere uscito dopo Final Fantasy VII, portandolo a non essere compreso da un bel po' di persone e questa remastered è un bel modo per recuperare uno dei capitoli della saga di Final Fantasy più affascinanti di sempre.

Parlando più che altro della qualità di questa rimasterizzazione, Square Enix ha svolto il classico compitino. I modelli di tutti i PG sono stati rifatti più che dignitosamente in alta definizione ma per quanto riguarda i fondali, purtroppo quest'ultimi sono rimasti in bassa risoluzione e cozzano con i modelli completamente restaurati in HD. Prendersela però per il mancato supporto ai 16:9 è difficile, in quanto avrebbe richiesto di ridisegnare intere zone dei fondali e sarebbe stato un lavoro lungo e dispendioso. 
Alla fine stiamo parlando di una Remastered e non di un remake. Quindi, risparmiamoci certe lamentele. 

La colonna sonora resta quella del mitico Nobuo Uematsu e provengono direttamente dalla versione originale.

Questa versione, contiene anche dei modificatori, attivabili direttamente dai tasti appositi:

- Uno è dedicato ad aumentare la velocità di gioco fino a tre volte a quella standard
- Il secondo è dedicato a recuperare HP, aumentare la forza e rendere costantemente attive le mosse limit break (quest'ultima cosa avviene normalmente solo quando il PG raggiunge la soglia critica dei propri punti vita)
- La terza è dedicata invece alla eliminazione degli incontri casuali.

Ci sono anche altri modificatori per questa versione ma tutto ciò può essere ignorato tranquillamente e sarete in grado di giocare a FFVIII anche nella sua versione più pura, ovviamente. 

Per concludere, io consiglio più che altro questa riproposizione di Final Fantasy VIII a chi, come il sottoscritto, desidera rivivere ancora una volta l'indimenticabile avventura di Squall e per chi vuole compiere un viaggio nel tempo alla scoperta di un videogioco che può ancora regalare incredibili emozioni.
Videogioco quindi super consigliato ma la qualità della Remastered si attesta sul passabile e niente di più.

o jogo da minha vida <3
não tenho o que dizer, não sou a pessoa certa para fazer um review técnico sobre o game porque sou extremamente fanboy do FF VIII.
A melhor trilha sonora da série (estou falando da ORIGINAL do PSX e não a horrível MIDI da versão de 2013 da Steam), o sistema de combate mais bizarro porém divertido e os personagens carismáticos. O Squall é um adolescente horrível no início porém vai amadurecendo conforme o jogo progride e aprende a rever vários conceitos da sua vida, principalmente sobre o valor da amizade.

Minha única reclamação sobre essa versão remasterizada é a tela 4:3 que deveria ser 16:9.
Ignore os "fps b#tches" que estão reclamando do jogo não rodar a 60 fps. É algo TÃO IRRELEVANTE pra um jogo de 1999 que você não perceberá diferença alguma (sem contar que você pode até usar velocidade x3 para jogar rapidamente as coisas, então não sei por que estão reclamando disso).
Comprei a versão PSX, comprei a de 2013, comprei a versão remasterizada e comprarei se sair pra smartphone sem dúvida alguma.
Sério, se você não gosta do FFVIII é porque jogou errado.

column8:
Liked:
-Character models look fantastic!
-Boosters and cheats if that's your thing.
-Retains original music from the PSX version.

Disliked:
-Backgrounds are still the same low-res ones from the original
-A few bugs such as not being able to take screenshots and achievement notices not popping up (I still get the achievements, but I still have no way of knowing it!)
-No 16:9. Pillarbox only. A minor gripe since this game was made with 4:3 CRTs in mind.
-No rumble support!

For those with any VRR monitor, I suggest that you turn the feature off as it causes ghosting.

All in all, a solid remaster but still need some bugs to squash. I'm sure a patch or two will be able to resolve these issues.

column8:
Can you really remaster something when you don't even have the masters anymore?  Is this a shameless cash-grab?  Do the whiners have legitimate gripes? TL;DR? Absolutely.

This is a remaster, not remake. You can't expect a remastered 90s game to have 21st century technology. (Widescreen is literally impossible to do seamlessly without redoing literally every background/foreground... if you don't want a stretched/magnified image (and if you do, more fool you) And those whining about this being "censored" REALLY need to get a life in this instance, at least.

This is a VERY sloppy "remaster". I'm not entirely sure what they've done but whatever methods they used none of them are successful. I see AI upscaling artifacts -yet few benefits of it when done correctly-, interpolation artifacts, aliasing artifacts showing that some things were, in fact, touched by human hands... Yet they couldn't be bothered to fix the dithering artifacts, either...

Outside of most, not all, 3D models, it seems the preferred choice was to simply put a vaseline filter on with extra blur for good measure. Yet you'll jarringly see unrefined, unblurred, untouched edges with horrible aliasing on random backgrounds/foregrounds. 

There's still model jutter as if this is the PS1 version without proper Z support... only now with "better" 3D models it REALLY looks bad and stands out

You cannot skip cutscenes. You can't manually fast forward with button press like you could with the much better FFXII remaster. You can't really imagine just how incompetent DotEMU were with this mess...

It may be interesting to see if this gets, relatively, better mod support/ports in the end. (or if people just port the better models from this backwards into the old PC port) But as it stands buy the original. Mod it. Be happier. Especially since the fan AI improved backgrounds for the original are leagues above this incoherent mess. (I am just about certain DotEmu did AI for some backgrounds and definitely the video since during fast paced cuts it pixelates, raw looking not filtered, again so it's just not a vaseline filter)

Oh, something positive...well you don't have to apply the midi mod to get PS1 sound anymore. Yay... That said, back to annoyed feedback: Should have midi optional and done an orchrestrated version that could be switched on the fly if they were going to be so lazy graphically and do such a SHAMELESS cash grab in the first place.

column8: I was really looking forward to this. I loved FF8 with all it's flaws lol I wasn't expecting a huge overhaul for the remaster. Just a simple "fresh coat of paint". While the main characters and enemies look decent every other person still looks like they did back in the original version. So having a nice new looking Squall standing next to another student that hasn't been touched up at all looks really weird. I also found that the game lags a lot (i.e. The Fire Cavern) when there is a lot going on in the backgrounds. I just can't possibly understand how the original version runs better and smoother than this remaster. Even moving around the menu is sluggish and slow. The ball was dropped on this one. Get the original version over this.

column8:
Final Fantasy VIII is my favourite entry in the series, my first even. After hearing that this game gets a remaster I got really excited.

Here comes the 3rd of September. The game comes out. All we have is not what we wanted. The game has updated models of the characters, you can actually see the faces of them. But that's all it changes. 

The backgrounds are still the same low res backgrounds we are all used to, some characters become the old models (Headmaster Cid turned from HD to PS1 graphics), 

Game does not even run in 1080p. It's stuck with the old 4:3 even if you choose 1080p option, and don't get me started on the frames. I was expecting 60fps or even unlocked frames for this game. Naah, not with this one buddy. It seems like they followed the same nauseating frame changing gameplay from Dissidia NT. Menus have solid 60fps, it may even go slightly higher. Then 
while you explore the world your frames get havled. When you enter a combat, it gets halved again to 15-god-damn-fps. 

It really is a shame that this remaster has been butchered like this. But I've heard people saying that Square lost the source code for this game, so it might be a original game, but modded. Who knows. I hope this will get fixed, until them I will keep my review as negative.

column8:
This is probably the best way to experience the classic joy of Final Fantasy 8.  The improved character models and battle enhancements bring final fantasy 8 more into the modern age by smoothing out some of the rough graphical edges the game had during it's original release.  The battle enhancements, including the steam exclusives, let you experience the game how you want.  If you want the challenge of the original, you can have it.  If you want to be a monster murdering machine early on in the game and play through the story at break neck speed you can do that too.  All is not perfect however, I've experienced several crashes while running at the accelerated 3x speed mode.  Also, sadly lacking is the magic booster from the original steam release of final fantasy 8.  While you can max out the magic you do posses to 100 at any time outside of battle through the cheats menu, there is no way to give yourself all the magic types in the game.

All in all, I love being able to experience FF8 with better character and monster models.  I just wish it had been a full HD Remaster like X/X-2 got.

When Nostalgia gets the better of you...

don't waste your money. Read a few of the negative reviews and you know all there is to know.

I only want to add:
Textures are actually worse than before. They were scaled to a slightly higher resolution and got a minimal softener treatment to reduce the ugly aliasing of the old pixel-mess. In return the textures lost a bit of sharpness, noticable when you scale em down again and compare them to the non-"remastered" version.

Do yourself a favour, don't buy it. Wait for FFVII.

And if you really need to play it, play it in windowed mode and reduce resolution to 640x480 or something like that. Alternatively you could sit 15 feet away from your monitor...

I use 1024x768 windowed mode on my 2k screen.

column8:
Not great, not terrible...

I guess it’s a functional PC port of Final Fantasy VIII, so that’s a recommend.
But I have to say, I’m not impressed. For every new good thing, there’s a bad one.
 * Updated character models – but Squall looks different than original.
 * Controller support out of the box – but no analog movement.
 * Modern display and anti-aliasing – backgrounds are stretched, everything looks weird.

For now, I'm going to refund, but may buy again later if there are any good mods.

*edit: had a CTD error right after beating the final boss. That's inexcusable.

column8:
As many have already said, this is a very bad remaster and I have to give it a thumbs down. The main problems are:

- 4:3 display
- Game runs at 30fps which drops to 15fps (!) during battle
- They only updated the character models and not the backgrounds. This makes the backgrounds look even worse and they are also very blurry

The only good thing is the x3 speed boost but that's about it.

I think your best option to enjoy this game is to play the classic steam version with mods or perhaps play the original upscaled on an emulator, if that's an option for you.

Soin, Soin +, Soin Max, Brasier, Brasier +, Glacier, Glacier +, Foudre, Foudre +, Morphée, Cécité, Aphasie, Eau, Cyanure, Esuna, Rafale, Folie, Mégalith, Zombie

Possibilité d'accélérer toutes les scènes (cinématiques, vidéos, combats, etc.).

Les attaques, certains Limit Break et certaines G-Forces infligent 9 999 points de dégâts.

column8:
Okay first let me say I absolutely adore this game. This was my first Final Fantasy game and I grew up playing this. I love everything about it, I have nothing negative to say about the game itself.

That being said, this re-release has a lot of issues. It crashes more often than it should  and dosent work with intel integrated graphics, so you likely wont be playing it on your laptop unless it has a dedicated graphics card. 

They updated the character models but not much else, so you'll still get the same low resolution backgrounds with a smoothing filter applied. Its pretty obvious that square enix made a minimal effort on this "remaster" just to make a buck.

I'm happy to get a modern version of FF8 with updated character models but I really feel let down that I cant play this on my laptop and that square enix didnt do more to polish the release. We've waited 20 years for updated character models.

What a shame...

The game is not ... terrible but it's not good either.

I mean I think on balance this version is better than the 2013 Steam version which itself was based on the original PC version of 2000. There's HQ character models, the original music which is better and autosave. There are bad things though like the removal of Chocobo World minigame, blurring of the already bad backgrounds, censorship of putting a skirt on Siren amongst other things.

The good things about this version should have been in the 2013 version seeing as it was sold as an "HD" version or added later. This feels more like a version aimed at the consoles which didn't have any version of the game until now. They could have at least given 2013 steam owners a discount on this version but no.

First of all, if you expect a full remake, don't even consider buying - this is not remake (who would have thought?)
If you just want to relive the old classic in slightly better graphics and with much better music, it might be worth your while. That is, if you can overlook few (quite important) flaws:
-Forced 4:3 resolution (with black sides, if you choose another aspect ratio)
-Bit of censorship
-limited FPS
-some models look terrible (in HD, but without any added textures)

All in all, this remaster could have been much better. But it is not entirely bad either. Too bad there was no discount for owners of original FF8, reviews would be much better

6.5/10

edit: aspect ratio can be fixed now, thanks community

Je suis un grand fan de FF8 et c'est une honte de sortir un remaster fait à la p**** comme ça 

ouais les personnages on voit bien qu'ils ont été refait mais déjà FAITE LE POUR TOUS quand Cid et Quistis font l'explication de l'examen du Seed c'est normal qu'après Cid devient du vomis de pixel ? dans la salle de classe des pnj sont dans le même état !!!!!

FMV en 480p qui pixellise hard quand y'a du gros mouvement !

Texture d'arrière plan des décors on dirait que ça a même pas été retouché !

Le triple triade juste SVP, des png aurait suffit, ça prend max 15 minutes à faire, mais non les verso de carte sont immode et je parle pas du terrain de jeu, LES MODDEURS FONT MIEUX SUR LA PREMIERE VERSION PC !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

enfin je vais dire ce qu'il ne va pas sur le SEULE gros point de gameplay qui me tenais vraiment à coeur pour la version pc,
pour le Turbo des G-Forces, C'EST PAS NORMAL QUE QUAND TU SPAMS VITE LA VERSION PC N'EST PAS P****** DE CAPABLE DE PRENDRE LA VITESSE DE L'INPUT CORRECTEMENT ET LA CROIX NE CLIGNOTENT PAS AVANT SA TOTAL APPARITION, c'est une honte on est en 2019 et ces deux problèmes n'ont même pas été arrangé, sur les versions consoles on a bien le temps de voir cette croix apparaitre et on est capable de faire de bon score au turbo pour bien améliorer la puissance des GF (pour ma part pour shiva et golgotha une moyen de 170 à 215 au turbo sur pc une moyenne de 120 à 135 !!!) alors même si je m'en sors très bien sans les GF c'est pour moi comme un mini jeu de tenter d'atteindre 250 sur tout le monde même les première et ici c'est tout bonnement impossible.

Donc juste une chose à dire aux collègues fan, rester sur PS1 !!!!!

Heureusementn une personne répondant au nom de McIndus existe, cette personne est un moddeur, et avec tout les mods actuels dont un en test alpha sur lequel il continue de travailler, la on peut dire que c'est un vrai remaster grace a lui. juste soyez patient pour que tous les mods soit disponible.

When I got the game I thought remaster meaning the gameplay will be like the in game cutscenes crisp and clear but it isn't, it does offer xbox 360 controller support that the 2013 version didn’t offer unfortunately, that is all it has to offer other then that it is the 2013 Version there is nothing new, the characters and card game look better but the rest is exactly like it was on the PS1, the world map is the same, the graphics are the same even the aspect ratio is the same 4:6, it hasn't done anything new or different.

I was hoping for better world graphics but that didn't happen, I was hoping the game would look like the cutscenes but no, I have also noticed some of the monsters are missing, when I saw remaster I thought, cool, they are going to maybe add so new things, instead they removed things.

I am really disappointed with this Remaster, Square could of done a much better job, do yourself a favor and buy the 2013 version, it is cheaper and offers exactly the same gameplay as this one minus the xbox 360 controller support , I won't recommend it, I expected so much more, I’m a long time fan of the game, it was my favorite Final Fantasy but this is very, very disapointing and not worth the price. The Final Fantasy 10 and 10-2 remaster were great but this one didn't receive the same love that 10 got sadly.

column8:
what can be said about this remaster besides its a remaster of a great game. so i will be frank before this came out there was a post made by fans of the 2013 port modded to review bomb this game and truth it does not deserve it so i will go over some pros and cons of the changes.

 pros:
keeps orginal gameplay
has proper controller support (2013 version needs a mod to have controllers truly work)
the music is that of the orginal they just changed how how its play (2013 being from a source that was not used since the early 2000) (this can also be seen as a con as many like the modded versions better)
3x speed is great for farming and if you want the no random encounters can be fun as well (these are the main two cheats added to the remeaster that was not in the 2013 version)

cons:
upscaled graphics while this can look for the most part all it did was make some areas blurry that being said its mostly background and nothing truly impornant to the game.
Censorship: while i dont really care about censorship seeing as almost if not everything gets censored and will always happen they censored this game even more then they did in the original release the most noticable one being you cant see sirens pantys anymore anyther one that unless you looking for it you will proboly not notice is on some of the girls like a higher shirt or lower skirt that being said shiva was not censored at all.
and lastly its not suited for wide screens and i know this as i have both a widescreen and a normal screen and with the widescreen you will get those black bars on the side were on the normal sized screen you wont

mix: this will deppend on the person
new character modles or some: for me this is a good thing for others its bad
music: again i had this as a pro as unless your modding its 100% better then the 2013 steam version

the i dont care part:

frames while i did not test in the fmv side they seam to be the same as the rest of the game but the game is locked at 30 and for this type and style of game thats fine its not needed to be higher and any that says other wise are spoiled little brats.

parts that can be the same
cheats and i mean most of them are the same with some changes for example the booster in the 2013 version did all and gived you all magic while the new version does not give any new magic but it does allow you to get almost all cards and items and max level and master all skills the current gf can get (does not include item skills for the gf)


so it turn is it worth its price for me yes the music and controller support with out mods and two of the new cheats are really nothing and to put it simple the 2013 version is about 15cad while this is 25 cad and for the changes and removing the need to mod its worth the extra 10 for me so all i can say is look up videos and see if you like it if so by it if not then dont. just ignore most of the review bombers

I'm really really sad that I have to vote this one down. Loved FF8 back in the days. Surely still love it.
But not this "remaster". Sorry but this has to be a hoax or scam. 

Only thing they "remastered" are the Character and slightly the Mob-Models. 
The backgrounds are still the old JPEGs from 1999. And it has no Widescreen support.

Sorry thats a refund.

This review has been edited. I have also switched from recommending this game to not recommending this game, and then back to recommending this game. See the bottom section for my update on 9/5/2019 and my other update on 11/27/2019.

Pros:
-Higher Resolution Models
-Controller Icon Prompts
-Chocobo World has been removed and Chocobo World items can now be obtained in-game with Rinoa's Angelo Search ability
-Better PC options such as anti-aliasing, borderless windowed, etcetera
-PSX audio versus the OGG files that were up-converted from the crappy MIDI audio of the 2000 PC port
-Minor bug fixes

Cons:
-Backgrounds were not touched up
-The game was not remastered for widescreen (which makes sense as backgrounds weren't touched, but it's still disappointing)
-The Triple Triad screen seems a bit washed out

That's my first impression. I love the game itself. That makes up for the quick cash-grab from SquareEnix. I would still recommend this game over the 2013 version as I suspect that there will be more/better mod support for this game in the future versus the 2013 version.

Update (9/5/2019) - It seems the modding community won't be able to do as much with this version of the game as the pre-rendered backgrounds are not easily accessible for them to touch this up. It's still *possible* that mod support can make this game look better, but at this time it seems unlikely. I would still recommend this game if you have no desire to mod a game to make it look better. Other than that, the 2013 version is the recommend version at this time. If mod support turns around in the future I will update this review again.

Update (11/27/2019) - There have been a few graphical mods that have come out to make this game look better. Backgrounds are still atrocious, but I've moved back to recommending this game again.

Melhor de todos os jogos

Veramente osceno, come si puo' nel 2019 chiamare "Remastered" un gioco con i soli modelli poligonali dei personaggi aggiornati? Video in 4:3 e con risoluzione inguardabile, fondali slavati e pessimi.. l'unica fortuna è che stiamo parlando di Final Fantasy VIII, un gioco che ha segnato l'infanzia di molti, ma lato tecnico è un vero scempio.
画质提升的真好 但是PS移植版只注重画质了其他的根本没提升尤其没有中文。还有就是键盘党的噩梦，键位超级别扭根本没法更改键位为了这个游戏买个手柄真不值，125的定价切实不值  想玩的等打折吧

This game was a gem on PlayStation and it's a gem now. If you haven't played it yet, why not?

column8:
Parte positiva: Al empezar vemos como el juego reconoce perfectamente el mando de xbox one, lo resalto, ya que en su anterior versión lo teníamos que configurar. Los modelos de los personajes, los G.F. y enemigos principales son muy bonitos y no pierde la esencia del original. Los cuadros de diálogo se ven muy nítidos, al igual que los menús, todo esto va muy fluido. 

Parte negativa: El renderizado de los escenarios, enemigos secundarios y del mapa mundo es nulo, esto choca bastante con los personajes ya que parecen que están pegados de mala manera en el escenario. Las escenas de vídeo van a 15 fps , el juego a unos 30 fps con bajones. La pantalla se ve a  resolución 4:3 sin posibilidad de cambiarla. 

Parte neutral: Lo de los límites infinitos y el juego más rápido no se bien de que nos puede servir aparte de bajarle la dificultad al juego, aunque son opciones que si no quieres no usas, así que lo pongo en neutral. Tarda un poco en iniciar el juego no se si es algo puntual de la versión de pc.

Opciones: Si tienes  la otra versión de final fantasay VIII en pc.... puedes jugarla y bajarte mod, lo verás todo más bonito, lo negativo de esto es que tienes que configurar el mando y poner los mod, es algo tedioso si no sabes. No obviando que tendrás bajones de fps muy bruscos en esa versión con mod en el mapa mundi.

En definitiva: Si quieres jugar a final fantasy VIII porque nunca lo has jugado o eres fan, cómpralo. Si por el contrario no te importa instalar mod y hacer configuraciones compra la otra versión sin el remastered de título. 

Yo no recomiendo la compra hasta que metan algún parche donde arreglen lo de los fondos, aunque también estaría bien que arreglaran  lo de los fps y la resolución.

column8:
Ich schreibe sonst eigentlich keine Reviews aber das hier soll eine Warnung sein: Meine Vorredner haben recht, das ist kein Remaster sondern ein müder Aufguss von SquareEnix. Die Charaktermodelle scheinen geschärft worden sein, der Background ist es nicht und nun ist der Unterschied so gross, dass es richtig stört. Kein Widescreen, Auflösung der Zwischensequenzen gefühlt schlechter (wahrscheinlich hochpoliert). Die paar (meiner Meinung nach unnötigen) Zusatzoptionen wie das Ausschalten der Zufallskämpfe oder das Beschleunigen sind den Preis nicht weg. Die Musik ist ebenfalls wie im Original, was ja cool ist aber dann kann ich auch die Version von 1999 spielen. Und für eine offiziell beglaubigte Cheatkonsole Geld zu verlangen ist ja wohl ein Witz!

In diesem Zustand ganz klar KEINE Kaufempfehlung, spart Euch das Geld für einen echten Remaster und zockt das Original! Das hier ist reine Geldmache von Square Enix!

column8:
[EDIT] My Problem got fixed by changing the Documents-Folder's Steam ID (in fact, the Folder did not have my ID - I changed it to mine and then it worked).
But still, after Playing about 2 hours I still cannot recommend this Version.
Dont missunderstand me: the Game itself is GREAT - but the Remaster not worth the Money.
The only remastered things there are the playable characters and Weapons/G.F. But not anything else - not the Map-Design nor the Monsters or even any backgrounds.
In addition, the game got some Censored parts I can understand because of the better Graphics. Would not be nice to see to many Privat-Part-Details on Sirene for Example... BUT! They overdid it in some parts!
I would recommend to buy the Remake, if it is on a discount - for lets say - 10€ or lesser. Not worth the price now.

[Original Comment]: Would be nice, if I could have started it. The Steam-Threads are full off Errors... But I wanted to try it... and regret it.
One of the Errors got me: "can't open config.txt" - tried about 20 solution-ways and gut many responses from others experiencing the same issues - or similar errors. So, Now waiting for a Day-1 Patch...till then, no positiv votes... SE schould have made many experiences with remasters and remakes but they dont seem to learn from the failures  in the past... Will change the Review to positiv, if the errors get fixed within 48 hours.

So, being a huge Final Fantasy VIII fan, I immediately pre-ordered the Remaster from seeing the character skin updates.

I supposed I shouldn't have been sold just on that - that's literally the only good thing about it bar the original gameplay.

They have so bloody lazy with everything else with this game.

Any moving characters have been updated, which is great. However, any backgrounds or peripheral characters are still back in 1999. The music is still MIDI so sounds tinny and poor, and even the computer in the classroom where you get the first two GF's hasn't even been touched. It's horrendous.

Do NOT buy this game - just go for one of the free mods on there to HD the original game...

They applied a blur filter to the backgrounds so they are totally blurred. They even cut and censored some content.

Total garbage, stay away. Use the version from 2013 with fan made mods. It looks much better. Moders even used AI neural network for better backgrounds, textures, and so on.

Original music from PSX version
New character models
Auto save function


Cons:
Censorship
Cut content
Disgusting backgrounds
Different main character
Cheats
Price

The game has bugs now
No put effort, the game is almost the same as the version from 2013

Madre mía, por donde empezar con este "remaster"

1. Los fondos: Literalmente ninguna mejora en relación con el original

3. El mundo: Literalmente puedes ver cuadrados en el suelo, parece que no se ha prestado nada de atención a la zona donde pasaremos la mayoría del tiempo
4. Bloqueado en 4:3
5. Bloqueado en 30 fps con las escenas a 15 fps

Parece un remaster hecho con mínimo esfuerzo y ganas, si tienen el original, usen mods, la experiencia y los gráficos son mejores que este juego ahora mismo. Esperemos que Square Enix parchee esto y le de a FF8 el remaster que se merece

[h1] Final Fantasy VIII é grande [/h1]
Mas pode esperar a promoção e as correções.

O jogo roda lisinho, os controles respondem e foram devidamente adaptados ao mundo atual. Todavia, parece que tem muito trabalho pela frente. As personagens foram graficamente atualizadas, mas os cenários estáticos não receberam muita atenção e não há um grande trabalho de remodelagem. Hoje, o FFVIII 2013 pode ser uma opção mais "bonita" se aplicada uma enxurrada de MODs. O preço está elevado e a Square-Enix Lamentavelmente não ofereceu incentivo, gratuidade e sequer um desconto para os compradores originais.

What a waste of time.

Literally all they've done is update the skins and made some of the language a little more politically correct. (also Siren now has no bush on show)

So all of the music is the same as before.
All of the background visuals are exactly the same, that being the same as they were in 1999
All of the FMVs have been taken from the last iteration of FF8 they put out on PC and look worse than the skins.

They have added fullscreen 1920x1080, but this does not mean the game is widescreen - you have two giant black bars at either side.

Also cheats and some useless achievements.

Honestly, this isnt worth £15. You're better off buying their other one on steam for 9.99 for all the differences you'll save.

This was a cash grab and nothing more

Also cheats and some useless achievements.

Honestly, this isnt worth £15. You're better off buying their other one on steam for 9.99 for all the differences you'll save.

This was a cash grab and nothing more

column8:
This is a joke of a remaster.

DISPLAY IS 4:3 !!! 

Why on earth there is a set of 16:9 resolutions if there are giant black borders on the sides.
World map looks like PSX version, backgrounds look like PSX version + are very blurry,
Characters got a set of better textures.

Overall it looks like almost zero work (except character models) was put into it.

Oh and the 'exclusive wallpapers' are literaly TWO wallpapers in a different resolutions.

If you still want to play it - (because I'm refunding it) do youreself a favor and install reShade with some HDR/Blom filters to make the visuals more bearable.

column8: 回憶無價

Lemme just head the "muh censorship" guys off at the pass.   The original designer of a summon disliked a panty shot he put on Siren, so he personally redesigned it.  if you see someone complaining about censorship they're a baby who want to find something to complain about.    Also Rinoa has less cleavage... for a not very cleavage heavy character as it was?  People will look for a reason to be mad any time a game gets any overhauls.   That they're made about these two things should tell you how good of a remaster it is.

Great game, gets a good visual overhaul.   Most the background textures look rough, but when it comes to the character models and menus and whatnot, looks great.

System Menu options are nice, and add a small quality of life boost.  This is still the same game you loved,  but it's juuuust enough of a visual overhaul that I can play it on a large screen tv and be happy.  They didn't reinvent the wheel, they just threw some new tires on it.  

I'm falling in love with the game all over again and if you're an old fan, this is the right edition to bring you back into the series.
